Summary: Lovely hotel in a beautiful location.  First visit to Huntington Beach and I am so pleased I was able to stay at this hotel. Fresh and modern feel to the hotel. Rooms are clean and spacious with good views. Good quality food. Excellent service throughout the hotel.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel in a Fabulous Location
Summary: My three teens and I just finished a stay at the Waterfront Beach Resort. While hotels are being impacted by the pandemic all across the country, this hotel has worked hard to work around those issues.  Everything was fantastic - no restaurant issues, the pool was staffed well with servers, and everything was operating as it should be.  And the location cannot be beat. There is so much nearby - food, shops, and a wonderful beach.  Highly recommend it and cannot wait to go back. My kids really loved it too.

Once again a truly memorable stay! We’ve been staying at this hotel every January for the past 4 years. Being former residents from the area we enjoy coming at this peaceful time to have our family reunions.  The staff is amazing across all departments. I want to thank Mitchell & Jordan at the front desk for always being so helpful and hospitable, and Shea from the Boardwalk restaurant, as well.
Room tip: So close to everything. What I’m saying is the hotel is in a perfect location at the beach,...

Summary: This is an awesome property. Hospitality, on-site and nearby dining options and entertainment are outstanding. The room was clean and spacious. So nice to relax on the 12thf floor balcony and enjoy the view! Will most definitely book again!

The hotel and location are obviously amazing, but the staff just made our trip. Specifically Vincent and his valet team, they saved the day literally pushing my daughters car by hand to a place where it could get connectivity - thank you guys!! Shout out to Robert, total gentleman, great work!!

Summary Heading: Great location, great property!  Our view of the ocean was incredible.
Summary: It was a quick girls trip before a company meeting, we loved the property’s location, rooms, service, and view!  We walked across the street to walk on the beach and watched a beautiful sunset.  We also rented bikes and really enjoyed cycling for over an hour.  We will definitely be back to enjoy this beautiful property.

Summary Heading: Amazing Stay for both Leisure & Business
Summary: The Aesthetics, amenities, and overall vibe of this hotel was amazing. Would definitely recommend this location for couples, families and Business Meetings. The views are amazing and the location is perfect for walks on the beach and to local restaurants, bars, etc.

Summary Heading: Great selection right on the water!
Summary: So pleased with our perfect stay from check in to check out. Fab staff, great pools and hot tubs, great location walkable to everything. Highly recommend. One of the best Hiltons we’ve ever stayed at.

Summary Heading: An old hotel at excellent location and friendly service
Summary: Spent eight days in an oceanfront suite. The reason to pick this hotel is simply because of the location. Walking distance to the town and beach. Loved the view. Enjoyed sitting on the balcony to watch the sunrise and sunset. The room was basic but successfully decorated to create the ocean resort atmosphere. But the room was quite noisy because of the busy highway and noise from next doors. Our bed was comfortable, and we had good nights of sleep. The room was clean enough but not immaculate. The housekeeping service was on demand, not regular daily basis. There were moments the room needed to be tidied up even though we had put in requests earlier. The hotel is a big complex, and most parts looked tired. Had breakfast at the downstairs restaurant every day. The menu was

I just wanted to say that both Cece and jayson O as well as Pat, bartenders at the Waterstone resort have given me some of the best service Ive ever had anywhere. Thanks for everything. See u next year

Amazing, wonderful experience at The Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach as we celebrate a milestone anniversary and the Christmas holiday with family.  Every evening we toast, magnificent sunsets from several hotel vantage points. Appreciating the colorful skies marks a special way to end a day of walking along the Pacific Ocean, watching the surfers, and simply enjoying being together in Southern California sunshine.  At the hotel, we've enjoyed many offerings, including cocktails on the rooftop bar, dining at several restaurants, hanging out at the pools, and working out in the well-equipped, clean fitness center.  The staff is very friendly and helpful. In particular, we have been so impressed with the professionalism and positive service provided by Perla at the

Summary Heading: Dated and aloof hotel being run like a budget select service motel.
Summary: Usually very forgiving, but just had to..  Dated hotel claiming a resort experience. Currently being run like a cheap select service offering. Restaurants are barely open/functioning. Resort fee is being charged for 'use of the pool' according to front desk. Service is aloof, uninformed, and disengaged with little regard for guest experience even when approached with inquiries. The one sliver of light on the entire campus is the woman who runs the little cafe in the marketplace.

This was a special Birthday trip for my son and "staycation". The staff was amazing!  The extra that was done by their concierge, Darby Ziegler. - decorating the room and sending up special dessert etc really made my son feel so special.  Paulette the GM leads a team that is not just professional for your stay but lends a boutique hotel and "familylike" personal touch to the entire experience.  The room was incredible with a wonderful ocean view and great proximity to the pool.  The pools slides etc. made this resort stay complete.  Only issue was the restaurant but I found out that is separate from the hotel so makes sense.

We came here in the summer time, end of May or early June. The security guard saved my husbands life. I don’t remember his name but I would like to thank him. My husband had a medical emergency in the hallway walking towards the lobby, and the security guards saw him unconscious lying down on the cameras. He is a type 1 diabetic and thankfully with the security guard’s quick actions was able to get him back to our room and we force fed him sugar. If he had not been found any sooner, he could have died. I just wanted to reach out to say thank you so much and to recognize an outstanding employee. This hotel is an absolute gem, we plan on staying again soon.

Summary Heading: Great service, beautiful surroundings, but noisy and expensive
Summary: Waterfront Beach Hotel is beautiful and we really enjoyed the oceanfront balcony.  You could easily see the HB pier from our balcony and long stretches of the beach. They have two swimming pools with hot tubs, one of which has a water slide.  Food was good at Henry's Coastal Cuisine, Surf Hero marketplace and room service but on the pricey side.  Hands down, our favorite dining experience was at the OffShore 9 Rooftop Lounge. The gorgeous views, ambience and service created a truly unique experience. The Truffle Fries and Charcuterie Platter were awesome and they had a nice selection of mocktails for our son. The room was a disappointment, though, especially since we splurged on a King Suite. The pull out sofa bed was extremely uncomfortable for our son. He ended up just

Had a great two night stay here, before going home to Uk.  Had a partial ocean view room, very good with everything we needed.  The poll areas are lovely, convenient position close to restaurants and shops.

Attended the hotel's annual brunch and it was wonderful. It is held in the ballroom and there was every kind of food imaginable. The hotel is beautiful and in a wonderful location across from the ocean. The staff is wonderful. We did not stay overnight.

We were at the hotel for a somber occasion, but the the entire staff, from valets, servers, front desk to the general manager respected our grief and went out of their way to make our stay peaceful and memorable. I cannot express how appreciative we all were for the kindness shown during our stay. We have stayed at numerous Hilton properties and this was by far the finest accommodations, restaurants, cleanliness, etc.

We spent 3 nights in Huntington Beach leading up to a Disneyland experience to celebrate my daughter's 8th birthday. I'm so glad we decided to book the Waterfront. There are lots of choices in this area and the Waterfront did not disappoint!  The location is excellent - an easy and quick walk across the street to the beach, a few minutes walk to a great outdoor mall (Pacific City), and only 10 minutes or so walk to the Pier and Main Street. We took advantage of most of what the hotel had to offer - our girls loved the Driftwood Pool with waterslides and my oldest was able to get a training session in (she's a competitive swimmer) at the Huntington Pool. We loved popping in early each morning at Surf Hero (Tina is wonderful!) for coffee, hot chocolate and snacks, and after-dinner

My wife and I stayed in a partial oceanview room for 2 nights, and had a simply phenomenal experience. The bed was incredibly comfortable, room furnishings were modern and sleek, and every staff member we interacted with was absolutely fantastic.  I spoke with a gentleman at the front desk - I can't remember his name for the life of me, but he mentioned he used to work in the pool area before moving to the front desk. I was extremely impressed with his customer service. The housekeepers we interacted with were fantastically polite, and accommodating when we asked for an extra blanket.   After working in the hospitality industry for 15+ years, I can truly say this hotel has put together a phenomenal staff, who provide a fantastic guest experience.

This hotel is as basic as they come. The grounds are worn, housekeeping is by request only and toiletries are not provided.  No shower gel,  you only get a wall mounted shampoo, conditioner and lotion nothing else.  Disappointing dirty dump in need of serious rejuvenation by experts in hospitality business. Not even up to any hotel standards.

We left our stay feeling like we were put a room that never should be in use for guests. The room was as dilapidated as any hotel room I've ever stayed in. We documented the various issues, which are listed below.  -	Sofa cushions were worn out – you literally hit the fold-out bed frame when you sat down. Also, the fabric was very worn. -	Sofa bed was completely unusable. Mattress was completely shot, which caused us to have to change our plans. -	Two of the four faucets were leaking. Plus, the toilet had to be finagled to keep it from running. -	Paint was badly chipped around sliding door. -	Fabric on balcony chair coming un-sewn  -	Sliding plantation blinds on balcony door blocked the locking mechanism so the door was nearly inoperable when blinds were opened -	Paint badly

No matter how beautiful a Resort is if the first person you encountered does not have the right attitude on how to treat a guest well, it deeply affects and changes your perception of the place. The front desk staff here needs serious training on customer service. Although the manager had reached out to make our experience better and I deeply appreciates her for doing that.  Beware of any upgrades offered. Make sure that if you initially booked at the Twin Dolphin Tower, which is the newer tower, upgrade offered must be in the same tower especially if paying upgrade fees. Important points were not not made very clear by the front desk staff. He gave us a so-called upgrade with additional fees but he did not say that it will be at the old tower. The old tower has this musty smell

Great location in the heart of Huntington Beach, beautiful view to the ocean, everyone’s very friendly my special thank to Mr Daniel for Housekeeing, great Director, always very enthusiastic and ready to make dreams came true. F.Beverages food excelent,any restaurant : boardwalk, dock bard or Surf hero,. Definitely I be back. Thanks.

I stayed with my firm at its expense, after providing my Hilton Honors number. Although I am a diamond level member, the property refused to pay me any points for the substantial cost of the room. I have stayed at the Paséa and a Hyatt and found them to be much better properties. The layout of the Waterfront and the decor were not as nice as what I found at those neighboring hotels.  I would not stay here again if it were my call.

Summary Heading: An Honest Review for this Beachfront Hotel
Summary: Although this is named a RESORT, the service and amenities are lacking, therefore I consider this a hotel. The location is across the highway from the sand, so be careful when crossing. The hotel offers beach chairs, bike rentals and umbrella's for a charge. HB allows firepit's on the beach and the hotel will provide a space, chairs and wood for $200.  The rooms are on the small side and a partial ocean view will have a very small balcony with two chairs and a table. We had to put the table in our room to move the chair positions. It's tight. We faced south and had a good morning view of the sand and waves in the distance. There is a bed and small couch in the room. The bathroom is minimal, so don't expect Q-Tips, shower cap or thread kit. Housekeeping is "by request only" and

From the moment I arrived in the valet area until driving away in my car I enjoyed every moment of my stay. Valet was organized and immediately responded to arrival. Was nice being able to park and be centrally located so could eat at property or be within walking distance to a variety of eating establishments that would fit all budgets. Check-in was rapid and felt welcome. All areas of property were very clean and sanitizer stations available. Never had to wait long for an elevator. Room had a safe in closet and bathroom area very large, shower had a handheld shower head if needed and was placed lower, also higher shower head for those taller could be used. Enjoyed sitting out on balcony, watching the waves, sunset or just reading. Didn’t go to pool but appeared those in area

Pro location is great. Close to beach and close to stores and restaurants. Staff was extremely friendly.  Cons: way over priced. No less than $500ish a night MIDWEEK before taxes and a resort fee. Breakfast buffet for 2 people came to about $80, $5 for a bottle of water, and more just to name a few. Toilet paper is like sand paper for the price we paid, I’d expect a MyPillowntype softness. Facilities were run down for a place calling itself a resort.  I’d stay here again if the price was closer to $200-250.

B level hotel with A level prices. Hotel is nice enough. Location is great. Finishings are poor for the price. Some examples…Broken/missing beach chairs/umbrella/boards. Maybe the worst attribute; One ply toilet paper in a $600/night room!

Great vacation hanging out at the beach and pool. Food and hospitality was great. Valet service was awesome too they shuttled us down to main street to go out to some shops. Cole G was out valet. He got us right where we needed to go. He then came to pick us up later in the evening!

Summary Heading: Hotel is not being kept up. Terrible service
Summary: Poor service, dirty, uncomfortable We were harassed daily at the pool to wear paper wristbands. One day 3 security guards and the manager came to tell us to wear the bands or leave the pool. She also said we could find another hotel and she would refund our money. I paid good money to use the facilities and shouldn’t be treated or harassed about it. Other guests were also upset about the security harassment. The pool area was dirty, they use to have pads on the loungers and outdoor couches, those have never been replaced and the loungers are so hard we could barely walk after a week of laying in them. Breakfast is buffet only. In the dolphin tower the AC blows directly on one of the beds and makes you feel like your sick each day. Lots of dogs some of which I saw pee in the

We have stayed here a couple of times and I must say; it is a great place to stay if you are traveling with kids! The pool is a lot of fun, if you can, get a room with a poolside patio (worth it). The beach is right across the street, you have plenty of food options and a strip mall down the street that you can walk to with endless coffee, food and desert options. We are Hilton honors members and I had a bit of an issue with the front desk and their lack of customer service which is the only reason I did not rate them 5 stars.

We had a great time at the hotel and at Huntington beach.  Are we glad we went, yes.  Did we have a great time, yes.  So why did we give it four stars?    Here are our positive observations: Location.  It is across the street from the beach.  It’s a quarter mile walk away from Pacific City Mall and a 10 minute walk from Main Street.   Pool.  Two pools, one kid friendly and the other more geared for adults.  The child friendly pool has two water slides and a separate sand area for the toddlers (which mimics a beach experience).  Children are allowed at the other pool but it definitely has a different vibe.  Both have large jacuzzies.   Food.  Food was good.  We only ate at the breakfast buffet.  There are a couple places to eat dinner at the hotel but we chose to explore and eat

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but thought it was pricy for what we received
Summary: We liked the hotel and had a nice stay.  It was surprisingly clean for a beach hotel.  The staff was very nice.  The grounds were beautiful, great views of the ocean and we were able to walk to a lot of places.  Pools were all gated so no beach goers could sneak in.  Loved all the fire pits they had.  Some you had to order food or drink in order to sit there.  The lighting in the bathroom was fabulous but could have used a fan.  It is a dog friendly hotel and people bring dogs of all sizes.  You hear barking and they are at the pools etc.  One lady took an umbrella just for her dog.   The cons: -Only valet parking and it was expensive -Room was small for 4 people.   -Resort fee was charged in addition to the high price to stay.  The discounts they offered for it wasn't anything

We’ve only been here a few hours and I’m already hating it.  First, we checked in and arrived in our room to find only one washcloth. We’re a family of four. Called down twice and still haven’t received more.  Did I mention we’ve been up 24 hours and are dying to shower?  Our room is teeny tiny.  The air conditioner is making an awful noise.  Thankfully I packed ear plugs.  The hotel itself is nice, but dirty. Dirty carpets, dirty floors.  And for the price we paid for four days there is no daily housekeeping.  Stay elsewhere.  Not accommodating whatsoever.

For the cost of this hotel (5 star resort prices) the experience was severely subpar.   The outer shell/appearance is great. As would be expected at a 5 star resort, there is no public parking option, only valet. And while the valet staff are friendly and quick, the driveway is a mess with sign of organization.   There’s plenty of room for them to make separate lines for check-ins/outs, regular overnight guests, visitors - but instead you show up and if you’re lucky to get someone’s attention, you’ll just be asked to stop and constantly asked the same questions.   The lobby is pretty, but the registration desk is tiny for this enormous resort. There’s no clear explanation by the front desk staff that your “Resort Amenities Fee” is a mandatory fee you’ll be charged  to cover

We went to eat at Dock Bar and Boardwalk. Great food and ambiance. We loved our server Rachel who took care of us and our dog. She brought water for the dog and made great suggestions for food! Short rib rigatoni was our favorite. Grab a drink at the dock bar they have some cool drinks for the summer !

Time to make a change! Hotel is tired, dirty and definitely not a 4 star resort. We’ve been coming here for years but it’s time to go next door. Elevator wait times were so bad we started taking the stairs. Carpet and paint is worn and dirty. Not what it used to be. Pool was anything but relaxing, seemed like they are catering to a rif raf clientele. They had a dj there both days we tried relaxing at pool, horrible! Loud rap-disco crap music blaring, couldn’t read or have a conversation, tried escaping by heading to room, nope, it was so loud on our balcony we couldn’t relax there either. I’ll just stop there….

This is a very good place to relax if you have the money to pay the high prices at this location. Bring snacks and food so you can keep the cost down. Pool and jacuzzi closes way to early in the evening! Close to the beach and other activities around.

This is an ideal location for Huntington Beach.  Walked to the beach, shops, and dining.  Service was great, rooms clean and perfect.  Great dining on the property but limited, pool bar was good.  Staffing is still an issue everywhere.

ROOM: Pros: we stayed in a Dolphin Tower Suite. The room appeared to be newly remodeled. It was beautifully decorated and clean. Con: the lamp shades looked old and appeared stained.   POOLS: The hotel has two slides. The pool with the water slides is great for families with children and the other pool is better for teens and adults. CON: when we were there they were doing work In the outdoor shower and were using loud power tools. I asked if this work could be completed another time (as many guests were complaining) but the staff was not helpful and the work continued.   This hotel does give chairs and umbrellas to take to the beach. This is a great amenity.   STAFF: many staff members were friendly and helpful (some front desk staff, the room attendants and room service

This is a nice hotel just off the beach. I loved the location but the beach and traffic is part of an issue for a hotel like this. You must valet which I didn’t care for. They also need keys and wristbands so using the digital key isn’t helpful as you have to go to the front desk. They don’t really give a lot of information and you are left wandering around trying to figure it out. Overall it is nice and fun area just wish it better for the $ paid

Nice. The food was great at all on site restarants. However, the rooms were very small but they do have nice views of the beach. $44 for valet parking is ridiculous. And you can only do valet parking! Good stay overall though.

Summary Heading: Great Ocean Front rooms, but LOUD traffic noise!
Summary: Great rooms. Great location. I loved the view. However, if you sit outside, there is a lot of traffic noise below. So don't sit outside to relax and enjoy the view...unless you just like hearing loud 18 wheelers, motorcycles, and cars pass by all day long!

The hotel is decorated beautifully, we loved our room decor. Our balcony had a wonderful ocean view. Very nice and helpful staff. It was very cool to sit in the pool and see the beach in the background. CONs would be we unplugged our frig cause it was making a loud, irritating buzz sound. Disappointed that washer and dryer weren't working to be able to use soap. Was disappointed the much anticipated pool slides were out of service. Thanks

Summary Heading: Paid too much for room. Happy that we didn’t upgrade.
Summary: I expected more for what we paid for. The coffee was awful and wasn’t functional.  The room wasn’t too clean and small. The room was worn and  had carpet stains. What made it good was being close to the beach and loved the pools.

Love this place. Great location, close to NP Beach for whale watching, Harbor cruising. Rooms are well appointed with nice sunset views. Love the 2 pools, having a quiet seclusion is appreciated. Highly recommend upgrading to suite. Beach accommodations a plus.

Summary Heading: Great location but Poor customer service management
Summary: We just had our family reunion at this hotel this past week. We picked this hotel since it is across the Pacific Highway from Huntington Beach. It is close proximity to the beach.   We had over 14 Suite nights at this hotel during this stay. We were disappointed at the value of these Suites. Each costed 800$ a night with small space and substandard bedding and furniture.  What was really disappointing to us was customer management at this hotel. First, this hotel hid under the Covid name to not do daily housekeeping in our Suites. We had to ask for it each day. Even when we asked for it,  one day, they did not do it. Management blamed it on short of staff.  We could not check into one of our Suites until 5pm the day before. We requested late check out for the next day till 3pm

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel….just too many families with too many kids
Summary: Beautiful hotel for sure!  But the customer service was lacking.  No explanations on where things are and it was like pulling teeth to get our bags brought up. It also took forever to get our bags picked up for checkout.    I would NOT recommend this hotel for singles or couples as there are WAY TOO MANY FAMILIES staying here.  It’s kid central.

We’ve stayed here several times and have always enjoyed our stay.  However, this time there was a weird security guard dressed in all black including a jacket hanging around the pool gates checking everyone for a bracelet even though we have keys on our phone and CAN OPEN the gate.  Clearly we are guests.  He wouldn’t let my friend in until we went to the front desk to get another bracelet.  It was a bit off putting.  And the slide was closed.  The security issue could be cleaned up a bit.

What a wonderful place! This place is totally Awesome. Great views of the ocean and the coolest rooftop bar where we had a lot of fun. Valet was super helpful and super friendly. Cole Gowan was very quick to get our car when we were checking out. Will be back in september!!!

This has honestly been one of my favorite experiences at a hotel. The location is right across the street from the beach, the restaurants in the area are exquisite, and all in all an awesome place to relax. Samuel Rodriguez, one of the valets at the resort, was able to give me great food recommendations and did not disappoint in customer service. Same can be said about all the other staff at the hotel. Would 10/10 recommend coming here.

The staff in the restaurants and the pool are fabulous and extremely attentive.  The rooms are also nice, updated, and well planned.   However, the front desk staff, including one of the managers, are in need of some serious training in guest relations.  I booked via The United Vacations website, which is a third party site. The check in went smoothly and we were given keys to the room and wristbands for the pool. The next day, around 2:45 PM, the front desk manager called the room. She asked how I wanted to pay for the extra time in the room since I had overstayed beyond the 11 AM checkout time. I told her I had booked the room for three nights, not one. She told me that the computer showed one night and that I needed to come down and show evidence that I booked the room for

Summary Heading: 4.75  which could become a 3.5  or 5.0..Two major But addressable issue.
Summary: Everything was perfect except ONE big thing…  It’s a California Beach Resort Hotel …what their to a companion about…not much at all the best part of the hotel is their staff from the valet that greeted us, to Juan the night auditor who did some magic to upgrade us into a better room in the dolphin tower (note there was an upgrade fee—but understandable).  After checking in late from her flight, having breakfast Buffett  at the Boardwalk Resturaunt  was delicious, fresh, clean. My daughter and I had what was a worth $60 breakfast. Katelyn and the manager were exceptional. The made-to-order omelets chef working on Friday was very  friendly and engaging: while he was making the perfect omelet.  The pool seems excellent if you’re into a bunch of kids running around being kid. I

Old dirty converters on both beds... The filler in the comforter looked and felt like sawdust instead of feathers. Blankets with stains in the closet. Asked for two clean replacements, they both had stains in them as well. No market open after hours.   Accomplished diamond member, is out this at $150 a night not $500+  Hotel workers getting in the elevator as you go up to your room and riding back down to their floor instead of giving privacy.

Checked in for my birthday on a Friday night thru Sunday.  As a diamond Hilton member, they could only give me a 12pm check out....Also, messed up my breakfast credit, and only thought one person was in the room when my wife and I both walked up to check-in.  The Surf Hero F&B outlet has an amazing breakfast burrito, just feel bad it's so small and busy.  Coffee was great, but only had small cups available.  No large coffees!  The sever at the pool, she was hustling.  Never stopped, always walked by, cleaning up trash and towels.  The bartender at the pool remembered my drinks and was super friendly.  The security at the pool was the nicest people I came across all weekend. Forgot my wristband, he was nice and polite asked me to get it, and even suggested just going to the front

Want to stay at a resort across the street from Huntington Beach? This is your hotel. Location is prime, close to restaurants & shops. It isn’t cheap but you’re paying for location. Valet parking only $44 daily & daily resort charge ($33). Rooms are nice but our fridge was unusually noisy. They have 2 pools, 1 with a slide (my son loved it) and heated. In lieu of a continental breakfast we got a $15 credit up to ($30 a day) for being a Hilton Honors member which was great. We used it at the Hero Cafe for snacks one day and breakfast at the Boardwalk restaurant the next. Overall great hotel with a great location to everything.

The first day I arrived to the Hilton there was a line down the driveway with families everywhere scrambling to get their stuff out of there car. Although it was very chaotic I still felt very welcomed by their valet and how accommodating they were. A valet attendant named Austin Peretz grabbed bags from my car from their parking garage since I left it in the car and did it with a smile. Overall loved their valet and special shout-out to Austin:))

Summary Heading: Fantastic stay at The Waterfront Beach Resort
Summary: Love The Waterfront Beach Resort!  My family and I have stayed here many times and always leave wishing we could stay longer.  Our last stay was Memorial Day weekend. From check-in to check-out was nothing but enjoyment, with ALL hotel staff being nothing but friendly, helpful and professional.  Jasmine at the front desk heard my wife say it was my birthday and upgraded our ocean view room to an oceanfront view with a wrap around balcony.  Thank you Jasmine!  Also a shout out and thank you to Ernesto and Travis who took great care of us while dining near the pool. A big thank you to all of the staff, I just wish I had all the names.   Great rooms, great staff, fantastic food, and all right on the beach.  We can’t wait to return.

I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and had a great time, the guest, workers and more were all super caring and gave me a great vibe the whole trip, but the valet always welcomes be the best, aka.Austin

Overall had a very nice stay.   Wife and I redeemed two free night certificates here over Memorial day weekend. So we had 2 separate reservations, under 2 different names. We are both Hilton Diamond members. Note that per Hilton policy, we were not charged the resort fee, as it was an award booking.   Our experience was overall very good. When we arrived, the check in desk agent Nina (or as I called her, the Wizard) did some magic to keep us in the same room both nights, and even found us a bit of an upgraded room in the brand new Twin Dolphin tower - despite being Memorial Day and the hotel being basically sold out. She explained everything to us, offered us a late checkout by an hour, and did it with a smile. When we checked out, I went to complain that we got charged $10 for

Summary Heading: Not worth the price you pay
Summary: For the price of rooms at this hotel ($600-800/night), I expected so much more.  I only booked one night.  As a Hilton gold member, I am supposed to get a room upgrade (based on availability) as well as late checkout.  Despite the fact that they were still taking reservations for the room that I should have been upgraded to, they claimed they were all sold out and refused to give an upgrade.  I arrived around 2:30, but my room was not ready until 4pm, which is check in time so I cannot fault them for that.  In order to use the pool facilities, you have to have a room key, so that wasn’t an option while we waited.  There was no concierge to hold our bags so we just sat in the lobby with our bags until the room was ready.  The room had recently been remodeled, but they must have

My stay at the Hilton was phenomenal. Food was great! The restaurant offshore 9 was great! The customer is awesome. My valet Cole Gowan was hustling fast to get my car as we were in a big hurry to leave. 10/10 service and will gladly be back later next month.

Overall amazing experience! My family stayed here May 13-16 and we totally loved it! The food was amazing and my kids LOVED hanging out by the pool whenever we got tired of exploring the area. Our valet, Samuel Rodriguez, was able to give us local restaurants to try out and gave us ideas of activities we could be doing while in town!

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed in
Summary: I’m actually so sad that I put this hotel at the start of my overseas trip, coz I didn’t get to appreciate it as I slept for most of it!   I arrived down to Huntington after a 14 hour flight from Australia and was surprised with my room being ready at 1030am. So lucky. I got the partial ocean view room on the 8th floor and the view was stunning. Room was gorgeous as well. I can also promise you that the bed was one of the comfiest I had ever slept on as I slept for 12 hours lol.  Staff were super friendly and the location can’t be beat. Pool looked lovely as well. Highly recommend staying here. Worth the price!

This was our second time staying at this hotel, because we liked it so much the first time. Room was nice, we had a King partial view and it was a good view. The Boardwalk restaurant has a great burger, even if the menu is a little pretentious (in our opinion). The pools are nice, they have "security" and wrist bracelets to make sure only people staying there can utilize it. It's in a great location as far as walking to food and shops.  The negatives are that you do have to cross a busy street to get to the beach. Also, there is no free breakfast, which means you have to go out first thing in the morning to find food, unless you plan ahead. And it was our 25th anniversary, which we told a couple of them when we were checking in, but they don't do anything for it. We've been at

Went to the Hilton Waterfront Hotel for the McKenna Claire event and received amazing service from the valet team! Cole Fischer was awesome and helped get our car back quickly. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to host an event.

My family was attended by Austin Peretz. He was so helpful on such a busy day and extremely kind. Austin did an amazing job by keeping our bags safe and calling for a bellman to help us. Definitely a family favorite. We had a great time!!! Will definitely come again!!!!!!!!! Thanks again for hiring such great people.

We had a positive experience from the Waterfront Hilton staff, including from the hotel valet. Austin Perez assisted us during our stay and went above & beyond to help us, which we greatly appreciated! :)

Summary Heading: Outstanding Service, Extremely Clean, Great location
Summary: Extremely friendly and welcoming staff.  I specifically want to mention Haley (worked at the bar across from the pool on the 1st floor).  Haley was above and beyond welcoming, attentive, and kept the bar moving along great.  Haley made excellent drinks, but she truly was engaging with every customer with local recommendations, and making people feel human and not just another customer.  Also, Leer, Leer helped me with my bags checking in and out.  It was a standout that during my stay I realized I left my sunglasses in my car that had been valeted.  When I went down to valet to ask if they could retrieve them for me, Leer, was nearby and said, "Would you like it if I grab those for you and just bring them to your room so you don't have to wait down here?"    I was very impressed

The hotel is beautiful.  There are several delicious restaurants to choose from.  The pools are large.  They have two pools one for adults and one for children.  You're close to local restaurants and shops.  The beach is right across the street.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  We will be back.

Summary Heading: One of my favourites - top notch in every way
Summary: This resort is one of our favourite of all Hilton properties! I stayed here several years ago, and since then, there have been significant improvements. The room was decorated very tastefully and the view over the pool and the beach is stunning. The staff are very accommodating and our whole stay went very smoothly. During Covid, they even made amendments to ensure that they provided treadmills outside by the pool. The restaurant is nice and offers high quality food; however, it is also close to so many fabulous places at Pacific City. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. My only disappointment is not staying longer and I cannot wait to return. Being diamond members, we have visited Hiltons all around the world (with around 100 days in Hiltons in 2021), and this one stands out

Our 2cd stay at this resort in six months and worth the return. Our check in with Nina was above and beyond what I’ve experienced as a world traveler.  What is usually a “get me my room as fast as you can!” turned into a great conversation with smiles and valuable information about the property.  If Hilton could clone Nina and make her the standard in all of their properties checking in would be a lot more enjoyable!!!  The rest of our 2 night stay was just as impressive. From getting a cup of coffee and breakfast burrito at Surf Hero with manager Tina making sure everything is ok, to passing staff in the hallways and lobbies everyone was wearing a smile and quick to say hello.   Although the hotel was built 3 decades ago, it was remodeled a couple of years ago and our

The check in process was easy. Damian was the highlight. Very respectful and accommodating. Room was nicely appointed. View was great. Roof top bar was a highlight. Great staff there and overall. The Hero Market had great coffee and good wine choices.

Shawn and Jordan did a great job setting up our bonfire by the beach. These guys were Very helpful and accommodating. Bonfire was ready on time. They made sure we do not run out of smores, drinks and wood for fire. Best Experience!

The attendants by the names of Sean and Jordan treated us so kindly and were even nice enough to make conversation. They helped us with all of our needs and were very respectful. Incredible service all around! Sean was extremely helpful with the fire and Jordan supplied us with delicious s’mores ingredients.

they became my best friends, nicest guys i have ever met. kept us warm all night and were never boring towards us! if you come here ask for them. I will be coming back, me and my friends still speak about them to this day!

My family was attended by both Sean and Jordan. They were great servers and extremely kind. Sean did an amazing job of keeping our fire going and Jordan was very accommodating when we asked for more chocolate. Definitely a family favorite.  I had a great time!!! Will definitely come again!!!!!!!!!

This visit was phenomenal. I was serviced by both Sean and Jordan and they were amazing. Incredibly sweet to us and we had a lovely conversation. They always checked on us to see how we were doing and I felt so loved and appreciated. Will for sure be coming back.

After a few roadblocks with contacting agents from reservations, I luckily stumbled upon Mitchel, who was outstanding. Thank you for the incredible help and willingness to go above and beyond for ensuring we stopped a cycle of playing phone tag with the reservations desk.

The accommodation where quite excellent. Beautifully furnished. Beautiful beach front view. Ver friendly staff. Could not ask for more for my few days of vacation to California from the East coast! Thank you .

Summary Heading: Thank you Nina!!  Excellent hospitality and kindness!!
Summary: This resort is absolutely incredible.  Nina at the front desk is a rock star and went out of her way to help us with our trip plans. She made me so much more excited about staying at this resort and visiting California than I already was.  She has A+ Customer Service and Hospitality skills. The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort has beautiful views of the beach and is extremely clean. Thanks so much for making me smile today!

Clearly one of the best quality hotel experiences you will have in Orange County.  A great place to stay and play.  From the time you arrive the valet to the registration staff, to the restaurant staff everyone treats you very well.  I have stayed here in the past several times and will be staying here as often as possible.

My wife and I were in Huntington Beach for the first time in many year. The new tower for the hotel, the additional amenities and the Pacific City mall adjacent make for a wonderful beach escape. The staff was incredibly friendly, the food was delicious, the beautiful room with an ocean view topped off the stay….looking at an entire week in September.

We had a great time at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort! The room was beautiful, clean and had a fantastic view of the beach. We really enjoyed the pool and hot tub. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We had a small issue with our door but one of the staff saw us and got us help right away. Can’t wait to come back!

Thanks to Shawn who was the bonfire attendant we had a wonderful evening watching the sun set, making s'mores and enjoying our refreshments. Shawn was fun attentive and interesting.vomfy chairs. Blankets. Limitless wood for fire.  Highly recommend doing a bonfire at Waterfront Resort. Fav activity of the trip

pros: great location, nice views, quiet area  cons: issues with service, no concierge, attitude issues at reception desk, corridors cluttered with in-dining trays, in-room safe not working.    Maybe we just weren't lucky but I don't think we'll stay here again.

Location, location, location.  Less than 10 minute walk to Huntington Beach Main St and Pier.  Coffee/breakfast restaurants a block away. We faced North in the Twin Dolphin Tower.  View was beautiful. Why only 4 stars...the sofa bed couch was horrific! No padding and you're literally sleeping on the metal springs. I would still recommend staying here if you want to enjoy Huntington Beach area.

Wonderful hotel and location. Stayed here multiple times. The front desk staff are stellar and very customer service driven, happy to check for upgrades available, they are professional and want every guest to have the best experience. Keeps us coming back for more every time.

We just returned from a 2-night ‘staycation’ at the Hilton visiting out of town friends.  We booked a poolside patio suite which was very convenient traveling with kids.  Although this is a beautiful, massive property, there were some things lacking that would have made it truly a 4 star experience and will probably cause us to go back to our usual hotel, (the Hyatt down the street).  First the good: -Valet was well staffed, kind and highly efficient.   -Hilton app was user friendly and gave us the ability to check-in and obtain our digital key without having to stop by the front desk -Service at the Boardwalk Cafe was excellent as was the food (order the chicken Piccata, trust me). Breakfast buffet was fresh and tasty, Albeit not a huge selection for $39 a person. -the pool was

Early morning guy working the front desk is rude and poor communication and custom satisfaction skills.  Other than that room and check in and out is good. The pool is amazing with views from the room are breath taking.

We had a wonderful experience at the Waterfront Hilton, service was great, cleanliness was top notch, access to beach and other businesses.  Surf Heroes Marketplace has great options for quick dining and snacks

Great place for a long weekend small family reunion that coincided with a meeting that one of them was involved with. great place for both a short walk to the shopping center which has great food and various stores to visit. Of Course being across from the ocean is a huge benefit along with a walk to the very famous Hunting Beach pier. and Downtown Hunting Beach

The new Tower at the Hilton is beautiful!  It is modern, clean,and very comfortable with all the amenities and a beautiful view of the ocean from our balcony. It is within walking distance to downtown restaurants, Pacific City with shops and more restaurants and of course, the beautiful ocean beach.

The location of this hotel can’t be beat!  Waterfront, fantastic family friendly pool, not to mention its heated, the location is so nice. We walked everyday to Pacific City which had great options for meals throughout the day.  We had a partial ocean view room on the 11th floor & it was stunning!  The beds are so comfy & the rooms are beautiful & well decorated.  Loved that they came with a fridge & microwave!   The staff was super friendly & efficient!   This location is pricey but you definitely get what you pay for!  We hope to save up & return again soon!

Just wanna recognize Lear the Bell Hop. A very polite young man! Lear went over and beyond to provide us with great service in regards to helping us with our luggage! Lear took the extra step to retrieve a bag from the trunk of my car downstairs that I had forgotten upon arrival.  Overall great experience at the Water Front Resort.

Summary Heading: If you are are thinking about taking a trip to this area, do it. Have Jordan check you in, and wait for the good times to start
Summary: My experience at this Hilton property was an absolute grand couple of days of west and wewaxensashen at wast. From the second that my family and I turned into the driveway up until the time that we departed, I could not have asked for anything to be improved upon. My interactions with all employees, especially Jordon at the front desk were top notch and could not have been better. During these catch all of excuses (well....due to covid...) this resort, aside from the facial coverings that are required, made me feel as if I was a guest pre March 2020. The pool and whirlpools  were great, the food and service were awesome, our rooms were more than adequate, and the aesthetic value from all points were special in all areas

There is always great service from valet, check in, restaurant service and anyone you come in contact during your stay. We go one time a year for business but make it a leisurely trip after to just relax.

My room had a beautiful ocean view. I loved that my room smelled fresh and clean . The gentleman up at the front desk and parking attendance were attentive and nice . The only complaint I had was that my bed was very hard and uncomfortable . I had the worst sleep ever . But over all I enjoyed the cleanliness .

Damian was there to help us with our whole stay. Everything about this hotel is 5 star. We love staying here. We had our holiday party here and all of our staff had the best time. They made the whole day and weekend so enjoyable and relaxing.

My husband booked this hotel for my birthday weekend. The hotel was clean and room was very spacious. The bathroom was a nice size with a lock on the door lol. Hotel is valet parking only. Only downside is that my husband and I didn’t have any assistance with our bags once we arrived. Hotel is within walking distance of other restaurants and retail stores.

Chose this hotel for location and it turned out great, only downside was the daily parking fee of $44, with no self parking options. Hotel is within walking distance of many different amenities like food and shopping

Thank you Mitchell, Mr. Campillo, Shae, and many others for your Outstanding Hospitality! Icing on the cake at your “Jewel” of a resort in HB. We were wowed again with the beautiful (hypoallergenic) room, total cleanliness, and gorgeous sunsets. Holiday Breakfast Buffet was exceptional. This property offers so many areas to experience a true Vacay and the convenience of walking to even more. Huntington pool and jacuzzi (strong jets for relieving sore muscles) was much appreciated. Pet friendly property- although we didn’t bring one, seeing, hearing, and meeting so many warmed the property and our hearts. Looking forward to our return! Cheers

Summary Heading: Large, resort hotel very close to the beach
Summary: Large hotel complex that provides for all the basic needs a traveller may have. Very functional with little in the way of character but it is clean, has large rooms and is right alongside the beach. Enjoyed my stay there.

Summary Heading: Wonderful location across from the ocean - has everything
Summary: I was at the Thanksgiving Brunch yesterday in one of the ballrooms. They had set up a beautiful venue with music and the best wait staff - friendly and so helpful. They had everything from sushi and prime rib to lamb and salmon. We sat around the pool where there were lounges and many covered places. They actually have put sand on the side of the pool with firepits. The kids really enjoyed playing in the sand. They have many restaurants in and out and many bar areas even a bar on the roof of the hotel with sofas and a great view of the ocean.

We asked for a hypoallergenic room and what we received were foam pillows that felt we were sleeping on a bunch of rocks, full of lumps and craters! The bed was HORRIBLE, wish I could have thrown it out the balcony, it was that bad. Not fun waking up w/an achy back & stiff neck. The bathroom vanity panels covering the sink kept falling down (because it was held together w/Velcro). The hallways in our tower (we were in the older tower) were dark & dinghy (circa early ‘90’s Thanksgiving motif). We were told the rooms were recently renovated but it felt that it was an afterthought. The front desk personnel were top notch & very helpful, that was very appreciated.

I did not feel appreciated by the hotel staff, and the customer service is poor. The staff and the restaurants and lounges are subpar, and upon check-in, I had to tell them my last name three times because the woman at the front desk did not care to listen when I was speaking.

The air conditioning did not work. I called front desk engineer came Up to fix. It was fixed for about 5 minutes. Very uncomfortable due to it being a hot weekend. I called and complained so hopefully they can accommodate us since the stay was pretty pricey

Summary Heading: Very loud noise from road and guests using pool. No concierge as advertised. No information on amenities offered.
Summary: Requested room was not available. Refrigerator was not working in the room. No information in room on availability amenities. Directions to room which required a long walk and multiple elevators were not provided. Concierge not available.

We had a friends reunion in November. About 10 adults with multiple children. The hotel was impeccable. They have multiple sitting areas outside and indoors were we all met up for drinks and fun. The children enjoyed the waterslide the most. We had kids ages 5-14 and they all loved the pool which is next to the jacuzzi which is perfect (adults can hang at the jacuzzi with drinks etc)... Lifeguard on duty. I did give the 3 stars because the food was terribly expensive and disgusting... Heros restaurant has some of the worse pizzas we ever had in our life! We had so many, we did not want to leave the hotel so we all survived on snacks...  All the restaurants are overly priced and unreasonably costly for families. Management, have you consider adding a subway restaurant or a

We stayed in this hotel for the second time. We like the location ad the view, I miss an indoor pool but the gym is adequate. The major negative experience was the breakfast. Guests are allowed to have breakfast until 10:00 on weekdays which meant they started to nag guests at 9:40 to leave and they failed to refill the trays on purpose. In addition breakfast room is too small and crowded in covid times... The Bar or conference room should be used as additional breakfast hall. Only one coffee machine was available for 100 guests, meaning queuing for coffee... Apart from the breakfast experience the hotel is clean and well equipped. Breakfast was a major letdown in an allegedly 4 star hotel...

It's our favorite family staycation including grandma and dog stella. Love our local Hilton peeps! We had a few Issues but they handled with a lot of grace. We would stay again for sure. Thank you for making our stay comfortable and accommodating.

Our family took a week to travel the PCH up to San Francisco and back.  The WFBR was our stay for the first night of our trip and the last night before flying home.  I have absolutely no regrets regarding our choice to stay @HiltoHB.  Our first night we stumbled upon the Cars and Copters annual show.  Combine this with the obvious attractiveness for wedding events and corporate events the place was packed.  We were still able to reserve a great room in the Huntington Tower with a wonderful ocean view.  The check-in process was smooth and the staff was friendly.  Our kids had fun at the pool area with the slides.  We utilized our dining credit towards 2 flatbread breakfast pizzas in the morning.  They were great and larger than I expected.  A nice amount of food for our family of

Terrific town and beach to visit.  Our hotel stay was equally wonderfully.  Customer service was off the charts.  Magnificent pool and good food options.  Recommend staying here anytime, but especially when the colters and Car show takes place in the Fall.

Absolutely loved this hotel and location!  Ease of online check-in, mobile key access, and incredible ocean view from patio. The room was clean, modern and comfortable. Walking distance to lots of shopping and restaurants.

We love staying at this hotel. The staff is amazing and the hotel is perfectly located near restaurants, nightlife and of course the beach. This is the BEST place to stay whenever in Huntington because the staff and location. Thanks 😊

Very nice property. Only negative aspect of property was the gym wasn’t up to the rest of the properties status. Overall hotel had Quality Service and professionalism of the staff was obvious. Hotel wasn’t near full capacity and not everything was open, but what was, was well staffed. Location is great.

The Waterfront Hilton never disappoints my expectations for my Huntington Beach experience. This hotel was the first resort established in this area and still remains the best of all the new resorts. The entire staff is focused on making your stay enjoyable with excellent service and friendliness. Beach access is excellent with the best location for all the best Huntington has to offer. The Waterfront has so many services available for beach activities, from rentals to fire pit service.

My husband and I stayed here last weekend, and I had accidentally booked and paid for the wrong day to stay through Travelocity.  The manager Damian Garcia was a life saver, went above and beyond to find us a room on a sold out weekend.  Damian also gave me his card to use to help to get my funds back that went unused.  I received a full refund from Travelocity today.  I’ll be back to this beautiful hotel very soon!

Summary Heading: Needs to figure out if they are a 2 star or 4/5 star hotel.
Summary: I brought my daughter up to see the air show in Huntington Beach. When we first arrived the valet didn’t even have carts for our luggage so I had to carry 4 bags and make sure my daughter was safe in a very busy entrance. The front desk girl was very nice and got us checked in fairly quick. However I encountered more problems later that evening. The pizza place was to busy to deliver to the room so I ordered from Uber eats. My daughter had just fallen a sleep and supposedly the concierge wouldn’t let the Uber eats guy up to deliver the pizza. I consequently had to run down which was a disaster with my daughter. Unbelievable they couldn’t let them bring the food up. Then the next day we had to be checked out by 11am with a checkin time of 4pm. I also used my Chase equivalent to

Off Shore lounge was amazing. Great views of the beach and amazing drinks. It does get a little chilly at night so bring a jacket. Kaelyn helped us at the rooftop with drinks and turning the heaters on, she’s amazing. Luis and Damian were super helpful! Highly recommend.

DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU ARE A DIAMOND MEMBER! REPEAT DO NOT STAY HERE! THEY DO NOT HONOR DIAMOND STATUS HERE! Checked in for one night for a wedding. Had been calling weeks in advance to make sure it was noted that we wanted an upgrade as Diamond. Checked the night before and they had plenty of open rooms. I called the day before check in again just to nicely ask about upgrades. I was told that they couldn't honor it until check in but it looked good. I get to check in the day of and the front desk essentially said they would not honor it. They said it was their discretion and even with just 1 night and open rooms, but they wouldn't do it. Absolutely rude to my wife as well. Add to that, as been noted by others, hotel is very dated and valet is suspect. NOT WORTH IT!

Service was very good and staff very friendly and helpful. The food (pizza and breakfast omelets) were very good. Just a short walk to Huntington beach pier. Multiple restaurant choices and beach activities next to the hotel. Pool area was very nice with beach views. Room had a  great view.

This hotel is beyond a 5 star experience!  The rooms and views are gorgeous, the staff is extremely accommodating, the restaurants and Bars ++++++++!! We had a family gathering in memory of our Dads passing . Everything went perfectly. From the Sunset views at the 9th floor bar (live music included )  to the pool slide for the kids ! Such a fun gorgeous Hotel ! We cannot wait to come back ..

Best hotel in Huntington Beach, all the rooms is beautiful, excellent view to the sunset, Front Desk Manager Mr. Jessie exceed all expectations  Offshores roff top has excellent view to the Ocean and City view, Great memories for my family, definitely ours back. Great food! Ours celebrate 21 years for my daughter.

I recently stayed three nights at the Waterfront Beach Resort, Hilton in Huntington Beach.  Spoiler alert: I recommend this hotel to all and will have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again the next time I am in Huntington Beach.  Initially, if you plan on staying relatively local, use Uber/Lyft rather than renting a car and paying for parking. From the airport, an Uber to the Hilton costs about $25.  The Hilton has two towers.  I stayed on the fifth floor of the Huntington tower in a “resort” view room.  From my balcony I had a great view of the beach, which is immediately across the street from the hotel.  Although the rooms are identified as “ocean view” and “resort view”, it appears that all rooms have an ocean of some kind.  Recommendation, save your money when

Summary Heading: Smoke detectors going off twice in the middle of the night.
Summary: Woke up in a panic twice to smoke detectors going off in the middle of the night waking up our two young kids. The only compensation we received was late check out… that’s clearly not compenstion for the scare and panic. There was a mans voice that came over the speaker to let us know it was a false alarm. Not to mention the pool slides were not running the day we arrived.. main reason we chose that hotel. Very disappointed.

I've stayed here three times when in town to visit family.  It's a nice beach location and has a decent pool.  Its four star, but nothing overly special.  Mediocre service in the restaurant.  Icd atay here again, as its convenient ro family and the kids like the pool.

We had a group of family in the hotel and had great experiences with the facility and staff.  We ate in the restaurants, lounged by the pool and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The room was clean and comfortable, the view was incredible and the places within walking distance were a lot of fun.

We stayed here so that our kids could play on the waterslides. Unfortunately they kept the waterslides closed and the pool staff admitted that this is pretty normal here. Do not expect the waterslides to be open if you were staying here. Management did not care too much that a lot of families were upset at the pool.

The restroom was broken so my families have to switch room as soon as we checked in.  The manager of the hotel restaurant in first floor  talked to me in the language which I do not understand (I assumed it was  chinese language) just because I am Asian. The hotel valet parking crew broke my air freshener in my car but didn't  inform me at all nor apologized.  These events  all happend at a 3 night stay at Hilton. Horrible experience!!

Beautiful spot but they are definitely penny pinching. I got that it is covid, but the rates haven't dropped.  When you pay nearly 700 dollars a night, service should be better.  In particular, they closed the water slide at 3pm while the pool doesn't close until 10.   The slide had to have someone watching, so guessing they didn't want to pay.  And they donr clean your room unless you ask.   And when I did ask, what a pain in the butt they made it.   Beautiful view and room, but service lacking

My family really enjoyed our beach stay but there are a few details that really need someone’s attention. Great location, restaurants and overall a pretty resort. My first complaint is the sofa bed, it was AWFUL!! Hilton should be be embarrassed, it was truly the worst mattress I’ve ever seen. Asked for a rollaway and somehow it was worse, the springs were actually poking out. For $750 a night? Nuts. And what beach resort doesn’t have umbrellas at the pool? It seemed strange and after a day at the beach not ideal. Also important for families to know Saturday nights it kind of turns into a 20 something nightclub. Lots of people hanging out looking for a rooftop party.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, just don't accidently spill a drink
Summary: Stayed here with my family of five (three children ages 9, 7, & 7) for three nights last week. The best part of the experience was the pool area and general location of the hotel. We also had a nice experience with the restaurant staff and bartenders. Accomodations were fine; my daughter slept on the pull out couch and we really enjoyed sitting out on the balcony. We spent the bulk of our stay at the pool.   The Valet service is not as advertised, nor was the contactless check in process. We were anticipating being able to access our room with our phones, but since our room was an "E-room", we still needed to get key cards from the front desk. No biggy there. We also were under the impression that anytime we needed our vehicle, we could text down and get the process started. Not

The Hilton Waterfront in HB is just what we needed!  The property is lovely, directly across the street from the beach.  Food and drinks have the expected high price tag but there are many great options a short walk down toward the pier.  Two nice pools with plenty of chairs.  Yes, people save them early and then leave.  No one is policing this despite the sign that says they are.  It wasn’t a problem for us.  The room was immaculate and the beds comfortable.  We really loved this stay and we will return!

As a DIAMOND Hilton Honors member I was not prepared to pay the outrageous parking fee of $44 per day.  I have not paid that much in NY or Chicago. The parking fee put a real damper on the weekend.  I was also disappointed with the number of patrons who were NOT wearing facemasks indoors.  On a positive note, the check in process was efficient and quick.  The front desk lady was polite and pleasant.  The room was spotless.  Unlike the other Hiltons during the past 12 months, there was no sticker on the door validating a deep cleaning.  The room was quiet, especially considering on Sunday evening there was a large wedding in the courtyard below our room and the PCH was so close.  The balcony had a nice view of the nearby Huntington State Beach.  The property was a nice walk to

We were so happy at the beach. We could walk on the sand, enjoy the view, have drinks on the roof top, and enjoy Starbucks for breakfast.  We loved our dinner at the restaurant.  The valet parking went very smoothly.  Sean was VERY welcoming!!

Summary Heading: The Waterfront Beach Resort, A Hilton Hotel is simply Brilliant
Summary: The Waterfront Beach Resort is simply amazing.  We had a brilliant vacation with our family.  The rooms were most accommodating to our large family and provided plenty of space for relaxation and rejuvenation.  The amenities are fantastic.  Our kids lived at the pool and enjoyed the sun bathing.  The staff is extremely kind and truly the best.  Thank you!

The valet was the only problem we had. Long wait times to get the car and very expensive for guests who are staying the night at an already expensive hotel in HB. We are locals and we’re disappointed with that charge $44 per night .

Summary Heading: Best Beach Resort at Huntington Beach
Summary: An incredible resort with many amenities, beautiful/clean rooms, caring staff, perfect location to beach.  Close proximity to local restaurants, shopping mall, etc......all within walking distance Definitely a future return vacation for the entire family!!!

Great property by the beach, overall great location and clean rooms.  Beware dining at restaurants there will automatically add $4 to your bill so either tip less or ask the front desk to remove it on checkout.  Only other bad experiences was on checkout, a young woman with long blonde hair was very snotty and seemed like she didn't want to help.  She removed the $4 after I complained but never thanked us for staying at the Hilton even as a Diamond member.  Her ID was listed as LKERZIE on the bill.  She should not be customer facing.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Amenities, Don’t Expect any Hilton Honor Perks or Appreciation from Staff
Summary: This was our second stay at the hotel, it was apparent this time around the hotel has made some major changes to staff and leadership, for the worse. The location is great, the amenities are ok. We did not feel appreciated by staff. Even as a Hilton Honors Diamond member we did not feel appreciated. You are forced to valet. Everywhere you buy anything, even the gift shop, you are presented with a receipt basically asking for a tip. My impression is that staff is under paid, and guests are overcharged. For the size of the rooms, and the quality of the beds, the resort charge, forced valet, I think you can find something better in Huntington Beach. Our first visit to the hotel was much better. We don’t plan to return to this hotel unfortunately due to this last visit.

Summary Heading: Such a beautiful hotel with and amazing staff 100/10
Summary: I came from out of town for a work trip with another coworker of mine and we both didn’t want to drive home (4hours because traffic) and we made the decision to stay. We had such a WONDERFUL time everyone was so kind and sweet and very helpful I couldn’t have asked for such a better time 🖤

This was our most recent visit of many stays.  One word describes the Waterfront...CONSISTENCY!  The property is always well maintained, the food is terrific and staff is the best in the entire Hilton chain.  We are Hilton Diamond  members and have stayed at many Hilton properties.  You will not find a better hotel anywhere.  They are across the street from the Pacific Ocean and a great beach.  You have all the ingredients for a wonderful relaxing vacation.

We always have a great time when we stay here every year but this year was just amazing! Damien at front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade since our room wasn’t ready and I couldn’t believe our room! He was so friendly and made us feel very welcomed. Our hotel room was phenomenal and our stay could not have been better! Thank you so much for making our family vacation a memorable trip and we left overly happy.

I loved the resort, but I had charges upon charges on my card. When I got there , at 4pm my room was not ready until 5 pm. Then they put a hold of 400.00 , for just in case. Then I noticed another hold the next day for another 700.00, I mean really I was with the kids there is a thing called budget. And now still disputing charges. This has effected my future trips to a Hilton.

I paid too much for the stay and top it off the valet and resort fees. They upgraded my room but the previously room was better than what they gave me. And there was no refrigerator. They only have valet and that’s like $44 a night. You can’t self park.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to go for a family Vacation.
Summary: This place is a really great place to stay if you are going to be in Huntington Beach. Great rooms, Great Views from your balcony, Great food, easy access to the beach, two pools, two hot tubs, wanted to stay longer but we had to go back home. Would definitely do it again.

This was our first time here at the Hilton waterfront and we loved it and want to come back.  Our kids loved everything and everything was available for us.  The only down fall was that one of our rooms was not available to us after 4pm.  Luckily we were all out shopping that we didn’t mind it because we were in walking distance to everything.  Best thing was that the hotel watched our luggage’s for us so we can enjoy other things. Including keys to the pool!

Summary Heading: Great location, hotel, lots of billing problems
Summary: The hotel location was great, right across from the pier and a couple of blocks from main street. They have multiple pools/hot tubs. One pool was heated and rarely busy while the pool with the water slide was packed as was the hot tub there. The rooms were clean and had a modern look. They claimed to have bike rental but when we went to rent one we were told we had to walk across the street to rent from a third party company and come back and pick up the bikes probably a 25-30 minute ordeal. Hero pizza was great but wait times were around 2 hours to get a pizza. They didnt offer room service giving covid as an excuse however covid wasn't an issue with their over crowded pools, elevators and common areas. So it feels like they are are just cutting corners and using covid as an

Shower was not clean.  Waitstaff didn’t seem to want to be there.  Early desk manager is awful and floors, restrooms and areas nowhere near clean.  Nothing open before 7am.  No coffee and certainly unfriendly staff.

We loved everything from the cleanness of the resort to the professionalism from everyone in the staff. I was very comfortable throughout my stay. Definitely recommend and will be coming back. It was very convenient since the beach is across the street.

While the hotel is beautiful, the cost to stay was very high compared to the value of the experience.  The food was over priced, Buffett was average, no room to sit at the pool with my kids and no late check out.

I stayed here for a quick business trip and the hotel was great. I was sad I didn’t get to utilize the amazing facilities more. The hotel was beautiful and I hope to go back with my family for a vacation.

The name of the hotel is just the start of the lies. Calling it a resort is generous, let alone waterfront. The paint is peeling terribly all over the exterior, the bars and waterslides were closed every time we went to use them. Also, the hotel itself is not exactly waterfront. It’s alongside the pacific coast Highway and across the highway is a parking lot and then it’s the ocean. For a resort price (we paid more than $500/night), we expected some amenities to be part of the price tag - WiFi as a starter. But no, they charge a sneaky resort fee of $33/day for your WiFi and “complementary” water bottles that you can ask for at the front desk. On top of that, to park at the “resort”, you must pay a valet $42/day (there’s no self park on the property). When we spoke with the

Summary Heading: Spring break on the weekends, families during the week. Very expensive for what it is.
Summary: Arrived to the valet. No greeting. I interrupted the group of valet’s discussion to obtain service.   The pool was the scene of a Cancun spring break mob on the Sunday afternoon we arrived. I expected a family vacation based on the reviews I read. Thankfully the scene calmed down for the week and families settled in.   Booked an ocean view suite because I didn’t want to be poolside. The room provided was overlooking the pool with a slight ocean view when I looked around the balcony privacy wall.

This hotel was below my standard Hilton experience.  The location was nice. The balconies good. It’s got a very busy road between you and the ocean and on the weekends the traffic was incredibly loud. Motorcycles driving by were triggering the car alarms.  The pool was okay. They expect you to wear a tacky wrist band to enter on the weekends and only give you one even if your staying Saturday and Sunday. I do not want to go to dinner with a soggy blue wrist band. They said just go to the front desk for a new one, I find that Inconvenient. All of the restaurants do not open and coffee places do not open u til 7am. There are lots of early risers waiting for coffee. The first evening the restaurant staff did not offer kids menus so we spent 500 dollars for 8 people and none of the

We spent a wonderful weekend here with family (11 people).  Service was outstanding, the rooms are very nice and all have a partial ocean view.  The two pools and snack bar were great, even on a busy weekend.  The hotel also has beach chairs and umbrellas you can take across the street to the public beach.  The Pacific Center outdoor mall is one block away with restaurants/shops.

Great facilities and awesome location right across from the beach.  Rooms were comfortable and ocean view from rooms was amazing. Enjoyed the pool area, even though the weather was kind of chilly.  Pool temp was comfortable and hot tub temp was great.

The location is great with a perfect ocean view . The hotel is clean and Covid guidelines are enforced.The spa is fabulous! The rooftop deck is a great place to watch the sunset. The rooms are spacious. The staff is welcoming.

I was very happy with our stay at this resort. It has gorgeous views, the staff were all very friendly and helpful, and it was very clean. Walking distance to the beach, the pier and lots of shopping and food. The only complaint I have is the cost of the food at the on-site restaurants. It was all really good but really expensive. Overall very pleased!

Summary Heading: Give me the room I paid for
Summary: Used the Hilton app, upgraded room to oceanfront 9th floor and the day we check in we are now on the 3rd floor? We were told must be a app glitch and cant change room to 9th floor? Asked to just down grade the room so that we can be at least on 9th floor Hilton did that but we were charged the upgraded price?? The hotel overall is nice,clean and our boys had a blast at the pool with the pool slides. Don’t have vegan options like most nice hotels so we had to order door dash most of the time.

Understandably, I can relate to the many 5 star reviews regarding this Waterfront Resort. Having many choices for a bite with friends, the service and quality of food was  top-tier! I'll definitely order the shrimp taco's again. Plus, the attentive staff with the beverage refills or better, another round! Cheers!

The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We loved our room, especially the view. Sitting by the pool sipping cocktails was very relaxing and just what we needed. Didn’t love the price of the valet parking but our stay overall was worth it!

Summary Heading: Poorly prepared room and bad service.
Summary: Two adults and two children arrived. No drinking glasses, no hand towels, and no facial tissue. Called the front desk but nothing arrived after two hours. I went to the front desk to complain. They sent up 2 drinking glasses for 4 guests. Very expensive and very poor service.

Summary Heading: A great short getaway at Hilton Huntington Beach!!
Summary: Last week my wife and I celebrated our 40th anniversary at The Waterfront Beach Resort by Hilton in Huntington Beach, what a treat it was!! A big shout out to David Wright of Guest Service Manager arranged an upgrade (as part of the benefits being a Diamond member)  for us to an ocean view room on the top floor, with a great view of the Huntington Beach pier. What a great view indeed it was, in particular for watching sunset!!  The property is clean, and the staff are friendly. There are two separate pools, one for the kids with a waterslide next to it. And the beach is just across PCH, less than 2 minutes walk.   A couple things preventing me from giving it a five-star rating: 1. Parking is valet only and it's $42 per day, and 2. The Boardwalk Restaurant's breakfast: food is

This hotel was awesome. I enjoyed the rooftop bar while looking over at the ocean. The drinks from the rooftop bar was excellent and staff did a great job. My kids loved the water slides while the adults were enjoying the jacuzzi. I enjoyed everything about my trip and plan on booking again soon.

This was a great resort it was expensive but worth it.  The location and view was spectacular. The room was growth a beautiful view and balcony.  The staff was top notch. Very friendly and helpful. They really cared.  Saw the staff picking up trash blowing outside.  Above and beyond.  The drinks and food was very good. Beds are very comfortable.   The room walls could be a little thicker.  Could hear dogs barking and doors slamming shut.  We would love to stay here again.

Great view and facilities made better by the fantastic employees.  We always include a stay at The Waterfront when visiting So Cal.  Good location with the beach and HB nearby. The 9th floor bar a great place to watch a sunset.

Loved the ocean views, love the lifestyle, so relaxing to sit on the beach and enjoy the ocean views. The hotel was ok. Had originally book one bedroom suite but ended up with a suite. It was ok but they charged me for the 1 bedroom suite

Great hotel, beautiful rooms with views, very clean and perfect location, very helpful friendly staff too ! They were helpful in helping us pick out a restaurant and provided a map to help us plan our days.

Not a good experience unfortunately...Under staffed and overpriced for the service that this hotel is offering right now. No bellman, no housekeeping, reduced water slides hours, no beach chairs or very few, pool towels are old and always running out with in a few hours, no pool service, no cabana service, no outdoor bar Monday-Wednesday. I forgot Valet overpriced and rude...This was my 4th visit....to bad I liked this hotel 🙁
