I had an ocean front view / you could get a partial view and it would be just as good. The hotel is in walking distance of Pacific City and the main street. It was all great.

This is a very nice resort howerever it is still going through some growing pains resulting from the added Tower and the Pool remodel.  Food was nothing to write home about.  I would have been better off going to Denny's for breakfast.  The 9th floor bar makes up for some of the issues I had with this stay.

My husband and 2 little kids stayed during Labor Day weekend. Overall a nice stay- staff was helpful and friendly, pool area nice and overlooking the beach.  I loved that we could eat outside overlooking pool/beach.  However, it was sooo crowded!  Once they build the new pool perhaps this will improve.  Also not helping were the multiple weddings a day and all their guests- the hotel is probably less busy during the week.  Would stay at this hotel again for the proximity to the beach and the convenience of complimentary towels and beach chairs, beach toys, and umbrellas! Ocean view room was really not spectacular, I was able to see a small strip of the beach only if I stood out my balcony. Would not pay extra for this again.

Great Hilton hotel and a great experience as always.  Beautiful view of the beach from all rooms and very helpful staff.  Very easy access to the beach and the pool area is great. Restaurants are very nice and food is good and good value.  Parking is valet only.

Location, accommodations and service excellent. Outdoor dinning and entertainment experience was exceptional. Hotel staff very helpful and professional. Particularly enjoyed the feeling of being outdoors with the expansive open doors facing the oceanfront.

Summary Heading: Amazing Resort Experience with Amazing Staff
Summary: If I could rate this property with 10 stars, I would. This resort is a favorite of mine -- they offer incredible service and the grounds are beautiful. The staff is unbelievably helpful and so friendly. I could not say more wonderful things about the Waterfront! :)

Summary Heading: Poor set up, Overly crowded, Poor maintenance
Summary: Since they added a 2nd tower of hotel rooms, they have not doubled the pool area or the parking access to the hotel. It's a nightmare getting in and out of the valet parking, and often there is a line into the street to get in. This is appalling considering that they charge $38/night for parking.   The pool area during Labor Day weekend was a zoo: stepping over people to get anywhere, and chairs crammed too closely together.  Our room had several things wrong with it: The TV didn't work for the first 2 days, the toilet was leaking so the water would run intermittently waking us in in the middle of the night, and the phone didn't work for a day. They fixed the first and 3rd thing, but didn't fix the leaking toilet even though we reported it. The last night it took an hour to get

Summary Heading: Excellent suite in Twin Dolphin tower
Summary: This is our second time in Huntington Beach in the Summer, first time at this Hilton property. Overall, we had an excellent experience, despite the construction going on in part of the building. The location is excellent, across the street from the beach, providing chairs and umbrellas and toys for kids (shovels, pails, etc). The one open pool was more than adequate, although we left by the weekend so didn't see the rush of weekend travelers. The buffet is very reasonable, pretty standard continental breakfast and warmed items as well as an omelet station.   The Twin Dolphin tower suite offers two queen beds and a sofa bed, which makes it an ideal room for families with more than 2 kids.

Summary Heading: Great location, new renovations very nice, but not perfect for families
Summary: This was a short visit to Huntington Beach with the family.   We stayed in a suite in the new tower.  The location of the hotel was close to the main area of Huntington where you can walk or take a short drive.  The renovations on the 2nd pool were still ongoing, but didn’t detract from the stay.   Our room was spacious and housekeeping did a very good job with the cleaning.  There were a few problems with the large sliding doors not being able to open fully, but not a major factor.  Being a family in a suite, the room design was not optimal as in some other hotels.   The shower, sink and toilet were all in the same area so if one person is showering, everyone is pretty much blocked out from getting ready.  We were surprised that the architects of the rooms would do this as

We stayed in the twin dolphin tower 2 queen suite poolside. The suite is spacious, clean and very comfortable. My husband and I, two 21- year-  old daughters, and my Mom fit very nicely ( the poolside suites have a fantastic private patio with a table, chairs, umbrella, and couch!) The pool was great with poolside service for drinks and lunch, and the prices were reasonable. Poolside servers were friendly and very attentive. Everyone at the hotel was! The hotel has sand chairs, towels, umbrellas, and beach totes that you can check out and take to the beach (you get them right by the pool) We tried the hotel restaurant a couple of times, and it was good. We used an uber to dine on Main street in the evenings, it's an easy walk I just didn't want to. There is a gift shop coffee
Manager Response: Dear rayeconley,   Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We truly appreciate your 5 star review! I am so pleased you and your family enjoyed your time with us. We know you have many options when staying in Orange County. Thank you for choosing to stay with us at The Waterfront. Have a great week!   At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: This is a great resort. It is undergoing a major renovation with construction on 1/2 of the resort.  We stayed in the new twin Dolphin tower and it was fantastic. The room was wonderful and HUGE!  If you need a crib, this is the place, perfect spot for it.  Rooms are suites, 1 bedroom with a double vanity in the bathroom, 2 televisions, doors into both bath and living area for privacy.    The new pool has a kiddie slide, I recommend that you go in the off season when kids are back in school until the remodel is complete.  We had drinks at the bar which were very expensive, holy moly, hotels are known for their costly food and drinks but this was a little ridiculous.  We did eat breakfast in the morning and it was very good.  There is a lot of walking at this hotel, I don't think

Hotel in disarray.  Pool overcrowded and dirty.  Restaurant terrible.  Restaurant menu was very limited and what was on the menu was terrible choices.  Pool has a sand deck next to it inviting sand into the pool via guests.
Manager Response: Dear JosephNick1950,  Thank you for your message here and please accept our apologies. I'm not sure how things got so out of hand here with your stay, but it is quite obvious that we disappointed you at every turn. This saddens me greatly as this is so "out of the norm" for who and what we are...ever. We receive many, many reviews here on TripAdvisor that are extremely positive, so to see that you were so extremely dissatisfied is quite concerning.  Again, I offer our whole-hearted apologies and hope that you will, in the future, give us a chance to "Make It Right".  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Outstanding resort, wonderful rooms!  Great pool with a view of the beach.  Sand area at the pool for those that want to dig their toes in the sand.  Great rooftop restaurant and bar overlooking the ocean!     Most outstanding staff EVER!  DAVID W. AND VICTORIA...were stellar, my disabled son was unsure of how to turn on the shower.  David W assisted him and set the temperature to his comfort.  While my son showered Victoria and I chatted about my son and our reason for being there...my birthday!  To my surprise when we returned to our room they sent sent a bottle of champagne for my celebration.  What a great place...hope to be back soon!
Manager Response: Dear L D,   Wow! What a wonderful recap of your vacation with us! Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your interactions with our staff; especially with David & Victoria. I will be sure to pass on your kind words to both of them. We know you have many options when staying in Orange County. Thank you for choosing to stay at The Waterfront. We hope to see you again in the near future!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: After checking in for a business conference and being sorely disappointed in the room location, my stay got worse as I went to go to sleep for the night and realized that 2 if the pillowcases were dirty. #yuck.  In the morning I went to check out the balcony. As you can see below, not only do I have no view, but clearly, housekeeping doesn’t check on the balconies.  At the end if my first day of meetings I came back to my room to find that the coffee service has not been replaced.  So I guess I will now need to call them yet again to do their job.  #nothappy #need mycoffee
Manager Response: Dear Madonna C,  Thank you for letting us know about your experience thus far. Please note the location of the discarded rag and cup are on the roof of the 1st floor in front of your balcony. Our housekeepers are not able to access this area and they have alerted a housemen and engineering to retrieve the items. We have also placed additional coffee supplies in your guest room. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance here at the Front Desk. It is our pleasure to make your stay more comfortable.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We chose this location for our annual meeting. Karie Brown was in charge of the our event and team dinners.  Everything was executed flawlessly, and everyone in my party felt the customer service they received was exceptional from both her team and the hotel in general.
Manager Response: Dear 239srhodes,   Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience with us. We are happy to hear our team exceeded your expectations. We expect nothing less from the amazing Karie Brown! Thank you for trusting us with your event and we hope to see you again in the near future!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Beautiful location on PCH overlooking the beach. The room was amazing and so was my ocean view. The room service was efficient and the food was delicious. The staff were very professional. The only downside is the valet parking, it can get very congested very quickly, which caused a 15 minute wait. Not necessarily a deal breaker but wanted to mention it. Overall, I loved this resort and will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay. We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We know you have many options when staying in Orange County. Thank you for choosing to stay at The Waterfront. Have a wonderful rest of your summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: This hotel is in a great location close to the beach, shops and restaurants.  There is construction going on but it was the weekend so not much work going on.  The pool and the restaurant was fun.  Enjoyed how close the hotel was to Main street and across from the beach.  Definitely worth the view of the ocean from your room.  Checkin was a challenge due to not many people at the front desk.  Concierge was knowledgable and made phone calls to get reservations.  Valet service was quick and easy.  If you are looking for a fun, clean and great location, this is the hotel for you.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay. We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We know you have many options when staying in Orange County. Thank you for choosing to stay at The Waterfront. Have a wonderful rest of your summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Be advised that rooms in the north are not nearly as nice as the brand new south tower The view is lovely once you get past the construction (we had a waterfront room) The balcony was large but had old cement walls.  The room layout is all chopped up so you don’t really see the ocean in your bedroom  The pool area is fantastic and staff are very friendly
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay!  We hope that you will consider staying with us again in the near future.   At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: This is a super resort. I will be back. My room was a perfect. I did not want to leave. Next time I’m coming for a week. I had a couple of problems but they where immediately dealt with. Terry at the front desk went out of his way to make it right. Victoria who I believe is guest relations help us with the mix up on our Beach Cabana. She was also amazing. You guys rock and I’m coming back for a week next August. The picture below is the view from my room. Clean and perfect. I was there to bury both my parents and they turned a bad situation into a complete awesome trip. Thank you Terry and Victoria. See you again.
Manager Response: Dear Judy T,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent visit. We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay! Thank you for mentioning our superstars Victoria & Terry by name. I will pass on your kind words to them. We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and we hope to see you again in the very near future for a week long stay. Have a wonderful summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in Great Beach Town
Summary: Great place to enjoy the Pacific Ocean and a California Beach Town. Close to the pier.  Clean beach right out front of Hotel.  Great pool for both the kids and adults.  Great restaurants in house and nearby.
Manager Response: Dear Don A  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay. So glad you enjoyed your time with us and out location. We are grateful you choose to stay with us and hope to see you again in the near future!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Love the Huntington Beac Waterfront Hilton
Summary: Always clean, fabulous view, no traffic sounds heard in room. Nice pool, beach across the street and very friendly and helpful staff. The reception desk staff goes out of their way to accommodate your needs. Family and child friendly.
Manager Response: Dear csorensen1,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We know that you have many options when staying in Orange County. Thank you for choosing The Waterfront. Have a great summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Pros Great location Dolphin Tower is newer Lot's of family friendly activities Good service Pool food/drink pricing very reasonable  Cons Construction going on and one pool is closed Hard to get a lounge by the pool No self parking, valet is $38/day Mattress on sofabed is way too thin  Dropped in for a weekend get away and was pleasantly surprised. Despite the size of the hotel and how busy it was, check in was easy and service throughout the weekend was pretty good. We had a suite in the Dolphin Tower, and while the rooms show a little wear and tear, the decor and amenities were great. All fixtures were Toto and a nicer quality than most, the only thing lacking was the mattress on the pull out couch. It was literally like sleeping directly on springs. We asked for an extra
Manager Response: Dear cuteesq,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review! We truly appreciate your feedback and use it to better train our staff. I will be sure to pass your notes on to our executive team. I am so pleased your whole family took advantage of all the activities. We know you have many options when staying in Orange County. Thank you for choosing to stay at The Waterfront. We hope to see you again in the near future. Have a wonderful rest of your summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, Great place to stay
Summary: Located right across the street from one of the best beaches in California, this is a great choice.  The rooms are nice as is the pool.  There is a quaint coffee shop on property and the service is fantastic.  Valet is your best choice and is reasonable.
Manager Response: Dear hoffr02,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay! We hope to see you again in the near future. Thank you for choosing to staying at The Waterfront.   At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Great visit and a special place!
Summary: We are local but stayed there for our anniversary as a getaway.   Right across the street from the beach and while at the pool can go back and forth to the beach.  All staff very nice and a great experience. Rooms in Dolphin tower upgraded and outfitted well!  Only went to the Boardwalk restaurant for breakfast and was very good.  Great rooftop bar I highly recommend!!!  View of ocean and pier is spectacular!  Try it for sunset. Hotel is dog friendly as we saw many. They also do many weddings, 4 this weekend! Fun, clean and a beautiful place. 15 minute walk to Main Street and the pier or they have a shuttle every hour. Valet parking u cannot self. Valet high price at $38 but u are at a 5 star what can u do! Great location and have been there a number of times!
Manager Response: Dear brmezz,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay! What a wonderful recap. We hope to see you again in the near future. Thank you for choosing to staying at The Waterfront.   At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Great location and good recognition of Diamond members... but the Huntington tower needs renovating
Summary: We stayed here for 1 night as part of a California road trip in mid-August.  This hotel is in a great location - it looks onto the beach/ocean and the pier and downtown areas are not far away (5-10min walk). I would highly recommend walking to the pier to watch the sunset.  As a Diamond Hilton Honors member we were upgraded to a room with a better ocean view which was appreciated, though we booked a room in the Huntington tower which is the older tower - whilst clean and comfortable this tower would benefit from renovation as it is showing its age in comparison to the new tower.  The pool looks onto the beach/ocean too and has a large number of loungers and it wasn’t overly busy despite it being the summer period. A  second quieter (adult only) pool is under construction which I
Manager Response: Dear Internship10,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay! We truly appreciate your Hilton Loyalty. Thank you for trusting us over the years with all your travels. We hope to see you again in the near future. Thank you for choosing to staying at The Waterfront.   At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful beach hotel with great views
Summary: Our first impression at check in was that the hotel was kind of hectic - the lobby was very busy and on the small side. That being said, the staff was efficient and professional and moved things along quickly. We stayed in a king suite with ocean views, which was gorgeous - loved the furniture and decor and the bed was super comfortable. We had two sizeable balconies and loved the views of Huntington beach. Parts of the hotel are under construction and it looks like they're building a new pool - I'm sure it will be spectacular when it's done. The existing pool was fun, though a bit crowded. We had lunch at the restaurant, which was solid, and it was convenient to be able to get Starbucks coffee at the gift shop. I was really impressed that they sent a gift up to our room after
Manager Response: Dear Chevstar29,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay! I am so happy to hear you received the gift we sent. We are grateful for your loyalty to the Hilton brand. We hope to see you again in the near future once our expansion is completed. In addition to updating our existing pool, we are also adding a Spa and fine dining restaurant. Thank you for choosing to staying at The Waterfront. Have a wonderful summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Stayed in a room with 2 queens with partial ocean view in Huntington Tower. You can tell this tower is the older one, but it is still pretty nice. The lobby was beautiful. We walked over to the Dolphin Tower pool area at night. It was very busy but very nice.   The location of this hotel was great for us. We walked to the pier for dinner the first night and the next day we walked to shopping on the main street across from the pier as well as Pacific City which is even closer.   There is only valet parking at this hotel.

This hotel is one of our favorites.  Walking access to the beach, pier and downtown Huntington Beach is great! We stayed in the original Huntington Tower and the rooms were very nice but the balcony is too small for two chairs; the newer Dolphin Tower appeared to have full size balconies that can accommodate two chairs and a table. The new pool area is open since the original is under renovation and completely closed off.  The Boardwalk cafe had great breakfast service and we particularly enjoyed our server Patty’s great friendly attitude. We tried the rooftop lounge but it was super windy so didn’t stay for a drink. Parking is steep at $38, but street parking can be found nearby if you’re willing to walk.

We took a summer vacation in Southern California and this was one of our destinations, and our most favorite! The hotel is absolutely amazing! We stayed in the new Dolphin Tower and the rooms, decor, just everything was modern and top notch! We ate at the hotel several times during our stay and the service was top notch! We will definitely be returning.

This is a solid resort for families. It’s not perfect but it’s very good.  There are 2 towers and currently one of the pools is being remodeled. It looks like this will be the adult pool. The kids pool is great for families. There’s a shallow entrance for little ones and 2 slides for older kids.  The hotel has tons of beach equipment to rent and it is literally across the street from the beach. It’s like 75% if Hawaii with 25% less travel burdens.  Some of the cons: Since the 2nd pool is currently closed, the main pool was pretty packed.  There were hardly any chairs.  The pool side food is not too expensive but the food is quite mediocre. It would appeal to an 8 year old.  Tip: 1 block north there is an outdoor mall with tons of restaurants and absolutely worth going to for

Typically I do not rate a hotel twice but in this case I believe it is warranted since the tower we stayed in is completely new.   So we stayed in the new twin dolphins tower in one of the ground floor suites, giving direct access to the pool. We really enjoyed the room, it is nice to be able to close off the bedroom section. Obviously rooms are completely new and very nicely equipped. Only thing I could ding the room on is the air conditioning in the bedroom, if you are close to it it can feel like it is blowing directly in your face.   We also really liked he new pool and rooftop bar.   All and all a very enjoyable stay, we will be back.

Took a multi-family trip to California for a long weekend. All 13 of us stayed here and were NOT disappointed! Very close to Newport Beach and only 45 minutes away from L.A. and Hollywood. The food was good and the place looks amazing. They hosted a fundraiser while we were there and we got to meet Loni Love. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

We booked a two room queen suite for 4 nights currently still here and we are staying on 6th floor overlooking the pool. I paid extra for an ocean view however you cannot enjoy your ocean view while sitting on your balcony  as the two massive air conditioning fans are huge and make a terrible noise....it really has spoilt our stay as we wanted to chill on the balcony while looking out on the ocean but the drumming noise is too much...Not what I expected for the price I paid...Hotel offered to move us but can still hear the fans from any room overlooking the pool on the new twin dolphin side...!!!
Manager Response: Dear kerrypar,  Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We are not sure where the disconnect occurred that caused you to go the extra mile and contact Hilton Worldwide and TripAdvisor as we have been working directly with you to make your stay more comfortable. Our Asst. Front Office Director Shannon Baccaro is awaiting your call to Make it Right for you. We look forward to speaking with you directly.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with a perfect location
Summary: We stayed 3 nights and wish we had have booked for longer ! Our kids loved the pool, the slides and the large sand area. We loved the attentive pool side service. We had a room with a view of the ocean and it was beautiful. I would recommend a room not over looking the pool as the pool is open early until late. You can pick up towels, umbrellas, beach chairs and sand toys by the pool and bring them to the beach. You don’t need a car here, everything is within walking distance. My only complaint is that the hotel was really cold inside. Wear something warm if planning to eat indoors. The staff at the bar were all lovely, the kids enjoyed milk and cookies each evening while we enjoyed a glass of wine before bed. I love how this hotel has been styled, everywhere is beautiful.

Summary Heading: Have been coming to the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort now for 13 years.
Summary: Very disappointed this time around as only 1 pool open for too many people, very overcrowded. Riptide Bar food was not nearly as good as Shades, which was closed. Won't be back anytime soon. We will try another resort.

everything about this hotel is very nice. The location is perfect, across from the beach and just a short walk from shopping and food. Pool is great for families with lots of shade and water slides for the kids. Would highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay again myself!

Summary Heading: A wonderful anniversary evening in the heart of Summer
Summary: I stayed one night here in Huntington Beach, CA. As a local, it's the perfect staycation destination, not just for the location, but for the staff. Here is an in-depth review below:   Location:  Right by the beach, next to the shopping plaza Pacific City, and if you're lucky, you get an amazing view of the Pacific Ocean.  Room:  Great, quaint room. Though the one odd part about this room was the motion sensor light in the closet. It would periodically catch me waking up in the middle of the night on my way to the restroom and would come on, forcing me to close it, even with the door closed. Great balcony!  Staff: Where do I begin? The staff makes the hotel a 5-star hotel on the beach. They are the cornerstone to the excellence of this property. I was welcomed with a gift for our
Manager Response: WOW! What a review. Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent anniversary stay at The Waterfront. I am so happy you enjoyed your time with us. It is so kind of you to mention so many of our wonderful associates by name. I will make sure to pass this on to them. We know you have many options when staying in Huntington Beach; thank you for choosing us!   At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice  Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location, Big Hotel, Great Service
Summary: Getting to this Hilton is easy. Just follow PCH. It is right across the street from the beach in Huntington.  The Hotel is huge. One of the bigger Hiltons that I have been too. Rooms are normal size, very clean, somewhat of a surfer decor. The staff is great for a big hotel like this. The pool was very very crowded so get up early.   Lots of great restaurants and shopping near by. What a location to get great food, shopping, and beach play.

The hotel is conveniently located to the beach.  The staff at the hotel is all around service oriented and friendly.  We had the great pleasure of working with Tammy and Vanessa, from the concierge area, prior to and during our visit.  Both are the definition of customer service and going above and beyond.    We were in the Huntington Tower, which had nice partial views of the ocean and faced the pool.   You could not hear any noise from the pool or street.  We rented a cabana for two days and the service was great.  We also rented the firepit for one evening and the kids enjoyed making s’mores.  We did the pool multiple days and the hotel provides balks and noodles for folks to play with.  There’s two slides which the kids had a blast using.     There is a shuttle service to

It was nice to be able to walk to the beach and back to the hotel in less than 5 min. The rooms were clean, the property was clean and the pool was fun for the kids.   The only bummer is was that there was construction and only 1 pool was available.

Summary Heading: Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort Full summary
Summary: I Did not want to book a Twin Dolphin Tower room because I had been there 7 times and I am used to the Huntington Tower so when I arrived I checked in with the lovely staff and went to my room with a full ocean view. I had asked if I could stay in the South side of the Huntington Tower as they are building in the north side. I had a View Of the Beach and loved the wifi and mini fridge that I could drink some water every Day. The nearest airport is John Wayne but try to go to the main Airport LAX as John Wayne isn’t the best airport in the world. WiFi is Charged only if you don’t have Hilton Honours which is easy to get for free so download the app on your phone!!! I love the Driftwood Beach Club and pool My Son loves the Waterslides and liked the the mini beach next to the pool.

Summary Heading: Good location, friendly staff, some shortcomings
Summary: Spent two nights in a Dolphin Tower twin ocean view room. Very nice and large living area with balcony, large bedroom and bathroom. Fairly new...well equipped. Not so clean... Lovely housekeeping team who tried to help with removing the vomit smell of the room. But couldn’t.  Lots of dog hair on the carpet and our suitcases bottoms were full of those when we left.  Good pool area and as said in other reviews very busy as the second pool area is under construction.  So no surprise here.  The beach is 5mn walk away and splendid. Pacific City mall is 5mn away as well and has good restaurants. Valet parking...and scratches on the bumper of rental car seen only after we left... All 4✳️ are rather accurate. Not a 5✳️ by a mile.

My friend and I stayed here at the beginning of August.  We loved the property but only wished the adult pool was open because the other pool was so crowded.  The location is perfect for a beach vacation and we were lucky to stumble upon the Van’s U. S. Open of Surfing.  I wasn’t aware that there was a shuttle to Main Street and may have taken advantage of that had I known.  Overall this hotel is in an excellent location and if you want to stay at the beach I would definitely recommend it.

Great location! Beach across the street!! Nicely appointed rooms! Nice balcony!! Nice rooftop bar! With amazing views👍👍did not eat at hotel !?tried for breakfast one morning but there was a 30 minute wait!

Summary Heading: Great location and beautiful new tower
Summary: We visited in August and the new tower is beautiful!  The location of the hotel is perfect.  Right across from the beach and a short walk to town and Pacific City Center.  We stayed in a 1 bedroom queen suite.  The room was very nice but is definitely suited more to a family than sharing it with friends.  We found that the bathroom door doesn't have a lock and you cannot have someone in the shower and the toilet area at the same time as there is no privacy between the two.  Would highly recommend regardless!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review of your stay. We appreciate you trusting us with your family vacation! Sounds like all of you have a fantastic time. Huntington Beach is such a great walk-able beach city...glad you took advantage of it. We understand that you have many options when visiting Huntington Beach. Thank you for choosing The Waterfront! Have a great summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: This hotel was great!  We were able to vacation and bring our 2 French Bulldogs as well!  The property is beautiful and totally dog friendly.  Our room - in the Dolphin Tower, was a delight as it was a suite with an ocean view and all of the amenities.  We were able to dine each morning and our frenchies were welcome to dine with us.  We were also able to bring them poollside (they are not allowed in the pool or on the sandy areas) which is fine and the way it should be.  The hotel is located across from the beach and next to a great mall (which is also dog friendly.)  This was our first experience at a superior hotel that welcomed our pets.  We will definitely return!

Stayed end July to early August and loved this place. The new Dolphin tower is awesome, the rooms are spacious, well appointed and the views even better. The staff goes beyond to provide assistance and Huntington Beach is a great area. Nearby shops and restaurants make it a perfect destination. Thanks to Joseph Boyer who assisted us. Only negative is the small pool which gets very busy and overcrowded.

Beautiful hotel with amazing views of the beach. The staff was very nice and helpful. Loved the sand area by the pool with fire pits to enjoy in the evening. You could also reserve a beac Fire pit with chairs and food for an extra fee.

Summary Heading: Lovely decor and so fun for kids!
Summary: Our family just spent 4 nights in this newly remodeled resort and had a wonderful stay!!! Everyone was incredibly kind, from reception to housekeeping. The pool was especially fun for the kids and the water slide provided hours of entertainment! We also loved the location - prime to walk everywhere! The rooftop bar is so nice and the staff was very accommodating and sweet to my daughters. The room was spacious and clean and I loved all of the decor! The dining experience at the restaurant by the pool wasn’t impressive, but that can easily be overlooked considering every other aspect of our stay was wonderful!
Manager Response: Dear mtaamcd,   Thank you for your wonderful review of your stay! I am happy to hear all of you had a great time. We are so grateful you choose to stay with us. We hope you have a wonderful rest of your summer. See you soon for another vacation!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: This location is “THE BEST” location by far!!  Super close to main st with free shuttle service close main st until 10 pm. The view from rooms are spectacular!!  Staff super friendly and provide service with a smile!   I will definitely be back!!
Manager Response: Dear Dara,  WOW! Thank you for the kind words. We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay and our central location. We hope that you will consider staying with us again in the near future. Have a wonderful resort of your summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Meeting and catering staff excellent.  Rooms nice if you have view of pool/ocean. Relaxed vibe, busy.  Parking expensive. Food good. Friendly staff. Elevators can be a bit slow. Will return in future. Very good for meetings or leisure.
Manager Response: Dear colesloough,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Waterfront. I am so happy you enjoyed your time with us. We know you have many options when staying in Huntington Beach; thank you for choosing us!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: I’ve stayed at this hotel over 25 times. It is my favourite Huntington Beach hotel. The location is superb. It is located across the road from the beach, and a short walk to restaurants and shopping. During the day, I’ll often relax by the pool and take a few dips, work out in the fitness centre, and have my breakfast and lunch at the hotel. In the late afternoon, I usually go for a one-hour beach walk, stroll on the pier, window shop, and engage in people-watching. The pool is large, and its odd shape allows for lots of seats near the water. The beds, pillows and bedding allow for a very comfortable sleep. Being a Diamond member of Hilton HHonors, I generally get upgraded to a front ocean view suite.   The staff are friendly, helpful, polite and accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear KodoDrummer,  We are so very grateful for loyal guests such as yourself! We are humbled and honored to be your home away from home for your vacations. Thank you for the bottom of our hearts for choosing The Waterfront year after year. Please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly if I can be of any assistance for your future stays. Have a wonderful rest of your summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Underwhelmed. Giant kids resort with poor service
Summary: For starters who still charges 14.95 for internet.  Everyone wants it put it on room rate and stop nickel and dining.  Housekeeping often a weakness is shoddy.  Every morning I asked them as I left for service.  Everyday I came back at 3pm to a dirty room.  They never restocked properly.  Room is big and soulless.  No facilities just a sad empty fridge.  Couldn't have breakfast outside one morning in the middle of summer as understaffed.  Low rent crowd and everywhere loud and overcroded. Ear cleaner bud left in hallway for 2 full days.  Really not my type of place but if you like huge kid packed over crowded over priced and under serviced properties then you have found the perfect one
Manager Response: Dear Ask n,  Thank you for your review and choosing The Waterfront. We appreciate your feedback and always look to continuously improve our service. Comments such as yours serve as a valuable learning tool and opportunity for improvement. We will address this review with our management staff. Please note: Hilton Hotels offers in-room internet at no cost when you open / have a complimentary Hilton Honors account; apart from that, the charge is $7.95 per day. We would be more than happy to review your charges with you. If in fact there was an erroneous internet fee charged to you; our deepest apologies.  Best wishes on your continued travels.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We had an amazing stay here at this hotel. We had called to see if we could check in early but the room wasn't ready. They did offer us to use the facility until the room became available which I thought was so nice of them. The parking is pretty price but the gentleman at the front desk did tell us we could park in the residential area and just walk back to the hotel. I loved how this hotel was in walking distance of the beach, shopping and so many places to eat. The staff here were very friendly and helpful I would definitely stay here again!

I have stayed at Hilton The Waterfront Resort multi-times now because I never been disappointed. I love the location, the walk to the pier, close to multi shops and restaurants, and it's across the street from the ocean.

We had a great time!  The pool was amazing, they have slides and a beach side seating.   I must tell you, the beds are so comfy and the pillows are great.  The shower... great!  Restaurants and service A+.  We recommend this hotel and we will stay here again. Ghe only draw back is you cannot speak directly with the hotel to book your rooms.  Reservations to book a room sucks... they got my name wrong,  and did not understand what i needed.  I gave it 4 stars for this reason.

Loved the new tower I think its called the dolphin tower.  The pool was crowded and too many kids in jacuzzi.  This will be resolved when the old pool is done with its reno. I would suggest having a adult only jacuzzi when old pool is renovated.

I read reviews, but I never write one... we were staying at Waterfront Beach Resorts last year during US Open and decided to come back again. We loved all about it!!! I’m single parent (nurse) and I checked in with children on Thursday and our room wasn’t ready, yet. We were early. Receptionist told me they will give me a call. Just wanted to make sure we are facing pier ocean view as I knew hotel was under construction, but everything was functional, quiet and beautiful. While we waited by the new pool and had a lunch there I’ve a got a call to let me know my room was ready and we’ve got upgraded to Presidential Suite!! I was speechless, everyone was so helpful, professional and thoughtful. Location, fantastic new pool with slides, entertainments, everyone we talked to made us

Starting with the negatives, which are not many, this is a fairly large property, so there will be a lot of people, though it doesn't seem like it, except at the pool.  At peak times, forget about finding a chair at the large pool area.  Also, expect to wait a while for your car during peak times at the mandatory valet.  Having no parking but valet is a big negative, but whatever.  Lastly, the gift store/coffee shop is way too small for this big a property.  Now the positives.  This is a beautiful property.  Lobby check-in area is fantastic.  All the staff, from the valets, to the baggage check to the front desk, to the maid, are all INCREDIBLE.  These are well-trained staff, and this property is extremely well-managed.  Our room was good-sized (2 queens), with a balcony having

Summary Heading: Noisy & crowded with less than stellar staff-but great location
Summary: You can't beat the location- right across from the beach! But it comes with drawbacks- motorcycle racing down PCH at 2am in the morning- & ocean views come at the price of front row and noise of their construction. The desk staff isn't friendly at all (apparently greeting people is too beneath them- they just stand there staring at you) & when I reported that our room was still dirty- used robes hanging in the closet- used toiletries-I got

Summary Heading: Lovely Resort with terrific service and nice amenities!
Summary: Stayed here for 4 days for a Girls Getaway and Birthday Celebration.  We stayed in a double Queen with partial ocean view in Huntington Tower that was spacious and comfortable. Enjoyed the balcony even with the on-going renovation of the pool area in full-swing.  We enjoyed breakfast outside -great view of the pool area and ocean, terrific food, and attentive service. The French Toast with lemon cream cheese and blueberry compote was amazing and the California Omelette were my faves. My daughter enjoyed the breakfast sandwich so much she ordered it twice!  It is an easy walk to Huntington Beach Pier and nearby shops and restaurants and valet service is quick and friendly.  This was our first visit to this hotel but it will not be our last!

I stayed in the newly updated Twin Dolphin tower, in the 2 queen bed suite. It was perfect for a family!  I brought my 3 teenage kids, and they liked it. There is a pull-out sofa bed, but the mattress was terrible - like wires poking in your back. If you don’t need to use it then don’t. (Or if your kids are tiny and don’t weigh enough to compress the mattress, then it’ll work for them.).    The location was ideal - walking distance to the beach, pier, and Pacific City (an outdoor mall with lots of restaurants.).  I’d stay here again for another staycation!

My husband and I enjoyed a 6 night stay here at the end of our honeymoon after road tripping around California. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here, we had a room overlooking the pier and beach which was lovely. The service throughout our stay was exceptional, all staff members were attentive and willing to go the extra mile. The pool did get busy on the weekend as they don’t yet have 2 pools but we were still able to get a sun lounger with no trouble. Pool service was good too, providing the usual pool snacks and cocktails! We also visited the rooftop bar on our last night and the views were spectacular! Concierge were really helpful too when we enquired about Disneyland, offering the best driving route and advice on tickets and time to arrive.   A word of warning though, they

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort, perfect location, impeccable service
Summary: This was the 3rd stay for my family at the Waterfront Beach Resort and we're already looking forward to coming back. The resort grounds are beautiful, the rooms are comfortable with very nice interiors, and the restaurant/lounges are excellent. The new pool is fantastic and has everything you need - towels, sand toys (there's a sandy area or you can take them to the beach), umbrellas, food/drink with pool service, and kids activities (slides, face painting, etc).    The service at this resort is one of the best I've ever encountered. From valet to check-in to room service to pool service. Everybody makes sure you're taken care of and they go above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect. Special thanks to Luis, who always ensures our family is set up for a great vacation!

We absolutely loved this hotel. Fantastic accomodations. Great location directly across from Huntington Beach and near the pier. Within 2 minute walk of Pacific City (outdoor mall with restaurants etc) which is awesome. There is also a shuttle which can take you to Main Street Huntington. Nice pool with water slides and hot tub and view of the ocean. Hotel offers activities for kids like glitter tattoos and a “fire dance”. Also, has kids club for babysitting purposes. We stayed during the Vans Surf competition so the area was packed but it made it very nice to not have to deal with parking and have someplace close to retreat to. Sidenote, accomodations are a bit pricey (roughly $450/nt) during this period.

Second time staying at this property.  The service and staff is always spot on..the common areas are spotless...food and drink are excellent!  We stayed in the Huntington Tower, which is the older of the two.  It is still spotless and more than served our needs.  Every Hilton employee we spoke with was outstanding, beginning at check in, to the wonderful women who serviced our room daily, to the wait staff at breakfast.  We are excited for the completion of the second pool area and look forward to enjoying it on our next stay.  I would highly recommend this property as well as the Huntington Beach area as a whole.  Thank you for a great vacation!!!

Staff were very friendly, accomodating, welcoming, helpful. Nice location where all the action is. Despite my late arrival, I was told my room was not ready. Concierge extended courtesy breakfast and gift certicates to shop without me even asking. You’ll enjoy your stay

Loved the suite in the Dolphin Tower.  Perfect for families of 5 with teens.  Very nicely placed with all activities within walking distance.  The free laundry was awesome.  There is construction going on which looks like a new pool!  The one pool was a little crowded for my taste.

I booked an ocean-view room for a pre-college trip with my daughter. While our room type is supposedly available on floors 1-7, our 1st floor room is nothing like the others (despite my being charged the same). It's directly adjacent to the pool area so we can't open the side window, let alone have the wrap-around balcony in the description and on the other floors. We also have a solid balcony wall rather than the advertised glass one (since we're on the ground floor). So, we only have a standing ocean view. I would be less disappointed if I knew what I was getting ahead of time...and if I weren't getting charged for a better room than I got!
Manager Response: Dear Usha P,  Thank you for your recent review, we appreciate sincerely your feedback. We apologize that you came all this way only to be disappointed with your room. Please consider calling our in-house reservations department directly at 714-854-8000. Ask for Laura or Cathy to be assured you are speaking with someone on property to discuss specific room types. We do hope that you consider us again for a future stay. Again, please accept our sincerest apologies.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: My husband and two daughters and  I had a great time at this hotel for a week in July.  Stayed on the 9th floor of the Twin Dolphin Tower - we could see the beach pretty well from the balcony (kind of a side view vs. straight on but good enough for sure)  We had a small suite; a bedroom w/2 queens, roomy bathroom, and a sitting room. There were pocket sliding doors we could close between the bedroom and sitting and bathroom and that was nice!  Very roomy with good amount of spots for clothing and such - we really didn't feel squished at all (and that's saying something, with 4 of us for a week, one being a teenage girl).  Despite quite a few reviews saying otherwise, we had no trouble with the Valet parking service. We only used our car a couple times, but we called down 10-15

Our family had a short stay in Huntington.  The hotel is very nice - we found all the staff to be friendly and helpful.  The prices for drinks and food by the pool were reasonable, and the room rate was also reasonable for the time of our visit.  We were in the new tower and the rooms was beautifully appointed and furnished, and the AC was strong.  We would definitely stay there again.  Oh - make sure you hit the open air bar on the 9th floor for a drink around sunset.  WOW!

A very nice location and friendly staff.  Remodeling had very little impact on our visit.  Pool and dining areas are very nice.  It would be nice if the outside rooftop lounge was open later, especially when you are there with business associates/customers.

Summary Heading: Water Slide is off the hook
Summary: Great Experience and Loved my first impression walking into the newly remolded Resort. There new tower looks great and I love there brunch. Absolutely great for the kids. Make sure to check out the bon fires outside in the pool area

Summary Heading: We just got back from a vacation staying at this resort.
Summary: This resort is beautiful and in a perfect location.  The beach across the street from the hotel is fantastic.  It was so nice to be able to take chairs and an umbrella to the beach without being charged for them.   The staff was excellent.  Everyone from the front desk, concierge, all the guys that do the valet parking and the staff at the pool, couldn't have been nicer.  Very friendly and accommodating.  The pool area is great, although it would be nice to have the hot tub for adults only or an age limit.  It was too crowded with small children.  Overall, I would definitely choose this hotel again and hope to visit again someday.  I would highly recommend it.

We stayed here for 5 nights, using Hilton Honor points - the location is great (right across the street from the beach and a few blocks from the pier). The adult pool was closed for renovations, but the newer pool was really nice. There were some mixed reviews on this site, that had me a bit worried, but as soon as we arrived, we knew we had made the right choice. The hotel staff were really friendly and the service at the pool and in the restaurant was excellent. Food and drinks were excellent! We'll definitely be back to experience the adult pool, as the kids pool was a bit crowded. The hotel provides free chairs/umbrellas to use at the beach. If you stay in the older tower (which has been renovated and is really nice), ask for an odd numbered room for a view of the new pool

My husband and I stayed here with our 10.5 month old son.   We were very disappointed that we were only staying here for one night during our mini California road trip. We would have loved to have stayed longer!   As soon as we walked into the hotel we were taken aback by how lovely it was. The design was fantastic... I later looked up the interior designers used online so that I could use this as inspiration when decorating my own home.  We loved our room, the size was good and again the interior was lovely. I particularly loved the bathroom. We had an amazing view of the beach. The hotel is just across the road from the beach.   We did use the pool briefly and also had lunch by the pool. The staff were lovely and the food was enjoyable. My husband particularly enjoyed his

Under some renovations, the Waterfront is doing a great job of becoming the best hotel property on Huntington Beach. With a new pool with 2 slides and firepits, its a fantastid upgrade which leaves makes you not consider going to the beach. Once the property is fully updated, I might consider a 4.5 rating

Summary Heading: Great rooms.  Great location.  Staff could be friendlier.
Summary: Great rooms.  Great location.  Staff could be friendlier.  Check-in was rushed only to wait.  Drinks expensive.  $11 for a vodka and tonic.  Beautiful hotel.  Pool water cloudy.  Overall nice but room for improvement.  Likely would return.

My wife and I visited for our anniversary and stayed in the new tower; it's only 6 months old.  What a beautiful property!  We had a suite and I think most of the rooms in the new tower are suites so if you want to spend a few more bucks, stay in the new tower.  The older tower has been completely renovated so that's beautiful also. The property looks right out on the ocean!  What a view!  You're within walking distance of Pacific City, a new, upscale retail complex that houses many restaurants and boutiques and it's all open-air. You can walk for miles along the beach and even bring your dog to the Huntington Beach off-leash dog beach.  The dogs love it. Stay in this resort -- it's truly "California Dreamin"

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel and Great Experience
Summary: When I booked this hotel there was a Construction warning right on the front page of the website, and thank you Waterfront Beach Resort for doing that.  It gave me the opportunity to call and ask about the construction and find out that it would not impact my stay.  (Not all Hilton properties will do this and would just let you be blindsided by the construction)  After calling the resort and being reassured the construction would not impact my stay I moved forward and booked.  We arrived around 6pm on a Friday and walked into a beautiful, clean, bright hotel.  I would certainly go back to this property if I was in the area, but I would not make it a beach destination spot for my family.   We did have two situations that I want to bring up, not because of the problem but because

Summary Heading: Tropical weekend just one hour away
Summary: The Waterfront was a hit! We invited family members for dinner while staying in Huntington Beach. We all loved the location, the pool, the free hawaiian fire performance, the food, and the amenities in this hotel.  Place was clean, staff was helpful and accommodating, Only a block away from Pacific City and 2 or 3 more blocks from Main St. and the pier.  The rooftop lounge was nice and chill and the Moscow mule was very refreshing.  Best part was the wrap around balcony facing the beach and PCH due west.  Can't wait for the Huntington Pool to open up.  In fact, making our reservations now!!!

We loved this hotel. Stayed in the new Twin Dolphins Tower. Rooms are spacious and modern. The reason I gave only 4 stars instead of 5 is that the AC unit in our room was really poorly designed. It dumped cold air on one bed in the room, and then as soon as it stopped the room didn’t retain the cold air and was instantly hot and muggy. Just a bad design, but needs some work and really impacted our ability to sleep.   I would give 6 stars for the staff though! They sent security to retrieve Tylenol from the closed hotel shop after hours for my sick kiddos fever! They stop by every night with bottles of water, ice and chocolate. We loved the staff. Concierge booked several trips for us at deeply discounted prices, too.   Location is perfect, and they set you up with whatever you
Manager Response: Dear jmltravel2009,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay. I am sorry to hear about your room AC unit, but I am glad to hear of the wonderful service you received from our staff. We are grateful you choose to stay with us and we hope to see you again in the near future!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We love HB! Had never stayed here as we “preferred” a place up the street but this was a last minute beach getaway and the other place was full. Wow! We were in the twin Dolphin Tower which is new, bright & fresh, and spacious! So nice that our family of 5 could all be in one room/suite together, and not falling all over each other. We loved our balcony and ocean view, and the breakfast in the restaurant was delicious and had some good GF options for my daughter. The staff were exceptionally kind and helpful! You’ve won is over, Waterfront Hilton!
Manager Response: Dear rockymtnboilerbabe,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We love our new suites too...so glad you liked them. Thank you for choosing to stay at The Waterfront. Have a wonderful summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: The venue is outstanding ...right across the beach highway from the white sands of the Pacific Ocean..opens to the outdoor patio to enable the sights/sounds of the O.C. Beach activities in sunny So. Cal....The Hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier and more  accommodating from re-decorating  one of the cakes to assisting with parking/directions/arranging gifts...and just being helpful with the clean-up chores
Manager Response: Dear bbiken,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful review of your time with us! I am so glad you had such a wonderful interaction and time with our staff and amenities. We know you have many options when visiting Orange County, thank you for choosing The Waterfront Beach Resort.   At your Service. Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Right on the Beach - what else do you want?
Summary: This hotel was a bit more fancy than other Hiltons I've stayed at but there wasn't any snobbish feel to it..the staff were very friendly and the facilities (pool, gym) were top notch. But, the real attraction is the city beach literally across the street. It was great to go to the beach and enjoy it, but then escape to the luxury of the hotel as a hotel guest..i.e. to get away from 'the crowd'.  Breakfast was good and the room service guys were very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear 02Mambo,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for choosing to stay at The Waterfront. Have a wonderful summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: My family and I have visited this resort many times and I have to say the staff, service and accommodations are the best! Our experience each time is amazing and they never fail to impress me with the small things to the staff remembering us and making us feel like family. We always look forward to seeing our favorite bellman Brooks when we arrive for a nice warm welcome. The rooms are very comfortable and you will get great rest.. then wake up to an amazing view, what more could you ask for!?! The room has a mini fridge and a single serve coffee maker which is great but they also have Surf Hero shop which has Starbucks and other snack items. They also now have 2 pools, one with 2 water slides which the kids love and great pool side service for the adults. If the beach is where
Manager Response: Dear surgteck05,  Thank you kindly for the wonderful review of your stay! We are so grateful you choose to stay with us. We hope to see you and your family again in the near future! Have a fantastic summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Dolphin tower is very nice, minus the billowing marijuana plumes
Summary: Hilton did a great job on this new tower. Great, clean suites. Unfortunately we had rooms around us that thought we'd enjoy their dope stench. The pool is kid oriented with slides and way too many loungers. Not a good vibe.
Manager Response: Dear Scott E,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. I am so sorry to read you did not enjoy your time with us. Please know that our front desk staff is always available to Make it Right so that you are able to enjoy all of our amenities while here on property. Our second pool will be opening by the end of the year. We hope you would consider staying with us again once our expansion is completed.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Waterfront Beach Resort for two night over the 4th of July.  My daughter used the pull out couch but on our first night we pulled it out only to find unclean sheets!  Next, she went to take a shower and the handle fell off in her hand.  Finally, two of the power outlets in the room did not function. We tried to have lunch in the hotel on the 4th; however, there was only one option--a $55 lunch buffet.  We decided to go elsewhere. The pool is too small to accommodate all of the guests, and the hot tub was teeming with little children jumping between the main pool and the hot tub. The location is great if you wish to spend time on Huntington Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Earl,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience. We apologize that your stay with us was less than enjoyable. I am so sorry to hear of the issues with your room. I will immediately bring these concerns to the attention of our housekeeping managers.  Our lunch buffet at Boardwalk restaurant was offered at a price of $32 for adults and $16 for children. We also had our In-Room Dining Menu, Dock Bar Light Bites menu, Offshore9, Riptide Pool menu,The Chill Zone Movie Concession Stand and Surf Hero Market open for Lunch. I am so sorry if these options were not made aware to you. We would be happy to discuss your stay further. Our Director of Operations, Ajit Acharya, is available at 714.845.8000. Thank you for your time.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel customer service needs better communication skills. Other than that everything was excellent.Swimming is fabulous a little over crowded due to contraction building another pool but it's worth it.

I stayed over at the Hilton in Huntington Beach on a recent business trip. I was not every impressed with the hotel.  The room rates were high and there was construction next door.  There are better options nearby.....

This resort is gorgeous, the view is amazing and the location is perfect! BUT the way my family and I were treated was horrible! Let's start from the beginning, my family and I arrived here yesterday (the day before 4th of July). As soon as we pulled up we were awed of how gorgeous this place was. We immediately got more excited to stay here! The valet and the bellmen were so amazing and went above and beyond with their service. We got there around 1:00 and check in is not till 4:00 which I was aware of before hand. The front desk gave us a pool key to enjoy till a room was available. Luckily a room was available early and we got checked in at 3:00 which was great! Our room was amazing on the very top floor with partial ocean view.   You're probably wondering why I'm only giving
Manager Response: Dear empascual31,  Thank you for your review and choosing The Waterfront. We appreciate your feedback and always look to continuously improve our service. Comments such as yours serve as a valuable learning tool and opportunity for improvement. We will address this review with our management staff. Best wishes on your continued travels.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Amazing hotel! We stayed in the Dolphin Tower and the room was very cute and comfortable. The staff was great as well as the rooftop. The location in walkable to Main Street and the the beach. I highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear 705marieo,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. We truly appreciate you choosing to stay at The Waterfront. We hope to see you again in the near future. Have a wonderful summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We had a short stay at the Resort and really enjoyed ourselves. Beautiful location across from the ocean. Enjoyed the pool and the beach. Easy walk to Pacific City for restaurants and shopping options.

Fist class hotel.    Great room. Great staff  Great views,   hotel very clean  pool area fantastic,   beach on your doorstep,  from the moment you walk in you just know its going to be a great holiday.  they can't do enough for you,   even give you towels and equipment brollies etc for the beach
Manager Response: Dear Fred C,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay with us. I am so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay., We know you have many options when visiting Orange County. Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, great service, satisfied customer
Summary: We stay here using the Hilton Honor program. The hotel was right across from the ocean, since we are gold member the hotel place us on the 10 floor with front ocean view. What a great view! The kids utterly enjoy the hotel as well as the beach. The breakfast quality was exceptional, we enjoyed the service of the waiting staff. We will definitely consider this location for our next summer vacation.
Manager Response: Dear nickyang76,   Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of your stay. I am thrilled to hear your stay was everything your family was looking for. We do hope to see you again next year. Thank you for choosing to stay with us! Have a wonderful summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: OK stay, not a great resort as i expected
Summary: Checkin time is 4PM which is quite late. We arrived at 3:30 and the room was not ready. Front deck gave us 3 complimentary drinks and 1 appetizer as the compensation. I went to Lounge bar area and no one there actually offered any help or asked me anything.  I cannot see any menu around . After a while, I approached the ppl inside the bar and ordered three drinks. we were called at 4:05PM and the room was ready. The room is very small, but quite clean. The decoration of the hotel is quite contemporary and I love it. At evening they do room service again in the room and left water and chocolate. Our kid liked it. breakfast has no much choice and all just basic continental breakfast buffet like other 2-3 star hotels. even no any kinds of berries are included in the fruit section.
Manager Response: Dear yujunh2015,  Thank you for your review. Your comments will help to further train and refine our processes throughout the resort. We greatly appreciate your staying with us in light of the issues you expresses and our sincerest apologies for not meeting your expectations. Please feel free to call our Director of Operations directly at 714.845.8000 so we can Make this Right for you. Thank you for your time.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: The Hilton was the perfect spot for our family of four... clean rooms, great pool, easy walk to/from the beach, easy walk to Huntington Beach pier and shopping.  It's our favorite.  The staff was very kind and courteous throughout our stay.  We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear ljkkendall,   Thank you for your review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We hope that if your travels bring you back to Orange County, you will choose to stay with us once again. Have a wonderful summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We stayed in the dolphin tower on the seventh floor with our 4 children for 2 nights. There were several areas where there is need for improvement. The air conditioner made an annoying sound, similar to a helicopter, every time it turned on. Twice, after housekeeping had been in the room, I found 2 long, thick, black hairs on the bathroom floor. Should have been noticed and picked up during cleaning as the tile is white and shows any dark hairs very easily. The pullout bed in the sofa is very uncomfortable and my daughter hated the bed. For the price of the rooms, the beds should be comfortable even if it is a pullout bed. The beach entry to the pool needs to be scrubbed every day, but wasn't. It was slimy and dirty. Considering that this is a popular area for toddlers to play
Manager Response: Dear Nancy C,  Thank you for your review and choosing The Waterfront. We appreciate your feedback and always look to continuously improve our service. Comments such as yours serve as a valuable learning tool and opportunity for improvement. We will address this review with our management staff. Best wishes on your continued travels.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Our latest visit was June 2nd through June 9th 2018.  Mr Joe Boyer assisted us with our reservation. He always responded immediately to any email questions I had during the months leading up to the trip. This year we reserved 2 rooms and they made sure that the rooms were next to each other on a high floor, oceanfront. As in my past reviews, I can't say enough about the exceptional service all-around. Everyone we encountered was always willing to try to accommodate any request and the entire staff is professional and always pleasant and welcoming. The resort has added a 2nd tower and pool area since our visit in July 2017 and it is absolutely beautiful.  We discovered this resort in early 2014 when researching to find a hotel in Orange County for 2 nights while my husband was on
Manager Response: Dear Karen L,  Thank you for the lovely review of your recent stay with us. I am so happy you had a wonderful experience. Thank you for mentioning Joseph by name. He is one of our shining stars here at The Waterfront. We truly appreciate your feedback and hope to see you again in the near future. Have a great summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: Wonderful place to stay and very family friendly. We went for my birthday with our toddler and he loved the hotel and the pool. The rooftop bar was a great spot for a drink or an appetizer while the main restaurant was perfect for lunch.
Manager Response: Dear Rachelleannebird,  Thank you for taking the time to write such a lovely review of your stay. We truly appreciate you choosing to stay with us. We hope to see you again in the near future!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: I loved the stylish Dolphin Tower.  The décor was new and beautiful.  I loved the location.  A quick walk across the street got us to the beach.  Bottom floor rooms have an extended veranda to sit out on.  We went during construction, I would love to see the new pool.

Great location! Very nice hotel.  Good service. Beach towels, chairs, umbrellas were free.  Only downside was the accessible room had no shower seat &  my wife is in a wheelchair, so we bought our own.  But overall a very nice stay.
Manager Response: Dear Runkga,  Thank you so much for your kind review of your stay with us. I apologize that the needed amenity of a shower seat was not provided to you. Please know we do have guest rooms that have shower seats installed in them. For your next visit, please call our in-house reservations team directly at 714-845-8000, Monday - Saturday, 8:30am - 4:00pm to make arrangements for this room type. It would be our pleasure to assist you and your wife. Thank you for your feedback and have a wonderful summer!  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: With the second tower now built this location is way too crowded to enjoy. I stayed at this location previously and it was great. This property has left luxury and romance behind and gone for cramming as many guests inside as pissible
Manager Response: Dear jmssupra25,  Thank you for your recent review. We apologize you were disappointed with your stay. With sold out peak season upon us, those seeking a relaxing oasis at a family resort may not find our property fits their needs. Rest assured, we are opening an additional pool, fine dining restaurant and spa in the very near future. I hope you would give us another opportunity at that time and find the exact environment you are looking for. Have a wonderful summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary: We had a double partial oceanview.  We loved the view of the water/beach.  Loved the Saturday eve Polynesian show by the pool, we loved doing the S'mores beach experience, body boarding on the water.  All hotel staff we encountered was friendly and helpful.   What a great little getaway close to home.  Want to come back with family and rent a cabana and try out the not yet open spa.  Have high hopes for that.  The only thing that needs revamping/revisiting is the food.  Not many options for dinner and the quality of lunch was not good.  I guess there are nearby other options but it would be nice to just stay on property and have proper delicious food to match the view.

First off, I want to say THANK YOU to the amazing and attentive staff at this magnificent resort.  All expectations were exceeded and beyond.  Pictures, reviews, and marketing does not even begin to touch what this resort is about.   Upon entrance, you are warmly greeted and made to feel very important and valued. We were traveling with two young kids, who absolutely loved the pools/slides/sand areas and they haven't stopped talking about the activities the staff put on for them throughout the day.  The drinks and poolside service was outstanding. The whole stay we were treated as royalty and adjusting back to reality after that vacation has been difficult. We are from Indiana and frequently travel to Florida and the East coast.  This was our first experience at a Hilton on the

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay! Upgrade to a suite if you can!
Summary: Its a shame that we could only stay one night, but it was a Sunday night, so we were able to upgrade to a suite on the 10th floor with an OUTSTANDING view!  WELL worth the money to be up higher to watch everything.  Of course, it was a beautiful day.  WARNING:  THERE IS construction going on M-F, so, they are going to make some noise.  Depending on where your room is will determine how much you will hear.  We were in the North tower (not the newest Dolphin tower) so, just below us they were doing work.  The staff was outstanding.  A well oiled machine.  Had appetizers at their restaurant and they were delish. Wish they had a Keurig though.

Bedroom - 2 comfy queens, closet, wall mounted TV, window Bathroom - Great shower, double vanity, toilet room, closet with 2 luxurious robes Living room - Sleeper sofa, Wall mounted TV, long dresser/desktop combo, patio with partial ocean view, mini fridge, Keurig Pool area is beautiful with water slide, sandpit with toys, plenty of seating and daily events  Valet parking only (even though they have an underground lot) New outdoor mall one block over with many food options Cross PCH to get to the Beach  The suite wasn't ready until 30 min after check-in time, and a bit pricey even after discounts but experiencing the new Dolphin tower was well worth it!

I will return to Huntington Beach someday soon I hope and The Hilton Waterfront is the only hotel I want to stay in!!!  We spent three wonderful nights here and it just has everything! For a start the decor is just beautiful, a very relaxed, casual beach feel to it but it has a touch of class.  The receptionists on check in were so professional and friendly, as was the porter/bellboy who assisted us with our bags. The room... We booked a family room to sleep 5, it was just perfect. It had two double beds along with a sofa bed - so so comfortable and plenty of space. Gorgeous bathroom with beach side decor, double sinks and a huge shower.  We were lucky enough to have a balcony with an incredible view of the beach. They also provide huge cosy bathrobes too - perfect for relaxing
Manager Response: Dear delasa,  WOW! What an absolutely wonderful review of your perfect family getaway! This is what The Waterfront is all about. Fun for all ages. I am so happy you were able to do a Beach Butler Bonfire at Waterfront Adventures. It is my personal favorite Huntington Beach activity. Quintessentially Southern California! We know you have many options when booking a vacation; thank you for choosing to stay with us. We hope to see you again. Enjoy your summer.  At your Service, Kim-Erin Justice Guest Experience Manager

Summary Heading: Awful service, nice rooms in new tower
Summary: I was here for a long weekend for a wedding staying in the new tower so can't speak to the rooms in the old tower. However, they are about a year behind schedule of having the new pool up and running which was part of the reason the wedding was booked here in the first place. New tower rooms are suites, well-furnished and spacious. Although mine had a blood stain in the carpet. My main disappointment with the hotel was the service. Literally, not a single thing was easy, check-in, valet, dry-cleaning, room-service, hotel bar, housekeeping....everything needed to be addressed multiple times to be resolved. I expected much better paying $400+ per night. The weird thing is the staff all seemed very nice, but I think they're just poorly trained so I'll peg this on bad management.
Manager Response: Dear Robert E,  Thank you for your review and choosing The Waterfront. We appreciate your feedback and always look to continuously improve our service. Comments such as yours serve as a valuable learning tool and opportunity for improvement. We will address this review with our management staff. Best wishes on your continued travels.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: This is one lovely hotel. We loved the location and the atmosphere. We didn’t dine at any restaurants at hotel to pricey and not our cup of tea. One thing that stood out was the fact the concierge had called us personally to let us know the second pool would be open during our visit. Well that wasn’t the case when we arrived the pool was super busy since only one pool was open and we didn’t even get to enjoy the pool which was the main reason we chose this hotel. Pool has an amazing view of the ocean. Sad we didn’t get to lounge not one time during our stay. They gave us a $100 comp for that, but honestly when you pay $400 a night you expect to be able to enjoy the facility. So yeah $1000 for 2 nights and no pool kind of sucked. I understand that it wasn’t ready but why
