You may be interested to know that USA Today is available free and on your phone or computer once you log into our wifi (and this is true at all Hilton properties). There is no charge or cost to you. Parking fees are posted openly on all of our websites and also on your email confirmations and reminders. As with most resort hotels, these are never part of your room rate thus leaving you more options for transportation should you desire not to drive or park. Additionally, unlike all other hotels in the area, The Waterfront currently does not have a resort fee and has no plans to do so until all construction on our southside is completed.  We wish you all the best and hope your journey home was safe and comfortable.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: What a location across the road to the beach. The pool is small bit lovely and has much needed shade protection. The hotel supplies beach gear including chairs, kids spades, boogy boards etc. The room was lovely with a good view and a nice modern bathroom. We dis have to remind them to make up the kids sofa bed for the 1st few nights. Valet and concierge were super. In easy walking distance to town. Breakfast was tasty but often had long waits for a table. Not sure if you can book a slot in advance.

This hotel was beautiful and everyone was friendly especially the gentlemen working the valet. The rooms were very clean and the views of the beach were amazing! my family and I only stayed for one night, but we definitely will be back!

The beach is across the street.  Still very nice.  Walking distance to a small shopping area with restaurant.  Safe walking, walk down the beach to the pier . Great people watching.  Coney Island to eat out there. if you like that.

We decided to extend our vacation for one more night and stayed here with our 5 year old , the hotel is very clean the rooms were nice and our view was fantastic, Our 5 year old had a great time in the pool. It is also real close to the beach, we live in the area so we just hung out by the pool.We had dinner at the restaurant on site it was very nice food was good and not too expensive considering where it is. The hotel is a little pricy but worth it , I would definitely get a room with a view of the ocean. We will definitely be back.

Helpful and accommodating staff. We were with a group of about 100+ and the staff never appeared stressed or put out. Clean facility with great food. Right across from the beach and near a new development with great eateries and shopping! Awesome views as well. Housekeeping staff was SO nice

This is an upscale Hilton Resort at the Huntington beach. Shops and many restaurants on walking distance. Clean and beautiful room with frendly Staff. Breakfast is expensive but als HHhonor Diamont member free. A little expensive but all in all good value for money.

I've had hundreds of hotel stays and this by far was the best service I've ever experienced. Every one was very friendly and helpful from valet to front desk, from to the servers to the house keepers. All of the hotels in the area have great views and good amenities, but I will return to this location based on the service alone. It makes them stand out from all others.

Hilton Huntington Beach Waterfront is strategically located across the street from the beach and 1 mile from all the "action" on Main St. Great restaurants within short proximity and food/bar was great at the hotel. We attended a fantastic wedding with a great view of the ocean while dining in the ballroom. Food was outstanding for a banquet.

The stay and the weather was great! Lots to do around that area from the beach, pool, Main Street and a mall a short walk with food, clothes and ice cream and coffee places. The. Construction during the day was a little loud if you were in your room during 9-5 on the south side, but the pool side you didn't even know anything was going on.

This resort had great staff who were attentive and friendly. It was clean and the view was beautiful. It is a great place for a relaxing weekend. I loved the Hawaiian fire and hula dancers by the pool at night and the beach amenities which were included. There were 2 weddings while we visited but the hotel was good about accommodating guests by providing a shuttle to the nearby Hyatt while our pools were closed. The restaurant for breakfast was delicious and they were good to accommodate food allergies. My partner loved their eggs Benedict. We wish they had a spa and a nicer hot tub area. Also, an additional fire pit or two would be great. That being said they are building a brand new tower which looks promising. They said it will have a new pool for kids with slides, have a

We made a last min reservation to take the kids to a fire pit that was set up with chairs all the fixings for our s'mores drinks etc. Nick the guy who was in charge of our pit was AWESOME  He had our kids laughing the whole time our fire was always flaming perfect. Thank you Nick for a fun evening  P.S the bike was a hit 😂👍🏻

Had a wonderful stay. The staff was excellent. Very clean. I paid extra for the oceanfront view and SO glad I did. I wish I was told about the complimentary beach equipment. There were 4 of us and I do wish there were more outlets in the room.

We enjoy this property for family visits to this area. The public spaces are a little dated. The rooms are uniformly clean and well appointed. The staff is warm and professional. A large hotel expansion including a new pool will open next summer.

We always have a wonderful stay at the Waterfront Hilton in Huntington Beach.  The staff is personable, rooms are clean and fresh with great views.  Be sure to save an evening for the beach bonfire and ask for Jose!  You won't regret the memories made during this time together!

Summary Heading: Fantastic location - the refurbishment planned in 2017 will make it spectacular!
Summary: We spent 2 weeks here in June with 2 children.  The pool was warm and clean - and not too deep so it is very family friendly.  There were numerous staff attending to the pool area which ensured a fresh supply of towels, iced water and assistance at all times.  Ask for a Fountain Drink from the Surf Hero servers ie. diet pepsi, sparkling water as you get free refills! We had a room on the 8th floor looking north towards the pier and overlooking the pool so the construction did not bother us at all and these balconies get sun in the afternoon. The whole hotel is very clean and very well organised considering the amount of guests, weddings and business conferences that it holds. The location was perfect for us as it is so close to the beach, the boardwalk, restaurants and the

Been a 4 times and each time I have the best vacation. The Team is fabulous, the rooms are good and definitely stay in a room with a view.  The restaurant is fantastic the pool is nice and my favorite part it is across the street from the BEACH. so easy to get to and they do offer complimentary  sand toys for kids, boogie boards and chairs.  You can rent bikes right from the hotel and go all day if you want! The shuttle brings you to the downtown area where there is lots of shopping and restaurants. You can walk if you want  to since it is not very far. Also, just opened next to the hotel is the new Pacific City Mall area and restaurants galore. Love this resort and they are adding on to the resort and it should be ready to go mid next year!!! Can't wait to go back.

This Hilton was very nice.  I am a Hilton Honors member, so I generally stay within this brand.  The staff at this hotel were all very friendly and helpful.  I found this hotel to be very clean.  I was in my room one day when the maid came in, she did a very thorough job.  Getting chocolate by my bed every evening was also a nice touch!

We stayed here last minute for a quick break from the heat - what a treat :).  We loved the hotel and have already booked our next reservation for the 4th of July!  The construction is next to the building and not during weekends so not an issue at all.  Looking forward to our next stay!

Beautiful grounds and can't beat the location - and - They are adding-on a wing, which should be done summer 2017.  Free shuttle to downtown Huntington Beach, although it's a pleasant walk as well.  New development next door, "Park City" that has several great shops and restaurants!

We stayed here for our Honeymoon. Started with upgrading our room to a fantastic suite. Then they gave us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Along with free half day bike rental. We go over to get the bike rental and they ask us why we are visiting California. We tell them honeymoon. The guy says.. Keep the bike all day and have fun. What a great time we had..

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel in a gorgeous beach front setting
Summary: My wife and I recently stayed for 1 night at this hotel in our trip down the Pacific Coast highway. After a hectic few days in LA and San Francisco it was great to check in to tissue hotel and relax by the pool for a day before continuing to San Diego.  We stayed in room 909 on the 9th floor and had a fabulous view of the beach front. There 8s building work currently going on in this side of the hotel where the new Tower is being built (an extension to the existing hotel) but work finished at 5pm and didn't affect us at all.  The new facility will be fabulous I'm sure. The staff at reception and in the valet parking were particularly helpful and made us feel very welcome. The breakfast was good and it was very pleasant sitting outside on the terrace enjoying it. Overall,

Rooms are extremely clean.  we had an ocean view room and it was worth the money.  Beautiful mornings on the patio and sunsets are amazing.  Location was the best.  Just a few blocks from the downtown entertainment.  Construction was going on, but did not affect us at all.  Staff was amazing.  We will be back.

Everything is of great quality: service, cleanliness, food... Internet is not so good as it kept disconnecting, but everything else was excellent! The weather was not so good the weekend we went, but there was a lot to do!

Excellent Staff, Good location, beautiful Surrounding ...etc. mostly very good to relax in the front of the beach hotel. Best in full service to your room as well. Ballroom is also beautiful and big. bar service is superb.

Summary Heading: After  4 days in condos this hotel was a welcome respite
Summary: Great seaside resort with a flair for service. Comfortable well equipped rooms with great upper level views of the area.Excellent desk and valet staff.We were there during a booked wedding at the pool so will refrain from  commenting on the pool area. Restaurants were first class with typical Hilton attention to detail.Nice little market area for in between snacks etc. Will make this my destination for LA trips as the beach and downtown area are vibrant and well thought out.

The parking fee is ridiculous but everything else about the hotel is top notch, couldn't have enjoyed my time there anymore, the staff is friendly and the location perfect, they are starting construction of a new tower but they dont start work till after 8 am and even then i was never bothered by construction noise

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, shame about the construction site next door.
Summary: This certainly is a very nice hotel, very tasteful, nice bar and restaurant, the staff I encountered were all pleasant and helpful. So far so good, however, right next door they are building an extension to the hotel so if you end up with a room at that side of the hotel your view won't be so great. The first clue will be when you arrive at your room and there is a yellow plastic construction hat in the room, they have a sense of humor I'll say that for them!!!  As for Huntington beach, well if your a surfer or into watching them then you will be fine but otherwise the beach is a featureless expanse of sand, a walk to the pier will only take about 20 minutes which is where the main town centre is too. There is a good retro diner on the end of the pier which does a nice

Great room, Great view, friendly helpful staff, good location!  The beach is just steps away. Great shopping just a short walk away. Shades restaurant has great food and friendly service. We would stay here again.

My Nephew and friends just graduated from high school, and we gave them a weekend at the beach before they all go in different directions for college.  They had a great time, and so did we!  The bonfire experience was great, the entire resort was fabulous.  We were able to have a cocktail while the kids were out being kids!

Housekeeping was very unresponsive and desk staff was less than helpful.  Valet and bell staff was awesome.  I had stayed here before and was very satisfied but this particular stay was a comedy of errors.  I expect much more for the Hilton chain.
Manager Response: Dear Kevin S,  Thank you for your recent review. We are very sorry that you were dissatisfied with your housekeeping service. We will be following up with you shortly via a personal email as well as looking into what exactly happened here. Ordinarily our housekeeping staff receives the highest of marks consistently, so we'll need a bit more information from you so we can "Make It Right".  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Comfortable rooms that are spacious & clean. The beds were very comfortable.  Even though we were on the fourth floor, a bit further back, we still had a great view of the ocean.   I don't care for the required valet service of $32 a day but this is the only way you can park your car there. No self parking was available.  But all the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful...from the car valet to the front desk staff.   We are Gold members of Hilton Honors so we appreciate the complimentary breakfast (continental at the restaurant or up to $15, for breakfast items, at the deli/ coffee shop) and the Internet.  The beach is right across the beach, Very convenient.  The pier is just a short walk. We drove downtown but the hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to downtown

Very nice for a single night getaway. Can get very pricey with add-ons such as parking, pet charges and Internet service. Nice area for the dogs including doggy bags, that was very helpful. My dog enjoyed her stay.

Excellent location, two blocks from main street and the pier, near restaurants, bars, and entertainment. Breakfast is very good at the Hotel. Huntington Beach is the surfing capital of the United States. You will see surfers all day long by the pier. There is a great bar and restaurant at the beginning of the Pier called Dukes. Casual and fun and noisy. I've returned twice to this Hilton Hotel. Pricy but good. Enjoy.

Stayed here in June and what a great place!  Beautiful place and beautiful staff.  The staff makes you feel so comfortable and they are so helpful!  Hotel offers towels, chairs, umbrellas, sand toys to take over to the beach. The restaurant offers free breakfast for children (my daughter is four and hers was free.) they are in the process of building a new tower scheduled to open 2017 we were on the opposite side of the building and heard nothing.  I can't say enough about every single staff member they made this a great vacation!  I'd recommend this place to anyone!!  Great place for children!! The beach is a short walk across the street and it's a great location on the beach.  Several eating locations within walking distance.  Close to pier and downtown .5 mile or less.

We booked this hotel for our honeymoon night.  We actually booked 2 nights so I could stay the night before my wedding with my sister & then the wedding night with my new husband.  Hotel itself is beautiful and my sister & I got in late the first night.  I told the girl at the front desk I was staying here for my honeymoon and I was getting married the next day.  I ended up with the room literally next to the elevator and kids from prom were extremely loud until I had to get out of bed and politely ask them to keep it down as I was getting married the next day and needed to sleep!  Luckily they were very cool and left pretty quickly.  I was bummed that after informing the front desk I was getting married the next day, that she would put us into such a loud room!  I decided not
Manager Response: Dear NurseVanessa,  Thank you for taking the time and effort to write such a detailed account of your recent stay here at The Waterfront. I am so sorry you encountered so many challenges during your wedding and honeymoon. Please know that this review is being escalated to the highest levels and all managers and directors will be asked to respond to our GM directly as to how any of this could have happened. The last thing we would ever want is to NOT be the best part of your special day, and we obviously failed you here (even with a comp'd night).  I can assure you, this is not how our hotel operates and there will be extensive follow-up with all of our associates. You did all the right things (letting us know about your wedding at check-in, making requests that were nowhere near unusual or out of bounds, and doing so with grace and kindness) and frankly, we blew it. On behalf of our entire tam, I am truly sorry and will have one of our executive team members reach out to you shortly. We would love the opportunity to make this right by you and earn back your trust and future business.  And, while awkward to do so in this note, please accept our congratulations and best wishes on your recent marriage. We wish you all the best.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: This is THE place to stay
Summary: This hotel is a place that will make you keep coming back! Everything here is so beautiful! And having a hard working staff makes all the difference. Any questions we have and anything we need, we get! Everyone is so friendly and there are so many great things this place has to offer. Our large room has a breathtaking view of the ocean. When we come back to Huntington Beach there will be no question on where to stay next. 10/10 in my book!

Excellent location - great staff - great hotel - would highly recommend.  This location is right on the Pacific Ocean located on Pacific Coast Highway right in downtown Huntington beach - perfect for all beach activities.  The staff goes out of their way to satisfy every need.  Great food and fantastic heated pool as well as weekend events and children activities.

From the managers to front desk staff to valet guys.  Everyone was amazing.  Rooms were clean. Beds comfy. They treat you as if they known you.  Best experience ever. Will definitely go again.  Went to the beach,  they offered us beach chairs, umbrellas, beach towels and volley balls to take with us.  All included free with your stay.

My wife and I always look forward to our stay at this hotel.  The staff is well trained and very attentive to our needs.  The bar and restaurant staff are fun and have always met our needs. The room is always clean and comfortable. The only negative is that we do not stay long enough on each visit.

The best spot to unwind and relax.  The hotel staff is amazing and the rooms are gorgeous. So much to do and see.  The local shopping is fantastic, The choices for night life are vast, and within walking distance from the hotel.  The pool Service is above par, and the overall experience worth every penny.

It was a great experience from beginning until end. Love that you include your guests in the renovation process. So much fun for everyone. Great job. Parking fee feels a little pricey but amazing valet staff.

Summary Heading: Sound of Surf at your doorstep
Summary: Beautiful clean friendly hotel with amazing location. Walkable to shops and restaurants, cool poolside vibe and across from the beach and ocean.   Highly recommend!  Every staff member I encountered was polite, friendly and helpful.  Our room was spotless and all areas of the hotel were clean and smelled amazing.  ! Gorgeous !

Summary Heading: Best View and Best Location on an Awesome Beach
Summary: There are many reasons why we have stayed in this hotel more than any other hotel in the world.  We have used this hotel for more business and social events than all other venues put together.  The beach and sunset views, the proximity to one of the greatest beaches in the world, the walking distance to great shops and restaurants, the fabulous view balconies and the proximity to all the attractions of Southern California make this The Place To Stay.  Our out of town guests love this hotel and always look forward to coming back.  We have always experienced exceptionally professional, friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Rooms are always super clean.  The live music entertainment at the pool and pool side restaurant is fabulous.  The event coordinators are creative, responsive and

So, this was my second time to this hotel.  I must say, it again has exceeded my expectations.  I would recommend it to any and all who come to the area.  Great staff,  awesome location with access to any and everything you might need!

Great Hotel although the web site offered free shuttle to Disneyland and of when in fact they didn't have a free shuttle. Instead I was offered a taxi ride there for $60 each way, $120 total. More then the airfare to get to California from Tucson Arizona. That was a major bummer.

Summary Heading: Anniversary getaway, can't wait to go back soon!
Summary: Excellent place for a getaway or special occassion. The staff, especially Tammy the concierge went above and beyond our expectations to make our anniversary special. All staff is welcoming and pleasant, the food is consistantly excellent. Complimentary beach gear, rental bikes, smores campfire wagons...so much fun!! And the rooms are very relaxing and the ocean views are awesome!

Staff was super responsive and the quality of the accommodations were as should be expected. The location of the hotel was awesome for a good experience in a little beach town, walking distance for everything!

Abraham at the front desk was above and beyond friendly and accommodating. We had our dogs with us and when we entered our room there was a gift package for our dogs and a card to welcome us. We will stay here when we visit HB As they have the best dog beach in the area and for us, the best hotel to stay at. We will ALWAYS STAY AT THE WATERFRONT!!!  Can't say enough about the service at the restaurant as well. So accommodating to our dogs. The food was great and the wine was very good as well. What a wonderful trip! CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK!

Awesome stay was very happy with the whole experience. Great door bell service and everyone was wonderful. Things were easy to find and everyone was helpful. I would definitely go back for the next vacation!!!

We stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort and loved it.  Every staff member we encountered was super friendly and very helpful.  The parking is valet only, but you have 24hr access to your vehicle if you need to.  The resort is within easy walking distance to the downtown area, but the resort offers a shuttle if you need a ride.  The beach is across the street and the resort has beach chairs available if you need one. The room was clean and nicely updated had a mini fridge to use.  The balconies are angled in a way that each room has a "view" of the ocean.  The Hilton is building a new hotel tower, but construction is limited to starting at 8am. It did not bother us at all.

We stayed here just for one night before flying out of LAX.  We stayed in a Studio suite which was quite spacious.  We stayed on the 8th floor and had amazing views of the beach, it was such a summer type feeling with the light decor of the rooms. The bed was very comfortable.  All of the staff we meet were really nice and helpful.  The property is light and airy, its a fraction dated but definitely not something that would turn me away.  I also know that they are expanding the property so in about 12 months time it will be awesome!  The pool area is great, with plenty of sun lounges and a gorgeous view of the beach.  We had breakfast in the Shades Restaurant.  We choose not to have the buffet but I wished we had of as it looked good and the a la carte that we choose took a long

We just arrived in Huntington Beach today to celebrate or 35th Wedding Aniversary. We are Diamond members and were impressed with this property online. We were somewhat disappointed that we could not receive the customary room upgrade for Diamond guests. I would like to say that we are very impressed with Vanessa the concierge. It was not her fault that we could not be upgraded but she said she would do her best to get us an upgraded room during this stay as soon as available. She has gone out of her way to make our stay memorable and she should be recognized. I will post again after our stay to hopefully share what the ocean rooms are like.

Summary Heading: A joy of a place to stay!
Summary: We stayed here when our daughter was married last month.  All rooms have an ocean view, albeit from a small patio.  Regardless, it is hard to beat the fantastic beach weather, the view of the pool and ocean while sipping your morning coffee.  Everyone was very helpful and did their best to make sure we had a comfortable visit.

Without question this staff went above and beyond to make this trip special for my family and guest. I was absolutely amazed by how friendly and helpful every member of hotel staff. From parking attendant, front desk, bell and several others in hotel. There was not one person who wasn't willing to help and make sure we were 100% satisfied.  Blown away!!!

I have to say, that everything was perfect for our stay. The room was immaculate, the staff was friendly, and professional. All of our needs were met. The beds were super comfy, and the view of the ocean/resort view was wonderful from our balcony. Staff goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome and comfortable!! I can't think of anything we lacked.

We spent one night in May on our way from San Diego to San Francisco. Ramil was awesome because he was very helpful giving us a map and tips on where to go. He also helped us get our luggages ready. They have a free shuttle to Main street where you can go eat and walk to the Pier. Everyone was so friendly. It was windy so the pool was nice since we could not go to the beach.

Summary Heading: Great place, great price, great rooms.
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel with nice size rooms. Service is Hilton standard, possibly better than usual since it has a relaxing beach atmosphere. Within easy walking distance of beautiful beaches and downtown. Restaurant and nightclub right in the hotel as well as Starbucks and gift shop.

It was so nice to enjoy the view and the amenities at the Hilton Waterfront Hotel!  It wasn't too crowded.  The rooms were clean and beautiful.  I enjoyed having a drink by the fire place in the outside area of the restaurant.  The guitar music was excellent.

We were looking for a getaway for our 22nd wedding anniversary somewhat close to home. The waterfront Hilton is a great location just across from the beach and a short walk to the shops and nightlight around the pier. The room was large with a nice balcony overlooking the ocean and beach to the south of the property, The bed was very comfortable and the who;e room nicely decorated. They are building a new tower just to the south and a large crane and construction site is visible and possible noise issues during the week. The pool area is nice and we enjoyed sitting next to the big fire pit at night enjoying the evening air. The rooms are not cheap, but when compared too other beach area accommodations they are in line and seem to be a much better facility. One caveat, there is

Room was very nice, but between the construction and the highway noise, it wasn't the relaxing experience that I expected. Great views of the beach! Hotel restaurant service (for dinner) was okay but not great. Easy walk to the pier, shops and restaurants in Pacific City.

Lovely Hotel, opposite Huntington Beach, about a 10 min walk to the pier and shops. I was dissapointed that there was no shops in the vincity. It was approx 40 mins from LAX,  Lovely rooms, with lots of space, gorgeous views of the beach. Breakfast was great and nice staff. small shop in the hotel.

My daughters wedding reception was held at the hotel. Vanessa Delp was a wonderful representative for your company. The service that was provided by everyone of your employees was wonderful. We definitely plan on returning.

I stayed here 1 night - overnight after a long day during business travel.  The front desk was very accommodating during check in.  The room had ocean/pier view and was very quite.  The room was very clean.  The restaurant downstairs has ocean view with inside and outside sitting available.  All in all very nice hotel for business or leisure travel.

Really good value. Would recommend this hotel to everybody. Close to the beach. Close to really good restaurants and shopping. Wonderful breakfast. Nice rooms and great service. Location is cool and easy access.

Stayed there 4 nights and u enjoyed it. except the fact that they put me in a room next to their construction site, it was a good stay overall. They changed my room when I reqyested. Make sure to ask for a room away from the construction  area. It is very noisy and it likely will be there for long time as they building  huge addition. Tammy at concierge was a great help during our stay and she was very nice and professional .

Pricey but nice location.  My daughter got married here and overall a very nice location and wedding.  The only problem the wedding was at 4 and check in was at 4.  They were able to accommodate most of the rooms.

Most rooms have an ocean view but I would recommend one on the pier side for a nice sunset. Ocean front role can be a little noisy as PCH is between the hotel and the beach. Check in was fast and easy. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The small lanai was nice for an evening drinks. The grounds are top notch. Parking is valet only which kind of bothers me. I understand the high fee for a coastal beach property but the fact that I have to call down for my car just to retrieve something left is a real pain. Why don't they let you into their garage and what are they trying to hide? Hum.   The restaurant for small bites and drinks was disappointing. Requested an outdoor spot but was told that there were none. We could wait in the bar area for a table to open up which we did

If making plans to vacation in Huntington Beach - this is the hotel!  You will be treated well - the customer service is excellent, the rooms clean and comfortable and the food mouthwatering.  It will be a vacation to remember.

Loved this Hotel! I would recommend it to everyone. Very friendly, clean, awesome pool, walking distance to Main Street,Happy Atmosphere!  The bedding is very comfortable also! One more thing they make Great sandwiches/cocktails by the pool!

This hotel has a great location, my room was clean and spacious,and had a beautiful view of palm trees and the ocean.All of the staff were friendly and helpful, and greeted me daily. I would recommend this hotel and plan on staying there again.

We live about 30 minutes inland but wanted to spend the night at the beach. The hotel was very nice. We were upgraded to a corner suite which had a great view. The staff was wonderful. The restaurant was OK but not great. There is a store on the property that is way overpriced so walk a little to find what you need.

Summary Heading: Great for Events and better for Vacation
Summary: I have stayed at this property as an event planner holding an event in the ballroom as well as a guest who gets to enjoy the property amenities.  Every single time the service level supersedes any luxurious resort in Orange County, which is not an easy feat!  The staff members in every department go above and beyond the call of duty and truly understand Customer Service.  Romell is always great at the front!  If you need to plan an event, get in touch with Karen and always request Church as your banquet captain, just to name a few.

It was just a bad experience overall.  No maid service, extremely slow room service.  No one seemed to care.  Construction or not, I expected better.  Given the lousy room view of the construction I would have expected a bit more in the way of accommodating effort.
Manager Response: Dear patrickebrown,  Our apologies for any difficulties during your stay. As a rule, your satisfation is our mission! We are very sorry we disappointed you. While we can't help the construction next door we can make every effort to be sure you feel served and cared for...and somehow we missed that. In looking at the housekeeping log however, I see a note marking the room "Do Not Disturb". When that is on your door we take that as a hard rule. However, you are always welcome to call us to have the room made up, regardless of the hour.  We would welcome the chance to serve you again and make things right. Please contact me personally to secure your reservation...and if you'd be so kind, grant us the opportunity to show you what we're really made of.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Nothing Special here except the price
Summary: Our room was comparable to any 3 star hotel. We were on the 6th floor & located well away from the elevators. The rooms are not very sound proof as we heard a lot of commotion in the hallway & in the room next to ours. It settled down after about an hour of kids shouting & running up and down the halls. The A/C works great & easy to program to your preference. WiFi works very well and is fast. There is major construction going on around the hotel which makes arrival a little taxing but not impossible. Aside from the ridiculous room rate, the parking (Valet only, no self parking) fee was exorbitant $34.00 per night. The lobby was very nice & check-in went pretty smooth. Check-out also went smooth. I guess you pay dearly for a beach front hotel, although you have to cross a busy
Manager Response: Dear Rocky R.,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate all of your comments and apologize for the noise issues. Often the young ones get a little over excited the second they lay eyes on the ocean and realize they are here... but our highly trained staff can usually get them to settle down and get "into the groove" of relaxing. Never hesitate to call upon us...we'll come to your rescue anytime (and we'd never let the kids know we got a call, we just "magically appear"). You are also correct in pointing out that we are a "valet only" hotel (as are all of the hotels and resorts up and down the coast). We hope that not having a resort fee on top of that took a bit of the sting out of parking. Unfortunately, with space, security and liability being an issue while providing 24 hour service and access to your vehicle there really is no other option for us at this time.   We look forward to having you come back to Huntington Beach...whether you stay with us or choose another option, it was a delight to serve you. (And if that other hotel you find doesn't quite cut it for you, give us a call. We'd be glad to have you back!)  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The staff is amazing and went out of their way to make our stay perfect.  The room had a balcony and a beautiful view of the ocean.  Beds, linens and amenities were very nice.  We walked to the beach, the Pier and Main Street.  Yes, there was a lot of construction in the area but it didn't affect our stay as we were on the pool side.  The lobby and pool area were beautiful and immaculate.   We will definitely be staying here again!

Spectacular view of the ocean, close to Main Street, downtown shopping, great restaurant, delicious brunch, room service was awesome and super quick. Our room was very comfortable and the bed was amazing! Close to Duke's and within walking distance of the pier. Definitely will stay next time!

My family and I stayed here for 5 nights.  The staff was efficient and friendly.  The location was perfect...across street to beach and 5 blocks from Main St.  Hotel grounds were beautiful.  Only issue is that Valet parking was only option and expensive.

Stayed here for 3 nights with our dog. The resort caters to dog owners and this was a huge plus for us. Very pet friendly. Staff and service was awesome. The location to the beach and pier area is also a plus. Yes parking is expensive  but just plan for it and you won't be shocked. Thier is a restaurant  on site.

Summary Heading: Will not accept Hilton Honor Reward Certificates
Summary: I have Hilton Reserve Credit Card which entitled me to 2 free nights on a weekend.  The hotel website shows standard rooms open but Hilton has declined to honor reward certificates at this hotel.  Very disappointing.
Manager Response: Dear jasontraci2006,  Thank you for reaching out to us. Please contact the Hilton Hhonors "help desk" (1800HHonors or 1-800-446-6677). As long as we have rooms available on the dates you are requesting the system should be honoring reward stays. There may have been a glitch in the system or an issue with some of the data entry. Either way, let's get you speaking to a live person right away so we can clear this up. We would love to have you as our guest!  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We came here for a bar mitzvah, and stayed for the weekend. A beautiful hotel and right across from the beach. As easy walk to the HB pier and Main St. Clean and modern rooms, great food and good service. Ramil our bellman was especially helpful! There is construction going on @ the hotel, but a view of the ocean makes it worthwhile. Wished we could have stayed longer! This is a great place for a "staycation" for those who are CA residents, but not local.

Summary Heading: Not quit what I was expecting
Summary: Got to the hotel at 4:05 our room wasn't ready but excited to wait since they upgraded us from resort view to ocean view, and he said he didn't want to change us because it was such a great room! The front desk phoned around 4:30 we proceeded to check in and get to our room and I'd say it's a palm tree view. The ocean might have been there... Somewhere ... The rooms are adjacent to pool and venues held at hotel so couldn't keep the balcony door open for the ocean breeze there was just too much going on!  The room service for dinner was awesome although instead of 45 minutes took an hour and a 1/2.  We are diamond members at Hilton and the first time staying here.... Not sure if we'll return.
Manager Response: Dear Pennell,  Thank you for your review. Our apologies that you were not completely satisfied with the view from your room. We do our best to keep our palms trimmed and tidy as to not obstruct too much of anyone's view of the ocean. We've made note of both your room and the tree issue and our grounds team is heading up to take a look today.  Please allow us another opportunity to serve you and, if available, we'll try to get you up on a floor above the palm trees. We look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Check in on line was fast and easy.  Room wasn't ready when we got there because we were early but they kept me updated as to readiness and got us in a bit early.  Valet parking was fast and convenient.  Got upgraded to a suite based on request on booking and sure enough got a beautiful room on the 12th floor with a great view.  Lovely room, a little tired, but clean and well-appointed. Service at the hotel was very good.  Location is excellent.  Easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and pier and right across from a fabulous beach.  We were only there for a couple of nights so not a lot of time to explore so will need to go back.

The Waterfront is our absolute favorite getaway. The Staff is friendly and accommodating; Bellman Ramil made sure we had a great time! Delicious food, spotless rooms, beautiful views and grounds! They provided bikes for a great ride along the beachfront and we can walk to the beach and downtown. Also they have a shuttle for when we bring family members not up to walking. A truly wonderful experience every time!
Manager Response: Dear Cyndee D,  Thank you! Comments like these really make us smile. Please know that it is a pleasure to serve you and welcome you not just as our guest, but as part of our Waterfront family. 25 years in the making, and we're just getting started... wait until you see and experience what we have in store for you next!  Best wishes,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Nice place but don't drive there. 34 dollars a day for parking  this is on top of high room price and 13% tax rate.  The service was fine and room was good   Overall if u fly and cab in its a good deal but if you drive in and stay for a few days parking is def a diturant
Manager Response: Dear W5563FVterrym,  Thank you for your review. Unfortunately parking will always be an issue for any resort hotel on the Southern California coastline. With both limited public space and beach operation times that prevent overnight parking (with the exception of campsites) that puts the burden of parking vehicles directly back on to the hotels. Add to that the need to provide security and 24 access for our guests and you can see how this can be quite a challenge.  You are absolutely correct in suggestion a cab/uber/or private shuttle as an alternative. Additionally, our on-site rental rates are competitive with airport rates and thus eliminate the need to bring your vehicle. Unfortunately this only works if you are flying in to us and not driving from a nearby location. Rest assured we feel your pain as we are subject to the same laws and restricted parking areas as locals. For your next visit, call our concierge team first and allow them to arrange a transportation itinerary that more suits your needs and desires. They would be more than pleased to do so!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed for four nights while attending a conference in Newport. Location is great, with the beach just a few minutes away across the pacific coast highway, and downtown Huntington Beach and the pier within easy walking distance. A good (reliable Hilton standard) sized room, partly renovated, and with some views. The hotel has a decent restaurant and a nice (smallish) pool area. It seems to be popular with parties, receptions, weddings. Parking is expensive, but I found the valet very efficient. Staff was overall very friendly and we really enjoyed our stay.

Didn't provide value for money - if anything everything was overpriced. No resort activities or facilities so not sure why they name their hotel as a resort. Room is basic. Pool is not heated. No poolside service. Food choice is limited. Stay somewhere else which provides better value for money and a better experience.

Stayed here for one night, great hotel, friendly service from the valet guys, front desk and waiters. Nice pool area and spa, great fire pit spot overlooking the beach. Had a room on the 10th floor facing the beach do the views were stunning. Would stay again

This is a very nice hotel was very nice and clean. The entrance was very tourist friendly the plants and the palm tree gve the hotel a very nice appearance. The concierge desk workers were very knowledgeable and friendly. The rooms is relaxing and comfortable. Rooms were cleaned everyday and the maids were amazing. The pool area and the hot rub very attractive, the view was amazing. Plus the all you can eat bullet from breakfast was great; the fresh omelette was nice hot amd fresh and the $22 was worth the price.

We loved our time at the Waterfront Hilton in Surf City USA.  The view of the sea coast and the pier was worth the expense!!  The hotel staff was especially accommodating and ever so friendly.   The hotel property is all around beautiful. Great location to walk downtown and the hotel's shuttle service made it easy to return to the hotel at night.  We would stay there again in a minute anytime.

Summary Heading: 26 year anniversary for a local couple
Summary: We are only live 30 minutes away, but this was exceptional vacation for a weekend away.  Staff was wonderful, rooms beautiful, and pool a full day event.  Love being close to HB pier and main street. Lots of things to see and eat/drink...  6 stars for me!!!!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Could Use a Refresh
Summary: I stay at this property quite frequently on business, and always have a good experience.  The staff is friendly and willing to help from valet parking to the front desk to the bartender.  The location is great, with most rooms having a nice view of the ocean.  Easy walk to good food and shopping, especially on Tuesday nights when the street fair and farmers' market is on.    Couple of minor issues to be aware of:  Despite the name, the property is not directly on the water.  Instead, it is across the Pacific Coast Highway from the beach.  This does add a bit of road noise and minor inconvenience for accessing the beach.  The only other issue is that the décor and facilities in the rooms are starting to show their age.  It is a clean and well maintained property, but just
Manager Response: Dear Z6858WMrobertm,  Thank you for your recent review and comments about our property. You may have noticed that there is no building of hotels or private property (with one small experimental exception of condos near the pier that will never be repeated) for over 10 continuous miles. Unobstructed Pacific beauty and open public access are the name of the game here in Huntington Beach, Surf City USA! We really pride ourselves on this fact and hope you enjoyed it as well.  As for our hotel décor and facilities you may have noticed that we are well underway with our $150M expansion and upgrade. Working at a record pace, and far ahead of schedule, we welcome you back to see all that we have done for you. Rooms in the current tower are nearly finished being upgraded and refreshed and the new tower and pool complex will open in the summer of 2017. Come now or come later, there is plenty "new" coming online every week...and we look forward to showing it all off for you!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The hotel is great, but the best part was how amazing all of the staff was. Every single person we ran into was professional, kind and helpful. We will be back for sure . I highly recommend a room ending in an even number that is higher (Ex:1018)

Stayed at this hotel for business meeting. View of the beach from our room was very nice, however, dampened by the sound of Pacific Coast Highway and construction next door. The hotel room's interior is dated and dirty. Carpet was so filthy it had an odor. Very glad that I spent only one night here. Good walking distance to Huntington Beach Pier.
Manager Response: Dear Dr_C_and_E,  Thank you for your comments. We apologize that you were not happy with your accommodations during your recent stay with us. We are rushing to complete both our expansion project next door and our in-house upgrades as well.  Should you ever experience an issue or problem while here, please do not hesitate to contact our highly trained and compassionate staff. If there is a way to "Make It Right", we'll find it. We look forward to your return and the opportunity to show off our brand new look a feel.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: No options for free or self parking at this hotel price seems a bit unaccommodating. The construction noise was pretty loud and started before 7am, they disclose that it should start at 8am - kinda eliminates luxury and sleep I would deem requirements at this price point.
Manager Response: Dear Jeremie W.,  Thank you for your review. Unfortunately parking at beach hotel, no matter where in the world, is always a challenge. We do our best to remain less expensive then our surrounding neighbors while maintaining safe and secure 24 hour access to your vehicle while it is in our care.  Your comments about worksite noise has us very concerned and we are addressing it directly with general contractors and site bosses. There is to be no noise or movement of any kind from 8am to 5pm Monday thru Friday (with absolutely NO WORK on the weekends whatsoever). Our sincere apologies. We are all over this immediately.  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Great Home Base for an Orange County Trip
Summary: My wife, 15 month old son, and myself stayed here during early March. The only complaint I have is there's no self parking and as you would assume, they gouge you with the valet costs, but you have no choice. Everything else about this hotel is great. All employees were very friendly and accommodating, and we were upgraded to an "ocean view" room. I put it in quotes because it doesn't directly face the ocean, it faces the pool, but you can clearly see the beach and the ocean from the balcony, so it was still beautiful. Think there are a few rooms that directly face the water, but most face the pool/courtyard, or to the south. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant every morning and it was really good and convenient. The room was very clean, and they gave us a pack n play for

We stay at the Huntington Beach Waterfront Hilton Resort at least three times per year.  Every stay is as memorable as the previous one...the service, friendliness of staff, food, rooms are AMAZING!  We love this property and would not stay anywhere else in Orange County!

My family stayed here on our first vacation to California. It was nice to be so close to the ocean. The pool was great too. My kids loved it. They charged extra for parking and made you use valet which made it difficult if you forget something in your car. They charged extra for a roll away too. And there was no breakfast included. Seemed a little expensive with so little amenities included. But it was a clean and comfortable place to sleep with great ocean views.

Summary Heading: To be perfect should offer free breakfast!
Summary: A very nice hotel. We really enjoyed our weekend stay. The bed was very comfortable. Even that our windows were facing the pool we didn't hear anything. Super quiet. We had great nights of sleep. The lobby decor is a bit dated. Location is perfect. walking distance from pier and restaurants. All our rooms had a cute balcony. My only complaint is they don't offer free breakfast and the room service took almost an hour to bring me just a cup of milk.

We were invited to the Taste Event by some friends we meet on a cruise. The event was unreal. Would highly recommend. We stayed at the Hilton. We knew some construction was going on next door but was never an issue. Because of the construction the wedding venue was a little strange but also not a big deal. The valet guys and gals were definitely hustling. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Check in is at 4 but will check your bags. We were in and out a lot. They have a Starbucks in lobby area and Shades restaurant had great food. Our grandkids came in Monday am for breakfast and they accommodated all our needs with smiles. We had a ocean front room and the view was to die for. Our room was always clean and restocked. This is an older resort but the location is great, they

Great Location.  The hotel is well kept.  I didn't have a chance to use the pool, but it looked nice.  The only negative was the view of the construction site outside my window.  I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Our family of 4 stayed 3 nights.   Outstanding staff and great space   Pool and beach access and proximity to Main Street all exceptional.  One day we were packing car to explore other nearby beaches and Ramil the bellman came by to ask where we were going and not only gave us great tips but also loaded our car with towels, waters, chairs, sand toys for kids and a boogie board.  We went to crystal cove and our day was that much better due to his attentiveness and care.  Thanks Ramil and thanks Waterfront for a great stay.   Regards, Patrick and Leah Gray

Summary Heading: Great location, beautiful decor, excellent restaurants
Summary: A beautiful setting, decor fabulous, excellent restraint, great pool with poolside service. Not a far walk to downtown, Huntington Beach has really grown in the last few years, a fun Beach town for sure. Biggest con would be the very limited parking, especially during surf week, hope the address that, though where any more people would go I have no idea:)!

This hotel is one of our favorite hotels in So Cal, looks out at the Pacific Ocean and is only blocks away from Main Street Huntington Beach with plenty of restaurants and shopping. Also great Sunday brunch inside and outside overlooking the ocean.

Our Fave in HB!  Stayed here numerous times - quality, service, facilities perfect for our needs!  Got a good rate on the room on the top floor away from construction that included breakfast for two and valet parking.  Excellent!

We loved out stay at the waterfront beach resort. The view was incredible, the food very good and a wonderful place to stay especially if you have a pet. I will come back again to rest in this beautiful place without hesitation.

Summary Heading: Awesome Waterfront Beach Resort Felt Like Home - Top rating from HHonors Gold/Diamond member
Summary: From the moment we pulled up to the arrival entry, it was an absolutely PERFECT family gathering. Despite being a busy time, everyone (I mean everyone) was pleasant, helpful and genuinely happy to have our group as guests. The property, restaurant, outdoor firepit sitting area and rooms could not have been better.  This felt like a Hawaiian vacation (coming from a cold region, it was just the place to be!).  As a pet/dog friendly resort, which is hard to find, our pup was welcomed and treated as a member of the family.  I cannot wait to return, and have booked a weekend for my son's upcoming surprise birthday gathering.  Look no further in sunny SoCal - the Waterfront Beach Resort is the place to go. Best location in Huntington Beach - just a few steps from the sand. Sunsets are

Stayed here for a couple of days with a friend that was traveling for business. The room was a tad bit noisy, but not unbearable. As for the other amenities, you cannot go wrong. The view is great, looks right down to the beach. The pool is great and the service even better. Received great customer service from the valet, to the front desk, restaurant and bar area. Perfect walking distance to shop downtown area and to walk to the beach right across the street.  Would highly recommend this hotel.

You wont need to look for the right place to watch the sunset, you are bathed in it at just about any place you choose, excellent service and quick and efficient staff .  The furnishings are updated , the rooms are sparkling clean .

They did a good job putting this building together. When we were in our room, we couldn't hear a peep from any of our adjacent rooms. Everything was in top condition with no signs of wear and tear. Our balcony view provided views of both the ocean and the pool. And equally important, the beds were very comfortable.   It's pretty easy to get to John Wayne Airport and our arrivals and departures were off-peak so there was no waiting in traffic. "Downtown," if you can call it that, Huntington Beach is a short walk, and there are several restaurants there that are worth checking out. We ate at Sugar Shack (see my review if you want) twice and were extremely pleased.   Really, the only complaint I heard about this luxury hotel was not the cost of parking, but the lack of a Starbucks.

If you love the ocean this is definetly where you want to stay.  Every part of the hotel had some part of an ocean view and even better cross the street and you were in it. Pool area was nice, plenty of seating. Walk outside the hotel and you are in the middle of great restaurants, shopping, beach, and if you travel wih your pet their is a dog beach about 1/2 mile. Staff was friendly. They have a coffee shop located next to the pool and whoever makes (onsite from scratch) the amazing cranberry muffins should be kissed. Seriously, the best muffin you will ever have so definetly try it! Guestroom was spacious, nice size bathroom, balcony, and beds were comfortable. Good deal for price.

Summary Heading: Just like coming back home, except way better!
Summary: So it's been another year, time for another review of my favorite place to stay - the Hilton Waterfront in Huntington Beach.  This time - 10 nights. I was fortunate enough to stay in one of the Junior Suites, which I think is a great value. You have a lot of extra room, you get a sofa bed if needed, and you have pretty much a 180 degree ocean view. You can watch the sun rise and then watch the sun set. And figure out what to do in-between, which if you  are lazy like me may be just doing nothing.  The junior suites have been renovated, and the result is very nice. The curtains are much better than the old shades, and as you can see from the photos the rooms look pretty elegant. Only drawback is they lost the second TV in the renovation, but the result is cleaner and hey you

Had a wonderful 2 days here for our Anniversary.  Everyone was so nice and the view from our 9th floor corner balcony suite overlooking the Pacific was fabulous! Would recommend staying there, especially for a special occasion.

Stayed in the hotel for 1 week in the early new year on a business trip  Great views of the beach from the room, including a nice balcony  Good restaurant with a great breakfast choice. Staff are helpful and attentive  Well stocked bar with a good choice.  The hotel is regularly used for US TV productions so  watching them shoot can be a fun way to pass the time.

Room was not what we were told it would be as far as an ocean view.  Talked to others who were duped as well and staff could have cared less.  Not The HILTON way what so ever.  The fact that what we booked and what we received and what we were told were two separate things.
Manager Response: Dear Michael J.,  Thank you for your comments. We have reviewed your reservation history and are completely baffled by your disappointment. You specifically requested connecting rooms with an ocean view, which is what we delivered. I can assure you, we "dupe" no one and our goal is complete guest satisfaction. We are so sorry to have let you down in some way, but honestly, we're having a hard time making heads or tails of this one. For reference and clarification, there are two main room types that guests sometimes confuse, which may have happened here:   There is "ocean view" and "ocean front". Ocean front, as the name implies, faces directly out to the ocean and is limited in inventory. Ocean "front" rooms only mainly connect to suites and therefore would not have been what you requested (a king room connecting to a double room). In addition, these rooms are considered "premium" and would have also been at a significantly higher rate.  For the remainder of our rooms, with few exceptions, they are categorized as "ocean view", as they all come with balconies angled at 45 degrees looking out to the ocean. Unless you were on a garden level (and your completed reservation and stay indicates otherwise), you would have had an unobstructed view of the Pacific, as promised.  We care deeply about you and your perception of us and our outstanding staff. Again, we are quite perplexed by your comment and would like to speak to you further about your stay with us. Please feel free to call our Director of Front Office so we may discuss this in person and "Make It Right", which is always the Hilton and Waterfront way.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel.

Summary: Spent a few days here and was very pleased.  Perfectly located across street from Beach and 10 minute walk to downtown shops and restaurants.  Resort-like facility with heated pool and hot tub.  Terrific dining and extremely friendly and accommodating staff.  Concierge spent considerable time with us planning events in LA.  Heavy construction going on next door on South side. Highly recommended and would definitely stay again!

This is an older hotel, the corridors are smallish, ceiling low, balcony tight.  Mechanical issues with the room, toilet runs on and on, bathroom outlet doesn't hold plugs.  All things you'd expect with an older updated property.  The Pacific Coast Hwy running in front of the hotel does make for a noisy open window experience.  All that said, the property has a great location near HB main street, pier, and almost on the beach.  New construction should be more modern and probably more pricey.  Restaurant staff were just superb, attentive and the food was reasonable and well done (only had breakfast off the menu.)  The pool area overlooks the beach and you can't see or hear the PCH in that area.  The outdoor seating areas are pleasant and were heated if you desired.  If you allow
Manager Response: Dear Kuzmagirl,  thank you for your review...and yes, we are VERY excited to have all of our resort expanded, updated and refreshed. It is an exciting time to be part of the fun here at The Waterfront.  We'll see you again very soon!  Cheers,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Large stain of mildew on pillow case (my face was in it the entire night!), loud humming noise from mini refrigerator that kept us up at night, towels not available at pool (we waited 20 min. for fresh towels), salmon ordered at Sands Restaurant raw in the middle, elevator stuck between floors while my 17 yr old was using it, toilet that was fixed flooded bathroom floor! Black line across flat screen tv while watch tv & phone not working (not an issue but just an example of condition the hotel is in).
Manager Response: Dear 4444Deanna,  Thank you for your message here and please accept our apologies. I'm not sure how things got so out of hand here with your stay, but it is quite obvious that we disappointed you at every turn. This saddens me greatly as this is so "out of the norm" for who and what we are...ever. We receive many, many reviews here on TripAdvisor that are extremely positive, so to see that you were so extremely dissatisfied is quite concerning.  I will immediately relay this review to all of our department heads and follow up with each of them and the actions taken. Again, I offer our whole-hearted apologies and hope that you will, in the future, give us a chance to "Make It Right".  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: A great weekend getaway from business
Summary: Everyone serves you with a genuine smile and interest in making sure your needs are met.  The beds are extremely comfortable.  The rooms are spacious and quiet.  The view of the beach was spectacular.  The only complaint is that on the weekends the traffic noise reaches the rooms.  But that ended around 10:00pm.  So plan your evening nightcap on the private balcony for after that time.  The beach and night life is a short walk from the hotel.  They also have a shuttle.

Lovely hotel in a great location, with very helpful staff.  I have to thank Joseph (Director of Customer Service) to start with for being extremely helpful before we'd even arrived in the US, with our LA Kings ticket booking & the TCL Theatre tickets & with all our questions...we really feel he went above & beyond to help us.   The guys on the valet were fantastic, every day, and really helpful with advice & any questions we had.  I thought the hotel was clean & tidy & very well kept, they were touching up paint a couple of days before we left...so all the walls were looking lovely & clean.  My children thoroughly enjoyed the very warm pool & we all loved it being just a crosswalk over from the beach.  You can easily walk to Main & the pier from the hotel & Pacific City is about

We stayed here for 8 nights at the end of March and it was a wonderful experience!  The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is beautiful inside and out and the rooms are spacious and well decorated.  We had an ocean view room and it was beautiful.  The valet service was exceptional!  I had never had valet service like that before.  The location is also perfect!  Of course it is right across PCH from the ocean, but it is also within walking distance of Pacific City mall and Main St.  Main St. has many different shops, restaurants, and bars.  I was very sad to leave and am still sad days later after being home.  We will be staying here each time we visit our family in Huntington Beach.    This hotel is WELL WORTH the money!

Summary Heading: Well located property directly across busy main street from beach
Summary: A typical resort hotel that also attracts conference and wedding business as well. Currently in the process of undertaking major expansion and upgrade plans which look great on the plans so should up the ante quite a bit in the Huntington Beach area. Nicly appointed ad spacious bedrooms although wifi quite flaky in-room so you might have to go own to the lobby area to get a decent signal.

We spent our spring break at The Waterfront and had a great trip. The proximity to the beach and downtown cannot be beat. Every hotel staff member we encountered was over the top friendly from the valet to Rich from engineering.    We were on the top floor (12th) and had a view straight down the beach. We could watch surfers from our own balcony. With the door open during the day, the PCH traffic was kind of loud even at the top but it was pleasant at night.   Facing East allowed us to enjoy full sunshine on our patio which was nice as the sun didn't hit the pool until almost 11am. They are doing construction right next door and it was annoying. Construction hours are M-F and only from 8 to 5. Its not a pretty view but the noise should be limited if you are there on the weekend.

Summary Heading: One of best hotel experiences ever!
Summary: From the moment we arrived the staff couldn't do enough for us on every front. Our room wasn't ready early as we expected so the comp'd our lunch while we waited not to mention upgrading us to a phenomenal suite!  The GM Paulette was amazing and personally introduced herself to us at lunch only minutes after we arrived. Every meal was delicious, the staff always attentive and just made it so enjoyable. They catered to our kids (11 & 14) and we could even let them wander around a bit solo, as it's pretty "self contained".  Special shout out to Kevin @ the front desk who helped us out with our Universal Studios tickets while the concierge was on her break. He not only took care of everything but gave us a TON of information about the rides, what to go to first etc. his info

Although the location is ideal, the service was disappointing for the price. The hotel restaurant, Shades, was mediocre at best with average service and disappointing offerings. The salmon was dry and the side dishes were tasteless. General hotel service was fine, but it didn't exceed anything that I've experienced at a 3-star hotel.
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for your recent post. We always like to hear from our guests (good or bad) and see every review as an opportunity to improve our quality of service. I am very sorry you were disappointed with your stay. We strive to go above and beyond our guests expectations at every turn and go out of our way to delight our guests or "Make It Right". I will share your review with our entire management team and culinary staff and would hope that, in the future, you would be so kind as to give us another chance. We would love the opportunity to  welcome you back.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I highly recommend this resort.  Beautiful hotel, great staff and roomy suite.  Everyone made sure our stay was fabulous.  Loved our room, very clean, perfect for family of four.  Room had sleeper sofa in main living area with wetbar, coffee maker and mini fridge.  Separate dining area, with balcony.  Only two chairs on wraparound  balcony, three total balconies.  Lots of storage in room for clothes.  Two separate bathrooms.  Master bedroom had king size bed with dressing area and vanity separate from bathroom.  Parking expensive, but no other options and it is the beach.  Easy access to beach across the street hotel offers free chairs, towels, wagon with umbrella.  They also rent bikes etc.

Summary Heading: A friendly place by the beach
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights, as my wife attended her conference, our soon to be 2 year old son and myself hit the beach and pool. Hotel was nice and clean, cross the street from the beach, 12 min walk to main street and the pier check in and out were smooth, staff were very courteous and nice all throughout the stay, and I mean everyone room was clean and bed comfy, view of the beach was partial, plus there was the reconstruction, which to be honest was mentioned all over their website, and the stay reminder emails they sent and although it was pretty noisy, once you shut the balcony glass door, you could barely hear a thing Usually I don't order room service, but traveling with a toddler is something else, so ordered breakfast twice and had a couple of plates for dinner once, it

Summary Heading: A Repeat Stay - A Few Years Apart
Summary: Stayed here a few years ago, and had a great stay. This time was a quick trip and we were gone most of the day so I can't comment on the restaurant or other amenities. Although they are adding on to the property, we did not notice any excess noise from the construction. Our room had an awesome view (7th floor ocean front), love that this property is right across the street from the beach. The room was clean, beds comfortable, and the bathroom spacious. We did have to ask for regular coffee as the maid had only left decaf, and for extra towels, but no biggie. The entire staff (i.e. front desk, bellmen and valets) was friendly and polite. There is a small deli that is part of the hotel, it's not a Starbucks although they do serve their products. The staff made a great caramel

Summary Heading: Loved our stay the second time
Summary: Close to the beach, shops and restaurants.  Enjoyed all aspects of the hotels restaurant, surf hero market, bar, pool and hot tub.  Staff at check in was great.  Bell staff was great.  Bartender was great.  My only regret was i wish i got their names!  Will stay here again.  Very clean.  Loved the view.

Everything about this hotel was excellent from the cleanliness and care of the facility  to the staff.  We enjoyed the fact that it is pet friendly and your pet is treated like a person.  It was located just close enough to the main street, but also just far enough away

Summary Heading: Good enough for business I wouldn't put high expectation for a luxury vacation
Summary: Nothing major to complain about, it's convenient, staff are friendly, clean enough, amazing location a walking distance from the beach and from Main Street, there is a Starbucks nearby and a good number of restaurants walking distance. At the time of our visit, there is some construction work going on, which is slightly annoying, even though you can tell they are trying their best to not disturb. They don't work very early, nor at night or weekends. Which is considerate. We ordered for in room dining few times, food varied between average and good, nothing wow. The in room dining is not available after midnight, which I thought inconvenient. There is a nice heated swimming pool if you want to relax and didn't feel like crossing all the way toward the beach. Major point, if you
Manager Response: Hello Rawan M.,   Thank you for your kind review. We apologize for the construction now underway, but I can assure you...upon your return you won't recognize the place! With an all new suites-centric tower, pools with waterslides and outdoor bars, new restaurants...about the only thing you'll recognize is the ocean out your window. That'll be right where you left it. Come back and see us and next time, we'll knock your socks off!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed for two nights and this was a wonderful hotel, great location, great facilities.  The rooms were quiet and had great views of the sea.  The food was nice and the rooms had really good facilities.  Would stay there again.  Great staff, service.

Summary Heading: Great location, enthusiastic concierge, helpful valets
Summary: First of all, this place is not cheap.  In addition to the room charge, valet parking is $34/night, plus Cali hotel taxes are at least 10%.  BUT if you're ok with spending the money, this is a great place to stay.  It is literally across the road from the beach, a short walk (or free shuttle ride) to the shops downtown, and biking distance to other beaches.  Tammy, the friendly concierge, arranged surf lessons for us and bikes to get there.  And even though the front entrance area gets busy late afternoon, there are usually 4 or more valets running around, offering quick retrieval and a friendly greeting.  I would definitely stay here again. TIP: Join Hilton HHonors to get free wi-fi

This Hotel was the best hotel that we have ever stayed at. The rooms were clean comfortable, beautiful and well serviced. We slept as well as we sleep in our own bed. The room temperature was easily controlled. Tammy, the concierge was so friendly and efficient and made us feel like family.The entire staff was extremely friendly and offered help throughout our stay. We were there for 4 nights and not one of us had a negative experience. The staff worked very well together and have They are very well trained for service.

The staff at the hotel could not have been more helpful in making certain that my client's meeting went off without a hitch.  The banquet managers were on top of everything and I had no worries during our entire stay.  The hotel is a beach property and could use a few upgrades but otherwise my attendees raved about the food and the beachfront location. I would definitely return again.

We went here for 2 nights as a getaway from our kids. Everything about this hotel is top notch! From the service upon arrival to the friendliness of the staff, there is no better place to stay. We stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night. We did not hear any noise from the construction at all. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast both days and I can tell you that the servings were huge. I ordered the lox and bagel on day and there was more lox than could fit on the bagel!! You are walking distance from Main Street, though they also have a shuttle that runs there complimentary as well. The hotel has thought of everything and they really do bend over backwards to make sure your stay in enjoyable. I am looking forward to coming back.

Summary Heading: Third year at this resort for a conference
Summary: My company has had our Sales conference for the past 3 years at this resort. It has been an excellent experience each time. The rooms are spacious, the food is great, staff is friendly and the resort is beautiful. It is right across Pacific coast highway from the beach and a 5 minute walk to shops and restaurants. The only small negative this time was the construction next door but they did not start too early in the morning and the rooms are quite sound proof.

This is the only hotel in the area that has a walkway over PCH to the beach. This made it so much easier to take the family to the beach. The hotel grounds are absolutely beautiful. They also offer bike rentals, boogie boards, skim boards, etc for a fee. Our room was spacious, with beautiful sunset views. There are multiple pools and spas. We will be staying here again.

We decided to stay one night but wished we had stayed longer!  EVERY staff member we met was so very friendly and helpful.  The concierge staff of Tammy and Vanessa were both amazing and went above and beyond even on short notice. Be sure to do the s'mores on the beach, best part of our trip. The 12 year old loved building the fire!  Paid extra for ocean front room, but really not necessary but the room was large. Can't wait to come back!  We ate breakfast because it was free as diamond member but wouldn't pay for it. Parking is valet only.

I stayed for two nights at the Huntington Hilton.  I paid extra for the beach view which I would not recommend. The road makes it very loud and the smoke from the bonfires comes into the room each night. We really were not able to enjoy the balcony or the sound of the water. The room was large and comfortable. Little things though like the coffee pot not near a plug was odd.

We usually do long weekends to Coronado but this time we wanted something closer so after researching Huntington Beach like crazy, we finally settled on booking the Waterfront Beach Resort (we booked a corner king ocean front suite). It did not disappoint. The valet guys were very welcoming, the front desk agent was super nice and professional, the girls at the gift shop were friendly and helpful. Every one we encountered here was so nice that even my young sons made mention of how nice everyone was. The hotel was clean and beautiful and definitely had a large presence. The suite had so many doors, I kept forgetting which one to go through for the bedroom or the bathroom or the living room or the long entry way - good problem to have in a hotel room - means you have a lot of

I have stayed in many Hiltons across the USA and this one is my favourite. From the smiling guys who swing open the doors to the good rooms with balcony, and the restaurant with great food this hotel has everything.                                                             Huntington Beach has got rid of all the old oil industry, only a couple of rigs far out to sea, and the beach is cleaned every day. Nearly everything is new and clean, even the old concrete pier looks clean and tidy.                                                                               Look out for the beautiful restored  1948 Chevrolet police car parked outside the hotel !

Summary Heading: Lovely - great staff. Great view in right room
Summary: Pretty hotel. Easy access in Huntington Beach. Rooms spacious. Staff at Shades restaurant was fabulous and accommodating. If you can get a corner suite or room on the end you get direct view of ocean. Some the the side rooms are a little more indirect view. Pool and patio very nice. Fire pit very inviting

Summary Heading: Really Nice Resort - But Add $34 to the Room Rate
Summary: Stayed here 4 nights for business.  Good Wi-Fi, and the room was very quiet.  Room safe big enough for a large laptop.
