I was given a room with a partial ocean view, and it was nice to have the door to the balcony open during all my morning and evening telecons.  They have a small convenience store (Surf Hero) in the resort that opens at 6:00.  I went there every day for my morning coffee, and the coffee was always fresh, and the servers working the counter were friendly and helpful.  Got room service one night, and is was very good.  ym is a bit small (2 cross-trainers, 3 treadmills, and 1 bike).  My only gripe was the parking.  You can only use valet, and it costs $34/day.  You can park across the street for $15/day, but you can't access your car at night (city closes the lot

Excellent hotel right on the beach and near the restaurants in Huntington Beach so that you can walk.  I got an upgraded room on the 12th floor with a view of the beach.  The room was extremely clean and the bed was comfortable.   The checkin was fast and easy and the valet (Luis) was extremely nice and recognized me two days later.  The only downside is there is construction going on next door in the lot beside the hotel.  Around 9am they started the construction and you could hear it from the room but I was already awake so it didn't impact me.

We stayed at this property last summer and were very impressed from the moment we arrived at the door.  Friendly valet staff and also front desk employees.  We stayed in an ocean view which was beautiful since we could sit on the balcony.  I loved that we were right across from the beach and walked down to the pier and parked ourselves for the two days we were there.  We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked very nice.  We did forget sunscreen and were able to purchase on site without having to drive to a Walgreen's.  Overall a very nice clean property with friendly staff and great for couples and families.

I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is situated right across the road from the beach. Nice lobby, good restaurant (Shades) serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, by the pool. There is a small workout room. My ocean front room was well appointed and good sized. Interior could do with an update.  Very comfortable stay next to new Pacific City mall in Huntington Beach.

This ocean resort is excellent for families, couples and business trips.  Their amenities are excellent.  You cannot beat the location.  The beach is directly across the street.  We had a bonfire - all the supplies were available at the resort.  GREAT TIME!

Overall experience was nice. Pretty grounds. Staff was pleasant.  Hotel was clean. Breakfast buffet was good.  Location was right across the street from the beach.  Hotel could use a little bit of updating, but not bad.

Very nice hotel and the staff was very friendly. The Ocean is right across the street. The pool is very nice and it has a lot of  lounge chairs around it. The food was excellent for breakfast & lunch. I would come back and stay at this hotel again.

location could not be better and the views are outstanding..the property is first rate..well maintained and tropical..relaxing and comfortable.  Food was delicious and many options for anyone.  There is some construction in the area if it matters

Summary Heading: Pretty nice place, my second time staying here
Summary: Just across the street from the beach.  Pretty nice location and the property is in good shape.  No self-parking, which is a shame, but everything else was good.  They helped us during check-in to place a food order since the room service was about the close.  Much appreciated.   I would stay here again without hesitation.  Walking distance to bars/restaurants

I expected more, from Hilton, from this location, for the price. Maybe that was the problem: coming into this trip I set my expectations too high? Anyway, I arrived late but not excessively late, at midnight, after a 19-hour journey door-to-door. On check-in there was a problem with my booking (made by a third party) but rather than offer a solution, the receptionist stared blankly at me. I was tempted to just lie down on one of the couches in the lobby, tired as I was. After a few minutes, I came up with what apparently was an acceptable suggestion, and was handed the key to my room. I was hungry too, but was informed that no food was available, either in the restaurant or room service. Once I got to my room, I was surprised and disappointed - like me it was tired, the decor
Manager Response: Dear Mike Temple,  Our sincere apologies for any confusion or delay with the check-in you encountered upon your arrival here at The Waterfront. Whether tired, hungry or both...we are in the hospitality business first and foremost and concern for our guests is our starting point. Regardless of the hour you arrive or where/how your reservation was booked, our team should have been "on point" and offered the caring compassionate service we are most known for giving. We will take this up immediately with our front office staff and initiate corrective measures at once. Thank you for bringing this to our attention and alerting us so that we may better train our evening associates.  Additionally, the space you see next the hotel (currently under development) is our resort expansion project. We are now underway with the building of an all-suites tower, new pools, upgraded amenities, simultaneous refreshment of existing spaces and yes, free wi-fi throughout (simply join or show your no-cost-to you Hilton Honors membership). Stay tuned and watch our websites as this is truly going to be something to behold. We're 25 years young, and we're just getting started!  We hope you give us the opportunity to serve you in the future and "Make It Right".  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We came for a couple's trip to visit family.  We experienced excellent service the entire time of our stay. We were given an Oceanfront Suite complimentary upgrade probably because of our Hilton Honors membership. We had a play,park, and eat(free breakfast) package that was a great value.  Wonderful location near the ocean that was also close to food and shopping. We were able to bike and hike the beach path.  We also enjoyed the Bar/Restaurant.  We highly recommend this hotel.

One night stay before flight home from LAX..  Great location, walking distance of shops, restaurants and the pier.  Hotel is across the road from the beach,  I requested an ocean view room and we were given just that, up on the top (12th) floor.  Views from the balcony were great.  Room was clean, and good sized.  Check in staff were friendly and helpful.  Breakfast (extra) was adequate.  Loved the complimentary champagne (wedding anniversary celebration), - thank you to Joseph Boyer for arranging this and the wonderful room.

My husband and I were celebrating our 30th Anniversary and was quit pleased with our stay.  Upon arrival there was a small room mix-up, but handled quickly and professionally by two outstanding hotel employees: Daniel Davila and Kevin Monroe.  We stayed in two different rooms the two nights we were there; one of the 2nd floor which had an ocean view and was nice, but the Catalina Suite on the 11th floor with the ocean view was spectacular.  The room decor was stylish and sophisticated and the large jacuzzi tub and shower with a bench area surrounded by mabel was beautiful.  The bed was comfy and cozy with the exception of the pillows, which were a little to soft for our taste.   We would definitely recommend this hotel (The Catalina room specifically) to family and friends

Summary Heading: Go Next Door to the Hyatt Instead!
Summary: My husband was recuperating from surgery and I was celebrating my birthday, so we booked a weekend getaway at the Waterfront Beach Resort to recharge our batteries and get a little pampering.  My husband is a Hilton Honors member, which is supposed to offer several upgrades and amenities with every reservation. We decided to upgrade our room to an "ocean view room". I'm attaching a photo taken from our room, so readers can appreciate that we didn't receive an ocean view at all. We were overlooking a construction area on the opposite side of the hotel from the ocean. When I complained to the front desk staff, Michael told me that any room above the 6th floor is considered ocean view, regardless of whether it actually has an ocean view or not. WHAT?!?! How does that logic work. I
Manager Response: Dear owenbuchholtz,  Our apologies for any confusion regarding your room type and other various charges you encountered during your stay. We believe you may have confused an ocean front room with an ocean view room (as all of our rooms feature balconies facing the ocean at a 45 degree angle and with rare exceptions have a clear view of the ocean). Ocean front rooms are just like they sound, facing directly toward the Pacific and are limited in inventory much like our suites.  We would also like to clear up a few questions you seem to have regarding parking, late check-outs and roll-aways (and information about our very good friends at the Hyatt next door). There is no self parking, either here or next door at The Hyatt. Both hotels are valet only for both convenience and liability issues. It is simply the nature of the beast in a resort area and clearly stated on all of our websites, including pricing (the Hyatt is $35, by the way). Check-out time is noon at both hotels and, when available, we are happy to accomodate a later check-out at no charge (if possible depending upon occupancy levels). Otherwise we offer a later check-out to 3pm for $50 if you so desire. Hilton Diamond members are offered complimentary late check out (again, if possible) upon request as well. There is a onetime fee for a rollaway bed, but it looks as tho that was comp'd for you as well.   Our hotel offers many a'la carte options for our guests (and presently has no resort fee as result) so never hesitate to ask us prior to arrival if you have any questions. We, like you, try to avoid surprises at every turn. Your satisfaction in your stay is very important to us.  Our apologies for any misunderstandings regarding hotel charges and polices. We hope this clears things up a bit.  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed for three nights for a work conference.  Seems to be a great location within walking distance to pier, restaurants, and shops.  The hotel was very nice - clean rooms, friendly, efficient staff. Staff did a great job with our conference.  I would definitely recommend and will stay here again if back in the area!

The security staff harassed us and embarrassed us in front of other hotel guess and the hotel did nothing to rectify the situation. The staff when we arrived were hospitable but after our experience with the security staff at the pool our vacation was ruined.
Manager Response: Dear kimberlyg62,  Our sincere apologies that you were disappointed during your stay. A review of our records indicate your bill had been reversed and refunded. We hope that this was communicated to you and is a satifactory solution. Our goal is to see every customer treated with respect and compassion and hope we have achieved just that.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Normally we go skiing over President's day weekend...our daughter ended up with a soccer injury that prevented her from skiing so we decided to head to the beach! The location of the hotel was perfect..just walk across the PCH and there's Surf City/ Huntington Beach! Our room had a beautiful view of the ocean and we watched several beautiful sunsets from the balcony framed by the palm trees around the pool. The pool was beautiful in a great tropical oasis type setting and the hot tub was great after braving the icy Pacific Ocean. Our room itself was very clean and comfortable...pillows and bedding were of very high quality. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Amazing customer service from everyone: concierge, desk attendants, shuttle drivers, valets, maids

What's not to love about this place...from the moment I pulled up to the property, I was in love.  The location is fantastic...sits right on the PCH and you just have to make it through a crosswalk to end up on the sand.  The pool is beautiful, and the Shades restaurant has great food and plenty of options for outdoor dining.  All of the employees I dealt with were extremely friendly and helpful, and my room was modern and large.  Zero complaints!!

From the minute we walked in the door we were made to feel special by the staff and waiters. The decor is beautiful. The room was nice and had a balcony to the ocean. About a 10 minute walk will get you to stores. Restaurants and the Pier. A very nice visit. We will return!

We stayed in the hotel for Christmas Holidays. I was amazed by service we received. Everybody from valet to restaurant were extremely nice and helpful. Special thanks to Tammy concierge and Amanda restaurant. Thanks again for making our stay delightful. Maria Mississauga, Ontario Canada

Summary Heading: 5 night stay leading up to Surf City Marathon
Summary: Great hotel and service! Chosen due to location and host hotel for the race. DO NOT eat at Shade restaurant, our 2 experiences there were extremely disappointing. Our request for something as simple as hard boiled eggs were met with the most disgusting, over-boiled eggs I have ever had (Priced at $3US/egg)! Worth walking away from the hotel to eat at the local restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer O.,  We are so sorry your experience with the "Grab & Go" hard-boiled eggs disappointed you. Thank you for both bringing this to our attention and taking our call to discuss this in person. We hope our solution "Made It Right" for you...and we'll be having a little chat with the night crew about boiling our eggs!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but not enough value for the price
Summary: Beautiful hotel but very expensive.  For about $400 a night I would have expected a bit more.   Breakfast was not included.  Valet service was an additional $34 a night and the Restaurant was very expensive.   It is nice being on the ocean and the pool is nice so I loved the atmosphere.   But the price was a bit hard to swallow.

We had a fabulous stay. Our daughter surprised us and booked 2 rooms so we could join her for the SurfCity Marathon.  There was a booking issue that was created due to a mixup on her part but they were wonderful in getting it worked out without extra fees or room cancellations charges etc.   The security on site is great.  They make sure no one is using the facility who is not authorized.   Parking is by valet only. This is to protect vehicles, apparently in the past they had problems with damages so now it's valet only.   The rooms are nicely decorated, fairly spacious, beds and bedding were comfortable enough.  Everything appeared clean (especially considering there were 20k in the area for the marathon many staying at this hotel )  It has a very nice layout.  It's directly

This hotel provides an absolute enjoyable relaxing stay whether it be for one day or days on end. Right on PCH and a quick walk across the street has you laying on the beach.  Service is impeccable.  Rooms are a little pricey, but the ocean front rooms are a delight and roomy!  Staff members are professional, courteous and helpful.  Never had a bad experience here.

Great location, beautiful room (with view!), easy walk across the street to the glorious beach. We received complimentary breakfast vouchers and were able to borrow sand toys from the bell desk to play on the beach. Very nice pool and hot tub. Also an excellent gym. :)

Came back for a return visit here at The Waterfront.  Service level remains high with friendly, professional service.  The staff was knowledgeable and offered helpful suggestions on nearby sights and restaurants. Delicious breakfast, and a convenient location made for another enjoyable stay.

Location is perfect. Views from room and balcony don't cost you extra, but are lovely. Walking distance shops and restaurants. Better to dine off site. Rooms spacious. Relaxing break. Despite central location rooms very quiet.

Overall a very good hotel at very good location. It would be good to make it clear a pool side with ocean view or pool side without ocean view so a guest to be cleaer what he will be getting.  It would be also better to give guest a choice of self-parking or valad parking because sometime a guest might feel more confortable for sel-parking.

Summary Heading: Great meeting rooms for business events
Summary: Stayed two nights for a business event here.  I didn't have much of a chance to enjoy the hotel, but appreciated the location (including a free shuttle to the nearby restaurant thoroughfare on the beach).  I was especially impressed with the meeting room used for my event: in addition to meeting tables, there was a nice bar area, and it generally felt a lot more cozy and friendly than your typical sterile hotel meeting room environment.

Was here on a business trip.  excellent service, especially from Elisa, the housekeeper for my room.  Front desk was great and everyone was hard working.  Just a minor bit negative is that the fridges are loud and the internet is slow.  In addition, the walls are very thin.  If you dont want to hear any noise from the other rooms, and you know what i mean, dont stay here

Summary Heading: Great four days at Waterfront Resort!
Summary: I was here on a four day business trip, for a conference. The Hilton has a great location, right at the beach, and is very clean. Every time I walked through the hotel, someone was cleaning or dusting! They seem proud of their hotel. Food was good at all our sessions. Saved the best for last: the staff was AMAZING! Friendly, helpful - I really felt looked after.

Clean, friendly staff, right near the main strip/pier. Only picked it because it was near where I had some business to handle, but would be a good spot for vacations or whatever. HB has really cleaned up over the years.

The hotel is right across the street from the ocean.  The ocean has side walks to walk along and it is a quick, lovely walk to downtown Huntington Beach for shopping and restaurants.  The gym is adequately furnished and the pool and hot tub are outside beneath beautiful palm trees.   The rooms have a small refrigerator and balconyes  to sit out.  There is a small café to purchase snacks, Starbucks and breakfast.   There is valet parking -- efficient but additional cost.  They have plenty of towel racks in the bathroom and do honor the save the environment by choosing to reuse towels.  With the California draught, I appreciated this option.  There are robes available in the room for use at the hot tub and pool.

Great location and Great Staff make this an excellent choice for beach lovers. It is all of a 3 minute walk to the beach, if you walk slow and/or get stuck waiting on the traffic light to change. City Center is a 5-7 minute walk or they have a courtesy shuttle we never used but were told about.

This is a great hotel with amazing views.Our rate included parking, and breakfast.  Walking distance to the pier and all restaurants. You can rent bikes right at the hotel, which we did, and ride for miles either north or south on the beachfront path across from the hotel.  The staff is really what makes this property special. They are always so nice and helpful.

The hotel is beautiful and the valet staff is great.  Very friendly and helpful.  The pool was under construction but it was too cold to go in anyway so that didn't bother us.  We had a great time.  Love the outdoor seating with heaters.

I picked this hotel because I am a Hilton Honors member AND the location of the hotel.  Every employee I had an encounter with has been both professional and very helpful. The room is clean and very comfortable. However, the sofa bed in the suite is extremely uncomfortable. I will use this hotel again in  the future!

You can’t beat the location and amenities of this hotel. I have come to expect certain level of service from Hilton but this time they just drop the ball. Staff was eager and quick to resolve our issues but those issues were completely avoidable. No towels in our room, room service delivered without beverages and incorrect billing.
Manager Response: Dear Nicolas L,  Thank you for your review. We quite agree the issues you experienced were inexcusable and we apologize. We have noted your information in your global account and our Director of Operations will be in contact to personally address these issues. Our sincerest apologies and we hope we can "Make It Right" by you.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We loved this place. A typical Hilton hotel, you would say. For sure Hilton quality, cleanliness and professionalism. Housekeepers were supernice. Ordinary but nice room with a spectacular view on the waves. Maybe the pool is a bit outdated. But the breakfast in the cosy restaurant watching the palms and the ocean: priceless. Quiet, relaxing atmosphere, comfy armchair, good food all for a fair price (15 USD for the continental). One only drawback: the AC freezing temperature! The only missing thing is a SPA inside the hotel. Valet Parking is bit expensive.
Manager Response: Dear Ramona P,  You'll be very pleased to know that, painful tho it is, our pool is being updated as I type this (and will be completed and refilled in the next 48 hours!). It has been a weeklong (nearly) round the clock process, but we have a new pool!   Come see for yourself soon... we look forward to caring for you upon your return.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Resort

Summary: The hotel was great and the service was above and beyond. I would recommend this hotel for a good experience and good location. They were very accommodating. The food was good in the restaurant and the atmosphere was relaxing.
Manager Response: Dear Karen S,  Thank you! We will share this with our whole team...and we look forward to your speedy return! We'll keep the waves ON for you.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hilton..My room was very comfortable..I had a nice view of the ocean from my balcony.  I enjoyed the amenities and the restaurant.  Shades had a lovely bar and a beautiful patio overlooking the pool and ocean.

Excellent Hotel with beautiful Resort View, Water View, great location, excelent restaurants in the area.  If you love Sea Food Captain jacks is excellent the best King Crab just a Mile up the street from the hotel.  They were shooting a movie at the Hotel, so we were able to watch. Check out Rosewood on This Wednesday.
Manager Response: Thank you Janice A,  We loved your review...and glad you had fun while Hollywood took over our lobby! The show Rosewood is on Fox. The episode we just shot here will air Wednesday, March 30 (check local listings for times). Remember, the hotel will "seem" like it is in Miami, but it was right here...in good ol' Huntington Beach! In this episode we are "The Coconut Beach Hotel"... ahhhh, Hollywood magic! :-)  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Not hilton standard but good location.
Summary: The location is very good, just across the street from the beach, and walking distance (15 min) to Main street, where all the restaurants and nightlife are.   The hotel has a nice pool, but seems to get pretty crowded in summer, as it already was busy in the middle of the winter. It is a big pool, but in an enourmous building, so the proportion of people vs size doesn't seem to be very suitable.  The pool area and the water itself is not very clean, but I presume that is because it was low season.   The hotel is extremely overpriced for the quality offered. Rooms are outdated and not taken care of. Bath curtains were filthy and full of stains, making it a very disgusting experience to have a shower. The smell in the bathroom is terrible, smells like urine all the time. Make sure
Manager Response: Dear innoluap,  Thank you for your review. Our guest satisfaction (in every aspect) is extremely important to us. We want you to feel cared for, listened to and above all else feel like you are at home. I am sorry we did not meet some of your expectations and we will share your comments with all appropriate departments to see where we can do better. Please never hesitate to contact us directly with any concern or issue...especially if we are not meeting your desires. Our job is to make sure you are happy and we will do all we can to "Make It Right"...on the spot!  You will also be interested to know that we have undertaken a major rooms renovation (floor by floor so no one will ever actually see us working) and be enhancing all of spaces in the tower. Expect any problems or issues to be resolved upon your next visit.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I have stayed here many times in the past. The service and location are the best in Huntington Beach. Can't wait to get back there again!  The best part is being a Hilton property - I travel every week for business - I did not feel like I was on a business trip at all Thanks

Wonderful getaway with the friendliest of staff.  Brought our 2 dogs and were very accommodating.  Gorgeous view of the ocean in very clean rooms.  Just a walk across the street to the beach. We would most definitely come stay again.

Summary Heading: Leaves you feeling like absolute royalty
Summary: I've stayed at the Waterfront twice now, once for pleasure over an evening and this last time for New Years. The staff remembered us, were quick to answer any questions and help out at every chance. The rooms are great: I slept like a baby every night! Comfy bed, nice view, clean (HEATED!) pool, hot jacuzzi, awesome food, cold beer, everything is great.

Needed a beach break from the heat of Las Vegas so looked for a beach in CA that was a close drive.  Had never been to Huntington Beach and found this great Hilton.  Since my husband is a Hilton Member, we focused on this hotel and read the reviews.  Hilton is one of our favorite chains, always clean and usually reasonably priced.  This hotel is wonderful!  Directly across the street from the beautiful Huntington Beach, they offer free beach chairs and umbrellas.  No fighting for parking spaces at the beach, just walk across the street and you are there!  They also have a beautiful pool and evening torch lighting and show at sunset!  The offer a snack shop with items you need at the beach, coffee and quick breakfast food.  We ate breakfast at the hotel, very good but very

Neat hotel and good location. Nice pool area, really good food and nice bar and restaurant area.  Very disappointed in the beds - (hard and not comfortable) for a $250/night room.  Also wasnt' impressed with them not letting us have a late checkout when the day before they hadn't cleaned our room until 4pm.  There are hotels in better locations in that area for $100 less per night.
Manager Response: Dear Dan D,  Thank you for your review. We apologize for not being able to honor your request for an early check-in or late departure. We almost always can do one or the other, if not both. Unfortunately this will happen from time to time (at any hotel) when we are completely sold out, as happened during your stay. Ordinarily we would have instantly upgraded you and got you into another room but, short of a storage closet, we had nothing to offer and could only rush the room cleaning to meet our standard check-in time for your room.   Give us another try (and check with our in-house reservations directly to see how busy we may or may not be during our return). We'll make sure you are well cared for!  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The suite was just beautiful We sat on the balcony looking at the water. It sleeps 4 no problem. has a kitchen table , fridge and bathtub in the bathroom. The only thing I didn't like is the bathroom is in the shower and bathroom so you had to wait to go to the restroom.

My husband and I traveled to Huntington Beach for a few days of rest. We always choose this hotel. We love it,the attention is excellent, the hotel staff is friendly too. The rooms are very clean, the decoration very nice. The only thing we did not like much was the restaurant food. Little choice of dishes on the menu and a little expensive.The rest was perfect.

Location, location, location. The Huntington Beach Hilton represents the true California experience of beach living, and is centrally located for access to the pier and numerous shopping and restaurant options.

We stayed as a family of four with our two teenage girls in a two double-beds room on the 12th floor. The hotel is shaped as a rectangular, with the narrow part facing west (the ocean) and the long parts facing south or north. In that arrangement, ALL rooms have ocean view (the east side does not have rooms) and all rooms have balconies. Those that are on the narrow side, facing west, are mostly suites and are "ocean front" rooms, but also right on the HWY which might mean some noise, while the rooms facing north and south are standard rooms, having "ocean view", looking either southwest or northwest. The hotel has 12 floors.  The room was relatively large with enough room for the luggage, moving around and enough space between the beds. So was the bathroom. Beds were very

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, but very thin walls
Summary: I came here for a New Years getaway with my husband. I was born and raised in HB, so i wanted to stay in my old stomping ground to bring in the New Year, minus the kids. We were able to get a sitter and get away. The hotel is beautiful, looks like its been remodeled, love the decor. Only problem is you can hear everything that others are doing. We were in bed by 9pm, we were woken up all night by rooms all around us. The rooms have hardwood floors, so the woman in the room upstairs was practicing here run way walk because it was like tapping all night. Then there was a giggle fest in the room nextdoor, all this after 1am. There was also what sounded like a toilet running all night. Ugh. If your a light sleeper, look else where.  My room rate was $332 out the door with taxes and
Manager Response: Dear dawnsully77,  Thank you for your recent review on Tripadvisor. Our apologies that your accomodations did not meet  your expectations, especially becuase you are a former local and that makes it all the more important we make you feel "at home". Major holidays (especially New Year's Eve and The 4th of July) are always a challenge to anyone wanting peace and quiet. We can, however, always help. If you're willing to be on a lower floor and not facing the pool you will always have the silence you are looking for. Next time, please do not hesitate to tell us at check-in your preferences and we'll do everything we can to acoomodate your requests! We look forward to your next stay.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We love this hotel.  The location is great and the service is top notch.  The room is spacious and clean and the grounds are beautiful.  We found the evening concierge Tammy Thurlow to be exceptional.  She gave us detailed advice and helped us with all our needs.  We felt very much at home here and will definitely return as soon as we can. The other concierge Vanessa was very helpful as well.  We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was delicious and pleasant.  Can't wait to return on a future vacation!

Complimentary water offered everywhere was nice.  Location makes for walkable access to Huntington Beach pier.  Construction in place-new 12ish floor tower being built.  $15/continential, $22 full breakfast, valet parking something like $25.  Can park across the street at I believe $30 day 1 and $15 per day for day 2 and beyond.    Front desk said 'ocean view room'.  Clarify-there are full ocean and partial ocean views. They may say 'ocean view' and give you a partial ocean view.
Manager Response: Dear MerryManUSA,  Thank you for your recent review. We would like to clarify your remarks regarding parking. We are a "valet only" hotel offering 24 hour valet services for $34 a day. We do not, however, have any kind of resort fee to offset any frustration limited beach parking can incur. Also, there is no overnight parking a the beach and all unapproved vehicles (bearing special city passes) must be moved off the lot by no later than 10pm. Exceptions are the few and limited camping slots that require and advanced reservation with the City of Huntington Beach and some metered street parking along Pacific Coast Highway, both of which are certainly options with no discernible savings for the inconvenience. Again, in the interest of safety and security for both you and your vehicle, valet parking is the only viable solution if a guests opts to bring a car on property.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We had such a great time in August that we returned in October, however TripAdvisor would not allow me to leave another review for 3 months so I had to wait until now to post my second review of this hotel. Once again, the staff was exceptional. Trevor, the valet manager was on point with his staff. Our SUV was ready for travel with one simple phone call. Brad Perry and Sarah did a wonderful job making us feel right at home. This is by far the best place we've stayed at when visiting southern California. Thank you all for an amazing time. We will see you soon.....Rich

I love this hotel.  Every time I check in the hotel staff have been nothing but kind, courteous, respectful, and professional.  The rooms are extremely comfortable, clean and inviting.  The views of the ocean are phenomenal and the food at the restaurant is fantastic (especially the morning menu).  I will always make this hotel my "go to" when I visit Huntington Beach

The staff at this hotel was very friendly. They made sure we were comfortable in every area of the hotel. The pool & hot tub were very clean with plenty of lounge chairs & towels available. The hotel is across the PCH 1 from a very nice beach.WIFI  internet  was free & fast. The view from our balcony of the beach was very nice. It was nice that this hotel is a non-smoking hotel. A coffee maker & small refrigerator in the room were a nice touch.

I travel A LOT for business and my company books Hilton properties the majority of the time so I have gotten pretty picky over the past few years~  We were here for a 3 day conference last week and I had a great experience.  What made this property stand out was the level of service from every sector of the hotel - the greeting and thoroughness of the valet (not just grabbing your keys, he escorted me into the hotel and advised exactly where the check in desk was). Courtney, the check in clerk gave me an incredible top floor upgrade (room 1211 has a great North facing ocean view).  The servers who helped set up our corporate buffet room were amazing - always cheerful and helpful (wish I could remember their names).  The location across from the beach was incredible and within

This had to be one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in. You won't believe this hotel. It's truly one of a kind. For a beautiful view and friendly staff. Some hotel may try, but when you have a hotel that goes out of their way to make sure you are comfortable. After hearing about how bad the other hotel was. The thing is, it was effortlessly with them. This is the kindness they do on a daily basis. What hotel can top this one???

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with no resort fees
Summary: Great Place on beach in Huntington Beach. We have stayed here many times and location is great like no resort fees if you book ahead you can get a decent rate. Special THANKS to the front desk staff on recent stay my wife was ill on the last day and they worked with us to give us 3 additional hours after checkout for her to rest in room.

A top tier Hilton.  Good exercise facility.  Internet is fast.  Elites get breakfast coupons for restaurant or snack shop.  No executive lounge, which is a minus.  Location is pleasant.  Area is expensive, as are rates.  Would stay again.

Prices varied from booking with Hilton online and the hotel when I checked in. The hotel staff had an attitude on and didnt want to honour much less check what was promised when I booked the room. Not happy with the experience, though it is a beautiful hotel and a great location. The server at breakfast also seemed to have an attitude problem. She didnt want to take the order or take a picture. The night manager did promise to make things right and I never heard from him again. I would say dont trust the booking, the final price varied by over 60 USD
Manager Response: Dear Madhur V,  Thank you for your recent review of The Waterfront. We did a bit of checking on what you indicated in your review (related to pricing) and our records noted that you booked thru central reservations over the phone with Hilton Worldwide and not the hotel directly. This would never effect the pricing for any of our rooms (since Hilton Worldwide Central Reservations or calling us here on property direct have exactly the same pricing...which is ALWAYS lower than any other online resource including third party "discount" sites). It would, however, sometimes effect a room description since a Worldwide agent only has brief descriptions of rooms all over the world and our in-house agents have much more detailed knowledge of the property here. We noted that you were moved to a suite instead of the originally booked ocean front room for a minimal charge ($20 USD) but we were happy to accommodate your request. Our sincere apologies for any confusion regarding your room upon check-in and we are glad we could accommodate your request for a suite.  As for the problems or attitude you encountered from any of our staff, we will look deeper into this and make any and all adjustments necessary. As referenced over and over on this review site by countless other guests, our staff is one of our strongest assets and we take great pride in this. However, you are only as strong as your weakest link, so your message is being shared with our operations department managers and directors.   Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Oasis Basis to Attend Winter Simulation Conference
Summary: Beautiful spacious room, immaculately clean, with ocean view.  Comfortable bed.  Blissful quiet.  Amenities that surprise and delight:  when entry light near door is off, light switch toggle glows softly in dark.  Light in closet comes on when closet door is opened.  Bathroom has mirror with "magnify" view.  In-hotel restaurant Shades has wide menu, delicious food, lovely breakfast buffet, soothing decor, and outstanding service.  Free daily newspaper.  Hotel is beautifully suited for meetings and conferences:  good layout, many spacious meeting rooms, lovely artwork throughout public areas and hallways, easily accessible elevators, gently sloping ramps along places where there are 2 or 3 steps.  (This hotel is far more competent to host conferences than the Hyatt next to it,

Summary Heading: Get the room facing the ocean
Summary: I stayed two nights and had a beautiful ocean view.  You can walk across the street to the beach to watch the waves and surfers.  I stayed on the 5th floor-room 503 and it was very quiet in spite of all the hustle and bustle of Xmas parties and rooms filled.  Excellent breakfast buffet and they have a Starbucks on the ocean side of the hotel.

Summary Heading: My stay at Waterfront Beach Resort Hotel, Huntington Beach, CA
Summary: I stayed at the Waterfront Beach Resort Hotel in Huntington Beach, CA for 3 nights.  It was for business purpose.  The hotel is located in walking distance to the beach and the pier.  The room is clean and nice.  All amenities work well.  The decoration inside the hotel is top notch.  The staff is very friendly.  I had a great time staying there.  I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Michael L.,   Just a quick note to say "Thank You"... and please come back and see us again soon. It would be our pleasure to serve you (perhaps next time just for fun, not for business).  Happy holidays to you and yours!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Location:  Off Pacific Coast Highway (PCH), half a mile from downtown Huntington Beach  Parking:  $32/night with valet service, not really a fan of valet and feel they are milking you here  Service:  Very sharp and kind, despite having some rude people the front office staff always kept their cool which impressed me.  I feel bad because there was this nasty lady and the front office staff always had a smile, kudos.  Had that been me....  The hotel also offers a free shuttle to downtown Huntington Beach.  Rooms:  Standard hotel rooms with views.  I personally do not care for the view but you can request ocean view.    Pool:  Heated and very large.  Restaurant:  Great food but a little bit pricey.  overall:  4.5 stars, not quite 5 but nonetheless a stellar hotel.
Manager Response: Hi lionel86,  Thank you for your recent comments, our staff really appreciates that! It can sometimes be a bit challenging for the front desk when they are confronted by an angry or upset guest but they are highly trained professionals who will do whatever they can to both mitigate the scene and "Make It Right", whatever that may be. They are a glorious bunch and we really look on them all in awe each and every day. These are the folks you want on your team (but you can't have them...we love them!).  Also, rest assured we are not trying to corner you in any way with our "Valet Only" option. Really we have no choice (and neither does any of our neighboring hotels). We are very limited on space to park here at the beach so we have to manage and care for each and every vehicle we receive. Our garages are very tight and this requires professionals to take responsibility for the safe parking and return of your car... 24/7. There is no overnight parking at the beach and feeding a meter on PCH is non-starter for anyone who then has to schlep bags and baggage to their destination. I apologize for the rate (which is less than any of our competitors, by the way) but this covers both staff and liability for you while you are with us. Like insurance for your vehicle, there's a lot built in to that pricing, I assure you. A necessary expense if you chose to park a vehicle on property I'm afraid.  Have a wonderful holiday and we look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The valet was slow, we called to get our cars and they were never there even when it took us 15 minutes to make it to the lobby. They could probably build a new parking garage every year at $32 per car per night...
Manager Response: Dear David S.,  Thank you for your recent review. Our sincere apologies for the unsatisfactory service you received from our valets during your stay. You comments are very important to us and will be addressed with all car-park managers and runners on our drive. We shall take this opportunity to review our procedures with staff and managers and look for opportunities to improve. We are a "valet only" hotel and for this reason we couldn't agree more...our service needs to be top notch.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Noisy bad smell tiny room called oceanfront
Summary: We stayed at the room the hotel claims to refer to as "Ocean Front". We have been Hilton HHonors Gold Members for over 10 years and paid 3 times the number of points for Oceanfront room. The room turned out to have bad smell at checkin, with non-functional power outlets, non-functional coffee maker, lacking basic room furniture. It was a tiny room with lot of street noise and far from ocean.
Manager Response: Dear FrequentDiner53,  Thank you for your review. We will review your reservation and perform a full inspection of the room you occupied. As for view types, with the exception of suites and some garden level rooms we basically have two types of rooms: Ocean View and Ocean Front. All "Ocean Front" rooms are exclusively on the front side of our hotel's tower and directly face the ocean from your balcony. We apologize if that description gave you any other impression and we will ask our marketing team to look at our hotel descriptions and see if there is anything that leaves room for misinterpretation. We pride ourselves on accuracy, service and guest satisfaction and are very sorry to have disappointed you in any way.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Lovely hotel and staff is very helpful, but unless you are looking for a quiet escape away from people and jolly entertainment, I would recommend a different hotel.  The location is perfect when visiting Huntington Beach, just a bit down the road from Main Street and shops and restaurants, however, if you want an enjoyable stay with a nice hotel bar and a less sleepy atmosphere, try the Hyatt down the road.
Manager Response: Dear SAM3369,  Thank you for your recent review. We actually pride ourselves on the comfort and quiet relaxation we offer to our guests. In many ways this sets us apart from everyone else in the neighborhood (although, at the height of summer, you would not think so at all...its a struggle! Just read reviews from a few months ago).   We are very aware of the options for a more boisterous "night out" at bars and clubs all around us... and even offer you complimentary transportation to and from our downtown and Pacific City locations to do so safely. When you come back here tho, this is your home... with all the peace and quiet that implies (and a staff trained to serve your every whim). So relax, enjoy, settle in and let the tranquility surround you. We'll let others "turn it up"... The Waterfront is where you can rejuvenate afterward.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Service from the personnel at the resort was excellent, but the room was not what I expected. What they list as an "Ocean View" room, might be sold as a "partial ocean view" room at a nearby resort. If you are booking here, do it directly with the resort to avoid unnecessary fees with an agency. No frills resort, but the beach is one of the best in mainland USA!
Manager Response: Dear James H.,  Thank you for your review. You are correct in advising travelers/guests to speak with us directly to book (either online or over the phone...we offer both!). Not only can our agents tell you exactly what type and the view a room offers, we can often also send you the photos to back it up. Additionally, there are no better rates or terms offered anywhere else. We guarantee that!  Booking direct saves you all of the hassle a third party can throw your way (especially if a cancellation becomes necessary...they can be very unforgiving)...and we offer special perks to those who book direct as well giving you even more "bang for your buck".   Your kind words for our staff is greatly appreciated and will be shared with everyone. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to your return.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Great experience. Friendly and helpful staff. The view was great, the balconies on the rooms were peaceful, the grounds were well-tended, bottled water was offered in the lobby, The survey requirements are too long.
Manager Response: Dear Garet W.,  We had to laugh a bit when we saw your "survey requirements are too long" statement. We tend to agree! But thank you for taking the time all the same...it means a lot to us.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We recently spent a night in you facility in Huntington Beach. The staff was accommodations were great. The only issues we had were as follows: the bathroom door did not close completely & our neighbor to the South was smoking on the balcony. Being very sensitive to cigarette smoke, we found this extremely offensive. I am aware that this situation was out of your control.  Thank you  Fernando Castellanos
Manager Response: Dear Fernando C.,  Thank you for your recent review. Here at The Waterfront we have a strict "no smoking" policy (including vaporizers) for all of our guestrooms, ballrooms, public areas and pool deck. We offer two outdoor smoking oasis' for that purpose. Never hesitate to contact the front desk (or any Waterfront associate) to report smoking (even on a balcony). We will remind the guest of our policy and issue a warning. Our guest's comfort, safety and health is of primary concern for us. We always keep these reports confidential, so please do not hesitate to let us know.  I have also alerted engineering to check on the bathroom door to the room you stayed in... we will correct that immediately.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms and good food at the bar! However, construction is going on next door.
Summary: I stayed here on a last minute recommendation, but with vast experience with Hilton's worldwide. I was very happy with the rooms, hard wood floors quite balcony doors that blocked out the traffic front the PCH. The bar served food to 11pm and room service was also available. It was a limited menu but I had a good burger with goat cheese and avocado, with a side breaded onion rings (my favorite, not battered). It was very tasty and done as I desired. A decent beer selection was also available, no Pacifico but Modelo was a good option. The location is amazing, close to everything!

We stayed here at last minute and didn't mind spending the extra money for the room, but then they nickel and dime you to death.  You can't take your own bags, so, there is the tip for the bellman, you can't park your own car, so tip for that person (mind you, they didn't tell me until my reservation was confirmed that there is a $32 parking charge), pet fee of $50 (non refundable), internet cost $14.95 if you want something other then just enough to get on to check emails.  The room was nice, but not that great that you pay over $200 for it.  Put on the 5th floor when we have a pet, a little crazy there and the noise you can hear from your room if you leave the sliding door open, is ridiculous....from the hotel bar.  I will never stay at a Hilton again, for one night, almost
Manager Response: Dear Karen N.,  We were sorry to hear that you did not find the room rate and parking fee's in line with your desire for beach resort location. Our revenue teams work very hard to make sure that we are competitively priced with all of our neighboring properties. We know you have choices and for many the room fee is the prime consideration. I researched the day you stayed with us and, in fact, all the hotels up and down the coast were experiencing high demand and occupancy. While it may have seemed unreasonable to pay for parking here at the hotel, it is the nature of the beast (limited space and no overnight parking at the beach). Again, with no resort fee and a lower parking fee than any of our Huntington Beach competitors, our valet parking service is consistently the highest rated for service and value in all of Orange County. Also, by joining our Hilton Honors program (and earning points for free stays and upgrades) your internet is complimentary. We highly recommend joining Hilton Honors and taking advantage of all the program has to offer.  Lastly, a quick review made by me of your guest folio indicates that your pet fee was waived and never charged to your account. We did this as a "thank you" upon arrival knowing the hotel was nearly sold out and that room types and floors available were limited at best. We apologize if our efforts to serve you as an honored guest did not meet your expectations.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Second visit and still an Amazing hotel
Summary: This was my second visit to this property.  The first was for a Hilton GM training class so I thought we may have been getting preferential treatment.  However, the whole experience (hotel accommodations, service, location, view, amenities) was so great, we made sure to spend two nights here on our two week PCH family vacation.  The hotel once again delivered an amazing experience.  The front desk, bellstaff, valet parking, swimming pool attendant, and basically every one of the staff were very friendly, helpful, and most seemed very genuine.  The room we had was very comfortable, clean and new-ish.  We also called the concierge to reserve on of their bon fires on the beach.  While it was expensive, it was so worth it.  Having the space reserved for you, complete with chairs and

Summary Heading: Close to Huntington Beach Pier and Main Street
Summary: Pretty good property. Across the street from the beach. Pier is walkable as is Main Street. My room was on the 12th floor with a "sunset" view which was pretty awesome. That being said, even though my room was a "renovated" room it was still a little worn looking.   A really good property with easy access to the beach. Valet was $32/day.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this venue.  The Staff was over the top helpful and the view was fantastic.  Had a 10th floor ocean front room.  The Hotel is located very close to Main street which is full of restaurants and shopping and they have a shuttle if you don't want to drive, plus they are right across the street from the beach. There is a $32 a night valet parking charge if you have a car and we were disappointed there was no other option given for parking to avoid this fee.  Otherwise we were treated like royalty which was refreshing compared to our other beach adventures!!!

This place was extremely comfortable, very clean. The staff is excellent. Very accommodating and every pleasant. The wait staff at Shades for breakfast was inattentive. All other hotel staff were wonderful. The hotel is across PCH from the beach. You can take a leisure walk to the shops and restaurants nearby. Very quiet and great place to relax even though I was there on business.

The Hilton Waterfront was a perfect hotel for our family weekend.  The rooms were immaculate, and we had great views from our balconies.  The breakfast venue was excellent, and the food and service were wonderful.  The pool area was very nice, complete with a sandy play area for the toodlers.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  The hotel location is great if you like the beach, only a short walk to the pier and Duke's / Sandy's Restaurants.

Tammy Thurlow ,Chef Concierge was a font of information during our family gathering at the Resort. She not only made excellent recommendations for dining and local sites but was able to solve every problem with tact and aplomb. She truly went above and beyond to make our visit memorable.  On the whole the property was excellent, but there were seven in our party and other than outside there was no convenient lobby space to sit and visit. We used the outside fire pit but would have preferred a comfortable lobby especially when the temperatures dropped in the evening.

First of all, let me say that every single employee that I interacted with was extremely friendly, professional, and dedicated to taking excellent care of the customer.  That alone, is worth 5 stars to me!  As others have said, you can't beat the location of this hotel.  Be aware that there is some construction in the area, so it is not the quietest location (also located right on the PCH), however, the rooms are very comfortable.  Temperature of the pool and hot tub were excellent - I think that some hotels keep their pools too chilly, and that was not the case at this hotel. Stayed here for 4 nights - only 2 minor issues - our room was not ready until almost 4:45 (check-in is at 4:00), however, the hotel apologized and offered a small token as a result.  The other issue was

my favorite Hilton by far!!  Outstanding service. Everyone is so friendly.  This is our 3rd trip here this year (I bring my dog, Jesse) Dog beach is just 1 mile away.  This is a great location and everything from room service to valet is fast, efficient & super friendly.  (and everybody always remembers my dog, Jesse and loves on her big time!)  They really make us feel special here. I particularly want to shout out to Daniel behind the desk (very accommodating & kind), Nick @ Bell is so attentive & friendly, and Kyle (I call him my bonfire guy, but I think he does everything around here!) Thanks to all the valet guys too who made every brief wait for our vehicle enjoyable!

3 nights was enough!  Mattresses needed update about 3 years ago!  Air conditioning was cool in daytime, but did not cool too well at night...strange.   The hotel staff was phenomenal, from valet staff, concierge, lobby staff, etc.  Very friendly and knowledgeable about the area!  Location is great, but it appears that Hyatt is spending multi-millions on 3 sides of the Hilton property!  Look out Hilton!
Manager Response: Dear JMan64,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your review. We're very glad our staff exceeded your expectations during your stay. It is always a pleasure to share this with them and puts a big smile on everyone's face.  You might also be interested in knowing that "the millions" you see being spent all around us is... US! That's right, tons of updates and upgrades are happening (and all without impacting any of our guest's experiences during this process) including property enhancements, group space and all furniture and bedding upgrades... which are nearing completion as I type this. So yes... upgrades are all on the way as ordered JMan64 :-)   We can't wait to have you back to see, feel, experience and taste it all on your next visit!  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: A beautiful setting, a great hotel, with even better staff.
Summary: I attended an event held at the Waterfront and couldn't have been more pleased with the overall aesthetics and level of customer service.  This place is steps away from beach and feels like a high end luxury resort without the pretentiousness.  I truly enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anybody in the area or coming from afar.

it was a great experience. very good location, all staff always friendly, clean room. we been provided with the increidible ocean views. since we arrived we feels like at home, pool and fitness center was very clean. thanks for make my stay.. a really good experience

We went down to the Waterfront Beach Resort to celebrate our birthdays and we had a wonderful time. everyone was friendly and tried to do much to accommodate us, it started with the phone reservation with Kelly, which gave us some gifts for our birthdays, continued with all the workers we spoke to or needed something from, and above all stands Tammy the head concierge , she went above and beyond our expectations. She made the vacation just superb.  Maydi and Nathan

The staff at this location really knows service.  You will find knowledgeable and helpful staff throughout the property.  The rooms are very nice and comfortable - some have views of the beach.  The catering for our event was also very good.

We could have not picked a better place to send our wedding night. Kyle at the check in desk was absolutely the best ever. He made both of us feel so welcome. They sent a nice package with champagne and glasses and chocolate covered strawberries and gifts. Wow!  What a great night. Thank you Kyle and the Hilton for the best night ever.

First of all, this property is like my 2nd home.  The customer service is impeccable and extremely friendly especially Devon, Austin, Shaun who greet you when you arrive at the front desk with a friendly smile!   Anthony the bellman was very informative and courteous.  I also had the experience of booking a Bonfire for my nephew Logan for his 6th Birthday.  Tammy-Chef Concierge went above and beyond to make this a very memorable experience for us all something we will never forget!!!  Thank you again for all your help.  PS:  Thank you Danny-Mgr. for the GREAT TEAM you have....keep up the good work!  See you again soon.....

Location is excellent for a weekend get away.  City of Huntington Beach has really improved their look and cleaned up the down town area and pier.  Lots of fun local restaurant options.  Always enjoy a great meal at Duke's.

Summary Heading: A Thanksgiving Holiday of Private Luxury
Summary: I remember as a former resident of San Francisco, I decided to take the Coast Starlight down to LA for a few days of rest and relaxation after dealing with the pressures of work.  At realizing how much I like the California coastline, I decided to book a room at the Waterfront Beach Resort at Huntington Beach, CA.  I really enjoyed the hotel restaurant, staff and the room was very nice and Southern California style with the ocean front view of the coastline that was awesome.  Additionally, what I enjoyed in terms of this private treat of luxury for me, myself and I is that the hotel is adjacent within walking distance of  the Huntington Beach boardwalk with nice cafes, friendly people and just the great type of Southern California beach type living as in being laid back and just

Just returned from another great weekend in Huntington Beach.  This is the second time I have stayed here for a race weekend.  Location cannot be beat for those participating in the Surf City 10 miler in October or the Surf City Half Marathon in February.  The race starts right outside the hotel and the finish is close as well.  With beautiful Huntington Beach right across the street who can ask for anything more but the hotel does deliver more with a beautiful pool area with hot tub.  The whole property is beautiful and a perfect setting for a wedding which we saw several being held here over the weekend.  The property is well maintained and our room was very clean and comfortable with an incredible view of both the pool and the beach. I will definitely be back and would not

Summary Heading: Nice Business stay at Water Front Resort
Summary: Great staff. Nice facilities. Since it was a business trip I was especially grateful for the staff helping me quickly address any questions/concerns that I had. My only complaint (not hotel's fault) is that there was construction outside my window, which put a slight damper on the ocean/beach view.

it was a excellent experience stay at the hotel and the staffs are very friendly and i will recommended this to my friends and family. and hoping to come back soon . my kids enjoyed the place, and its a very nice wedding ceremony we attended

Summary Heading: We will come back every year!
Summary: My 9 year old son and I did a mother son weekend here this past September...We had a corner room with a beach view.  It was amazing!    1. Upon arrival, service was second to none we have ever experienced.  Every single staff member was just as hospitable as the next.  They were all so sweet about making sure we had a great time - and for the first time ever, we experienced hotel staff that actually gave us advice on how to save money at their own hotel!  2. Loved the smore's package!  Though, I would suggest paying the extra money and letting them settup the beachfront bonfire.  We tried to go cheap and just asked them to put a wagon together for us...I didn't think how hard it would be to pull the wagon across the sand.  However, it was so worth it!  And they don't skimp on

I rented a suite and a function room here for a week and found the service to be excellent and attentive, especially the marketing director Scott O'Hanlon who made my visit very easy and convenient with his proactive and careful service. Great location, great food in the restaurant, nice fireside cocktail spot in the evening.

I had an amazing experience at this hotel.  I chose the Hilton after speaking with another high end hotel and also the Hilton about our upcoming wedding, and the staff at the Hilton was so much friendlier!  The customer service was absolutely awesome!!!

Summary Heading: BEST BEACH HOTEL IN SO CAL
Summary: We traveled all over southern cali. This hotel was THE BEST BY FAR. Clean, luxurious, on the beach.( across the street) there are not very many beach front hotels in the area. If they are they are usually small and older. The Hilton was good location to go shop, walk tge beach, food ect. Clean and safe part of town as well. Classy but laid back.  Only part i did not like was you are forced valet parking. You pay $30+ per day for valet, yet feel obligated to tip valet......I just made it a point to say im not tipping for the valet to myself. I seen others looked like they were thinking same thing. Perhaps hotel should spell it out for us. " valet gets paid by the hour, if you feel you got above and beyond then tip may be warranted.   I would stay here again. And problably will.

It felt like home. Warm welcome when we arrived. Counter help was very knowledgeable of all the sites and services surrounding the area. Rooms were very clean, roomy and comfortable. Valet was on point. You couldn't beat them to the lobby. Always smiling and again very helpful. It may have felt more like home to me since this Hotel was built almost on top of the very spot I grew up in. Kind of a strange feeling looking at the same scenery but through a different window

Hubs and I arrived on a Saturday afternoon, check-in was easy, we arrived at our room and were pleased with it.  Very comfortable king bed, a good sized desk area, flat-screen TV, small fridge and coffee station.  Unfortunately the lot next door is undergoing construction so it was noisy during the daytime, so I didn't use the balcony.  I was told that the resort is doubling in size and the lot would be under construction for approximately two years' time.    Weekends were particularly busy with multiple weddings, yet it didn't feel too crowded and staff were extremely efficient in setting up / taking down outdoor areas so there was minimal disruption.  All of the staff were very hard-working and valet staff were phenomenal - so helpful and ready to assist with any questions or

Booked four nights at the Hilton Waterfront after an unfortunate rental experience in town. This is a fantastic hotel right across from the beach with a great pool. It is a short walk up to main street for restaurants and bars or you can take a short uber trip. Our room was high and on the front of the hotel. It was roomy and airy. We loved it. Staff was friendly and helpful.  On future trips to HB I will never stay anywhere else.

The wifi service is uneven, and requires that you resubscribe frequently, more than daily in my experience.  If you're on a business trip, as I was, this is just not good enough.  We ate at the restaurant once, on a weekend morning, and had very slow service.  However, the food and hors d'oeuvres we had at the various meetings catered by the hotel were all excellent, so I think the kitchen is very good.

Lovely Hotel. attentive staff. CLEAN. food and coffee, tea, inhouse restaurant menu very good, desk staff, house keeping, pool and wait staff as well as parking people THOUGHTFUL and welcoming...complete with maps and dining out suggestions

My husband travels to Huntington Beach on business every month and has had the pleasure of staying at the HIlton numerous times.  I even had the opportunity to join him on his last visit.  Since my husband is there so often I got in touch with Megan Martin (Amazing!!!) to help me out with the specifics of his visits.  She was fantastic!  Megan has made this my husband's home away from home and hotel of choice.  The hotel offers comfortable and roomy suites with incredible views of the pier and the ocean.  Our son enjoyed the pool and hot-tub and my husband actually goes to the exercise room almost daily (small but does the job).  I would highly recommend staying here for a wonderful ocean experience.

Great Pool area overlooking the beach front Lovely Room Shame about noisey construction site next door Location is very good, only 5 minute walk to main restaurant/shopping street Very clean - comfortable beds

We were out in Los Angeles at a conference and I extended our stay for four nights. we had stayed at the Hilton Waterfront in Huntington beach some 22 years ago, and had fond memories. the Hotel is Enjoyable as ever. the desk, bellman, wait staff and maid were excellent. A special note for the Concierge (Tammy) she was very helpful in making reservations for us at a couple of our favorite restaurants. we received VIP treatment at Dana Point Chart House which made the evening even more special.

We held our annual customer meeting here and received great feedback from all attendees. The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are spacious. My room faced the ocean and had a nice balcony. The beach is right across the street and the pier, restaurants, shops and bars are an easy walk.  All the staff members were very friendly and a pleasure to work with. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Waterfront Beach Resort delivers on all levels
Summary: I am reviewing this hotel as a local resident in the same city as the Waterfront Beach Resort. I have not stayed at the hotel because I don't live far from it. However, I have visited the hotel many times for the restaurant, ball room events, seen all of their beautiful buildings and grounds, and interacted with their staff within the community many times. Their standards of excellence and customer service are outstanding! Their level of involvement in their local community is outstanding! When you see their level of service in other areas that are not directly beneficial to them as a company, you know their level of service will be above and beyond with their inhouse guests. Within our community, in addition to what I personally know, I have only heard rave reports about the

I stayed at the Waterfront Hilton for 4 nights this past week for a business conference.  It was my 4th time at this hotel and the service could not have been better.  I wanted to move my room because of the construction outside my window and they we extremely accomodating.  Every person I encountered from the front desk to the bell man was very pleasant and helpful.

Summary Heading: Lovely time at the Hilton in Huntington Beach, CA.
Summary: We really enjoyed our time at the Huntington Beach Hilton Resort. The staff were incredibly accommodating. We had a top floor room with a spectacular view of the beach and pier. We arrived early before our room was ready, and were able to leave our luggage securely at the hotel while we went to the beach. I cannot say enough about this great hotel. I want to go back soon!

I stayed at the resort for a family wedding, which work logistics prevented me from attending until a day in to the festivities. The Waterfront Beach Resort started me out brilliantly by getting me into my room at 11:00 a.m. Instead of the technical 4:00 pm check in. That act of thoughtfulness set the early standard for the service I received for a very busy 30 hour stay. Great room with a super comfortable bed and a luxurious feel to all appointments. The restaurant was great - food, ambiance and service. And while most guests will not be interested, I thought the food and service for the wedding activities were really excellent. Readers digest version, a fully great experience, heavy on a can do attitude and uniformly gracious service at every level.

Loved the room that we requested great view, excellent staff, definitely stay again. Love the pool view and that the beach was just right across the street. Loved able to sit on balcany in the evening and enjoy the sunset.

Summary Heading: When your Uber driver has better service than trained professionals...,
Summary: Just checked in around 3:45pm today and it only got worse after that. After checking in we went to our room and waited for our bags to be dropped off, it took around 25 minutes. Once getting to our room we realized it was a room with a connecting door, that attached to a room with a dog. A dog who barked continuously. We decided to leave our room to have a drink out by the pool. Once we sat down and had a sip of our first beers an employee asked us to leave within five minutes because there was an event at the pool. My boy friend went to the front desk to ask when the event would be over and the front desk manager had no idea. After waiting for the front desk manager to come check what was going on he offered a free drink at the bar. Smh.  So unable to sit at the pool for a
Manager Response: Dear Jodi B,  We are sorry that you had a disappointing experience during your stay with us. At Hilton, we always aim to ensure every guest feels cared for, valued and respected. Your feedback will help us deliver this brand promise. Guest satisfaction is very important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Whether a barking dog (guests with pets are not permitted to leave them unattended; always report this immediately) or dissatisfaction with any aspect of your room or accommodations, our goal is to always make things right by you. I apologize if we failed in this regard.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort with a lot to offer
Summary: My wife and I had a day to "kill" while my son was working (we were visiting).  Enjoyed an early check in (flew in from the east) enjoyed a beautiful pool with easy access to the beach with towels and chairs.  Folks at the pool side bar and  restaurant were friendly and attentive and the food was good.  Plenty of places to explore for food/drinks out side of hotel.  Looking forward to revisit

It has been a pleasure and most relaxing time my family and I had for a long time! The views were great from sunrise to sunset and thru out the day. The staff from the bell man, front desk to room service are ever so polite and always no matter what willing to go the extra mile!!!! Thank you for it all this was our first stay and yes we will be back for some more adventure!!

Beautiful views.  Beds are so comfortable.  Slept with the door to the patio open.  The ocean breeze was amazing.  Very much worth the money to stay there! Nice pool, we rented the cabana and it was very nice and comfortable. Even was able to watch the game while we were lounging.

I had an excellent experience and would recommend here to anyone , business or pleasure. The facilities , inclusive of the gym and pool and the restaurant was a home away from home. Fantastic balcony view of the beach and the surroundings

I spent 3 nights in this hotel as well had business meetings. The rooms are clean and the food is fantastic. The service is very good and everyone is very helpful. I had a problem to sort payment of the express toll as I was renting a car , Vanessa from the concierge helped me and sorted the matter while I was busy in my meetings. The location of the hotel is great in Huntington Beach. Will come again very soon with the family.

The Waterfront Hilton is situated in a great location in Huntington Beach, within walking distance to pier and downtown.  Well-furnished rooms and beautiful grounds.  It's my go-to place when visiting Huntington Beach.

I spent four days at this location with my sister and mom, we had such a lovely time.  Tammy helped us to find fun things to see and do nearby.  Courtney sent a surprise to our room, as a way to kick off our girl weekend.   The bike rentals are convenient and they offer everything you need to enjoy the beach free of charge.  Beach towels, chairs, umbrellas and toys for the kids, along with boogie boards.  What a great staff they have it was a pleasure staying at this property.  Super clean, well kept, and just comfortable and close to everything.

Wonderful hotel, beautiful and clean property, nice people, right across from the beach.  The food at Shades is very good.  The best part of our visit was the attention to our needs by the entire team.  Thanks to Austin and Andrea at the front desk, who went over and beyond.  My husbands 60th birthday celebration was topped off with complementary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries.  Amazing!  Thank you all so much.  We will be back soon.

My company held its user group meeting at this location. The checkin area was very nice and the people were very friendly. I was upgraded to a large room.  The beach is right across the street.  The pier is an easy walk. The meeting room was a little odd and the air conditioning in the room was very loud. The restaurant was ok. Overall it was a nice stay. The people really helped.

I was forced to book with the Hilton because I was attending a conference taking place at the Hyatt and the Hyatt was all booked up. I am glad I was forced to stay at the Hilton because they regulate the temperature indoors way better. The hallways of the Hyatt is the same temperature as outside. It was very humid during my stay so I was not very comfortable with the indoor temperature regulation of the Hyatt and it just made me appreciate the Hilton even more.

Great hotel that is walking distance to the Huntington Pier (the Hyatt is a closer walk, however).  Huntington Beach is a great place to watch the surfers and there are great restaurants in the area.  My favorite is Duke's but others think it is just "ok" and too commercialized.  I disagree and thing the fish and teriyaki steak are always great!  The Hilton is not very big and is a fairly standard Hilton expectation which I would define as nice, but not overly so.  I think the Hyatt is a nicer property so if the prices were the same, I would choose the Hyatt.

The resort is only as good as the people who work there, So this is for Austin at the front desk, who checked me in as soon as I arrived, me and my wife had a wonderful stay and it started with him, the whole staff is amazing.

Everyone in the hotel is service oriented.  Great rooms, lovely pool, directly cross from the beach.  Free beach chairs, umbrellas, toys for kids.   Bikes for rent, with lots of shopping nearby.  Beach fire Pitts and so much more.

Great location! Walk to the Pier or take the hotel shuttle.
