Across the street from the beach - just wish there was an accessible walkway over the road like the hotel next door so you didn't have to cross traffic. There was construction going on next to the hotel too so it was a bit noisy during the day. Luckily I had a room on the opposite side overlooking the pool so it didn't bother me too much. Great stay all in all!

Attended a successful business team meeting, departed with pleasant property thoughts. Hotel worked in every way. Food was excellent with perfect service. Beach towels and chairs exactly met our needs. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Ask for Nile if you valet or need a ride, he is responsive and efficient - regardless of the time of day.  I was surprised by this property and wouldn't mind staying again for another meeting. Nice job by all involved. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Poor in many area's, good in some, expensive and lacking
Summary: Booked a rate inclusive of valet parking and buffet breakfast - King Ocean View. Checked in without problem. Room was adequate but dated for $300 a night, safe was loose in the wall, air con controller also hanging off the wall. Went to breakfast the next morning and the waiter gave us a menu which was priced, we asked about what was included and he said that he didn't have access to that information, it was all done at reception. After breakfast I went to reception to clarify and was told we should have been given vouchers at check in, we were not. They then gave us these (and tried to bill for the breakfast at check out). Then the pool was closed between 5-6.30 on Friday and for 2 hours on Saturday due to a wedding. While at breakfast on Friday and Saturday the staff were
Manager Response: Dear William M,  Thank you for your recent review. I apologize for the challenges you experienced during your stay. I have alerted both the GM and our Operations Director who is now having learning conversations with everyone involved. You will also be hearing from us personally in a few hours and we hope we can make this right by you.  Also, you'll be pleased to know that on our Hilton website we now have a banner on our landing page warning of any impending pool closures due to weddings, filming, or any other activity. We thank you for your suggestion and, as you can see, have implemented it right away.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Customer service excellent, before you even arrive!!
Summary: We haven't even been on our holiday yet, but had to write an early review on customer service. We are going in April 2016 and emailed recently to ask a few questions about the area etc. The response we got were simply excellent. Tammy sent a really helpful reply about getting to Disneyland and all the great things the hotel had to offer, and Joseph has gone above and beyond to create a fantastic holiday for us, before it has even begun. We are flying from Scotland and right now we are very far away, but from this fantastic customer service, we already know this is going to be an amazing hotel.
Manager Response: Dear JNSN,  Now this has to be a FIRST! An excellent rating before you have even arrived... we are grinning from ear to ear and are buying our concierge and reservation teams all coffee this morning. Can't wait until you get here in April.  Safe travels...and thank you!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: To many weddings going on the weekend of September 25-27. Friday nights wedding was nice though I felt uncomfortable watching there whole ceremony while we ate our dinner. Saturday the hotel had 3 to 4 weddings. I felt we were either in the way or dodging wedding parties pictures guest all day. Even the valet parking area became a wedding ceremony. It was pure chaos! Cops were even called in at 2 am sunday morning to remove an obnoxious group out of their hotel room.
Manager Response: Dear John W.,  Thank you for your review. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the wedding ceremonies during your stay. That particular weekend was challenging for all of us as we too needed to accommodate an "emergency venue change" for one of our lovely brides. We did our best to minimize the impact on our regular guests and I am truly sorry for any disappointment you may have experienced. I can assure you, this was not a normal weekend for any of us, myself included.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We recently stayed three nights during the week. MAKE SURE YOU REQUEST A POOLSIDE ROOM! Otherwise you will get stuck looking at construction. Beach is right across the street.  Close shopping. The beds were comfy, the service was good and the food was yummy.

Depending on the time of year, this is a happening place. 4th of July was a great venue for celebration. Pool was packed and service was top notch. Clean and upscale decor. Parking was a bit high, but expected for a beach hotel. Easy walk to beach and restaurants.

Overpriced, misrepresented package deal, small room and balcony, paid for partial view of the ocean and got a few of construction, food made my husband ill, took a week to take a double charge off our credit card. Snotty front desk man.  Loud party a couple doors down, smoking kept turning on the alarms. OVERPRICED!
Manager Response: Dear 390lawrenceew,  I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry for the disappointment you experienced. Downtown Huntington Beach is undergoing a phenomenal transformation as we move thru the next 18 months. We are excited for the final product (some of which is already near completion and opening!), but unfortunately our neighbors development intruded upon your perception.  As for the front desk agent, this is not the kind of service expected from a Waterfront associate, especially at that first point of contact. Exceptional guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback helps us to improve. We hope you will stay with us again the next time you travel to the area. My apologies and I hope you will give us another try.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: To start off I will say that the hotel is very nice. It was great to only be across the street from the beach. We got there on Friday after noon and checked in. We love to hang out at the pool so we went down to the pool only to find out that it would be closed from 5-6:30 for a wedding and reception. So back to the room we went to change and head to downtown Huntington Beach which is a very nice small little down town. The hotel has a free shuttle that runs every hour to and from so that was nice. Well then Saturday we went over to the beach in the morning and came back mid afternoon to finish the day off by hanging out at the pool only to find out that it would be closed from 5-7:30 because of a wedding. I can't understand why they charge so much money to stay there and you
Manager Response: Dear love-road-life,  Thank you for your review and we apologize for any inconvenience caused by our recent weekend's events. This is not the norm for us and we do everything we can to steer brides away from areas that might otherwise impact other guests. This weekend, however, was a perfect storm of EVERYONE wanting to get married all at once! You may have noticed that we had both a complimentary shuttle to take you to the hotel next door to allow you to use their pool as well as a complimentary hospitality suite on the top floor of the hotel, all available during the brief period of our pool closure for the ceremony. I do, however, understand completely that if you had your heart set on the pool area at the same time as the ceremony was to take place nothing but disappointment would be the result. I sincerely apologize on behalf of our entire team. You'll be pleased to know that, effective today, whenever we know that any change to our normal operations are eminent, we will be posting them clearing and concisely on our website and thus letting you determine if you wish to book based on that information. I apologize for not having this up sooner and in the future will make every effort to keep you informed.  Sincerely,   Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I don't know where to start. 16 Nights of Enjoy and Comfort. The Waterfront in Huntington Beach was for the second time the hotel of our choice.  And it is great, awesome and much more.  If you have a problem you call the Front-Desk and they solve it. Customer Satisfaction is a high priority. Other hootels would maybe say not so bad at all. But they care for every single thing. And that makes a hotel a great hotel. Pool, Restaurant (Shades. We had breakfast and dinner and cocktails), Fitness-Room, Valet-Parking...... is really at the Limit of Perfection. Everyone is friendly and helpfull. We stay in many 5-Star-Hotels. But this is one of our Top 3. Go there and enjoy it. A great place !!!!  More information's? See a video on YouTube under: Hilton Waterfront Huntington Beach

We were greeted by friendly staff, and a great view out onto Huntington Beach. It was very close to the main drag which has all the bars and restaurants; 5 minute walk down the Pacific Coast Highway. Clean and large sized rooms with quality linen. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Everything We Could Ask For & More!
Summary: Our family vacation included a stay at the beach and we could not have picked a better location. The Waterfront Beach Resort offered everything we needed and more. Beginning with our check in, Vanessa was outstanding! Shane and his Crew in Valet were exceptional during our entire stay! Ramil was a great ambassador for the property and gave us some great insight on how to get the most out of our time at the Resort. The Concierge team of Tammy & Tamara were a huge part of our wonderful stay, they helped us with tennis, beachfront activities and best of all our "bonfire"! Thanks to Preston, Nick & Alex for making our evening at the beach a lifelong memory for our Family. Great job by one and all, can't wait to return! Richie W.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay on the beach
Summary: Theres nothing much to do but surfing in Huntington , however this hotel is a good location if you want to go to Lagoon-a beach, Long Beach, drive up the coast, or indeed surf. The location on the beach is beautiful and the hotel its self is very well looked after. Very nice place to stay and the staff are so nice,

This Hilton hotel is top-of-the-line (like so many Hilton hotels are!).  Overlooking the ocean.  We were in a corner suite that was superb.  Room was spacious, had great views, large sitting area, dining table, and outside table and chairs.  The staff goes above and beyond to help with anything, always with smiles on their faces.  The concierge (Tamara) was over-the-top helpful, pleasant, professional and a joy to work with.  The pool is great.  The restaurant has excellent food. There is also a market where you can buy grab-and-go stuff, as well as what you may have left at home.  A beautiful property!

We booked one night at this hotel because it was pet friendly and near a dog beach but the nightly rate was a bit high for an ocean view room that was far from ocean view we faced some land that was being renovated with debris everywhere definitely not worth it
Manager Response: Dear Rose A.,  Thank you for your TripAdvisor review. We apologize for the work being conducted during your stay. The parcel of land next to us is in the initial phases of a property enhancement and these tend to be a bit painful in the initial phases of work. The good news is that once completed the world of The Waterfront will be vastly improved offering you (and all of our guests) a wide range of new dining, shopping and leisure options seen no where else in Southern California! We are very excited and can't wait to wow you with all that's new upon your return.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: It felt like we were on a tropical island
Summary: My boyfriend and I splurged a bit to stay here for a few nights in September and had a fabulous time! Everything about this place feels luxurious. The rooms and premises were very clean and the lobby smells like coconut. The pool area is fabulous and large, you can order drinks right on the patio and also see the beach right across the street. The small store next to the pool has everyday essentials as well as a Starbucks which is perfect for early mornings. The restaurant is nicely located with outside seating however it is expensive and has a small menu. One thing I enjoyed is that the staff is present and friendly but not annoying. It is probably a 10 minute walk to the pier and downtown where there is plenty to do and eat. Their shuttle to downtown is prompt and easy. My

Friendly staff and convenient location.  Shuttle runs on the hour to downtown but if they are not busy and you ask they will run more frequently.  The suites are worth the price upgrade.  Reserve your bike rentals early in the day on the weekends.  Food at Shades is good but breakfast is a little pricey for the buffet.  Walk across the street to Jack's on the beach for a fun but cheap "beach lunch".

This is a lovely grand waterfront hotel with a very friendly feel. The pool area is very relaxing with fab views of the beach. We also had a lovely view of the beach from our balcony. The hotel location is good, and they provide a shuttle to and from the town centre if you are feeling lazy. The Market Cafe is also a great alternative to formal dining in the restaurant.

Summary Heading: Outstanding service, great loaction, fabulous holiday!!
Summary: I personally would like to thank Tammy who was so incredibly attentive to us not only through our entire stay but also prior.  Tammy arranged all our tours, took care of dinner reservations and went above and beyond to ensure my friend and I had a wonderful, relaxing holiday! I would also like to mention Dani (I believe to be the manager) whose customer service was also second to none.  Our room was beautiful, spacious, loved the fact that there were two showers in our suite, a balcony with a beautiful view, clean and spacious.  The pool facilities were clean, and the hotel is in walking distance to shops, restaurants and cafes.  I'm not sure if I would recommend the breakfast buffet as compared to the al la cart however, the Sunday brunch is definitely worth it.

It is one of the original HB oceanfront Hotels but still has a modern feel to it.  It is clean, nicely decorated and well managed.  I stayed recently and am staying again soon!  You can walk right across the street (PCH) to the beach or stay and relax at the pool with the ocean in view.  The on site restaurant has great food and service.

This hotel is in a great location, across from Huntington beach, with beautiful views of the beach, sea, waves, etc.  I stayed here for three nights on business however would come back here for a personal stay anytime.  The room had an ocean view on the eight floor.  For a good view, ask for a room on the 5th or higher floor as trees can block the view.  The room (#827) was nicely decorated and clean.  It was spacious as well.  Had a balcony too.  The valet was courteous and professional.  All hotel staff was very friendly.  The restaurant by the pool served delicious breakfast and lunch.  I haven't tried their dinner menu however I am sure it would be tasty, the fire pit by the pool was a nice touch.

Summary Heading: The perfect end to my 3rd Honeymoon
Summary: Leaving Portland on motorcycles heading back home to Cabo San Lucas.... this was the perfect place to stay after 12 days on the road.  Over priced 2nd rate hotels get old after awhile. This place is none of the above. Staff were all very nice. Loved the swimming pool area and the gym. Styfoam cups in the room with the coffee maker was a bit odd. Close enough to walk to the shopping areas.

Generally speaking, the Waterfront Beach Resort(across the Pacific Coast Hwy)was an excellent Hotel. The food and service was outstanding the rooms and common areas were all new, clean and tastefully decorated. The only problem, and it was a big problem, was the poor soundproofing between rooms. We heard every word, yell and cry made by the family in the room next to us. And I am sure they heard us too.
Manager Response: Dear Joe D,  Thank you for your recent review. We're very pleased you found us to be an excellent hotel. We do apologize for any noise or disturbances from your neighbors. Unless we are sold out, we are more than happy to accommodate a room change and even have our bell staff move your belongings for you. Upon check-in, every guest signs a "No Party" policy form at the Front Desk (unless they are an "E-Check In...in which case, upon complaint, security issues a warning and has them sign the agreement). Failure to comply will result in the offending parties being escorted off the property. We take your comfort and safety (including sound disturbances) very seriously.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: My sister and I went on a 2 night getaway with plans to get some much needed rest and relaxation. Upon check in I noticed printed papers behind the desk stating the pool would be closed for 2 hours during our 1 full day of rest. We immediately searched other hotels as a rest day at the pool was our main goal for this trip. Everything was booked so we decided to make the most of it. The next day - 2 hours before the pool closure -staff started moving away lounge chairs and scooting people away or to the other side of the deck. By 5:30 they had moved all of our chairs away and scooted us all out. The entire energy during this time was pretty dismal. People were not happy to be asked to leave. We dragged ourselves and our stuff to the side until the party was over 2 hours later. At
Manager Response: Dear reneeb1232015,  Thank you for your review. We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced during your stay and most especially the brief pool closure to facilitate a wedding. It is rare that we accommodate these requests, especially on a weekend, but it meant so very much to the bride and her family to have their ceremony in that location that we decided to allow it. We did all we could to mitigate any interruptions and made certain (as you noted) that we placed plenty of written notices throughout the hotel. Again, we apologized that this had any negative impact on your stay and would welcome the opportunity to "Make It Right" upon your return.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I always pick a Hotel because of reviews. This hotel needs to have a big pat on the back! The valet staff was awesome and took the $32.00 ouch of parking each night! I had ocean front on 10th floor and was great. The traffic is noisy but you are on the PCH. Restaurant had great food and drinks! I will definitely  stay here again . Decor was nice and kept up too.

Great first time experience, staff was great and will make any attempt to accommodate your needs. Great location, walking distance to main and pier.  Anthony in guest services made our stay more pleasurable when he found out we where honeymooners he made an attempt of getting us a room with better ocean view, even though the room we had did have ocean view, food and drinks excellent.

This hotel has a great location -- close to Main Street and right across the street from Huntington Beach.  It looks like a new shopping center is going up near the hotel as well.  The room we were in was bright and decently-sized.  For Hilton elites, the breakfast vouchers you receive can be used for the continental breakfast or room service, which I had not seen before, though I did not try the latter.  The continental breakfast was typical, but the restaurant is by the pool, so the outside tables have some nice views of the ocean.  Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but one night was interrupted by loud sounds coming from outside -- I am not sure if it was coming from the hotel or not, in fairness.  The only parking option at this hotel is valet, and because of a wedding one night,

Great Hotel in Huntington Beach. I stayed here with my wife, and kids for a week.  Service is top notch. I was greeted by Danny and Eric at the front desk. Both were very helpful on answering our questions. They both made us feel right at home. We were able to get our room right away which was located on the 11th floor.  The view was great, our kids loved it!  We were able to eat at shades for dinner on one night. The food was good, service could be better. Overall our stay at the Hilton was unbelievable. The staff is probably one of the friendliest one that I've seen while on vacation.  Thank you everyone for making our vacation a great one.  Andy.

Summary Heading: Great service and staff but the rate was a bit of a ripoff
Summary: This is a tough review for me because we had a fantastic stay despite feeling a bit ripped off by the room and rate. We paid nearly $500 a night for an ocean view double room with a private balcony on Labor Day weekend. Unfortunately the only way to see the ocean was to stand in a specific corner of the room or go out onto the very small balcony and turn your head. The room itself was actually a good size for our family of 4 but for that price we expected to actually face the ocean or at least have a view of the sunset which we did not. We did call the front desk to request a change but as it was a holiday weekend we were told there was nothing else available. The reason this was so upsetting was that. We could have had a larger room at the Hyatt (a much larger and nicer resort
Manager Response: Dear Elizabeth H,  Thank you for your review. We apologize for any confusion regarding the room type you booked. We take great pains to honest, transparent and careful to describe each of our rooms and suites. Occasionally the word "ocean" can trip up a reservation if you're not speaking to us directly. We have two types of "ocean" rooms in our tower: Oceanfront, which as the name implies is front facing on the tower with a direct forward view of the ocean; And Ocean View, which offers a view of the ocean from either the  window or angled balcony. The balconies all face at 45 degree angle out to sea and are designed to give every guest their own view of the majestic Pacific. We apologize that you were dissatisfied with the view you obtained and, being Labor Day Weekend and with a fully sold out hotel, we further apologize for being able to accommodate your request of a room change. Ordinarily this would not be an issue and we would have been more to please to move you until you felt "at home". Our mission is to "Make It Right", and we asked that you please give us the opportunity to serve you again in the future. Your kind words for our staff brought a smile to many faces, and it would be our pleasure to welcome you back anytime.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: A fantastic beach front hotel with stellar service
Summary: We visited huntington beach for our anniversary and this hotel once again has exceeded our expectations.   The view alone from the room is breathtaking but the pool area is so awesome with all of the palm trees and ocean views right near the sparkling blue pool with poolside service. .. that I had to take a wide angle panoramic picture to capture the majesty of the view from the pool patio and lounge.  We breakfast and lunch outside and the large umbrellas and great bloody Mary's kept us outside enjoying the ocean air and views.   I had the ceasar salad to start and the club sandwich which is a triple decker loaded with avocado, sprouts, bacon and sundried tomatoes. The sandwich is no good in had remembered it from the last time we were here.  My wife had the beef flautas and

The Hotel is excellent and comfortable but why oh why only one mediocre restaurant in the whole hotel ? Breakfast is very poor both Continental and A la carte. Fruit selection is an apple orange or banana!!!! In California ???!! Totally uninterested in their customers.
Manager Response: Dear Doug1961,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. Our full service and award winning Shades Restaurant and Bar offers a full array of fresh fruits and at least two kinds of melon and pineapple at every breakfast buffet. You may have mistaken our "Grab and Go" Surf Hero Market as the only option available to you for breakfast and for that we apologize. Upon your return, please allow our concierge to reserve you a lovely outdoor table on our patio where you can experience our bountiful buffet while taking in the ocean views. It will be a pleasure to serve you.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: My wife and I were supposed to be in Mexico for our honeymoon, but due to a passport issue we had to cancel that trip and think something more domestic, Huntington beach here we come!   This hotel was amazing, it felt like we were in an all inclusive resort. The staff made the experience even better! Daniel at the front desk during check in was amazing. Ramil, made sure we had everything we needed during our entire stay, bike rentals, coupons to restaurants in town, bag service, everything. He was up every morning to say hi and make sure our stay was great. Vanessa and Tami with the concierge were extremely helpful when I wanted a honeymoon surprise setup in our room while we were out.  If you're willing to pay a little more for your stay in Huntington beach, stay here! The

We stayed in the King Suite...corner room with a view of the beach and pool...wow!! Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, especially Hayley & Jorge by the pool!  The Shade's restaurant was amazing! Slow roast chicken with a sweet salty and sour sauce that was out of the park-YUM! I would defiantly stay there again!!

This hotel has everything. The ideal location accross from the beach, fantastic amenities including bike rentals, boogie board rentals and our favorite bonfire with a butler on the beach. Food was amazing, accomodations were perfect for our family of 5, and the concierge made sure to exceed all of our expectations. We'll definitely be back!

I recently stayed at this hotel as part of a sporting team visiting (Special Olympics- before the World Games). The staff were beautiful, helpful and very enthusiastic- they did every thing they could to make our stay really fun. The view from my room on the 5th floor was fantastic- the facilities were top class. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to check out the pool. When I  go back there then I will absolutely make sure I stay here .

This is our second time staying at the Waterfront Resort Hotel in Huntington Beach in the past 2 years and the hotel continues to exceed our expectations. Service and facilities are excellent and is very convenient for the beach. The rooms are great where our room had a great view of the Pool, Beach and Ocean including watching a super sunset every evening. Only negative point was on very busy days (especially Weekends) around the pool, there is not enough Sun Beds available so my advise is to get your towels out early and then carry on with your plans for the day. No  other complaints about this hotel and we will be back in the future to stay here again.

Thank you for making us feel welcome, we had a very relaxing and restful break before heading home to NZ. If i had to describe your hotel in one word it would be EASY  We will be back next year for sure !!

A perfectly located hotel, all of the staff were fantastic and very helpful.  Rooms were lovely as were the surroundings of the hotel, very much spoilt by one male guest who was seen on more than one occasion spitting on the pool side (while walking about with his young son) - spitting does seems to be a bit of a californian habit unfortunately ....expensive hotel but does not always go that people with money have good breeding or manners! what a shame Also did have problems with the wifi at this location.

Summary Heading: Awesome End of Summer Beach Visit
Summary: We wanted a place to stay on the beach prior to our end of summery Disneyland visit with our 5yo. This location was perfect with great access to the beach and to the shops and pier at downtown Huntington Beach.  The hotel staff impressed from arrival to departure with their friendliness, helpfulness and the personal touch of getting to know your name and greeting you with your name as you made your way through the property. Food in the restaurant was excellent, pool area was clean and comfortable, and there are many beach "tools" available to take across the PCH to the beach area.  View from our room was fantastic and the rooms are recently updated and in great condition. We would highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are in the Huntington Beach area and looking for a

Beautiful location across PCH from Beach. Staff was amazing from entry to leaving property. My only complaint about property would be the small pool and a high noise level but other than that, a very good property to stay😎😎

Employees are well trained, helpful, and very accommodating The hotel is lovely and easy to navigate.  The guest rooms are good size and all have water views. Unfortunately, there is construction going on, with noise that can compromise your visit.

Summary Heading: Attentive service and a fantastic location
Summary: Attentive staff, wonderful location right across from the beach, spacious rooms and wonderful outdoor patios with fire pits. I stayed for work but it felt like a holiday. The staff were so wonderfully supportive with booking airport transit and other travel logistics and answering questions. There's great live music poolside on some days and the atmosphere was very relaxing. A good choice if you want to be slightly away from the centre of Huntington though you can easily get there in a few minutes by taxi or a 15-20 minute walk. Because it's slightly out of the way, the beach out front is a bit less busy in peak times than it would be closer to the pier.

Summary Heading: Good Stay for a Good Value
Summary: Stayed at this hotel this weekend and overall it was a great experience. We were with a larger group and some of our friends had some complications with their rooms.  Our room was on the second floor with a partial view of the beach. The room was clean, but a bit outdated, but overall it was okay. My only complain is the cost of a small water bottle… $3.99 sounds ridiculous. And the wi-fi in the room is not free.  The swimming pool is a bit small for the size of the hotel, but it’s great for family with small kids. On Saturday they had a DG and a limbo contest for the kids. Staff around the pool was EXTREMELY courteous, nice and helpful.  The small coffee shop and small gift shop is great and has lots things you can get without leaving the hotel.  The other “issue” was the lack

The location of this hotel and amenities fit our needs well. The atmosphere is always upbeat and yet relaxing.The beds are exceptionally comfortable. We also like that we receive an email from Hilton before our arrival that gives us the opportunity to choose from several room locations.

I LOVE this hotel!!  Our room view was amazing! Pool and beach view!! Sunset view was so romantic! The room also had a balcony and chairs so it was nice to sit on the balcony to enjoy it all.   The pool is so much fun! Drink and food service while laying out! Plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas. Pool was so inviting during the summer day, couldn't get me out lol!  On Saturday, they have a live DJ,  during the morning it was fun to relax but it was also nice to get the party started around 2-3pm. The DJ stopped before the sunset, that was sad. On Sunday, there was live steel drum entertainment by the pool, felt like we were on an island. Saturday night, there were hula and fire dancers by the pool, so entertaining! We watched from our room.  The food is delicious!! Ordered

Pros: large rooms, many resort activities, location is great, staff is super friendly...Dan the room ops man, Sarah at the desk and Sydney in the restaurant were all phenomenal  Cons: property was much smaller than I imagined. It also didn't seem very clean. Rate was higher than what I'm used to paying.

I generally do not take the time to leave reviews although I should. Most people are quick to write a bad review, much less let others know what a great experience they had. I want to thank everyone at the Hilton Waterfront Resort for the most amazing time we had with them. My wife and I along with our grand daughter had the pleasure of staying with them. This hotel has the Hilton brand backing up their genuine, charming personal offerings with a staff that is second to none. A special thanks to Brad Perry, Tammy, Sarah, Nick, Scott, Cole, just to mention a few. You can tell everyone here embraces what they do. The rooms have spectacular ocean views, along with comfy beds and great accommodations. We felt so comfortable here that we rarely left the property which had everything

AC was broken on arrival. The hotel didn't attempt to fix the issue on the first night, we woke up freezing the next day. They sent maintenance to fix it on the 2nd day. Left that morning and came back after lunch to rest but maintenance left the backdoor open while fixing AC and the room was filled with flies. They didn't move us until late that afternoon when they absolutely HAD to since they couldn't fix it.  Lamps didn't work in 2nd room. Front desk didn't want to send anyone to check them out.  Manager was unapologetic and only offered to put a fan in our room before I told them that they need to move us.  Discounted 2nd night's stay but was definitely not enough. I had planned to propose to my girlfriend that weekend and it just made for a bad memory.  For the price and
Manager Response: Dear Abby D,  We are sorry that you had a disappointing experience during your stay with us. At Hilton, we always aim to ensure every guest feels cared for, valued and respected. Your feedback will help us deliver this brand promise. Guest satisfaction is very important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Your file is currently being reviewed by operations, the front office management team and our engineering department. We apologize that our efforts fell short of your expectations on such a special occasion.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Only been here one day so far. It's a beautiful hotel and great rooms. Room has a beautiful view of the ocean and you can see the mountains in the distance. Room is clean. Stuff is friendly and inviting.

I used to live in Huntington Beach but never explored this property.  It is a great place to stay, right by the beach and downtown.  The facilities are great and the rooms set up well, and as far as I can tell every room has a view of the ocean.  I would stay here again, if I get a chance.

spent 5 days at the beach, and the hotel staff was amazing,  the bell men, the front desk, the pool staff were all great and very friendly.  We really enjoyed their attitude and the experience,  we did a beach cabana, and a bin fire with Smores and both experiences were fantastic.  I highly recommend using these services to make your stay an experience

Summary Heading: As close to the beach as you can get in Huntington
Summary: There are two major resorts close to the beach in Huntington:  the Hyatt and the Hilton.  The Hyatt is probably double the price, so if proximity to the beach is the priority, the Hilton is probably a better bet.  The parking at the Hilton is valet and there is a charge.  The parking attendants are very friendly and helpful.  They gave us bottles of water to take with us every time we took the car out of the lot.  Check in went well.  However, one of the rooms had such a foul odor, we had to go back to the front desk to change rooms.  It appeared that someone horrible was spilled on the carpet, which was still soaking wet and some horrible chemical was used to try and clean it. This room had a wonderful view and was on the 4th floor.  Sadly, the replacement room was on the 3rd

Summary Heading: a breath of fresh air, literally...
Summary: It's great to know that there is an amazing escape so close to home. We spent most of the day just lounging from a place to another, mostly between the balcony and the pool. You can't beat the views or that cool breeze on a hot day that you only get by the ocean.  Staff's great, the valet guys are awesome. Dinner outside at sunset, a memory for the ages.  Thank you all, great job, we'll be back again.

Honestly, this hotel was not my first choice but I was pleasantly surprise!!!!!  Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite!!! It had a magnificent ocean view!!! The suite was gorgeous, huge and very clean!!! The hotel staff were all fantastic!!! (from the valet, bell man, front desk, housekeeping, and pool and bike rental attendees) They were all very helpful, attentive, accommodating, courteous and helpful.  The hotel is walking distance to the beach and stores.  The only thing I could say is that the pool is not very big; however, the suite we stayed in, the view, and the service we received more than made up for the size of the pool.  I highly recommend this hotel.  I am looking forward to returning again very soon!

From the moment we arrived until after we checked out, the staff at this hotel was friendly and helpful.  The property itself is gorgeous, and the restaurant is very good (great food and huge portions at breakfast).  The hotel is across the street from the beach, and they provide towels, beach chairs, beach umbrellas, and sand toys for guests to take to the beach.  They gave us coupons for 2-hour boogey board rentals as well.  Guests can also rent a cabana for the beach or purchase an evening beach bonfire with s'mores and/or hot dogs to roast.  If you'd rather sit by the pool than head to the beach, you can enjoy a gorgeous setting overlooking the beach and even rent a pool cabana.  This is truly a beautiful hotel with great amenities and well-trained staff.  I highly recommend

I have also stayed at the Hyatt next door to this hotel.  This Hilton offers everything you could want, for less.  And, most rooms have an ocean view!  I especially appreciated the free beach chairs, umbrellas, and towels to take across the street.  The at the hotel is lovely and the in room dining in fast.  The hotel will also set you up with everything you need for a beach fire in the evening.    Internet is free if you are a Hilton member -- become one!    There is a fee for parking, but that is to be expected.  The positive note is that they are extremely fast.  I called before coming down and my car was always waiting.  Valets were friendly, even when I left my cell phone in my car and needed help retrieving it.  Thanks guys!  Given a choice, I would save my $ and stay here

Summary Heading: Treat yourself to a real vacation in paradise!
Summary: the Waterfront provides close access to the Huntington Beach which is beautiful.  the rooms are quiet; the beds and pillows are comfortable; the rooms are clean; the people and staff over the top with friendliness; the menu, albeit limited, is good;beautiful swimming pool; fire pits; amenities for accessing the beach and downtown.  full service resort.

We stayed two nights at The Waterfront Beach Resort.  The property is beautiful and very well maintained.  The room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable.  We had a great view from our balcony.  The pool area was nice.  There seemed to be plenty of chairs and there were staff taking drink and food orders.  It is just across the street from the beach so it was an easy walk.  It was also an easy walk to the downtown/Main Street/pier area.  The only complaint I had about our room was that the shower was very slow to drain.  Overall, a great hotel though.

Summary Heading: Nice, but a little spendy and needs polish during the busy season
Summary: Overall we enjoyed our stay. The location is great. Very central with easy access to the beach. We saw lots of families, so this seems like a good place to bring kids.  Our room was comfortable and clean, and even though it was a "resort view" room we still had a nice partial view of the beach.  We visited during the peak of high season and the hotel was packed. It seemed like the staff were having a difficult time keeping pace with the high volume of guests. Many of the communal spaces (fitness center, hallways, etc.) were consistently slightly dirty and unkempt. We felt that our room rate was more expensive than what the hotel merited, and paying an extra $32 per night for parking was the straw the broke the camel's back.  I probably wouldn't rush back to stay there again, but

I stayed the weekend during the US surf pro championship at this nice hotel.    Pros: 1. Good service.  Attentive front staff. People at the front tried to help you.  I'm a gold member so they gave me a partial ocean view room from a resort view which is  a pretty standard upgrade.   2. Location. Walking distance to main street and surf competition and beach which were very convenient.  This was a big plus.  3. If people are familiar with starwood this place is like a category 5 spg hotel.    Cons: 1. This is a nice hotel but not a resort.  No spa or kids club.  Jacuzzi is smaller than some people's home jacuzzi.  At one point there were 9 people in the jacuzzi and they were packed liked sardines.   2.  Price. Perhaps they up charged because of the event but this is not worth

We stayed for two nights and had a great time. Wonderful bell hop who was excited to share all about the hotel. Easy access to the beach, which was most important to us. Don't worry about packing beach chairs, umbrellas, towels and sand toys, as the hotel provides it all at no extra cost. We got lucky, in that we arrived 4 hours early and we were able to check in! Our room was clean and had a nice ocean view. I did not think it was outdated in the least . It is about a 10 minute walk to explore Main Street. The restaurant was nothing spectacular so we mostly ate on Main Street.  The valet gave us granola bars for the kids when we were leaving which was a nice touch.

Summary Heading: Lovely resort, wished we could have stayed longer
Summary: We stayed here for one night at the end of a Californian holiday.  The hotel is located right across from the beach and not too far from the pier and Main St.  There are lots of facilities at the hotel and it has a good feel to it.  When we arrived our room was not ready (they guarantee 4pm), so we left our bags and walked up the beach to the pier to watch some of the surfing world championships.  We returned around 3.30 after the hotel had called us and were given a room facing away from the town, with an ocean view and balcony on the 7th floor.  The room was nice and large, with a nice bathroom too.  It was all very clean.  The air con unit blew over one of the beds, making that person cold compared to the rest of the room.  We had drinks by the pool later that afternoon and

Summary Heading: Great beachside location and nice property
Summary: Attended a business meeting here for 4 nights.  Had a room on the 11th floor (#1118-definitely recommend the even numbered rooms for a view of the sunset and you want to be near the end of the hall like I was...don't go for #1106, e.g.).  Nice property, right across the road from the beach, friendly staff, very helpful concierge.  It's a 5-10 minute walk from the main downtown area...it's closer to downtown than the Hyatt, so I would definitely stay here again.  There is music playing from the pool area for most of the day, but you can't hear it when you're in your room with the balcony door closed.  As an seasnedreler, I would definitely recommend if you want to stay in Huntington Beach.

We were very pleased with the hotel and the services that were offered, location was great.  We would highly recommend and would go back.  The only thing that I thought was expensive was the smores on the beach.

This was our second stay at the Waterfront Hotel.  We are Hilton Diamond members, and over the years have stayed at many Hilton properties.  Trust me folks,  this hotel has hands down the finest, best trained and efficient staff at any hotel we have ever stayed at!  Yes, I said ever stayed at!  From the time you pull up to the entrance until you check out, the staff literally doesn't know what to do for you next.  The folks at valet start it off with a great welcome.  Every time you go out with your car they ask if you would like bottles of water, directions, and then tell you to have a great day.  When you return with your car they ask how your day went and would you care for bottles of water again.  When we checked in we were greeted by Assistant Front Desk Mgr, Annika, who

Very close to Main St and the pier.   Rooms were large and the hotel is a great size compared to the Hyatt next door (which is a beast).  The concierge service was amazing as well as other hotel staff.  I also found to poolside food to be great quality and quantity for the price.

This is an older hotel that is working very hard to be current and up to date.  The rooms are nice....though they do NOT have 2 Queen beds in the rooms...only Doubles, so if you are bigger and sharing a bed....you might want to think of a solution.  The pool deck is right in the middle of everything and the Polynesian Show was pretty cool.  They have a shuttle, but the hotel is an easy 15 minute walk to downtown.....

We booked this hotel for a couple of nights at the end of a long tour round the West Coast and were looking forward to it.  However, as seasoned hotel users and following those we'd used during out trip in a number of locations we have to be honest and say it didn't live up to our expectations - reasons being: 1) We felt the room had a slightly tired look/feel to it. We commented that we'd stayed in much cheaper hotels on our trip which had a far fresher look/feel to the rooms. We had an Ocean View room on the 4th floor. 2) There were no bath towels in the room when we arrived and only 2 hand towels. This was quickly remedied however following a call to housekeeping. 3) The items offered for use in the bathroom were quite basic/limited for a 4-star hotel (shampoo/soap etc) 4)

Summary Heading: Expensive.. MAY be worth the price
Summary: We stayed at this resort in the busy season.  Rooms were way overpriced.  (WHAT ever happened to reasonably priced hotel rooms? Not everyone is a rich business traveller).  Aside from that, the staff at this hotel is by far the best staff I have ever dealt with.  They were so kind and caring, resolved every problem with a smile and really went above and beyond! I am Hilton Diamond, this place had the best food and the best prices I've seen.  I really appreciated this, I feel like so many hotels are charging more for less of a service.  At this hotel that was not the case. The management at this hotel have hired an amazing group to keep this place in top shape for the vacation of a lifetime.  We will keep coming back, given the prices are reasonable...

Check in was fast and easy. Room was neat, clean and nicely sized. Bathroom and shower were sized well also. Bed was comfortable and WiFi was about average for a hotel. Good location across the street from the beach so that makes it nice for morning walks. Good overall experience and I would stay here again.

Pros: 1. Great location short walk to main streets but away from the noise and congestion.   2. Nice coffee shop/ convenience store on site (friendly staff!) 3. Clean spacious rooms, loved the balcony w/ ocean view (even in the rain) 4. Room service for lunch was good (though burger did not come with onions and pickle) 5. Right across the street from shop on beach that offered bike and surf board rentals as well as snack bar.  Cons: 1. The only reason it's not a 5 is b/c there is no Spa on site, but you can walk over the Hyatt spa next door.   2. double beds were quite small.

From the time we arrived till now our last day the service has been top fantastic. The property is located directly across the street from the beach. Rooms are no the small side, but clean. Great food at all the restaurants and room service. Can't wait to come back here again soon.

The hotel was very pricey and small! The location is great and truly a plus! It is walking distant from the beach and Main Street. However, if you a large family or have several people in your party the supposed two queen bed suit is hardly big enough for four people. The beds are more towards the full size mattress.

After staying at the Hotel Huntington Beach, I decided to treat myself to one night as a decent hotel.  I have always been a Hilton loyalist and after staying at this hotel it was the best treat for me.  Will come back with my spouse for a romantic week end.

I love this place.  My wife and I got married here in 2014 and we hope to go back every year! The brunch is great, the pool very nice, and the views are wonderful.  The staff is great and always willing to help you with anything you need, just ask them.,

Excellent Hotel,  All the staff was very attentive!! Rooms were nice and clean. Pool area beautiful with the view of the ocean. It is a nice place to stay with families but also for a couples weekend.  I will be staying there again soon.

The Waterfront in Huntington Beach is our most favorite place to escape to.  The property is gorgeous, every room has a view of the ocean and the staff is 5 STAR. What ever your need is, the staff is there to help you.  It is directly across the street from the ocean and offers so much to do. They are family friendly and pet friendly.  They have a great restaurant that serves Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner.  A fire pit to gather around and make new friends.  I am in the Hospitality industry and have stayed in numerous Resorts that should train their staff to follow in the Waterfronts footsteps.  AMAZING  Can't wait to return.

The hotel is very nice, close to the beach, across the main drive actually. The staff were nice and service speedy. Breakfast not earlier than 6:30 though which we were not able to use since we left before then each day. This appeared to be an excellent resort for families not really set up for business travelers.

Summary Heading: Your Stay will Leave you Smiling
Summary: The first rate service and accommodations will leave you smiling! From the comfort of your room to the attentive and respectful employees, a hotel that defines professionalism. I arrived on business and I left feeling as if I just had a vacation! Thank you Hilton Waterfront for a spectacular experience!

This is a nice option but you will be paying more than I am accustomed to for the same quality that you can get elsewhere.  The location is convenient.  The staff is great.  We requested the 12th floor that has been remodeled very nicely.  Grounds and interior are kept up.  Pool is heated.  The hotel offers shuttle service to Disney, which I did not find on their website.  They also offer shuttle service to main street. The taxi ride to JWA is 45.00.  It is worth your time to plan your trip with a Tuesday night stay.  Main street closes down and offers street food and multiple vendors.  The walk to the beach is 3 minutes, the walk to the pier is 10 minutes.

Summary Heading: Great for the family! Great service!
Summary: We enjoyed our week long stay at the Waterfront. The customer service led the way overall. We had to wait for our rooms when we arrived, however that was made right with some complementaries from the hotel market/deli. The front desk was great.       The valet was great, but the $32 per day to park at hotel was too much so I parked at a friend's house down the street. The hotel offers free shuttle service to Main St. every hour on the hour. It would be better every 30 mins. during the summer months. We asked for shuttle at 7:10 pm. and they refused our request. The walk delayed our dinner a bit.      The bell service was top notch and Ramil,Cole,Nic, and the several others took great care of us.       Room service was prompt in the morning and handled ALL our numerous

My family and I stayed at the Hilton Waterfront over July 4th holiday. The beach is right across the street and it is within easy walking distance of shops and eateries. The service was excellent. however, the rooms were small, not clean (hair in the bathroom, stain on chair, hole in carpet, spilled food in room fridge), and expensive. For the price paid internet should have been free but was not.

I come to this hotel for a staycation because I love the customer service and everything about the hotel, from the room service to the restaurant and the bar and the pool. When I stay here I dont leave the entire time because they have everything you can need. I highly recommend the Waterfront Hilton.

We stayed here for a couple of nights.  The hotel is pet friendly and that helped us make up our mind to stay.  Beautiful property.  Very lovely rooms.  Our room was huge and we had lovely seating area where you could look out at the ocean.  A small terrace overlooked the tennis courts and then out to the beach and ocean.  Enjoyed the pool and appreciated being able to take beach chairs and towels, across the Pacific Coast Highway, to the beach.  I would stay here again.

Wonderful hospitality and located only 2 blocks from the pier and Main street ,the heart of H.B.'s restaurants,bars and shops. This property is located on World famous Pacific Coast Highway directly across the street from the ocean. Park your car and walk or take the free hourly shuttle Waterfront offers.     Comfortable , clean rooms equipped with a 2 cup coffee maker and mini fridge, desk, sitting area and balcony makes for a comfy stay. Stop at the many stores on the way in and pick up drinks and snacks for the room.     The pool area may seem small for the number of rooms but remember this is a destination resort with the Pacific ocean calling to you, most days half the resort is out on an adventure. It still wouldn't hurt to grab some towels and a magazine and "reserve" a

Summary Heading: We stayed long term and the staff was AWESOME.  We had our kids and dog and the staff made us feel like family members.
Summary: We stayed at The Waterfront Hilton for almost two months due to a plumbing issue flooding out house.  From the valet (especially Royce and Sam) to the housekeeping (especially Lordes) and the bell men (Cole!) to the awesome staff at the pool and front desk workers, all of the staff made us and our dog (a 65 pound lab mix) feel welcome. The room had a beautiful south facing view of the beach.  The pool was a great place to watch the sunset over the pier.  The pool house loaned us beach chairs, umbrellas, towels and even sand toys for the kids for free!   We will miss the staff at The Hilton Waterfront Hotel!

Overall the experience was very good. Unfortunately the pool area was under construction while we were there so the noise and ambiance suffered. The staff was friendly. The valet was very helpful and we used the free shuttle service to get to the main strip. The room was nice but nothing out of the ordinary from this level of hotel. All and all it is what I expected in terms of service and comfort.

We originally were planning on staying 2 nights at the Waterfront, out of our 7 night vacation to California.  However, we loved the area and hotel that we decided to spend our last night here and invite our daughter and family to join us.   The most important tip that I learned.....is to take advantage of the early check-in to secure your room number!  My account was not allowing me to login, some kind of IT glitch and so I didn't and thought no big deal.  Well it might not have been a big deal most of the time but this weekend the hotel was full and it was.  We paid for an upgraded view and in my opinion; we didn't get what we paid for.  I should've called and secured the room offered directly with the hotel.  That was my mistake and by the time we arrived all of the rooms

I've stayed at this Hotel several times and I truly love this place.  The service is exceptional, the staff was outstanding in every way. Each person was personable and helpful. It was an enjoyable stay – Thank you!

This was our 2nd stay here...and it was perfect. The location cannot be beat!! Very clean hotel & the staff are very courteous. They even had a beautiful bottle of champagne waiting for us to celebrate our anniversary!! This is a class A hotel.

Our son got married at the Waterfront Beach Resort. The resort itself is gorgeous! A picture-perfect place for a special event. However, our son chose this resort because of the staff.  They are the most professional, helpful & happy people I've ever encountered. This event was 2-year plan that came to fruition on the June 26th. The event was amazing and left us breathless! Because of our experience with the Waterfront Beach Resort our son's wedding was truly a dream event for our entire family & guests.

What can I say? This hotel always has a soft spot in my heart. My husband and I stayed there at the end of June for a few nights. The rooms are updated and the service is always great.  He is a Hilton Diamond member and they always take such good care of us.  We were there during a few days when the power was out in part of the hotel...the only complaint is that it dig affect the A/C in our room for the last two days.  Regardless,  the pool is relaxing and you have a fantastic view of the beach.  We will always be loyal guests of the Hilton Huntington Beach.

You do get what you pay for, and in this case,m you pay dearly.  Service was good.  Place is very nice.  Very pricey, consistent with the area.  This location NEEDS an executive lounge.  No excuse for not having one.

Summary Heading: Amazing service, beautiful place to stay
Summary: The staff at this hotel were amazing. They were all pleasant and eager to make our stay the best experience possible. The whole resort was clean and well maintained. Booking all of our excursions through the concierge was the way to go. She made sure we had all of the information we needed and made great suggestions. The beach bonfire, complete with s'mores and a beach butler, was such a cool experience. I highly recommend it.  We visited in late June/early July and the resort was not crazy busy, which we liked. There were always tables available in the restaurant and lounge chairs available by the pool. The beach is just a short walk across the street. They also provide a free shuttle every hour to the downtown area that has tons of cool little shops and places to eat.  A great

From the start, expectations were high due to the price and the location. This was not my first time at a upper level Hilton resort and it can be hit or miss so I was cautiously optimistic. Customer service was excellent with all staff being very courteous. The room was clean and well kept and had a mini fridge which was nice. We had a king room for my wife, son, and self and it felt spacious. The crib that was delivered was a pack 'n' play which is better than those clunky cribs. We had a "resort view" room and could still see the PCH & ocean. Noise was not much of a problem from both inside and out. The location was fantastic being that it took 5-7 mins from room to beach. The main street strip in HB was just under a 10 minute walk away. There is a shuttle but we never took

Amazing view from our suite. Room was very spacious and clean. Looking out the balcony you see the pacific coast highway and then the beach. Breathtaking view.  Highway does get loud during certain times of the day/evening. (It's the motorcycles)  Walking distance to the beach and the pier. You can rent beach chairs, umbrellas and beach toys free by the pool to take to the beach. Overall a great stay.

We stayed in one of the ocean view suites. Although they were a bit pricey the view was amazing. Waking up in the morning staring at the ocean was perfect.  The staff couldn't have been friendlier. The hotel was very clean. There is plenty to do within walking distance. I will definitely be back.

The room is lovely, and appreciated the ease of getting a roll-away bed for our child, but the room was not very clean-greasy finger prints all over sliding glass door to patio and balcony rail was dirty and sticky to the touch (appeared to never have been cleaned.  Phones in room were filthy and I had to wipe them down myself before using them.  Bathroom could have been cleaned a bit better.  Did not use pool as the entire area felt dirty (needs to be scrubbed down well and pressure-washed) and there was a large oil slick in one corner of the pool that had gathered dirt and grime and just made us feel like we would get covered in filth if we entered the pool.  We were sorely disappointed to receive to smile or friendly welcome at the front desk.  The front desk staff seemed
Manager Response: Dear AK,  Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay with us. I sincerely apologize for the housekeeping issues that you experienced; our hotel works hard to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of our guests and we are very sorry that did not meet your expectations. We're not sure where things went awry here as we have floor captains and daily detailed inspections. Rest assured, I am now working with our housekeeping and front desk operations staff to prevent this from happening in the future. I hope that if your travels bring you back to the area that you will consider staying with us again.   Thank you,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed here with family when first opened and came back for a couple of days and was not disappointed.  The staff is incredibly helpful and professional, which to me is almost as important as the accommodations.  The King studio suite we stayed in was immaculate, and the view was unbeatable.  Staff members such as Cathy at the pool ( I think Activities Director) make the stay particularly pleasant.  We encountered a problem, but it was handled with the utmost professionalism and we were made to feel like valued guests throughout the stay.  Highly recommend!

Stayed at this hotel for a wedding. The staff was awesome, they were extremely helpful and courteous. I stayed here for only one day, it was a Friday, the hotel was very lively, tons of things to do, from restraints to bars, to an awesome pool, friendly people, close proximity to the main part of town, 10 min or less walk. The beach is located right across the street. Valet only parking. I would definetly recommend this hotel for a relaxing weekend getaway. Price is a bit on the expensive side but its worth it.

Summary Heading: Great Location,  Beautiful hotel, but no parking, all parking is valet.
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for a 3 day business trip. The staff was over the top friendly and helpful.  The room was beautiful very comfortable with a good but not great view.  Cant help if construction is going on.

We loved our stay at the Hilton Waterfront.  The room was great.  All of the rooms at this particular hotel have a minimum of a partial ocean view.  We will definitely consider staying here again on our next visit to California.  Hilton delivers yet again!

For the price i paid for the room for one night, which was $439, you would think this very wealthy company could afford to give their guests a continental breakfast, or even a damn bagel or doughnut! something free besides shampoo

Summary Heading: across the street from the beach
Summary: The location is great, the beach is very clean, nice, with plenty of room . The staff were all friendly, and helpful.  The food and beverages prices are pretty high as compared to multiple restaurants and bars within walking distance.

This facility is outstanding close to the downtown area.  Fortunately it was a Tuesday and the farmer's market was buzzing with lots of folks.    Room with a view is worth the upgrade.  The food at shades was outstanding and a relaxing atmosphere, the fire pit provides ambouiance that made me wish my wife was with me.  Will visit and stay here again.   Hotel staff, valet service and housekeeping superior.

my second stay at the waterfront Beach hotel and as the last time also very friendly and helpful staff. Especially in the gate area . Aswell the location of the hotel and the walking distance to the "Huntington downtown" is very close and as well the pool area - sitting there and watch the sunset is a recommendation .

Stayed at the hotel twice and had an amazing stay!! Great hotel stay for a family close to all attractions!! Amazing staff at the front desk, concierge, housekeeping and pool.. My daughter loved the stay. They have a wonderful pool and the hotel is just across from the beach and 5mins walk to the Main Street. Recommend this hotel to everyone that wants to relax and unwind. All staff are amazing and helpful!! We were very impressed that we decided not to go to our next stay and just stay at the hotel.

The Hilton is a very nice hotel. I stay here a couple times a year for meetings.  They have a nice pool and they have a gym. Their biggest asset though is the proximity to the beach and the fact that is isn't as busy as it is right near the pier. It's close to the fire pits as well, which are nice to use at night.   It's also closer to the main part of town than the Hyatt is.  To be honest though, for an upscale hotel I'd rather stay at the Hyatt. For something more boutique style (and a lower average price) I'd rather stay at the Shorebreak.  The Hilton is still a good hotel though. Just not my personal preference.

Hotel and room were both very clean and nicely decorated.  Great location - across from beach and close to downtown Huntington Beach attractions.  Food/bar service at the pool closed too early.  Bar/lounge was too small and didn't take advantage of the view.  A Cabana type bar would be more appropriate for this venue.

Friendly staff, wonderful room, yummy breakfast.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know who needs a place to stay in Huntington Beach.  I had the best sleep in a very long time.  Who makes those pillows?

Until now, I have never been in a hotel where I didn't have a few criticisms. I can not think of a single thing that needed an improvement at the Waterfront. A great experience the minute we walked in. The concierge service was the best I have ever experienced. The location is also excellent for leisurely walks along the beach.

Although we did have a great view, we paid for it! We are Hilton gold honors members which obviously did not mean a thing at this Hilton. We weren't asked for upgrades or had no special privledges whatsoever. We asked for two extra blankets and they insisted we only needed one. We asked for extra towels (the kids went swimming and showered when they were fine so we wanted some for the am) they brought 2--- and both times it was a long wait. The room (suite) was nice, but again we paid for that. The hotel itself isn't really walking distance to anything but the beach, due to the construction around it. We ended up leaving and heading to Santa Monica- and stayed at the Shore hotel. Complete night and day treatment/stay.
Manager Response: Dear Jason N Nicole S,  Thank you for your review. We apologize for any miscommunication regarding your highly valued status as a Hilton Honors Gold member. We always offer a complimentary room type upgrade (when available) to our Gold members at check-in. I suspect that since you were already in a suite, there was no further upgrade available. In addition, we give our Gold members continental breakfast for two, a 20% discount for dinner in our award winning Shades Restaurant, free high-speed internet, complimentary bottled water and more. I will look into this further with our front desk managers and make certain that none of this somehow being missed.  I have also alerted our housekeeping department regarding your concerns to their response times to your requests. I apologize for those delays. Occasionally when we are sold out (as we were during your stay) our response times to service calls can take longer than necessary. I will ask our team if there is anything we can do to streamline or speed up the process.   Again, our sincere apologies for any disappointment. We value all of our guests and strive to give everyone the best experience possible. Obviously we did not meet your expectations and, given the chance to serve you again, will do everything to Make It Right.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights. Our rooms were well appointed and very clean. The entire staff was gracious and extremely helpful. Renting bikes on the property was fun and very convenient. The property is about a 10 minute walk to downtown. The restaurant was very good. Pool service and fitness room very good as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this Hilton property to anyone visiting Huntington Beach.

Summary Heading: Clean hotel, but not worth the price
Summary: Everything is clean, but I think this is not worth the money because sound isolation in the room is not so good, and internet is very pricey. But this hotel is nicely located from 10 min walk up to the pier
Manager Response: Dear Serge Jr T,  Thank you for your recent review and comments. We apologize for any sound issues you may have experienced with your room while our guest here at The Waterfront. Please let us know right away if there is an issue you such as this and we will do everything we can to accommodate a room move that meets your needs. Our mission is to make certain your are completely satisfied with every aspect of your visit and it is never a bother to let us know when you are not satisfied. We welcome the challenge and will "Make It Right".  Also, as a Hilton Honors member, you are entitled to complimentary internet! Make sure you sign up today. We look forward to welcoming you back very soon.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort right next to the surface paradise beach
Summary: Beautifully decorated resort with beautiful views over Huntington Beach, the ocean and the iconic Huntington Beach Pier. Short walk to the Pier. We only stayed for one night as we were making our way back home and had to see this well known beach. Rooms are spacious, staff friendly and check-in/out was quick. Great Christmas spirit with all the Christmas decorations. Was also so nice to see that it is a dog-friendly hotel.

Stayed one night here last night (Friday).  We were put in room 517 which was not a full ocean view like I thought we would have since we booked an ocean view.  The view could have been better.  The room was a normal size with modern decor but smelled a little stale.  Bathroom could have been bigger too.  But overall rooms were decent. The valet staff to the front desk to the waiters at the restaurant and everyone in between were all very welcoming and nice.  The food at the restaurant (can't remember the name) was great. Had appetizers the night we arrived and watched their hula fire show which was nice.   Before we check out we had the breakfast buffet which we paid for in our room category which was excellent. It wasn't a typical continental as they also had made to order

We stayed at this Hilton for 3 nights in March 2015.  Since I have gold status we were upgraded to a beautiful jr. suite with a wraparound balcony.  We had lovely view of Huntington Beach.  The location is good for walking to the beach and the hotel provides chairs and even a wagon to carry items to the beach.  The hotel also provides a shuttle to the shopping area.  Breakfast was very good each day. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would return to this hotel for a future visit to Southern California.

Summary Heading: Great people make this Hilton great
Summary: Love this hotel - The rooms are well appointed - the place is clean - But it is the people who make this place feel like you are being cared for - I have yet to encounter someone who is not helpful - This has been a great stay - as a matter of fact, this is our 3rd stay and we have always left with the feeling that we cannot wait to come back - The hotel is right on the beach (you have to cross a street, but that is how it is here) - The pool area is nice.  But I would update the chairs in the pool area . Well worth the stay if you are staying in the Orange County area - Plan on Valet parking though - We had turn down service - Great stay

Not a bad place to stay. Took a jr suite with a beautiful view, but everything at this hotel is just a bit off for the money they charge. No turn down service at night. No comfortable place to watch tv in the suite. Breakfast doesn't open until 6:30. Not great for east coast travelers. So more an ordinary Hilton than a resort.
Manager Response: Dear rstern,  Thank you for your review and we appreciate you choosing to stay with us. Just a quick note to let you know that we do have a nightly turn down service. It is automatic if you are  Gold or Diamond Hilton Honors member (all the more reason to join!) or upon request (at no charge) for anyone else. Please let us know next time and we'd be more than happy to take care of you.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We selected this hotel as a one night beach fix before meeting the rest of the family in Disneyland.  We used our Hilton Honors points for an oceanfront room but upgraded to an oceanfront suite with a wrap-around balcony on the 9th floor for only $ 58.00.  Well worth it, beautiful views of the ocean and pool! We did the mobile check in so got our key from the front desk and off we went.  At first we were bummed, the pool area was closed for a private event but it had great live music which we enjoyed all evening.  We had cocktails in the lounge before dinner in the hotel restaurant.  The food, service, ambiance were all first class.  Everyone super friendly!  We also had the breakfast buffet before checking out the next morning.  It had so many selections!  Would have loved to

This hotel has a wonderful beach right across the street, and a heated pool for when the sun sets!  Wonderful front desk service, great food (we had dinner and breakfast) and a great atmosphere in the bar in the evenings.

Great room!  Great view of the beach!  Great employees in valet, check-in and in bell service!  My daughter and I enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  The bed was very comfortable.  We enjoyed our balcony too. We splurged and ordered room service for breakfast.  The food arrived on time and was delicious. We really enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming back.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with room for improvements
Summary: The hotel is really great, nice lobby and common area and great restaurants and pool.  Room is really nice and spacious.  On last day (stayed three nights) my adjacent room has pipe burst accidents but the front office manager handled very professionally and upgraded me to suite that is really spacious but older than the standard room.  The oversized Jacuzzi tub made up for it though.  Additional charges for Wifi and for parking.  Parking (valet only) is over $30 per night, which for a nearly $300 a room a night I think should be included.  Location is technically not in Newport Beach but in Huntington Beach.

It was really awesome! I enjoyed every single day in this hotel! My best holidays ever. Beautiful property and very close to the beach. From the front desk, to the concierges, the bar and the ladies at the coffee/breakfast bar. Bed was super comfortable, spacious and best of all clean. Will not hesitate to come back! Special thanks to Sacha and Jenja. ;)

The staff at The Waterfront Hilton certainly know how to treat their guests!  My organization held a fundraising gala here and it was the most phenomenal service that we have all experienced!  The property is gorgeous and in a fabulous setting, what better place to go for work!

We had a total of 4 rooms and 14 people and there was ZERO issues.  The staff friendly and accomodating and the hotel directly across the street from the beach.  Clean and quiet, yet comfortable.  Only negative is the hot tub closed early and I really needed to relax in it..

Had a blast!!! If you are in Huntington Beach, This is the place to stay! The friendliest staff!  Beautiful views and TOP NOTCH SERVICE!!!!!    Would NOT stay at any other hotel!! The HOTEL is well maintained with beautiful grounds!

We stayed here for a night at the end of Route 66 it is a nice hotel to chill our and relax at with a nice pool and the beach just across the road. Our room had a view of the power station next door but you could also see the sea and the view did not put us off. The hotel is reasonable quiet for a resort hotel.

The view from the 9th floor was fantastic. The décor of the room was very old looking and the bed was saggy and the couch we chose not to sit on.  The food was very good in the restaurant and the lobby was very beautiful.  We felt it was overpriced and

I stay here frequently on business travel.  It has a prime location right on the PCH.  Beach is great.  The hotel staff is awesome and always take good care of me.  The hotel restaurant/bar does some nice food and the bar staff are friendly and will chat when I am eating dinner alone.  The rooms are spectacular with great views at most every level.  Never used the pool or other amenities, but they look good.

This was the best service I have received at any hotel in a long time.  I would highly recommend this location.  We had a fire on the beach the first night with all the fixing for S'Mores.  Rented bikes the next day for a ride up and down the beach and they arranged dinner on the pier.  All in all a fantastic weekend.

Very clean hotel. Staff is very friendly. Location is excellent. Pool is nice. You are literally looking at the beach from the rooms. I would definitely stay again. Restaurant is good too. They also offer a shuttle to town but you really don't need it as its a 15 min walk.

Discovered there were updated rooms with updated room ammenities for floors 8 and above - found this out after being invited to a colleagues room and shocked to find out it was MUCH nicer than my room on floor 6. So, I asked to be upgraded as well, expecially since we were paying the same room rate.  I was accomodated.  I am also an HHonors member (so, in my opinion, I should not have had that  experience). Overall, great place to stay.

The Waterfront is in a great location right across from the sand and sea of Huntington Beach.
