Balcony views to Newport and Laguna on the South side and views of Huntington Pier, Long Beach and Palos Verdes on the North...great pool with poolside restaurant, or enjoy room service with ocean views. Rentals of all sorts on site or on beach...walk to downtown shopping and restaurants.

I'll start with the positives. The room was spacious and spotless. And the location and (partial) ocean view were pretty good. However, if you're looking for a nice, relaxing, QUIET beach getaway, this is not the place for you. And, if you're looking for one of those hotels where you can open your balcony door and listen to the sound of the waves, I would look someplace else. There's a busy 4-lane road (PCH) that separates you from sand and surf. I guess what bothered me the most, though, was whenever I left my room, I kept on running into rowdy guests. I felt like I was on spring break. Not to mention the loud music and DJ's voice that reached my ears up on the 8th floor. At check-in, it would have been nice to mention that a wedding would be going on, and to give me the option

Stayed at the Waterfront Beach Resort for a few days recently.  Hotel was good but not great.  Clean and comfortable, but a bit tired.  Staff are terrific and really helpful.  They run a free shuttle down to Main Street once an hour (a local shopping area which specialises in touristy stuff and restaurants).  Easy to catch the shuttle to the shops, but not so easy to get back ... they forgot to collect us, as arranged.  Pool area is lovely at night, with lots of heating and yummy cocktails.    Beware the pillows!  They are soft, small and guaranteed to give you a sore neck the next morning.  Strongly suggest to BYO or go shopping when you get here!!  Otherwise, a good place for a relaxing couple of days.  Not sure about the value for money aspect - food is expensive and

After a few days in Anaheim, we knew we would want to stay at the beach for a few days. I read a lot about Huntington Beach and decided that is where we would stay. I had heard the Hyatt was great, but was full when I was booking, over 7 months in advance. After reading many reviews, we decided to book an ocean front room at the Hilton Waterfront, and I'm so glad we did. The room was very nice and clean, the view amazing, pool was amazing, we had a great time! They lent us beach chairs, sand toys and we found all of the staff we met very accommodating.  We would stay again in a heartbeat

Stayed here for 5 nights to attend a conference at the Hyatt Regency next door.  I'm a Hilton guy so chose this as a great option.  Overall the hotel is excellent for service.  The staff is one of the friendliest and most helpful of any property I've stayed at.    Why I didn't give the hotel 5 marks is because of the rooms.  They are remodeled and look great yet a few design flaws didn't allow this to be a GREAT room.  What specifically?  Noise between rooms is prevalent.  The rooms have wood and tile floors and there seems to be no noise reduction between rooms.  You can hear everything.  Also, it seems they skimped on the quality of the mattresses on the beds, or at least in the room I stayed.  Not the usual high quality box spring and mattress that most remodeled Hiltons have

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in a Great Location!
Summary: This is a first class hotel with reasonable prices situated right across from the Pacific Ocean.  The view is spectacular.  It is walking distance to beautiful Huntington Beach and Main Street, a cute little area of restaurants and shops.  We attended a Car Show on Main Street and there were lots of activities going on.  We also took the Catalina Flyer from nearby Newport Beach and spent the day on Catalina Island.  There is so much to see and do nearby!  The staff was outstanding!

We stayed here for the 1st time this month.Past visits we stayed at the Hyatt but when we went to book they had no resort view rooms left and the price at the Hilton was more in line with what we wanted to spend.  We got what appeared to be a remodeled room on the 3rd floor. Staff was very friendly. Not as spread out as the Hyatt or the grounds as lush but it is smaller. Due to the weather and being there midweek plenty of space at the pool even with one luncheon taking place.However if the whole pool is being used for an event as a prior reviewer noted that would be a minus. Maybe they will do what the Hyatt did several years ago and ditch the tennis court area for a 2nd smaller pool area As far as some minuses others have mentioned, yes they charge for parking but the Hyatt is

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, ocean views, but expensive.
Summary: Great location in Huntington Beach but you could find a better value at any number of beachfront hotels in California.   Parking fees were ridiculous, $36 per night, and the location of the hotel along PCH makes it difficult to eat or grab breakfast at places other than the hotel dining options.   For example, after a day at the beach you would need to walk about a mile round-trip to find a cafe or hassle with getting your car out of the valet to drive somewhere for dinner.   Also, no free breakfast. Room service fees are outrageous.

We stayed in a standard room on the 12th (highest) floor, which had been remodeled and -- as other have noted -- was generally very, very nice. The hardwood floors were a nice touch. The balcony, however, was tiny. They did fit two chairs and a small table on it, but then it was so cramped we could not walk between the table and either chair (had tro step over them to sit). Still, the view was exceptional, even from an "oceanview" room.  The hotel is very popular for weddings -- there were two in progress while we were there. Fortunately, these did not inconvenience us in any way.   The restaurant was really very good. The staff was especially nice, in general, as others have noted. The restaurant and cleaning staff were first-rate.  We did have two problems. First, if you look

For the most part the facility and staff are excellent, very accommodating and enjoyable. The upper floors have been remodeled and I would recommend staying in one of the newer rooms. The beach views are great, the boardwalk being just across the Pacific Coast Hwy..... a very enjoyable walk.  One word of caution about the handles on the furniture in the guest rooms, they tend to hook into clothes and tear pockets! I lost two pairs of Tommy Bahama shorts to the handles on the desk drawers so be careful. I mentioned something to the front desk clerk when I checked out. He said the information would be passed along to the manager.....have yet to hear back.    The fitness facility is about average for any hotel; a couple of ellipticals a couple of treadmills, free weights up to 40

Summary Heading: Some of the absolute best staff anywhere
Summary: Congrats on running a property where each and every staff member was happy, sincere, helpful, professional, and courteous.  Wow.  I'm an HH Diamond, been to hotels throughout this country, and I have never run into a better group of employees.  This includes time at other properties like Marriotts, Four Seasons, Ritz, Loews, The Wynn, etc.  From the parking attendants to concierge to front desk being helpful, to restaurants and cleaning staff, the gift shop, and the bartender and management.  The property is great with excellent beach location and near the happenings in Huntington Beach.  But the excellent and smiling staff made my business trip stay a success.  Bravo!

We stayed two nights in April in an 11th floor Oceanfront room.  These are the rooms that face directly out to the ocean.  The view was fantastic and the location is great.  You can walk across the street to the beach.  The hotel provides complimentary beach chairs, towels and toys which was unexpected and an added bonus.  The kids had a great time around the pool!  Other things to note $35 a day for parking.  They have a shuttle that takes you to main street in Huntington Beach, however, it is just as easy to walk.  Lastly, the beach has fire pits that are available on a first come first serve basis.  Pretty cool experience.

Summary Heading: Good, but don't bring the car
Summary: This was the final stop in our family's tour of Nevada and California.  Positives  Spacious room, great balcony view of the Pacific, fabulous pool area (great cocktails), friendly staff from bar to shop to check in, location.. Couldn't be better, I'd guess about a 60 second walk from the front door to the beach and about a fifteen minute walk to the Pier and Main Street.  Negatives   Wifi.. Should be included with the price people are paying, food in shades was hit and miss (although some great dishes and fantastic drinks selection)   The main issue we had.. Parking, $32 dollars plus per night to park is disgusting. We decided to park round the corner from the hotel.. For free. Completely safe and only a 5 minute walk away. No brainer.  Overall, a good experience. The hotel is

Very Helpful and friendly staff. Rooms tidy and clean. Easy access to beach and downtown shopping area.Good shuttle service provided on the hour. and the beach was just across the road and only one hour from LAX

Booked this hotel for a business conference.  Was pleasantly surprised with overall look and feel of the place.  Friendly, helpful staff may it easy.  Beautiful facilities including pool, hot tub and eating areas.  Location can be beat!

Summary Heading: Wonderful family stay with top-notch service!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 days/2 nights and had a really wonderful visit. Loved the Huntington Beach area and this hotel is very convenient to everything that the town has to offer. Great surfing within a few blocks and the fun Main Street area is a 5-minute walk. Pool and hot tub at the hotel is great, and the breakfast was convenient and delicious. Definitely check out their optional activity of S'mores on the beach--a big hit with the kids! Front desk and concierge staff were super helpful, from our initial contact all the way to our check out. I would definitely consider this hotel on our next visit to Huntington Beach.

Our family was there for a wedding the weekend of April 17th.  The entire staff could not have been any nicer. During the reception Tina took care of some of the tables. Unbelievable personality and service. She needs an award. The bell boys could not have not been nicer. Our only complaint was at the wedding cocktail party. One of the bartenders decided to card my daughter and her boyfriend. They both are well passed the age of 21. He would not serve them unitl they would go up to their room and get ID's which was on the 8th floor. As we waited and watched this same bartender did not once check or ask anyone else. I saw him serve a boy that I knew for a fact was not 21 but he didn't even ask for ID and this young man looked 19!!  I understand that bars have to do this but if

Summary Heading: The place to stay in Huntington Beach!
Summary: I have stayed at the Hilton Waterfront several times during the past few years (see other reviews), and each stay has been great. It's a beautiful property.  For this stay, I booked 5 nights so I could just settle in and relax.  As a Hilton Diamond member, I was treated to a nice upgrade to an oceanfront room. The room and the views were just great. There's nothing like sitting on your balcony and enjoying the California sunset.  The restaurant is still very good, and I appreciate that I can upgrade to the hot buffet breakfast with a modest charge. I always like to start off my days with some hot eggs.  Everything in the room worked very well, and the Internet service was very good by hotel standards.  Huntington Beach is a great place for a vacation, and the HWF is the place to

Summary Heading: We had an excellent Family Vacation
Summary: We choose "The Waterfront Beach Resort Hotel" for our Easter family vacation because of its proximity to the Beach and the Huntington Beach centre. The hotel offered all what you need to spend an excellent family vacation. The rooms are spacious, clean and very nice - with a great view on the Beach. The 'Shades' restaurant was nice and offered breakfast inside and outside (on fresher days with heating). The Service at this hotel is fantastic, from housekeeping, valet parking and guest services we experienced very nice, helpful and friendly staff. We will certainly come back to this hotel.

My first initial overview thoughts comes in mind is that the place is very clean. The conceige Rachel helped us very quickly with us finding an enterprise car service. She arranged everything with us giving her last minute request.  Impression of staffs were very friendly. Always said "hello" which was great start.  Room was cozy for 2. But when you are in Huntington Beach, you gotta take a breeze walk to the pier which only took about 10 minutes.  I definitely suggest checking out Ruby's diner which was at the end of the pier.

The staff was very welcoming from the minute we pulled into the drive! Only a half mile from the main street of Huntington Beach! Easy beach access! The only complaint I have is the shampoo, conditioner, soap, etc. were made in China! So, make sure you bring your own toiletries.

My family and I (husband and 2 teen kids) stayed at this resort for 6 days over Easter Holiday 2015. The location was the best part of this resort. It was between SanDiego and LA, so we had plenty of choices for day outings. The resort itself was good but not great. The rooms were smallish and the pool is way too small for the number of families that stay there.  The food was very good and the staff very friendly.  The beach across from the hotel was magnificent!!!! Huntington Beach is FANTASTIC. The beach itself is large and clean....The facilities placed along the boardwalk offer choices of food and drinks plus plenty of clean bathrooms.

Loved this motel, especially because it is directly across the street from the beach. And it has an excellent pool area which is relaxing to enjoy. Great beach view from all the rooms. Worth the money.

My family and I stayed at the Hilton for a weekend getaway and it was amazing! The hotel was very clean and the staff was excellent. They were very accommodating! We look forward to the next time we come back to Huntington! The hotel is located very close to the pier and is within walking distance. Can't wait to return!

Visited on a last minute local getaway and was pleasantly surprised on how nice the place was. the staff was great and helpful. I was surprised to see that this was a dog friendly hotel, luckily i'm a dog lover.  our only complaint was that our room smelled moldy and was a bit stuffy.  perhaps it was due to the air conditioner not really working. we asked for assistance to get the air working and they were unsuccessful in fixing it. Overall a good experience nice place, it would have been perfect if the rooms smelled better.

Summary Heading: I am ready to move in
Summary: Oh, I LOVED this place!!! Am seriously considering giving up the life of a lawyer to do anything at this Hilton.  The room was beautiful and had a great beach view.  The fitness center probably should be open 24 hours rather than from 5 am to midnight, but it was never crowded, so that was a plus.  Parking is strictly valet, which I actually don't really like (not a fan of having to ask for my car), but it was manageable for a couple days.  Across the street from the beach, great pool area, fantastic lobby, friendly staff.  Surf Hero Market might consider dropping the Starbucks, which, wherever one goes, is overroasted and just never good coffee.  Another peeve is the charge for (not particularly speedy) wifi.  I think that when guests are paying upwwards of $200/night, the wifi

Great grounds and location. Breakfast buffet was excellent. On a bad note, we could not use pool when we desired because of a wedding reception. Kids were disappointed. Wish we were advised ahead of time.

We finished up a Disney/Universal/Hollywood whirlwind tour at this property.  Had a fabulous time.  Amazing location, great pool, great hot tub, lovely balcony.  Had a real resort feel.  Average food, great service and incredible location.  Only problem was we only stayed one night!!!  We will be back for sure.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous property, great location, walk to beach.
Summary: So why three stars?  I have stayed here a number of times and it seems a little short on great customer service.  It is mainly evident in the restaurant/s where the food and service is consistently not so good.  Last time I was there, spoiled crab cakes were served.  Yuk. The chef and waiter should have known and thrown their bodies over them like they were live grenades. I could smell the bad fish from 30 feet away.  The rooms are pretty nice, loved sitting on the balcony at sunset.  Staying there again soon.  Other hotels sold out.

Summary Heading: Surprise Anniversary Trip to Beach and Disneyland
Summary: My husband booked a trip to CA for our anniversary as a surprise to me earlier this month.  He wanted to enjoy the beach while in the area and also spend a day or two at Disneyland, as any Disney park would be an ideal vacation for me.   I have visited Disneyland many times as a child while visiting relatives in Culver City & Whittier, and also as an adult, staying offsite at Good Neighbor hotels as well as onsite at Disneyland Hotel. The Hilton by far exceeded my expectations and I would return in a heartbeat! Though not located close to the park, the trek to Disneyland was short and easy - a simple drive (no freeway) and it was awesome to return to a non-hectic, relaxing vibe back at the beach after enjoying the attractions.   The staff at the Hilton was exceptional,

I will definitely be coming back here. Nice rooms, very cozy with ocean view balcony rooms. The food is really good. Sooo pet friendly. Took my dogs with me to the pool, gave me doggy treats with a bowl, only $50 pet fee. Love the pool area. Right across the street from the beach and a 10 min walk to main street. Male sure to check out surf city nights every Tuesday!!!

Beautiful property and very close to the beach.  I had booked a room with a "garden" view, but it ended up with both a garden and ocean view! Quiet room and very comfortable beds.  Of course, I enjoyed wearing the comfy robe provided in my room.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, clean rooms in great location
Summary: We stayed at the Hikton waterfront Beach Resort over a spring weekend.  The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable.  We asked for a high room when making our reservation but upon arrival were given a room on the second floor.  The hotel was full so they were unable to change it.  I mention thus because if you are sensitive to traffic noise and want an ocean view you should make sure to get a higher floor.  The traffic noise at night is very loud on the lower floor. That said, the staff was friendly, we lived the restaurant with cosy fire pits and a nice little coffee shop and gift store that sold Starbucks.

Good hotel in a nice location, PCH can be noisy at times but this did not affect the time spent their or the quality of our sleep. Rooms were clean and people friendly. Pool area pleasant (again a bit noisy) and food experience was good.

Summary Heading: Breathe in the Ocean, let the Stress Melt Away!
Summary: I am compelled to place this on tripadvisor because I had a fabulous stay and found the property to be well maintained with nice features and had a fabulous stay.  The room was average sized and had a comfortable bed with a nice working area.  The balcony (I believe all rooms have one) was fabulous and provided wonderful views of the Pacific (including a wonderful sunset...I would recommend staying on that side of the hotel.  The pool area was great and had a surprisingly hot, hot tub; I am used to hotels having just a warm tub, but this hot tub was done right!  The on site restaurant was decent and the staff was accommodating and courteous!  Of course, the prime feature of this hotel, its across the street from the beach.  Who doesn't want to jump into some crashing waves.

My fiancé got married on 3/21/15 and stayed for the two nights after in order to get away! We chose this location for it's amazing location. From check in to check out we were both blown away by the level of service that the hotel provided us. We had an amazing time and will definitely be coming back for over night stays very soon!

Stayed here for 3 nights for my friends wedding and just couldn't and still can't get over how nice and friendly everyone was, from the front desk, to the concierges, the bar and the ladies at the coffee/breakfast bar.  Bed was super comfortable, spacious and best of all clean.  Will not hesitate to come back!

This is a very nice hotel right across from the beach.  It has a beautiful outdoor pool and a large area with many chaise lounges.  The room was very nice - linens were superb.  Coffee maker and refrigerator.  The restaurant had excellent food and nice waitstaff.  It has a handy store for wine/beer/snacks.  It offers spa services - wish I had time for a massage!

You can't beat the location of this property for the price. Almost every room has a water view. They kindly upgrade you to a higher floor if you ask. They will let you check in early if the room is available. The food was excellent and the staff was very attentive. I asked house keeping to come late to make up the room after we all got ready for my daughters wedding and they happily obliged. I live near by but feel like I'm on vacation when I'm here.

Summary Heading: Good location and view, sub-standard everything else
Summary: We had a large block of rooms for a wedding in March. The location and views of the ocean are good, some other fundamentals (check in, check-out, valet) were average, and just about everything else left a lot to be desired for.   Pros - Location - Right in Huntington Beach, right across from the beach itself. If you go about a quarter of a mile down on the PCH you'll find some restaurants, shops, etc.  - View - Again, right near the water and the ocean. Our room had a clear view of it.  - Service - We had a large group so YMMV. Having said that, I had positive experiences with the front desk and valet folks.   Cons - Elevators - Not enough elevators considering the size of the hotel and the elevators move fairly slow. On one of the days the elevators broke temporarily. I

Summary Heading: perfect for business... and family vacation
Summary: During the week we used the hotel as our base for business meetings and  a tradeshow. But once work was complete, my family joined me for a fun filled weekend of beach,boardwalk, and pool fun in the sun.

Hotel was great! Right on the water, beautiful view, wonderful view of the ocean from the restaurant. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was great! Very comfortable bed! Everything was wonderful!

Summary Heading: Ocean Front Room: Obstructed View and Road Noise
Summary: Bottom line:  I recommend that travelers NOT patronize this hotel.    Hilton’s “make it right” policy is a false / deceptive / meaningless marketing gimmick that should be immediately terminated.  Hilton should have a “DO IT RIGHT” policy and then actually hold their employees accountable (i.e., fire employees and managers).  “Making it right” starts with the premise that Hilton intends to make mistakes and will contemplate fixing its mistakes only after people escalate their complaints to the corporate office.  Hilton charges a premium for Ocean Front rooms.  Palm trees obstruct the view of the ocean front rooms at least past the 4th floor.  Our room receives a lot of road noise from the busy Pacific Coast Highway that runs directly in front of the hotel.  And, you get a big
Manager Response: Dear TX_Trveler_2014,  Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We are not sure where the disconnect occurred that caused you to go the extra mile and contact Hilton Worldwide, but we are very glad you did. Internally, our Director of Operations will now investigate further and implement whatever changes are necessary to see that this does not happen again.   We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.   Thank you,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: You cannot beat the location or views of the beach from every room!  This resort was selected for a group event, which worked perfectly.  It's a great leisure property as well!  Ask for a room on the upper floors - better views!  The food was very good - you will love Shades Restaurant and Bar!  Very high energy, from the Sunday brunch (omg amazing - live music, etc.!) to casual drinks and apps in the evening!  The staff is great! Smiles, positive attitudes and willingness to assist! Clearly, this is a well-managed property!  The location is perfect for exploring the pier (do this on a Saturday or Sunday!  (so fun!) and the town of Huntington Beach. The town is a short walk but you can also catch the hotel shuttle if preferred!  You have to try U.S. Taco - great gourmet "casual"

Beware of parking excessive charge if you go over 3 hrs. while visiting or at restaurants. You wll be charged the full day charge of $15.00 even if validated. The resort is a beautiful, well located facility.

I booked the hotel as somewhat of a splurge as I was bringing my son during his Spring break to take him to the Amen Clinics in Costa Mesa.  So, I thought it would be a nice treat to have an Ocean view room. I was also hoping we might get an upgrade to an Ocean front room since I'm Hilton Diamond.  That did not happen and there is no executive floor.  The room had a great view and I enjoyed the sunset on Sunday evening. However, I didn't really consider that there would be so much construction noise from the hotel being built across the street. If I had known at checkin, I would have requested a room on the other side of the hotel.  This was the primary reason this hotel did not get a 4 star review.  So, my notion of enjoying a cup of tea on the balcony in the morning before
Manager Response: Dear MHB1971,  Thank you for your review and choosing The Waterfront for your stay. Our sincere apologies for the air conditioning and sound issues you experienced during your stay. Hilton Hhonors Diamond member or not, our experienced and seasoned guest services team take every issue seriously  and would have gone out of their way to accommodate your needs. Never hesitate to call on anyone of us should anything be less than excellent and we'll do all we can to "Make It Right".  Generally speaking, our neighbors construction has been a non-issue (with the exception of a few days here and there). They have been wonderful to work with and take our calls when ask if there is anything that can be done for the comfort of our guests. Their building is just about topped out now, so we think the worst has passed... WHEW!  Also, I'd like to thank you for idea of informing our guests more thoroughly about the busier times for valet services. While it may seem intuitive to the well travelled, your point of informing the guest of potential heavy usage peak times is something we can definitely do. Thank you!  All the best, and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Got problems... but solved most of them! Great place!
Summary: Although I had some problems with this hotel, I was very happy. The service was TOP NOTCH (for once). The bedding was great! The problems I had were:  1) The vent in the room (pictured) was pointed at the bed - at first, it was unbearable to lay in bed with that thing blowing on you like a tornado. I pointed the louvres up and problem was solved. Not a big deal. Thought I'd warn others about this  2) Our showerhead was TERRIBLE at first. It had great volume but sprayed EVERYPLACE. I complained on day 2 and they replaced the showerhead with a much less pressure one but worked much better.  3) I forgot a comb and they brought me one. That was nice but this was the cheapest $.01 comb I've ever seen - really almost unusable. Bought a comb that day. I didn't see if they charged our

Summary Heading: My Stay at the Waterfront Beach Resort, Huntington Beach, CA
Summary: Fabulous hotel, georgeous views of the beach, exceptional hotel restaurant, very friendly and helpful staff.  Drinking glasses in room not cleaned properly indicated by the presence of previous lip marks.

Staying here for several nights. Can't beat the location or the view! What really makes this hotel special, are the super-friendly employees. From the minute we arrived, each and every staff member has been very pleasant and willing to make this stay a pleasure. Nina, Michael, and Courtney are true examples of this. Pool area is quite nice, and the fact that the ocean is steps away, makes this spot a winner. The hot tub was not warm at all, so that was a bit of a let down - was told it needed to "reset" after some colder weather recently, so perhaps that is a one-time issue. Would love to see some type of recycling program here - saw lots of plastic cups and water bottles by the pool - all were thrown in the regular trash cans. Word of caution about this location - hotel is

My family and I stayed for the weekend and we loved it! It's a great location, close to the beach, and outdoor shopping area. The service was great, especially Ramil, he was amazing! He went above and beyond to make our stay memorable!

The hotel is great and the staff went the extra mile.  The workout facility is well appointed and the hotel is right across the street from the beach.  Also, it is only 2 blocks from Main Street in Huntington Beach.  The only thing I might think could be seen as a negative is that this Hilton location is very PET FRIENDLY and we saw many guests with dogs.  Not sure what that does to the rooms, long term.  But, the room we stayed in was very clean so I guess they are doing a good job in that department.  I will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Hotel is great, parking will cost you $245/wk
Summary: Parking is EXTREMELY expensive and valet parking is mandatory.  $32 / day + tip = $35/day x 7 days = $245/wk. That is a LOT of food and drinks... Other than the parking issue, service is good. The deal with the parking is that THEY DO NOT ALLOW YOU TO PARK YOUR OWN CAR, so you are forced to use valet. They charge $32/day and there is no other place to park near the hotel, because there are NO PARKING signs all around.
Manager Response: Dear Max,  Thank you for your comments. It is true that there is no self parking at any resort on the coast anymore (it is both a space AND liability issue that we simply have to manage) but you do have options, even when you are staying here on business.  Don't drive here in your personal vehicle if that's possible for you. Take a shuttle or taxi. Then, while here, arrange for a car via the concierge at rates that are no higher then those you will find at the airport. You have a car when you need it, a FREE shuttle downtown with  us anytime you want a ride, and no pesky parking charges. Additionally, you can find stay packages on our website that include parking (and breakfast and internet!). That is probably our most popular option for our guests.   Additionally, sign up for Hilton Honors and recieve TONS of benefits that sometimes include COMP parking at various properties and resorts. Get those points racked up and even your stay is free!  Valet-only is an unfortunate reality that, as innkeepers, we loathe as much as you. I don't like hearing about it all the time either, but it is the only solution to an overcrowded, lawsuit happy world we have to manage. My apologies that this was the one thing that stopped you from giving us a perfect score. I feel ya', I really do!  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Great for business and personal travel.
Summary: Great location, excellent service, nice place to call home on a business trip. As a frequent traveler this is one of the best hotel properties that I have stayed at. The bar and restaurant are top notch so there is no need to leave the property after a long day at the office. Additionally if you want to venture out, Main St. is only 3 blocks away with many excellent shopping, bars and restaurants to choose from. Tuesday nights on Maine St. there is a farmers market, street performers and vendors, with something for everyone.

Stayed here for three nights as part of a two centre half-term break.  Perfect location right on the beach which is beautiful. Rooms spotless and spacious with fantastic toiletries. Really comfortable beds. Don't forget to ask for complementary slippers. Lovely balcony -we opted to overlook the pier which meant you could see LA in the distance but you could also see the building works of a new hotel. Restaurant lovely, good menu and great quality dishes. All staff fantastic and really helpful very knowledgeable of area. They all made the stay special. Free buckets and spades for the children to use and beach chairs available for use whilst staying. The evening on the beach with private bonfire and food including marshmallows to toast is well worth it. Will definitely return.

This is a wonderful hotel. We had a great time and felt so taken care of by the staff.  The staff was so attentive and accomodating. The food was amazing, the rooms were beautiful and had great views. The hotel and room were pristine. When we asked for recommendations for dinner, the concierge was very helpful. We rented bikes from the hotel and the staff even offered to take our picture before we set out and gave us water for the journey. The breakfast we had in our room was delicious and right on time. We loved sitting outside of Shades and listening to a guitarist that was playing. Just a great hotel and experience. We are already trying to plan when we can come back!

The service and quality of our stay was excellent. The pool, food  and drink had exceptional value. Grounds and parking have been set up top accomodate the overall beach experience. Walking distance to pier and shops. Decor of rooms and hotel are first class.

My wife , dog and I had a great time. I have stayed at Ritz Carlton in Laguna Nigel, and the service here was even better. That says a lot about everyone. It did not matter who I approached, they were always willing to help, and also very gracious. We had left lights on in our car, and never used for three days, when We went to leave, the battery was dead. I asked for help and one of the managers, Trevor and Shane who worked at lobby entrance, got me a jump and quickly was on my way. This is true service, and this occurred at every step. When we checked in we received a goodie bag for our dog, wow, the area is easy to walk to restaurants, the beach is beautiful. Definitely going back there!

The hotel sits across from the sea along the coast in Southern California (Huntington Beach).  The view is absolutely stunning, the rooms lovely, the lobby and lounge area (that extends inside and outside) gorgeous.  The service is first class.  If you are interested in walking, you just cross the street and you are along the upper path or along the beach.  The famous Huntington Beach pier if about maybe a 10 minute walk north.  This is a great place for a business meeting or a personal get-away.

Nice hotel amneties. Location walking distance to beach makes hotel very attractive. Clean and well kept. Nice place to visit for a long weekend. Restaurant was not bad either, they had a good selection of food options.

One of the best hotels we've stayed in with our two kids (teen and preteen) the staff was so attentive - making sure the kids had all the things they needed for a fun day at the beach. Great Concierge staff who went out of their way to help - handed up water bottles before we left for a day on the town.  I was immediately looking at dates that we could return here when I got home.  Food at the hotel restaurant was great. The location was perfect.  Hotel Pool was really nice - never over busy.   My only complaints - I wish the rooms would have been two queen beds.  Two doubles was a little cramped.  The breakfast was a little pricey. The buffet was beautiful but it was on the expensive side for our family...some type of coupon or discount would have been nice for people staying
Manager Response: Dear KrysH131,  Thank you for your recent review...and we can't wait to have you back! By the time you get here the hotel will have completed the changeover from full size doubles to all double queens. You asked, we deliver! Also, on our website, look for the "Eat-Sleep-Surf-Park" package which includes everything you're looking for in a package PLUS parking!  Also (a quick advertisement here), from Memorial Day thru Labor Day our very popular Disney Shuttle returns. Free round-trip transportation to and from the park, twice daily, every day of the summer. Did I mention that its free for our guests? ;-)  Until your return, all the best to you and your family.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I Suprised my wife with a stay in an Ocean View room at this resort for Valentines Day. She was totally blown away and so was i. From the time we arrived the staff was Helpful and Curtious, we had an Amazing time we will definitely be back again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic getaway. Our stay was short only One night and we didn't have time to enjoy the Pool or the Spa, But we will for sure the net time we stay.

The location is beautiful!  I could see the mountains, the ocean and the pool from my room.  Morning walks on the beach before my meeting were a great way to start the day.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The meeting space pleasant.  Food served as part of the meeting and purchased on my own was good.

Summary Heading: We keep coming back and will continue to do so
Summary: We have been guests at the Waterfront Hilton for many years now and they keep delivering fantastic results. Just checked out and hated to leave! The views are fantastic, the rooms clean and very comfortable and the service is excellent. We were on the side facing the pier so had the benefit of seeing the beautiful sunset over the pier nightly. The valet parking is very expensive but at least they are prompt and courteous. They also don't seem to expect a tip, and are very gracious when tipped. The guest room interiors have been upgraded -nice granite in the bathroom and modern, sleek furniture in the room. The in room coffee is much better than the average and each room has a mini-fridge. Nice to have bathrobes and in room safes . We will be back. Kudos to the management team on

Lovely staff but the hotel looks like it needs a revamp. Its 19 years old and looks it. Our room was small and the bathroom was way too small. The food wasn't brilliant either. Great location though and the local nightlife and restaurants were awesome.
Manager Response: Dear Louise T,  Thank you for your review. As we enter our 25th year of beachside hospitality, I can assure you that service and comfort go hand-in-hand for us here at The Waterfront. While we won't be knocking down our tower anytime soon, we will abide by our core belief in continuous and ongoing upgrades (underway as I write this). From the new TV's installed in every room to recent redesign and complete enhancement of ALL of our Studio Suites, its just a matter of time (and how quietly we can move floor by floor as not to disturb you) before everything you see before you will illicit that jaw-dropping "WOW!". We hope to see you again soon... and we look forward to your next review.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I was here for a holiday party in December and decided to stay the night so I wouldn't have to drive home. Everything was perfect. The staff was on-point, friendly and professional. Joseph Boyer stands out especially for his efficiency and courteous disposition.  We stayed on the 12th floor and I was very impressed by how gorgeous the room was. I loved all of the sleek finishes, bathroom amenities and the Pacific Ocean view was absolutely stunning. From check-in to check-out, I felt relaxed and comfortable. By far, this is the nicest Hilton property I've ever stayed in.  The next morning we enjoyed coffee from the Surf Hero market outside by the pool and, since it was a chilly, they had the fire pits going. I could have sat there for hours.   All-in-all, our experience could not

Very accommodating to my son's allergies.  The hotel does allow dogs.  My son is extremely allergic to all animals.  Obviously it is very important for us to be in a room that dogs have not ever been in.  They set us up in a completely hypoallergenic room.  No carpets and no dogs can stay in those rooms.  The room was spotless.  Great location.  Right across from the beach.  Nice pool and hot tub.  Love the open fire pit for sunset.  Grab a glass of wine and a chair by the fire and watch the beautiful sunset.  The rooms have a coffee maker and a small fridge.  They accommodated a late check out so we were able to enjoy the beach the morning of our departure. Easy to cross PCH right outside of hotel at traffic light.  We rented bikes from Jacks.  Most places are the same rental

Summary Heading: Great location but really small beds in the double bed rooms
Summary: I stayed here with my two adult sons when we ran the Surf City Half marathon this year. The hotel is nice enough and the location is excellent for the race - right across from the starting line. When I made the reservations, I booked one room with double beds thinking that the room will have two queen sized beds, something that I've done with no issues for other hotels in other cities.  To my surprise, the beds were only full sized - much too small for two adults to share unless you enjoy sleeping really, really close to each other.  I've stayed a plenty of other Hilton brand hotels and never had this issue come up.  To the front desk's credit, they provided a roll-away bed at no extra cost. Nonetheless, I may try the Hyatt Regency just a block away next time we run a race in
Manager Response: Dear Timothy F,  The Queens are on the way! (And no, we don't mean Elizabeth or Victoria). You let us know and we listened...so queen beds it will be for all of our doubles. Our rooms division has already ordered the replacements for every room in the hotel and we anticipate the delivery and complete change-out to be done before Memorial Day. I'll close with one of my favorite hospitality phrases I use every day, but that today has even more reason to make you smile, "Is there anything else I can do for you?".  All the best, and we'll see you in a month or two (you can hang up on The Hyatt now).  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed for a conference. Beautiful property with lovely views and sunsets.  Across Hwy 1 from the beach.  Pool area is beautiful with a variety of lounging areas that overlook the ocean. The hotel is old style luxury but has been kept up to date with clean and spacious rooms. Rooms have huge framed floor to ceiling mirrors that add a nice touch.  Service from everyone from front desk to restaurant staff and housekeeping was excellent.  10 minute walk to pier and downtown HB.

Comfortable and friendly. Not a luxurious hotel, but very clean and well cared for. Loved staying here before and after running the Surf City Marathon. Loved sitting by the pool and being able to look out at the ocean.

Summary Heading: Beautiful ocean view, close enough to hear the surf
Summary: The hotel was very nice.  Starbucks market for breakfast if you don't want the delicious buffet. Lunch and dinner at the restaurant were very good. If you get an upgrade to oceanfront rooms, they are close enough to hear the waves.  Although, the rooms are also close enough to hear more traffic.  Even if you close the doors, the view will be worth the extra expense, which is not much.  We LOVED having the bikes to use to get all around town or to the next towns.  Minimal charge.  The Waterfront also has a deal with a surfer instructor outfit to let you use the bikes to get to the lessons.  Tory and Phil were great instructors!  We are not animal people so the "we allow dogs" accommodation made us a little nervous.  Like the place would be overrun with pets.  Certainly not the

The hotel was beautiful, just across the street is a wonderful clean beach.  I would go again the rooms are large and very clean.  Just a short walk from the Pier and close to all the downtown shops bars and Restraints.

Summary Heading: Large Customer Event with a few bumps.
Summary: What a great outcome and feel to this hotel.  We had a few bumps with rooms to begin with, once we got those handled the rest of the events went great.  The food was fantastic, the employees were well trained and helpful.  While we were staying it happened to be the same weekend as the Surf City Marathon which woke us up way to early in the morning. My only complaint would be the cost of the a 12 pack of beer for my suite with nearly 80 dollars for Coors Light which is a little extreme considering you can buy a 12 pack at the local liquor store for $10.00. That was upsetting, and since we paid for everyone's room, people with Hilton Honors accounts weren't credited with there points or stays which I don't understand.  This happened to me also, which still needs to be resolved.

We have stayed here every year for the past 5 years and the service has improved over time. Our excellent stay began with Jason welcoming us and engaging us in friendly discussion. He made sure to help us with our bags and direct us to the front desk.  Then, our front desk check in (and check out) was conducted flawlessly by Matt (?) the desk manager.   Our ocean view room, facing the pool area, was clean, beautiful, and quiet! We especially like the location-right across the street from the ocean/beach and right at the starting line for the Surf City Marathon. We also like the fridge in the room which is perfect and big enough for storing bottled waters and some celebratory sparkling wine.  The Surf Hero cafe service is always friendly and this time we took advantage of their

Summary Heading: Fabulous Views, Walking distance to places
Summary: We were in Huntington for one night due to having a business lunch the next day.  We live in on the coast in California, but staying at the Hilton Waterfront was a mini-vacation.  We had room with a balcony over looking the ocean.   The sunset was spectular.  The room was very comfortable, clean and more room than we normally need.  It was an easy walk to the pier and restaurants & shops.   There is a nice happy hour in the hotel bar with good price drinks and delicious food.   Our room included breakfast which was tasty.  You could either have the buffet or order off the menu.  We ordered off the menu and had a delicous eggs, bacon, toast breakfast.   the staff was very friendly.  When we want another mini-vaction on the coast of California, this will be the place we will go.

I experienced first hand what tourists from other cities and states experience and was very impressed. Your service catered to people that came here to see a beautiful beach and experience beach city life. Thanks for helping make HB a well visited city!

The property and the rooms are amazing.  The staff is very friendly and they greet you as soon as you pull up. The breakfast was first class, great assortment of food. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

The hotel itself is a true gem. Beautiful, clean and with gorgeous views. But truly the staff are the real precious jewels here. Everyday we were greeted with smiles! A santa ana came in that night and my husband woke early with a terrible migraine. One call and the concierge brought ibuprofen up to our room for us! We also left behind some important items in our rooms and within minutes they had them and mailed them back to our house. Every staff member was truly wonderful and we would recommend this hotel to everyone.

I paid $379 a night for a studio "suite" that was really nothing more than a standard room.  It had no microwave, a mini-fridge with no kitchen, and there was constant construction and remodeling being done at night in the rooms around us.  At the high rate I paid, I still had to pay $30 a day to park my vehicle, and another $30 a day to access the internet.  The pool would have been nice, had there been no construction crew outside tearing up the pool pavement.  This is one of the worst Hilton Resorts I have ever stayed in, and will not go back unless it was free.  I recommend the Hyatt next door, or staying in a different hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Joshua V,  Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience our pool deck remodeling may have caused. Renovations are painful no matter when you do them, but to maintain the outstanding appearance of our hotel year after year it is something we must endure. Our apologies. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. Also, we do no renovation work at night in or around guest rooms (and no hotel should). Please do not hesitate to contact us immediately if anything is disturbing your stay.  Also, please review your final bill again. If you were charged $30 for internet access, that is an error. Internet access in the guest tower is optional and only $14.95 per day. Please call us and we will remedy any incorrect charges immediately. Our goal is to "Make It Right"... no matter what it takes.   We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.   Thank you,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The view is amazing! Our room was huge, the bed was comfortable, the service was wonderful. The pool is big and has a fun atmosphere. The location is great. Main Street is a small walk away, and the beach is right across the street from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

Because I travel a lot and have so many choices of hotels, a hotel has to meet specific criteria for me to stay more than once.  This resort hotel hits the criteria and then some out of the ballpark!  Our second and recent stay was just as lovely as our first.  Both the exterior and public space interior give a palatial appearance.   Unlike most other hotels in that area and elsewhere, every room on floors 1-12 has a private patio with a view of the Pacific ocean. The rooms are well kept by the always accommodating housekeeping staff who will service rooms until 4 p.m.  Then, a another gracious staff member goes door to door in early evening to provide last minute needs like bags of ice for drinks, extra towels, etc.  The beautifully landscaped pool and restaurant are uniquely

My husband and I just got back from our 3rd trip to Huntington Beach staying at the Hilton Waterfront resort. We fell in love with this little town and this great hotel back a few years, and have tried to make it for a quick trip each January.   Our favorite room so far has been a 3rd floor room, facing the pool.  We had 12th floor, facing the room, but on the lower floors you can see the beach while still in bed. Higher floors you just see the sky.  This time we did Ocean Front, 9th floor, and I will go back to pool facing. The sun was blinding as it dropped in the afternoon, and we had to close the shades -- where is the fun in that!  Our room would also be hot, I would guess from the sun beating in.   We love Shades and do breakfast there. It didn't always have the buffet and
Manager Response: Dear MelissaKS22,  Your kind words have warmed us all today! I just wanted to share our staff's appreciation. It really made their day to see that.   And please contact me personally for your next stay... we have a little surprise in store for such a loyal guest like you!   All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I have stayed from Jan 16-18 with some friends and coleagues for a business and leasure. We orderd in the Restaurant "Shades" some Crab meat balls- awefull Fish meat were served. Send back to kitchen! The steak and Fish we had as a  main course- was uneatable-  More than poor!!! Try to get pepper out of the shaker-  not possible- holes to small for the pepper. Poor and unfriendly service. The Hotel new that we will come for dinner (26 guests) nothing was prepared- the heater were brought almost after we had dinner!   The Safe in the room were still closed from the guest before! Clean was only the bed. Dust all over- hair in the shower and in the sink! At breakfast same Service - NONE- had to wait 15 min before I could get a coffee. The buffet had some hot dishes- always COLD -
Manager Response: Dear Tommi61,  Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for your disappointment with your experience in Shades Restaurant. I was quite taken aback and immediately alerted all captains and managers to your review. It is obvious this experience colored the remainder of your stay and this is simply not a true "Waterfront" way.    We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider giving us another chance the next time your travels bring you to our area. I welcome the opportunity to personally "Make it Right" for you.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Our stay experience was excellent in every way.  Staff attentiveness throughout (valet, front desk, restaurants, and especially concierge) was terriffic.  Hotel location overseeing "surfer city" was unique in relaxation and entertainment.  Also the boardwalk and nearby pier are so convenient for leisure walking or running.  The hotel is also just half mile form Main Street and all fun activities there.

This is a great hotel in a great location.  The rooms are very nice and clean, nice lobby, restaurant and pool facilities were fantastic and beach is across the street.  Our family had a great long weekend vacation here.  Would definitely come back here.

The hotel was so beautiful and very clean. All of the staff was so friendly. This was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had! We had excellent help with our bags as we were greeted by Trevor in valet. Sarah at the front desk checked us in and was very friendly. Daniel was also very welcoming. The room was perfect with a wonderful ocean view.  We loved everything about our time there and am highly recommending it to everyone we know. Thank you Hilton for a fabulous stay!

Summary Heading: Quick overnight stay but just great
Summary: The one night we had was a perfect end to our Company Holiday party.  The room was great, we were on the 10th floor, love the new furnishings and the room service breakfast this morning was great.  Last night we sat at a packed bar and the two bartenders were great and offered excellent service even though they were slammed.  Valet was prompt and the car was ready for my departure as promised.

We are here now. I can't even begin to say how disappointed with our stay! There is a convention here and it is very noisy! We paid for a beach view room and are located over the pool. It is extremely noisy with the convention! My husband and I can't sleep and it sounds worse than teenagers on spring break! I would never stay here again!! Will choose the Hyatt next visit!!
Manager Response: Dear nSeal2018,  Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. Sometimes guest/group interaction doesn't always come off as we hope or desire. I am very sorry for that. Please never hesitate to contact us if you are being disturbed. Often our security team can correct the situation in a matter of minutes if we're made aware.   We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We stayed at this beautiful hotel for 2 nights. All staff was very friendly and very helpful.  I want to give a special shout out to the valet staff working on the weekend of January 17-18 Luis and Sean were the names I could remember they were super helpful and our car was ready every time we called. Super fast and very helpful with directions and recommendations :)   The McCurry family gives them 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Spent a week at this very nice hotel. My only complaint is being able to hear people shower from the room next door. Every room has a beautiful view of the ocean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. For the price of the stay free wifi should have been provided.

I stay here whenever the GSA rate is available.  It  is a fantastic value.  Very attentive staff, short walk to downtown HB, close to the beach, and well equipped facilities.  This review must have 200 charactiers minimum.

Summary Heading: Hilton has your back! Always there to support you in any case!
Summary: I really want the Hilton Corporation to know that the people who supported us in our stay were no less than phenomenal.  The Bell Staff and especially Nick were tremendous in supporting our family in moving a ton of stuff for our wedding to and from our room. The concierge and valet Smeer was very helpful in arranging a valet shuttle ride to the beach for our wedding party.  We were so happy to spend our 25th wedding anniversary and renewal of our wedding vowels with Hilton. They had really made a difference. We started on the beach and were rained out half way through our wedding, and were able to have most of our gests join us back at our suite which had plenty of room for all. These types of people that work for Hilton are the reason why I choose to stay on business or

You just can't go wrong at the Hilton Waterfront.  Lovely hotel, (mostly) wonderful service, great location.  Enjoyed our stay for a mother-daughter weekend!  Couldn't use the pool as it rained while there but it's beautiful.  The breakfast was top-notch and workout room was adequate for our needs.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Will definitely return.

Staying at The waterfront resort is a MUST on my travels! I feel so welcomed and cared for. Its a must for everyone who comes to southern California. The Sunday Brunch is stellar and the room views are magnificent.

Summary Heading: Great place, but not the best if traveling with a pet.
Summary: I had a good overall experience. The only two things that I wasn't happy with was paying $32 for valet parking, and not having a choice to self park, and the fact that there was really no place for my dog to go to the bathroom. It was a pet friendly hotel other than that.
Manager Response: Dear Anthony T.,   Thank you for your recent review... and we're so glad you were able to bring your best friend along with you! Here at The Waterfront we provide you with complimentary pet waste disposal bags (both at the front desk and via our stand at the end of our valet drive) for your convenience. That said, so long as you are a responsible pet owner (and it sounds like you sure are!), you can use any green space around the hotel. We don't have a designated space, per se. We trust you and your buddy to decide what works, so long as it is outside and on a green space. We love our furry friends and know each one is different... so we let you two work out the details :-)  As for parking, such is the nature of any coastal resort. With both space and liability concerns in mind, we have found that 24 hour, full access "in/out" valet parking was the only solution. Our promise to you: Safe, secure, covered parking for your second best friend while here at the Waterfront!   All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: great service, great in room dining (fast and DELICIOUS), pool awesome...and you are a two minute walk to the beach  clean rooms, comfy beds - ocean view was beautiful (we watched the sunset every night from our room)  expensive for a family

We've stayed at that hotel a couple of times during the last years and it's always a pleasure. This time our room keys were ready as we stepped through the door (we had checked in online the day before) and they were presented together with a letter and two bottles of water in a cute little bag be the supernice receptionist.  The location right at the beach is still perfect and we like the proximity to the pier, the Main Street Shops and Dining options.   The rooms mostly have sea view and are very spacious and clean, the gym is okay and sufficient. Go outsode for runs or walks along the beach :).  We love the pool area and the jacuzzi, it's a great place to sepnd the afternoon.   What still "annoys" us a bit are the high valet parking Prices.  We'll definitely be back, it's our

When my tired, aching family each took our shower; angels from heaven began to sing.  It was spiritual. Seriously though, it was a gorgeous hotel. Excellent service all the way around. I would highly recommend them.  And if you have a problem, they fix it immediately.

My husband and I stayed at this resort one night and we definitely will return. We can see the whole Huntington Beach shoreline from our room - It was a wonderful  picturesque. The floor is wood and it was perfect for my allergy. The valet staff were friendly and efficient. This hotel is dog friendly so it was perfect for our dog. It has a very nice area to walk dogs and the hotel offers services to walk dogs or even dogs sitting. We will try this service next time. Shades restaurant on the 1st floor has great ambiance and the hostess was professional and sweet at the same time. She was very accommodated. The food was excellent. I wished we could stay longer - maybe Next time. It is definite a 5 stars of everything: friendly staff, cleanliness, ambiance, location, roomNext time.

Summary Heading: The Romans Love it... so do I, for the most part
Summary: Each year, my Roman Italian in-laws ask me to book a room at this hotel when they come for their yearly visit.  My father-in-law always wants a king executive suite with the panoramic ocean view as high up in the building as possible.  Each time I book this trip, it is difficult to achieve this goal. This year was great, we were 8 stories up. Each time (this time) I inquired about this request, I was told, "We cannot promise any room. We see your request, but we cannot promise any room.  Anything could happen, a pipe could burst." I was actually told that twice this time.  I called ahead of time, arrived early, was very cordial, but not really appeased much.  But, we did eventually stay on the 8th floor (my family of 3 in another regular room).  Also, I did request early check

More than met our expectations. Although there was a bit of a mishap because the pool heater was not working, the staff was more than accommodating and provided a solution. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Thanks again, to Ajit and Ms. Fisher!

We stayed at the Waterfront the few days prior to Christmas.  It was out fortune to be upgraded to an Ocean Executive Suite facing the beach.  The facilities were immaculate and that is often not easy in a beach town!  Staff we're warn, friendly and excellent.  This property is going to,stay on the weekend get away list as a keeper!

After staying at the OMNI in San Diego we we looking forward to the same sense of luxury at this hotel - especially as the rate for the same package (eat/sleep/park) was $55 more per night. Unfortunately this hotel fall a little short.  The rooms felt dated and and the bathroom floor was very "spotty" so it did not feel real clean.  The breakfast service on Sunday lacked the staff to support the crowd - we asked twice about a heater and finally had to roll one over ourselves. Location was great  so it did have that going for it.  Very walkable to main street and the beach was right across the street.
Manager Response: Dear shooz1Va,  Thank you for your feedback. Your title "Just OK" caught our attention immediately as this is certainly far less than our team strives for at every turn. We made sure your review was shared in the morning huddles and stand-ups of our various departments... and they were in turn challenged to find every way possible to "Make It Right", as our motto states. I sincerely apologize for letting you down, even in the smallest of ways, and would ask that you please contact me personally before your next stay in Huntington Beach. I would like the opportunity to show you who we really are and go from just "OK" to "OH WOW!".  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing  The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: This Hilton is average - ok service, but prepare to share your pool time or using the elevators with huge wedding parties. Breaksfast is for free - but just for coffee&cookies in the shabby cafe, if you prefer normal (eggs etc) breakfast in the normal restaurant - prepare to pay in full. Small things could do the altitude.
Manager Response: Dear alexzhdanov,  I would like to thank you for your review here on TripAdvisor. It was a bit of a challenge locating your dates of stay, but as I remind our team daily, "Whether yesterday or a year ago, the guest experience is everything to us!"...and thus was able to piece together a snapshot of the weekend you were here in October of 2014.   In fact, yes, we were very busy with wedding parties here at the resort that weekend. I apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you. As a destination wedding location, we do tend to get many more guests who are actually staying with us and who are not just coming for the festive event. It looks as tho this may have been the source of some of your disappointment, and I regret that.   As for the continental breakfast in our Starbucks/ Surf Hero Market, this has become an internal topic of conversation for our .com team. You had booked our hotel and this package via an outside vendor, and we can see your point. We're currently researching better ways to handle foreign voucher systems and will come upon a solution to satisfy all involved. Thank you for letting us know about the problem.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Beautiful hotel, great room, great view, great staff, close to downtown Huntington Beach and the pier. Would love to stay again. The only disappointments were the mandatory valet service and the room temp was a little hard to control but that would not prevent me from staying here again!

Summary Heading: Very friendly and happy staff/ Beautiful
Summary: The hotel is in a great location. Our balcony view of the HB Pier and ocean was great but what made our experience great was the staff. They were not only friendly but seemed happy to assist. This seems rare today so I hope it continues in the future. We will definitely stay there in the future.

Excellent hotel in Huntington Beach. Very short walk to the beach and the hotel has everything you need. Check in was fast and effective and they gave us a little care package for our dog.  Even during a busy time of year the Hilton did very good with customer service.  This is by far one of the best hotels in Huntington Beach

Summary Heading: Wonderful Weekend Getaway with the Kids!
Summary: We were very pleased with the level of service this hotel offered.  They treated us like celebrities!  Ramel, Annica, Matt and Nick were just to name a few that provided excellent service.  The rooms were large enough for a family of four considering we did not get a suite.  Queen-sized beds would have been better, but I'd rather have more space in the room.  The views were spectacular from our balcony.  I recommend getting up early to see the sunrise.  Get the s'mores wagon for an evening treat on the beach...very unique since most California beaches do not allow fires.  Huntington does!  Reserve it in advance ( I didn't know this when I requested one as we were leaving to go to the beach, but Annica happily got it ready for us anyway).  The 32.00 a day parking is a bit steep,

This is an excellent hotel.  Lobby is inviting, well laid out.  Front desk staff was amiable, but not as nice as many Hilton Gardens I have recently stayed at.  Extra costs for everything makes this a bit pricey for business and the average person.  Parking is valet and an extra daily charge.  Internal restaurants are expensive and the free breakfast is take away muffins, donuts, yogurt, coffee, etc.  The $11 allowance didn't cover a coffee and muffin, so be prepared!  Rooms are comfortable, not overly spacious, but were adequate for a solo business traveler.

I have stayed at this hotel in the past and enjoyed it but this last trip after recommending this property to several associates when we arrived we were greeted buy a very rude woman at the front desk when we were checking in I asked about complementary breakfast that seems to be the norm and I had been offered when I made the reservation,  she rudely says I will sell you the breakfast vouchers for 30.00 each right in front of everyone and they only cover the Continental breakfast far from what I expect of a property like this if she did not want to honer what I was told when I made the reservation fine just sorry but try a hustle me 30.00 for a bagel and coffee just made whole stay bad I did not even want to go back to front desk again especially if had friends with me I want
Manager Response: Dear Gregory B.,  I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I'm very sorry for the disappointing service that you received; I will make sure to address these issues with our staff. This is most certainly NOT who we are or the kind of service expected from a Waterfront associate, especially at that first point of contact with the front desk. Exceptional guest service is the foundation of our brand promise and your feedback helps us to improve. We hope you will stay with us again the next time you travel to the area.  Thank you,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Location is perfect, across the street from the beach with unbelievable unobstructed views of the ocean. Very comfortable and well decorated rooms. Excellent food at the dining facilities and a very helpful, friendly , above and beyond service staff. The pool and grounds are beautiful and wind protected, a very nice gym. Easy walk to the Huntington Beach pier and downtown area.

Booked a King Oceanview Room, but was upgraded to a King Ocean Front Room for $20. Room was very nice and the view, especially of the sunset was fantastic! *BE ADVISED - the ocean front rooms are right on PCH so there are vehicles passing all day and night. You can hear the ocean in between the road noise, but we ended up closing the sliding door in the middle of the night because the road noise was too much despite being able to hear the ocean at times. We also had dinner @ Shades and the food and drinks were outstanding!

Stayed at this hotel in October and it was a very pleasant experience - from the valets, to the front desk people to the bartenders  - everyone was very nice and accommodating.  The rooms are very nice and beds are comfy.  Pool was relaxing and the hot tub there was as well.  We were able to rent bikes from the hotel and ride down to Newport Beach - price not too bad.  The hotels rooms price are a little high if you are used to cheaper hotels, but you get what you pay for and it was worth it. We were able to walk to the beach and even to the stores/restaurants in the area (a little bit further of walk though).  There are firepits on the beach and the hotel offers various packages if you want to use them at night (smores, etc.). Breakfast from the restaurant was super yummy - you

Company party was in one of the banquet rooms. Hotel staff was very accommodating and very helpful. Upgraded to a room with a view, was pleased with the upgrade. For a night away in the same city where I live was everything I needed

Summary Heading: Great Location- Every Room Has a View
Summary: I stayed here a long time ago and it is still nice. The staff are friendly and they have a shuttle at night to downtown. The rooms are recently renovated and have a cool beach theme to them. My only recommendation or complaint is that as a Hilton Gold or Diamond member you get a breakfast voucher for $10 to the gift shop which has no hot food but only muffins. Right next door is their restaurant which serves a modest breakfast buffet. Really you can't let us eat that like 95% of the Hilton Brand hotels do??

I came with my family to run the Surf City 10K. The price and location of this hotel cannot be beat. Hands down. The day we arrived, there was a wedding in the pool area, so we weren't able to swim. With two small children, this was kind of a bummer. The ocean is right across the street, so we took our girls over there and build a bonfire and made s'mores with them. That was a blast. There are tons of restaurants within just a few miles to eat at and you can walk PCH to enjoy the ocean breeze. The room itself was updated and clean. It had a balcony facing the ocean and a great view. We had a great time at this hotel. I only took away one star because the valet service to check in was very long and with so many people there working, I couldn't understand why. It seemed many of

We stayed here for the very first night of our delayed honeymoon. We were upgraded to a waterfront room which had a phenomenal view of Huntington Beach. Our room was beautiful and spacious and the hotel amenities were great. We had breakfast both days of our stay at the hotel restaurant and I used the gym facility. Short walk to shops and other restaurants.  We found the hotel staff very welcoming and helpful and will definitely stay again in the future. Thankyou for everything it was perfect.

No comp breakfast.  Parking very expensive.  Heat/air system  fair.  Bed only fair. Service good.  Good location near beach.   Food within one half mile walk.  Peer area interesting.  TV control slow response.
Manager Response: Dear Dennis M.,  Thank you for your recent review. Here at The Waterfront, every guest experience is important to us. We will send your observations onto the appropriate department heads and see if there is anything we can do to "Make It Right" for your next stay with us.  Best wishes,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The Hilton is a great brand and the hotel staff was excellent.  I attended my wife's company holiday party in the ballroom located on the 1st floor.  The oceanfront rooms are amazing.  Absolutely no waiting for the valet, bellhop, reception and elevators.  It was like the staff anticipated our every move.  This hotel and staff is worthy of my highest endorsement.

After reading so many glowing reviews, I was expecting to be blown away.  We have stayed at the Hyatt next door and if I had to do it all over again, I would stay there instead of at the Hilton.  Right off the bat - valet parking - $32.00.  Checkin was great which I did online via email the day before so all I had to do was pickup keys and was on my way.  Room on 5th Floor (513) with a teeny balcony but you could see the ocean to the right.    Room was fine, bathroom was too small and I kept backing into the toilet when I used the sink (odd).  Bed was comfy and the nightstands had motion activated lights which were cool when using the bathroom in the middle of the night.  Shower was lo-flow and horrible.   Room service for breakfast the next morning on our way out and wow, I
Manager Response: Dear Ginger G.,  Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. we greatly appreciate that. I am sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with your entire stay. I understand that parking rates were an issue for you, but please keep in mind that we fully transparent about valet parking at the hotel (on our websites, confirmation letters, etc.). Valet parking at above mentioned competitor hotel is $35 per night. If you're coming to the beach (or any resort hotel for that matter), parking is always a challenge. We are in the tough position of offering you 24 hour access to your vehicle and comprehensive security during your stay. I would, however, like to point out that we do not have a resort fee of any kind...and no plans to do so anytime soon. The same cannot be said by most coastal resort hotels.  I am very disappointed to hear that you were not happy with your room service and I sincerely apologize. This is unacceptable and will be addressed with the kitchen and operations staff immediately. Within the Hilton brand of hotels, we strive to "Make It Right" no matter what the issue. Do not hesitate to let us know right away, for any reason, a problem or concern while you are staying with us. We will do everything to correct the problem to your satisfaction promptly, I assure you.  I would like to invite you back and ask that you contact me personally and give us the chance to really knock it out of the park for you. It would be my pleasure to do so!  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The Waterfront Beach Resort was a good stay for a couple night business trip in the area.  The location certainly is a huge plus;  most rooms have balconies with an ocean view, so that definitely cannot be beat.  It is also a quick walk to the beach (with a traffic signal right in front of the hotel to facilitate crossing the Pacific Coast Highway), and a realtively easy walk to the "downtown" Huntington Beach area.  The rooms themselves were in good shape.  My room had laminate wood flooring in the living area, with stone tile in the bathroom and foyer area.  It looks like the rooms were recently updated, and definitely served their purpose.  There was more than enough roomf for myself and my belongings, and enough "charging" outlets near the bed for various e-devices.  I had

We visit Huntington Beach annually to visit family there and the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort is our place. We are usually there around Thanksgiving or Christmas when the hotel is festively decorated in addition to the otherwise lovely decor.
