The rooms are large and comfortable and well appointed, and with Hilton Gold extra amenities are usually in upgraded view rooms, bottles of water and complimentary breakfast which includes their great granola and muffins. It's a bit of a splurge price-wise when you add in the valet parking, but worth it for the ocean views and excellent service and ability to host our family that lives in Huntington Beach at their restaurant (separately reviewed).

I booked a double bed room. Everything about the hotel was great. A few things I thought might make my experience a tad better but wont alter me staying again. The pool/hot tub closes at 10pm, a little later would be nice. And there is a full length mirror in the room but its beside the bed. Placing it somewhere you could actually see your self at full length would have been nice.

The hotel's location was unparalleled. Our room had a wraparound balcony with views of the ocean and the mountains. It was breathtaking. The hotel was gorgeous the staff was super attentive. We are going back as soon as possible. Our new favorite destination.

Great property - small boutique hotel with awesome service.  Room with ocean view - wonderful.  Comfy bed, good bathroom.  Quiet.  Decent breakfast in Shades cafe near pool.  Wonderful to walk to beach & enjoy SoCal.  Only gripe: very expensive valet parking charges.  We will return.

Summary Heading: Comparable to luxury hotels in London and Paris
Summary: I stayed here for a four day conference and just loved this hotel.  the service was superb, my room with a view of the ocean was magnificent, the area restaurants were delicious, and the special event they planned for us with a catered dinner on the beach with evening campfire was a memory I will never forget.

The view of the Pacific was beautiful.  The room was quite clean and comfortable.  I loved the balcony which I enjoyed immensely.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The beach is a walk away from the resort.  The food was excellent.  There were many amenities of which I did not avail myself but wish that I had, such as the pristine heated swimming pool.  I hope to return again.

Summary Heading: Location is great, need attention to details.
Summary: The location was a great ocean view even though it was only a partial ocean view. This was the most expensive hotel that we stayed in during our trip and it was actually the least updated one, unfortunately.   They need to pay attention to details.  Our bathroom door had something either sprayed on to it or spilled on it as well as the closet door and the room side of the bathroom door.  Not sure what it was, which was disturbing to me because I'm sorta a germ freak anyway.
Manager Response: Dear Tammy R,  Thank you for your comments. We take to heart our guests point of view and the business they grant us... and completely understand "value for what is paid for" as a core concept. If ever you are not satisfied with your accommodations, do not hesitate to ask for a new room. We will do everything in our power to meet or exceed your expectations, no matter what it takes.  Currently a substantial number of our rooms and suites are quietly undergoing major renovations. You will be duly impressed with what you see, feel, and experience while you are here. Feel free to contact me before your next stay with us and I will see to it we give you the very best we have to offer. I welcome the opportunity to have you back and to be given another chance to "Make It Right".  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: the best hotel ever, staff was the best, felt like we were so pampered, view was great, the whole hotel was beautiful, we will be back, restaurants had the best food. I would tell my friends about your hotel

I don't know where to start...Matt and Joseph were great! they booked us in room 726.  Awesome view! the room was perfect, a little sitting room, wet bar, spacious bathroom.  Every area was very clean. My only complaint would be the bed was too soft.  Joseph was very attentive with emails. I requested a reservation with Shades and he had Mitchell contact me. Shades was OK, crab cakes tasted more like tuna then crab. but service was spot on.  I will try to send a 'thank you' to those we were involved with.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, Catalina suite, and better vibe than the Hyatt a few doors down
Summary: It's our Thanksgiving break and what better way to spend it on the beach getting your tan.  the Hilton waterfront in right across the street.  How does it compare to the Hyatt? We usually stay at the Hyatt but decided to spice things up this time around by going to the Hilton. Each staff member we met at this place was friendly.  The check in was fast, easy, and accommodating.  The Catalina suite was a room with stunning views and plenty of natural lighting.  I did wish the guest toilet had a fan, the smell stayed after bro went to use it.  The gym facilities are great and cozy. The hot tub --yes and hot! The restaurant Is  great and has happy hour :) the surrounding guests were easy to talk to, curious, and friendly.  This place is great for families,  friends, and couples.

This property is everything you expect for the price.  Service, location and cleanliness.  Very nice place to stay.  Service was first-class from prior to check-in (concierge) to check-in (desk staff, valet) to every other amenity on the property. Location is excellent... right across from the beach with easy access and a short walk to the Huntington Pier, boardwalk and shops.

Despite being on an upper floor there was quite a bit of street noise and. The toilet was loud and would run randomly throughout the night. The air conditioning was louder than most. We changed rooms after two nights but were put in the adjoining  room where we still heard the toilet running at night. We were here for a family wedding and the facilities and the food ere delightfulWe enjoyed our stay and being near the beach and the noise was the only disappointment.

We stayed her for three nights as my husband had business meetings at the hotel. Lovely looking hotel inside and out. Located right across the street from the beach.  Beautiful pool area which looks out at the beach. Room spacious, clean, and comfortable beds. Balcony did have view of the beach too. Beach chairs are available to take to the beach, just ask at the front desk. All staff friendly. Room service prompt and great food. Yes, you have to pay for valet parking and wifi.    Nice being able to walk to pier, and shopping and restaurants. Overall great stay and I'd definitely stay here again!

I stay in a lot of Hilton's and this one is top tier. Beds are extremely comfortable and staff (especially Scott) treat us we'll each summer. Bridge to the beach is a big plus and pool area is very nice. Restaurant choices on property are top notch.

Stayed for six nights in November. My second stay at the hotel, as equally as good as the first.  Check in was quick, polite and efficient (I'd asked for a high floor room and got one) which was needed after a long journey.  Room, facing the pool area, was a spacious twin bed with a small balcony and decent sized bathroom. Wifi had a strong reception in the room.  Service was great throughout the hotel, the bar/restaurant, concierge (very helpful when I needed a bike) and the team at the front desk.  Would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Great Staff...pity about the building work next door
Summary: This was our second stay at this beachfront hotel.   We knew we had to pay for valet parking, however, the valet staff more than made up for this and the service retrieving the car was excellent, even when there were lots of people arriving for a function. Really conforatble beds, great location and the fire pit was great in the evening. Arrived early and no problem in getting an early check in.  We had a 9th floor room facing north, however, during our arrival day (Friday) there was a deal of noise when on our balcony from the adjacent building works, we thought this would cease on Saturday, but they appeared to be working on that day also. Staff were great in relocating to us on the South side 11th floor, but the view was not as good and a small balcony.  No free WiFi was a

Staff are very helpful and friendly. I wish we could have stayed a couple more days.  The downside as others have already said is that valet is forced on you.  I don't know if you can have your parking validated if you have a meal there as a guest staying in the hotel.  Didn't think to ask.  The first night was very relaxing sitting by the fire pit looking out to the ocean.  Our room was not on the sunset side and tended to be a little noisy due to a private event going on below. Our room was not  renovated. I had family staying on the higher floors and they were renovated. Husband and I enjoyed our morning walk up to main street for breakfast.  My profile photo was taken from our room.

My wife and I stayed at the Waterfront Beach Resort this Fall while visiting our daughter in Anaheim.  We wanted a hotel that was less than 30 minutes from our daughter, was away from LA traffic, was in walking distance to local dining, and provided a relaxing setting.  We also wanted to spend some time at Disneyland.  This hotel met all those criteria, plus it is a short (and easy) drive to other nearby Orange County resorts and shopping. It's located about 2 blocks from Huntington Beach's main street and pier, both of which provide many eating and shopping venues.  That's an easy walk, although construction interrupted one of those blocks while we were there.  The beach is across the street and all rooms have ocean views.  The in-house restaurant in better than average, and

Had a wonderful 4 night stay at the Hilton.  I hate paying for valet but I must admit that they were amazing.  Beautiful location.  Recommend the fish tacos at Shades.  Worth booking the waterfront high floor to get an amazing view.  All the staff were fantastic and you can tell they take pride in great service.

Comfy beds and great location. better maintained than in past. Stayed there for about 15 years plus once or twice a year. Staff are all professional. Continental breakfast is the worst feature. And getting worse. if you dont like melon or dry pastry...Fruit selection is unacceptable.   Plus they close the bar early if not enough people around. Stay out of habit. plan to try next door.
Manager Response: Dear John K,  HOLD THE PHONE! Before you decide to not stay here again, how about you give us a chance to "Make It Right" for you? I have sent your review (thank you for this by the way) on to our kitchen department to see what we could do better with our continental breakfast... and was very perplexed that anyone would close our bar before the stated time, to say the least. I can assure you, unless there is not a soul about, a customer is a customer...and we'll gladly serve a single guest if he or she is there. I will get to the bottom of that situation immediately.  Please contact me personally before your next stay. I would like to see to all of your arrangements and welcome the chance to leave you with the impression you should always have as guest of The Waterfront... Wow'ed and ready to come back!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Started our 14 night trip at this hotel and we were so pleased with it. We stayed 3 nights. The hotel and grounds are spotless and the outside pool and dining area are lovely. Particularly liked the large fire pit. Huntington Beach was a great location for a chilled beach vibe, highly recommended.

My husband surprised me with a romantic weekend getaway. Although we tend to spend our alone time in Santa Barbara/Solvang area, since it was a last minute decision we decided to try something new.   Everyone was very friendly. We had a wonderful time.  Although there was a bit of trouble with the plumbing, the staff was very  accommodating.  We will definitely be returning to this hotel soon. Next time we'll even bring the kids.

We stayed the night here because its where my cousin had his wedding reception. I love this hotel. I love their restaurant, Shades...it's one of my favorite places to dine. Make sure to check them out especially at happy hour. Request Lauren as your server. She is awesome!   Only thing that was annoying was the 4pm check in. They knew I was there for a wedding that took place at 2 and wouldn't allow me to pay for an early check in. I spoke with several people a few days before the wedding and kept getting different responses. A lady I spoke with the night before my check in said to call as early as possible the morning of to see if an early check in was available. I called at 7am and they transferred me to a different reservations department because the front desk wouldn't be

This property is absolutely stunning. We had a fabulous view of the ocean and also overlooked an area where there were no less than 4 weddings over the weekend. They were beautiful. I cannot say enough good things about the staff. From the moment we drove up to the moment we left it was obvious that they were committed to fantastic service. And this is truly a dog friendly hotel. We never felt like it was a problem to have the dog there. As a matter of fact, there were several dogs staying there. We ate on site at Shades on the patio near the pool. The food was incredible. The service was amazing. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. We slept with the balcony door open and fell asleep to the sound of crashing waves. This hotel and its staff were amazing. I can't wait to

Summary Heading: Great wedding site except for the bulls
Summary: We attended a wedding here and it was great for that. In fact there were three weddings going on that day. All was good except for an event called Bulls on the Beach right across the street. Loud, smelly, yikes. The hotel claimed they didn't know it was going to be there when the wedding was booked but I think that's bull since all the cowpokes were staying in the hotel. The room was large and we had a nice view of the ocean from our balcony even though it didn't claim to be an ocean view. Parking is crazy expensive. Food on site is good. The Sunday brunch is expansive and all you can drink mimosas. Multiple fire pits and super outdoor spots for lounging. Robes in the room are a nice touch.
Manager Response: Dear BethAnnSH123,  No one was more surprised by the size and scope of this event than we were here at the hotel. Quite simply, our jaws dropped as the whole thing got underway! We are so sorry for inconvenience and disturbance this may have caused for you and your guests. While not directly related to us in any way, the event itself was in front of us (on city property) and thus we became "ground zero" for the entire show. We had been informed by the City of Huntington Beach that the event would be occurring and the size of the footprint, but in reality (as a first time event) even they didn't know what to expect by way of crowds, noise, and the general atmosphere. Now we know and moving forward will have a better idea of what this will mean for all of us should the event ever return.  To be fair, The PBR show, producers and CBS Sports were extremely responsive & helpful. They were very aware of our frantic calls & concerns and made every effort to lower the intensity of the event before finally pulling the plug (on time, as promised). We all learned a very good lesson that day on our side of the street. We're just profoundly sorry that it impacted you in any way.  Please accept our sincerest of apologies.  Regretfully,  Scott O'Hanlon & the entire Waterfront Staff Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: This was our second stay at this property and the beautiful weather made this even easier to write. The location, is two blocks from Main Street in Huntington Beach "Surf City".  The people, food and town are completely California beach friendly. Even better the whole town and the hotel are pet friendly, they embrace it!   The hotel staff are accommodating, friendly and very helpful.  They have an hourly shuttle to downtown, so if you are inclined, you can enjoy the food and as many libations as you want.   The pool is great, and they will provide you with beach gear if you choose to sun on the beach as apposed to the pool.  We had one small issue when we checked in with the room.  But the staff fixed it immediately and were excellent in communicating - great place!

From start to finish, this hotel and its staff were first class: the bell staff with the cars and front door, the check-in staff, the room was gorgeous, and the food was delicious. I loved having a Starbucks right on the premises, and the attached shop was well-stocked with sundries. During the day we walked across the street to the beach! Lovely!!

Summary Heading: Love it can't wait to go back!!
Summary: Very pleased with the service. Everyone was helpful and kind from valet, check in, room service to planning weekend activities. I loved that I was able to bring my dog too! Room was very nice and as promised an ocean view! Can't wait to go back!

Great family holiday hanging out at Huntington. Chill by the pool with a couple of beers during the day, hang by the fire pit with a merlot at night!! Kids can swim all day, cruise along the beach by renting a bike or skateboard, shoot some hoops at the basketball court down the road on the beach!! Breakfast is great with plenty of choice and friendly staff. Surf is freezing compared to qld!! Steamer alley for sure!!

Summary Heading: Nice place, great location, high fees
Summary: Stayed for 2 weekend nights at the Hilton Waterfront Resort in Huntington Beach in late October.  This is a very nice upscale high rise hotel right across the street from one of the best beaches around.  For the most part, a very nice place, but there are some negatives too. First the Positives: 1)	Great location for a fun beach vacation.  Huntington Beach is one of the premier beach areas in Southern California.  The beach is directly across the street from the hotel, miles of clean beach to walk, great waves for body surfing, etc.  The beach is great for anyone that is comfortable with ocean swimming, and the undertow is not bad at all. 2)	The property is very well kept, service is excellent, and many rooms have an Ocean view (most are a distant angle view, not straight on).
Manager Response: Dear Henneman,  Thank you for your recent review. We really appreciate the time and effort you put into that...very insightful for all of our staff! For the most part, it sounds like you had a great time and really enjoyed your time here in in Huntington Beach. We like to think of ourselves as one of the best beach locations in Southern California and your review certainly conveys that.  We understand that to some $32 for valet parking may seem like a lot, but taken as a whole (and the fact that there is no free parking in, on or around any of the hotels in Huntington Beach that you can safely leave your vehicle for 24 hours) complimented by excellent round-the-clock service with in/out access our parking rate is actually below those of our competitors. We hope this isn't a total "deal breaker" the next time you'd like to come see us...we'd love to welcome you back!  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I say excellent, one minor gripe, no free wifi. We stayed in a Hampton hotel,earlier on our trip, part of the Hilton group, but much cheaper, Wifi was free here, so why not in an expensive Hilton? Apart from that, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It was the last one, of our tour of the west coast areas, of America, and we wanted somewhere to unwind after driving thousands of miles. The hotel is a good position, within walking distance of Huntington Beach, and even a Wallmart on Beach Boulevard. The rooms are very bright, good size, and great views towards the Pacific Ocean. Very comfortable beds.  Pool area very good ( be careful moving the umbrellas, they are very heavy and cumbersome ). Plenty of towels, and a very pleasant area, where you can relax in the sun. Staff

Summary Heading: for what they charge it rated a poor rating
Summary: HI. we stayed here one night.  we thought what the heck its one time we wont listen to other who rated it poor and give a try.  well they were right, while the place was fancy and all that for the money we payed, over 300 for the night it I rate it POOR or less.  even the Hilton poor brother hotels give a free breakfast for 100 dollor a night places,  and they give free wifi also the Hilton don't give.  this was my first Hilton and unless they change their stuck up attitude this will be my last.  the room was nice and the workers attentive but 30 bucks for parking is really screwing the guest.  don't tell me nothing is free, for this kind of money everything should be free. if you think about staying here keep looking.  the pool area looked nice but the water was full of dirt.
Manager Response: Dear alanh45953  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry for any disappointment with your stay.   Our hotel's website does state that we do charge for parking and wireless internet, and that our breakfast is not complimentary. However, we regret that you were not informed before your stay. Also, many of these amenities are available to you by becoming a Hilton Honors member earning points for stays and automatic upgrades and comp's as your status progresses.  We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time you are in the area.   All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Worth $ to stay in a beach location for your SoCal visit
Summary: We stayed here twice: once in June the other in August. I grew up in Huntington Beach - so I'm bias on location, BUT the hotel is great even for being older. I have a 3 year old and he was able to eat free at breakfast & had great options for dinner. Pool & beach access is great for families - and  Main Street is a short walk it shuttle ride. In the hot months, I'd recommend staying here so you have a cool breeze to come back to away from traffic & smog if you are taking in Los Angeles sites. Staff is very friendly & helpful. I had to use this place as a home away from home & was able to tend to personal matters using their facility. Valet + tipping is pricey - my only small complaint.

I stayed at this resort with my parents for 5 nights in Mid-October. This resort is AMAZING! I have stayed at numerous Hilton properties and this one is by far the best. My parents have stayed here 5+ times, as my brother lives in SoCal and they stay here every time they come to visit.   The rooms are gorgeous, and our room had wood floors, which was really nice. Our view, while not considered "oceanfront" was spectacular and we still had beautiful views of the Pier and the ocean. The beds were extremely comfortable and the housekeeping staff was awesome - one day we came back to the room while they were still cleaning, and so we waited on the balcony for them to be done - they were vacuuming, dusting, and scrubbing the bathroom.   The pool is beautiful and has views of the

Summary Heading: One of if not The Absolute Best Hilton.Oceanfront with  Magnificent  Sunsets.
Summary: This is by far the best and most wonderful place on Earth.  Ocean.Boardwalk. .Sunsets Surf City USA..everything  you would ever can Dream  and Hope  for is right here. The staff and management are highly trained and the pool and swimming beach is endless. Our hats are off to this magnificent Waterfront Beach  Hilton Hotel as Five Star!!!!

We recently stayed at the Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach, CA. The hotel was wonderful. The pool overlooked the beach and had very comfy lounge chairs. The pool bar area was also very nice.  Our room was nice but alittle tight for two adults and a child. The one thing that was an issue was the safe in the closet. The door of the safe was facing the wall so it was very hard to see into the safe and use it easily.  But other than that this was a great place to stay.

Had a great stay for conference.  Great service and great helpful staff.  Beautiful location and landscaping.  Beautiful pool. Just perfect SoCal hospitality!  Love it. Had a great stay for conference.  Great service and great helpful staff.  Beautiful location and landscaping.  Beautiful pool. Just perfect SoCal hospitality!  Love it. Had a great stay for conference.  Great service and great helpful staff.  Beautiful location and landscaping.  Beautiful pool. Just perfect SoCal hospitality!  Love it. Had a great stay for conference.  Great service and great helpful staff.  Beautiful location and landscaping.  Beautiful pool. Just perfect SoCal hospitality!  Love it. Had a great stay for conference.  Great service and great helpful staff.  Beautiful location and landscaping.

The view was amazing on a sizable patio balcony furnished with chairs and a small table.  The staff was always helpful and friendly.  The location was close to downtown and the pier.  Thank you for a memorable stay.

Excellent plus i was so happy to visit Huntington  beach again but it was extra special  by staying at the hilton waterfront  unbelievably  nice staff was extra friendly  ive  worked at hilton las vegas 87to91 and the broadmoor hotel 79 yo 81 great job to the hilton staff beautiful  job especially the guys at the valet

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but nothing included in room price so becomes costly
Summary: We had a fabulous stay at this hotel and booked a corner suite which had a fantastic view  My criticism are that you are literally just paying for the room as nothing else is included. It costs $32 a night for parking and there are no other parking options near by so you are kinda stuck with this. There is no free wi fo so this costs a further $13 a day and breakfast is not included.  As this was the last part of our holiday we decided to treat ourselves however we ended up laying a further $300 just to cover the add ons.  As a high end hotel I would expect parking and wifi to be part of your stay especially at the prices they are charging, all other hotels we have stayed in in LA which have been equally as nice have had these included in the price.  Ideal location and staff all

The staff is great and the location is perfect.  Food and bar is also fine.  The rooms are a bit loud and furniture is not the most comfortable, but you will be at the beach and we never had a problem with the noise late.  We have enjoyed our two trips to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Should've Been A 5 But For Extortionate Parking
Summary: This was the last destination of our honeymoon, a week long stay in Huntington Beach. First Impressions were excellent, the lobby is very nice. We were greeted by Devin, who advised us we had a double room. Mentioning our honeymoon, we we immediately offered a king upgrade - the first time this had happened all trip. Unfortunately, there were no king rooms available for around 3 nights, but as soon as one became available, she'd let us know. Amazingly, as a consolation, we were given 7 days access to the breakfast buffet, saving nearly $50 a day! Unfortunately, they never let us know when, or if a king room became available, however the 'standard' rooms are excellent, with a beautiful sea view, and over looking the pool.   Our main concern was regarding parking. Having stayed at

I just came back from staying at the Hilton Waterfront resort. I was there for 8 days. What a beautiful hotel. The staff throughout the entire hotel was friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant was a little expensive but delicious. This is a top notch hotel in every way.

My daughter and I had a weekend getaway at this fabulous hotel.  We were greeted with warm, sincere, and professional staff from start to finish.  The views are breathtaking from any room in the hotel and we enjoyed the serenity of having a cup of coffee on the deck while taking in the fresh ocean breeze.  The main street is just a short walk down the beach where there are many shops, great restaurants, and fun activities.  The hotel was more than happy to offer suggestions for activities outside of  the hotel as well as inside, including movie room service packages that ranged from bowls of popcorn to Margaritas!  We had a FABULOUS time and will go back...again & again!

I choose this property year after year for my visit over the Hyatt Regency next door because of the staff; I know that the staff at this Hilton will always treat me special and make my vacation as memorable as the view of the ocean and pier.  There is so much to share about this most recent trip. Upon booking my room, my reservations agent, Cathy, was by far the most memorable in-house reservation representative that I've ever had the pleasure of speaking to. She thanked me for my loyalty and acknowledged my concerns. Upon arrival, the front desk advised me that Cathy made sure I received my room upgrade - even leaving me a welcoming card and goodies in my room. When I went to personally thank Cathy, she remembered me by voice. I had to give her a hug for this.   Shane, the

I spent my teen years at Huntington Beach so when I return to the area, this is my first choice.  The rates are reasonable compared to the competition and it is a gorgeous hotel.  Everytime I have been a wedding is happening and we can enjoy from our balcony as we gaze at the ocean and Huntington Pier.  The staff was top notch - the friendliest I have experienced.  They even have a service where you can get a wagon full of goodies and have your own beach party, complete with firewood and smores.  The "resort" title is earned because it is totally self-sufficient.  You won't be disappointed.

Even if I had been smart enough to get the names of all the employees that helped me, I wouldn't have room to thank them all. Very pleasant and helpful when checking in. They even got us a room early since we arrived early. The room was small but the view was GREAT. If you even slowed down in the lobby, there was someone asking if they could help you find something. Found out that I was there with teenage boys, made sure I knew that they had boogie boards to lend ( first come first serve). The concierge was really helpful. The guy at the front desk was very nice and helpful not just to me but to everyone. They also took off a charge because it was my birthday. Bottom line, I had a wonderful time in a wonderful place. Can't wait to return with the whole family.

Summary Heading: Nice view of ocean but not "resort" worthy
Summary: Huntington Beach is a primo location.  Always nice to wake up in the morning, look out the window, and see the beach.  Service was good at this hotel.  Front desk was quick.  Valet parking attendants were also quick.  Rooms are nice sized.  What's not so good are the beds and parking.  Beds are WAY too soft, even compared to other Hiltons.  Parking is valet only at $32/night; there is no other parking option.  This hotel calls itself a "resort".  But, except for being in a nice location, I didn't see anything "resort" about the hotel compared to other Hiltons.  Pool wasn't anything extraordinary, lobby is nothing special, etc.  Similar to others, I paid around $280/night.  I realize location = price.  But, it does seem over-priced for what you get.

The value of our stay was average.  The Hotel was clean and the staff was friendly.  The location met our needs.  My friend accidently tripped over a loose piece of flooring.  Maintenance responded with some duck tape.  I was a little disappointed that the staff did not follow up with the incident.

$289 a night and absolutely no frills --$32 additional Valet parking fee, No free internet, No continental breakfast, only 1 washer/dryer in entire facility, no shuttle services, and a distant 1-2 miles from any restaurants/shops. Get ready to put on your walking shoes!!!  Too high of a price, not worth it. Beds were totally uncomfortable, small - double beds.

Summary Heading: The Perfect Leisure Escape for Sun, Fun & Relaxing!
Summary: The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel is located on the picturesque coastline of Southern California, in the heart of Surf City USA™ in Huntington Beach, California.  Excellent staff with attention to details. Use their Concierge desk for recommendations for day trips closely located to the resort. Make sure and use their onsite bikes; we had the best time with those riding to beaches, shopping and dining locations!  Pacific Ocean views! Watch the sun rise and set from your private balcony. Heated swimming pool overlooking the ocean...a WOW! Factor. If you need a get a way; stay here!!!

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience at the Water Front
Summary: What could be better? In Surf City with a wonderful staff attending to our every need  with a Class-A restaurant on premises . It just doesn't get much better than this. There is no better place than Shades to watch the sub set and the sun rise.

My husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton Waterfront in Huntington Beach CA. We had the best vacation ever. The staff was such a pleasure. We rented bicycles which was the highlight of our trip Raml always had them ready for us. Tammy at the concierge desk was very helpful getting our trip to Catalina Island planed out for us and Nina at the Surf Hero Market always made sure we were taken care of by the pool. Our room was located on the 7th floor it was quiet, comfortable and had a great view of the pool and pier. I can't wait to return to Huntington and stay at the Hilton Waterfront!

The Hilton Waterfront is located about a quarter mile away from Huntington Pier and the central district, so we enjoyed walking back and forth along the beach.  Everyone we encountered at the hotel was extremely helpful and the grounds were very pleasant.  Our room was comfortable, quiet, and had a nice side view looking down the coast waterfront.  The free breakfast coupons applied to a take-out counter at the on-site mini-market, not the restaurant.  However, you can take your breakfast to numerous tables outside or around the pool and enjoy them there.  Because the hotel is located right on Pacific Coast Highway, car access is excellent.  We would recommend this hotel to our friends seeking a beach-town base for exploring southern California.

The hotel’s rooms are angled the way that almost all of them have a view of the ocean. Hilton has a very friendly and comfortable ambiance. Great pool with perfect water temperature facing pool side patio, and a great view of the beach and crashing waves. Actually, the beach is right across the street. I loved Shades Restaurant and Bar. I was enjoying my delicious meals and sipping on my drinks, while watching breaking waves. It is a perfect destination for a romance or a family fun.

Summary Heading: Can't Get A Better View of the Ocean!
Summary: This property is beautiful, quiet and somewhat quaint for a Hilton. I would definitely return to this location. The staff at the restaurants are helpful and very pleasant.  Nothing better than starting your day with a walk along the ocean.

I stayed here the September 27th weekend. The stay was simply amazing. I was a bridesmaid in the Kwock-Mam wedding. When I arrived I was quickly greeted with happy faces from the valet team. Bellhop Anthony helped me bring my things up to my room. Actually Anthony helped me and my bridesmaid all weekend. He was quick with my things and when I checked out he listened to my specific directions in removing the things to my room. I wasn't able to help guide him in actually removing things from my room but ran into him in the lobby as he was being sent up. He was more than willing to listen to my directions as I was frantically checking out to head to other events. He has a super happy attitude and positive energy which was great since some of us were stressed getting last minute

Literally across the street from the beach, couldn't ask for a better location, and just two blocks from Main Street (hotel does offer a quick shuttle).  The hotel itself was clean and upkept.  Upon arrival, everyone was most helpful and accomodating.  Valet were quick and courteous (liked the 24 hour access to the car as well as in and out privileges).  Check-in was smooth and we were able to get an upgrade (Bonus!) to a higher floor, which allowed for great views out on the balcony.  Room was very clean and modern.  Pool area was crowded...a larger jacuzzi or an adult only one would be nice to have.  No spa on site, but can book at neighboring Hyatt, concierge was helpful with this.  Would glad to go back for family vacation, but it's probably a mad house during peak summer.
Manager Response: Dear francisfammem,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We'll be sure to share it with all of our staff.  We are so pleased you had a good time while you were here. Your timing was perfect...great weather (well, we almost always have THAT) and less madness (you nailed that for summer!). The thing is, you just let the best secret we have OUT OF THE BAG... LOL!!!  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed for a relaxing 8 nights at the end of September 2014.  Pros:-  Lovely location just across the PCH from the beach.            Well kept grounds.            Very helpful Concierge Tammy, who went out of her way to help us.            Ramil, who was always cheerful,  asked if we needed help,            directions or any waters.            Comfortable room.            Lovely ocean view from balcony.             Always sunbeds available around the pool.            Valet parking very efficient and helpful.            Good outdoor seating around pool, restaurant and Café area.            Beach chairs and Umbrellas available.  Cons:- $32 a night parking.             $13 a day for Wi Fi             Restaurant dinner menu did not have a great selection and was displayed

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice, beds are terrible
Summary: The rooms with double beds are not queen size beds, they are very very small, feels like two twin beds. The room had a great view which it appears most rooms had great views.   Location is great but there are other hotels on the same street to choose from.
Manager Response: Dear 312philh,  Thank you so much for your feedback regarding our double beds. You'll be pleased to know that as a result of our room reconfigurations occurring with room renovations (now underway!) we have decided to replace ALL double beds with true Queen-sized Hilton "Suite Dreams" Serta mattresses. Our ownership takes comments like yours and suggestions such as these very seriously... and very soon, the changes will be complete. We look forward to having you as a guest in the future...and keep making those improvement observations. Where we can, we'll get right on it...and "Make It Right"!  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Thoroughly enjoyed our beach getaway at the Hilton Waterfront. The rooms were spacious, clean and tastefully designed. They were very accommodating and considerate of our room preferences.   Located right across the street from the beach, umbrellas, towels and chairs are all provided for. A short walk to the pier and Main St. stores, restaurants.   Everyone of the hotel's staff provided excellent service - the valet parking team, the front desk, at the Shades restaurant, poolside servers, housekeeping... Ramil, who assisted guests at the pool and lobby areas, seemed to always be near and cheerfully helpful even before we anticipated a request/question. We were very grateful to him for his hospitality and tips in making the absolute most of our morning/afternoon/day. Thanks so

Expensive area, so the hotel is too.  A very comfortable stay, very good location right across from the beach with sea views on 3 sides.  Lobby, bar, areas are very nice so it was surprising that the rooms were a little tired.  Although everything working and very clean.  Beds are very comfortable, which Hilton is very good at wherever you stay.    The extra guest charges are a little desperate.  $13 p/day for room internet (per device!)  $32 p/day for valet parking with no other option.    The hotel is in a great position only a 7 minute walk from Main st, and as such you pay a lot to stay there.  It's worth it, but those extra guest costs, especially the internet charges I think are outdated and it really should be free.  Very good customer service from valet parking to maids.

Summary Heading: Great location, services could be improved
Summary: We stayed here only 1 night, and we were a little surprised that there is only valet parking and no free wifi in any part of the building, not even the lobby. The location is superbe, and the outlets too. Check-in was quick and professional, dinner by the pool was the nicest thing.
Manager Response: Dear Claudio B.,  Thank you for your post. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the location, service, check-in experience and dinner al fresco in our Shades Restaurant and Bar. We work very hard to make sure that from check-in to check-out, everything you see and everyone you encounter meets or exceeds your expectations.   Parking at most hotels on the coast is valet only. We are very limited on space and thus cannot offer self parking. We have made a conscious decision to NOT have a resort fee of any kind and to allow 24 hour in/out privileges and service for this very reason. I have mentioned in other posts options that you have other than driving in to us to save on valet parking, the best being to take a shuttle or taxi to us and then let us drive you downtown or you can rent a car for day use from the concierge! No parking needed.  We do offer complimentary internet access in the lobby via our Connectivity Center (with both Apple and Windows based computers) complete with free printing! WiFi is optional for our guests both in room and around the resort. Trust me, there is no such thing as "free" WiFi. One way or another you will pay for it (either with a higher room rate or a lower standard of service), so rather than pass those costs onto you (whether you want it or not) or lower our levels of service in any way, we opt to let you choose. I hope that explains our thinking on this matter.  Please come back anytime tho... we'll keep the spectacular sunsets and dining and service just like you left it!  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: My husband and I had not spent a single night away from our daughter since her birth... and she is 4! I am a busy nursing student and my husband has a hectic "IT guy" schedule, but we were in desperate need of a weekend getaway. We opted for something super close, less than a mile from our home, the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort. We were blown away by our ocean view room. It had nice wooden floors, great decor, and a comfy bed. Not to mention the VIEW! We walked to the downtown area for breakfast at Bruxie (YUM) and some window shopping, and spent some time watching an awesome Polynesian show by the pool. The restaurant had wonderful service, and they even provide the menu on an iPad...so hi-tech. The two nights we stayed were amazing, and the time off from our parenting

Great experience! The hotel is beautiful and clean. The location is great and the service is outstanding. Do not hesitate to book this hotel. The beach and local area is a great holiday spot, we walked to everything.

This is a lovely hotel in a good location. The staff were friendly and attentive. The rooms are a good size and very comfortable. We had a room overlooking the pool and the ocean and there was a  bit of noise from the poolside bar, but hey, people are on holiday. Sitting on the balcony watching the waves and the sunset was lovely. The hotel was full when we were there and yet the pool wasn't too crowded and we particularly liked the choice of music played by the DJ on Saturday.   The only slight negative was the dining experience - not bad food but not particularly great either.

The hotel was great, the food at the hotel was great and the Valet Team was amazing. It didn't matter who was our valet our at what time we needed our car, each valet member was extremely thoughtful and nice and went above and beyond to make sure my wife (8 Months Pregnant) and I were taken care of. We don't usually remember the valet service at a hotel but they stood out and to top it off we never had to wait to get our car...AND they always had my Old School Rap Channel playing for us so we always started off the car trip in a good mood!
Manager Response: Dear cooperj4,  Hahahahahaha! We seriously can't stop laughing and passing this one around to everyone... BEST. REVIEW. EVER!!!   Thank you for making our day!  Best,  Scott "Old Skool Rap" O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for a few nights in early September. The hotel is just across the street from the beach, wonderful rooms, beautiful pool facilities, and a nice restaurant.   Though I stayed here on business (primarily), it would easily be a nice weekend getaway and romantic location too.  Would love to come back sometime soon.
Manager Response: Dear Dhavekost,  Thank you so much for your kind words! Our staff really enjoyed reading this and we can't wait to have you back...whether on business or for pleasure, we'll be ready to take care of you!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: After traveling the PCH and seeing all kinds of sites we were not sure what this location was going to bring us.  When we drove it we immediately knew. It was upscale, top notch and beautiful.  We are Hilton Honors members but that does not always guarantee the best hotels. But this one is right up there with the best. The room (upgraded) to ocean front was tastefully decorated, the A/C controls were perfectly adjusted, the beds and pillows were divine. The patio was perfect for late night and early morning reading. The location, while not right on the beach (an ocean set-back that assures public access to this oasis) was a great location for us walkers and exercisers.  Top notch.  We are glad we took the recommendation of our friends who formerly lived in California. STAY HERE

Summary Heading: Kick back at the beach and enjoy the sunsets
Summary: The Hilton Waterfront Hotel is my favorite of the options in the Huntington Beach area.  Actually, it's my favorite in Orange County on the beach.  The Hyatt is next door and magnificent, but doesn't match the Hilton.  Parking and room access is easy.  The property and grounds are gorgeous.  There really isn't a bad room, but always request pier facing to get the best sunsets.  My daughter got married in this hotel and I can also recommend the special event staff.  The food for the wedding was amazing right down to little cream puff swans which were adorable.  Check in was easy.  The pool was a comfortable temperature.  Room was standard, not amazing, but comfortable.  I did ask to change rooms 3 times to get the best possible view, and the front desk staff just rolled with it

A great value for the area!  Great room, location and Service.   The continental breakfast far surpasses most other hotels and for just $7 more you can have the full American hot/cold buffet - great way to start the day!   Nice pool/hottub too.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great view, great service
Summary: What a delightful stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort!  The location is excellent as the proximity to the beach is just a few steps. Our room was beautiful on a higher floor with an outstanding view of the ocean. It was so peaceful to sit our on our balcony and see the ocean and watch the surfers. The street noise below was minimal. The hotel will also set up cabanas, and different ocean adventures for their guests.  The room was comfy and spacious. The lobby was cool and welcoming with beautiful art and open airy feel. The staff is superb.  Friendly and efficient.  We opted for a late lunch snack and wine at Shades the restaurant on property.  Then a first class Sunday brunch the next day.  Most definitely not a typical hotel restaurant.  It was wonderful. I highly

Great amenities and the most courteous, gracious staff I've encountered in a long time! The gift shop staff is great and if you're on the pier facing side of the hotel the sunset views are outstanding.

We had a corner suite on one of the top floors with a view of the ocean.  It was absolute heaven.  The view was breathtaking.  The room was spacious, clean and had 2 sliding doors with a balcony that wrapped around the building. We noticed no street noise and slept peacefully.  The only drawback for me was that the hotel only allows smoking in 2 areas and no smoking is allowed on the balcony which I thought was crazy.

Stayed here over Labor Day weekend to wrap up the summer. This hotel is really nice. Its right across the street from the beach and pretty much everything is in walking distance. The lobby has a tropic feel, much like what you would find in any 5 star resort getaway in Mexico/Jamaica. The room had a great view of the beach South coastline. But what sells this hotel is the staff. Everyone was welcoming no matter their role. It makes all the difference, and its nice to know that hospitality is  still high on the priority list by some, and others should take note. Great job !!!!

Beautiful hotel and the staff was superb. Highly recommended. Location was awesome and the supply all that you need for a day at the beach, for free I might add. They had a great fire show on Friday night and our whole stay was a ten plus.

The oceanfront room had a great view!  I will definitely stay there again. I did not get to stay long enough to enjoy the pool.  it is a little pricey because of the location so I'm hoping they will give me discounts for saying all these nice things.

First time in Sharm and im very satisfied that i decided to go in Hilton Waterfalls. Very good hotel, with exellent staff. Rooms were big enough and very clean. And the most amazing part of these resort was the animation team that made everyday different games, and with them around u will feel very good all the day ( with aliona, polina and samos ). Thank you guys for that perfect week !

I am really not a fan of this hotel and rate it 2.5 stars, but since you can't give half ratings and I was really unimpressed by the hotel, I'm sticking with a 2.  We arrived on the Saturday of Labor Day weekend and were excited to see how close the hotel was to the beach. It's definitely not as impressive or as large as the Hyatt Resort next door (which is truly a resort, while the Hilton is simply a hotel). We drove up and were instructed to pull the car almost to the parking garage, and were greeted by the parking guys. They did not offer to help us with our bags (although they did take them out of the car, but left them on the driveway), and it felt a little weird to be 'welcomed' to the hotel basically in the parking garage, and not at the actual entrance to the hotel - it
Manager Response: Jessica,  We are sorry that you had a disappointing experience during your stay with us. At Hilton, we always aim to ensure every guest feels cared for, valued and respected. Your feedback will help us deliver this brand promise. Guest satisfaction is very important to us and we try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. We apologize that you were unhappy with the location of your room. All of your comments will be thoroughly researched and discussed with the departments involved during your stay.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.  Kind Regards,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing  The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: everything was wonderful, could of stay forever. the beach just across the street was so lovely in the evenings could sat on the balcony again forever. the peole working at the hotel where all polite and caring.

they could care less if the hot tub did not work for us and we stayed 6 days, the shower would burn you when you tried to adjust it. they were doing constuction at the bar at 10pm , the host made all the excuses in the world of why things were the way it was but would not even try to take care of us
Manager Response: John,  I am sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay. I apologize for the issues with the hot tub (it is now fixed and in tip top shape) and shower, and will work with our maintenance team to ensure that we make this right. Our entire staff was shocked and upset when the heater on the hot tub just "quit" in the middle of a busy holiday weekend (and we frantically tried to get the replacement parts here  during that time...to no avail). We are so sorry for that. If you return to our area, I hope you will consider staying with us again.  Kind Regards,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Nice hotel across street from beach
Summary: Hotel is located right across the street from the beach - many amenities including several pools, children activities and restaurants on site. They also have bike rentals available and chairs and umbrellas that you can take to the beach.   Rooms were nicely decorated and adequate space for a family. Beds were comfy and enjoyed the chairs on the patio.   Tried out both pools - family pool was busy and the kids loved the water slide. We rented a cabana in the afternoon and paid only half the daily rate. It included beverages, fruit tray and a s'mores pack - kids enjoyed roasted their marshmallows at the fire pit.   Great stay - highly recommend for families, couples etc.

Loved this hotel!! Staff was AMAZING, customer service excellent. Our room was beautiful with an excellent view. Super clean and comfortable. Across the street from the gorgeous beach.  Only downsides: had to pay daily for WIFI, which we thought would be included, and you have to Valet for $30/day (or you can park yourself for $50/day.) Other than that, we had a really wonderful experience and I can't wait to go back.

Stayed here in December of last year. It is a beautiful hotel and while our room had a balcony and ocean view, we also had a view of nearby smoke stacks. The staff was great, beach is across PCH and not quite as busy as others in SoCal or at least it wasn't during our stay. While we didn't avail it, apparently the hotel will prepare a picnic with fixings for s'mores! We also enjoyed dinner at the on site restaurant. Beautiful pool too.

In a nutshell: smelly, run down, noisy, very average food.  We used the toilet after checking into our first room on the 9th floor and got moved when it started to flow over and water was running everywhere.  Our room on the 6th floor was worse. Older furniture, torn curtain, toilet seat cover kept falling off, bad smell.   We had a hard time sleeping. With the balcony door open, it was very loud - music, people etc. (and we were facing to the outside of the hotel). People were smoking pot on their balconies and the fridge in our room made that buzzing sound. And I was unable to unplug it without moving a huge cabinet.  The mattress was reasonable but we did not get any good sleep on any of the two nights we stayed, woke up many many times. Second night we closed the balcony
Manager Response: Dear Princessvontrapp_7,  I'm sorry we were not able to provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about noise you experienced from other guests and the quality of your guest room. Your comments will help us to correct these issues. I have forwarded your information on to the various department heads and managers as well as placed your review on our internal messaging systems to be discussed by every department who will in turn need to respond back to me with immediate solutions and/or causes for concern.  At any Hilton property, we strive to overcome any challenge thrown our way and "Make It Right" immediately. Never hesitate to speak to our staff while here on property about anything we can do to make your stay more pleasant. We are here for you and can offer solutions that Twitter may not. We hope you will consider staying with us the next time you are in the area.  Kind Regards,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: My experience at The Hilton Waterfront Resort was marvelous. I was given an upgrade to a room with a spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean. Everything from the valet parking to the final departure was exemplary.

Stayed 3 nights here for a 1 year anniversary stay.  Room was very nice, clean, ocean view.  Had a little trouble at a restaurant off property and concierge was so upset as it was her recommendation that she went above and beyond to do things over the course of our stay.  sent red wine and chocolate covered strawberries to room, gave us free bike rentals for stay, etc.  Enjoyed our stay very much, only down side was that the hot tub was out of order our entire stay.

Just came back from staying at this hotel and it is a good hotel with a great location across from the beach. The rooms are modern but the lobby looks dated and the gym is small but has all the equipment you need for a good work out. The hotel is a short walk from main street and the pier. The pool is nice but is on the small size for the hotel. Despite these little problems this is a great hotel for a holiday in Huntington Beach.

We came here for the Labor Day weekend August 30 till September 1st, 2014 and we had a great time spending here, relaxing.  Beautiful view of the beach from the room, every single room had balcony with a view of the beach, refrigerator was in the room.  Our dogs were happy to stay there, no problems at all. Cleaning lady kept coming once a day to check if we needed our room to be cleaned.  The food was great, loved everything I ordered, but it was a little overpriced.  The only thing I didn't like here is if you bring laptop or tablet, you would have to pay $13 for Internet, also we got a room with two queen beds which were too small and pillows were not as comfortable, so we didn't get our sleep for two nights.  But the whole experience over all we had a great time!

Very nice hotel with excellent staff.  Great location within walking distance of Huntington Beach pier.  Great place to stay for business in Orange County.  Also, perfect stay for a vacation.  All rooms have at least a partial ocean view.  Taking the kids to Disney?  Stay here at the beach away from the madness of Anaheim.  The only negative is the hotel is valet parking only so add $32 a day to your stay.  However, the valet service was excellent and had my car ready as pre-arranged every morning.

Stayed 3 nights here with 2 older teenagers and had a great time. The rooms are good - very clean, comfy bed and we loved our ocean view. It is noisy with balcony door open but the double glazing does a good job of keeping out the road noise at night. We loved the fact that you could get beach chairs, umbrellas and towels to take over the road to the beach - free of charge. What we did not like was that wifi was not free  -  $ 12.50 per day per device - with teenagers that could be pretty pricey. When we complained they gave us a promotional offer - but seriously charging for wifi when you are paying $300 or so for your room is not on in my book! We booked 2 rooms - one for us and one for the teenagers - without asking we were given interconnecting rooms which was a nice touch.

1.	Great location – you are about a half hour drive away from John Wayne (SNA) airport, Disneyland and a bunch of other local attractions.  2.	There is a twice daily shuttle to/from Disneyland.  3.	The beach is about a 1 minute walk across the Pacific Coast Highway. The PCH gets a little busy during the day, but there are pedestrian crossings. The beach itself is well-kept, clean, and has plenty of facilities – such as toilets, firepits etc. There are also many lifeguard stations to watch over you.  4.	The Huntington Beach pier is about a ¾ mile (12 minute) walk from the hotel, as is the main street of the town (they’re directly across from one another), Worth the trip – especially on a Tuesday night when they close the road down for a street fair and food court.  5.	I think

We had such a great experience at the waterfront. The grounds were beautiful, the rooms were spacious enough with a beautiful view. The restaurant had great food &  drink specials. Every employee we worked with was incredibly helpful & so nice. Everyplace we wanted to go was walking distance. We can't wait to get back right away!

I highly recommend the king-size bedroom for couples who's visiting Huntington beach. The hotel room was super clean and the view from our balcony on the 9th floor was just breathtaking. We watched the sunset every night from our bedroom, it was very romantic.

this hotel is an excellent place to stay weather on vacation or stay-cation. plenty for the kids to do as well as adults. great location to the beach and to main street. Walking distance to everything. Pet friendly as well. Free face painting for the children by the pool  and  balloon animals. this hotel is a smoke free interment even at the pool area.

Having stayed at the Hyatt previously I was expecting the Hilton to be a similar resort having stayed at many Hilton hotel's this is overpriced and needs upgrading. It is not anywhere near the same standard as the Hyatt. I did stay during the Vans Open but still paid way over the odds for this hotel. Staff were friendly room was basic, pool area is small but staff again friendly. The restaurant food and staff were good. I would not recommend here based on the price we paid.
Manager Response: Dear tam6572,  We appreciate your comments and advise you to always check our events calendar before booking with us (or any major hotel in Huntington Beach) during the Vans/US Open of Surfing. This annual event attracts well over 100K people to our city and thus makes any room at any hotel a "premium place to stay" (and being a mere city block from the event makes us even more prime). All room rates reflect that. Adding a Wednesday prior to or Sunday after any weekend event will always cause your rate to drop dramatically as well. plug that into our booking engine and see what happens!  as for room and resort upgrades, we are currently taking delivery of new furniture for suites (as I write this!), guestroom TV's to be upgraded (bigger, sleeker, better!) and in general can't wait for the "high season" to end so we may actually complete our room renovations. we can't get in there until everything slows down. Watch this space for all new photos of guest rooms and amenities in the coming months. You'll be duly impressed!  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing and Advertising The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel Surf City, USA

Summary: Best of a resort hotel with beach access across the street. Hotel provides beach chairs, towels, etc. Heated pool was a little on the warm side and a tad smaller than I was expecting. Shades restaurant has great food. Quiet room. Only wish the bathroom had ventilation.

Summary Heading: The pool and the beach make this property great.
Summary: To be honest, the Hilton was my second choice.  I had a great stay at the Hyatt a few years ago and wanted to stay there again but it was booked.  We stayed here for three nights that were by far the best of our vacation.  The beach and the pool were the best parts.  Service was great from the start, the valet, front desk, housekeeping, and wait staff.  I saw managers walking around, talking to guests, asking how their stay was, and asking if they could do anything extra for the guests.  The view from the room was beautiful.  The balcony was a relaxing place to sit, but be aware there is traffic noise from PCH at all hours.  With the door closed, the room was quiet.  The room was spacious, clean, and well decorated.  There is one restaurant, (Shades-which I reviewed separately)

Summary Heading: Hilton Waterfront Resort/Looks nice fails as a resort
Summary: I love Hilton properties and spent a week at the Hilton Anaheim before this resort.  The resort is very nice and clean and had beautiful views and balconies.  But being a smoker the property is a non smoking hotel.  You can smoke on the outside in front or back of the hotel but you are not able to use the balcony for such options.  I am a considerate smoker and don't like to push my nasty addiction on others, but I would like to be able to use the nice amenity of a balcony to do what I like and enjoy it as a stress reliever.  The ice machine did not work on our floor and there was no food options onsite after 10:00 or 11:00.  The store onsite was quaint but I think they should offer more resort type foods or goods.  I had a cousin come in from another area of Southern California
Manager Response: Dear Christina R.,  Thank you for you review, we appreciate your input. I have traced your reservation and notified engineering of a problem with the ice machine located on the floor you stayed. In reference to your desire to see swimwear in the Surf Hero Market, I have directed your suggestion to the store manager (who is also the buyer). I know in the past the issue with "swimwear" was twofold: We have no changing room in the market space to try anything on and 2). We cannot compete with the variety and selection of the main surf and swimwear stores on Main Street. We do, however, offer a complimentary shuttle to Main Street should the need or desire ever arise!  As for smoking, you're right. Our entire resort is "Smoke Free", including balconies. we offer two outdoor "Smoking Oasis" far removed from guestrooms and yet comfortably appointed with outdoor chairs and couches.This is really out of consideration to (and the safety of) other guests located around, above or below any given guestroom. Most of our guests enjoy keeping their sliding doors open, particularly in the evening... and smoke being smoke...goes anywhere it wants to go. Add to that the burn marks on railings, litter on decks and flooring, fire hazard, and the health consequences of second-hand smoke and you have the makings of a firm policy that every guests agrees to (and signs) upon arrival. We won't be changing that anytime soon, I'm afraid.  Al the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: This is the best escape from L.A., it's close by, great location, outstanding service.  The views and grounds are beyond pleasant and the rooms are surprisingly quiet for being a beach front property.  We can't wait to go back

Our family of 6 stayed here in July for 3 nights.  We had a very relaxing and enjoyable stay.  The rooms are clean and spacious.  The staff is so very friendly and so much so, one morning, my husband and I were walking on the grounds and a staff member introduced himself and asked how he could make our stay more enjoyable.  This was such a nice touch and we had a really nice conversation with him about California (we are from Pennsylvania).  The hotel has a nice personal feel about it and we would recommend this hotel to families, since there is so much to see and do.  Also, on Saturday night there was a Hawaiian Show on the pool deck.  We enjoyed our stay and if we find ourselves in Huntingdon Beach again, we would stay there.

We stayed at the Hilton Waterfront for five nights. I don't have any complaints. The staff was all very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge staff that we worked with, Rachel and Tamara. Each time you leave or come with your car your door is opened for you and you are greeted and asked if you need directions. The food was very good in the restaurant and there is nice outdoor seating by the pool along with a lot of indoor seating. Fish tacos were delicious. Lots of chairs around the pool and you can get an umbrella set up next to your chairs for shade. Also by the pool you can get beach chairs, umbrellas and towels to take across the street with you and use at the beach for the day. You can pay to have a canopy set up for you at the beach also, but we didn't feel they

Aloha! This is a very fun and relaxing hotel to stay at for whatever reason you are going there. The staff is #1 and perky and also very helpful at all times. The price is excellent and we'll be back many times a year for chillaxation.

Summary Heading: First Class Hotel at reasonable price
Summary: Truly enjoyed our stay, despite the groundbreaking for an additional hotel next door, we did not hear any noise. Very clean and updated hotel in a pleasant area of Huntington Beach. The shuttle was available to take us two blocks away or to Disneyland, great experience.

I used this property for a conference for my national association and I don't say it often (only one other time) but if I could book this same property year after year I would. The service is impeccable, the views outstanding and the staff most delightful. The rooms are comfortable, food quality wonderful and such a short distance to walk and visit many sites. You can't go wrong booking this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Nicole,  You just made our day... thank you! This is one of those reviews that will be shared with every department and all of our staff members. Near the end of summer, exhausted and sometimes running on fumes, when we're doing all we can to please every guest...this is just what the doctor ordered to keep the smiles and service "up to full speed".  Please come back soon... we miss you already!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: If you want a hotel that's close to the beach, this hotel is perfect.  The hotel is directly across the street from the beach and the hotel provides all the beach items you would need; chairs, umbrellas, towels, beach toys, etc.  In addition to the friendly and helpful hotel staff and the excellent restaurants, the view from the rooms is amazing!

Given the price we paid which was the highest per night during a 3 week trip of California, this was disappointing given we had high expectations from the photographs and other reviews. The check in was fast and friendly but the hotel has a dated feel, the room felt old and was quite dark, and also it was extremely noisy. All noise from the corridor outside could be plainly heard and when the room next door or above used the bathroom the noise could plainly be heard. The pool was a lot smaller than expected and the restaurant was disappointing. The location is good, across the road from the beach and a short walk or shuttle trip from down town. Overall, probably would look elsewhere if returning to Huntington Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Philip33,  Thank you for comments regarding your recent stay with us. We greatly appreciate your feedback and view any guest challenge as an opportunity to improve upon our service and amenities anywhere we can. I am very pleased that you were impressed with our staff upon check-in and were able to utilize our complimentary shuttle to downtown Huntington Beach (always a favorite for our guests!). I will be researching your exact room to see if there are any additional areas or needs for improvement (lighting, condition of the guestroom and furniture, etc.).  For rate savings next time in HB (if possible) try booking your stay outside of the peak summer season (Memorial Day thru Labor Day). You will be amazed! In addition to a modest rate, once the kiddies are back in school, we find the hallways much quieter and the pool less crowded. In a phrase... "paradise to those seeking peace"!  We look forward to another opportunity to serve you and "Make It Right".  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Great experience at the hotel, in Huntington, and after
Summary: We loved the hotel, saying there for several nights. The service was first rate and the location was perfect. Our room was big, clean and overlooked the water. Everyone was very helpful. After our stay, we emailed the Director of VIP Services to get information about some pillows they had in the lobby. He offered to actually send us fabric samples so we could order them for our house. We received the samples two days later. It was far above and beyond anything we could ask. We would highly recommend the hotel and the staff, and will certainly stay there during our next trip. Thank you again Joseph for your help afterwards.

My wife and I have stayed here twice now, sans kids, on long weekend getaways. Our most recent was 8/1-8/4 2014. As with the first trip, we had a great time.  First, the cons: Rooms are reasonably sized, but not huge by any stretch.Valet parking (or self) are both NYC/San Francisco priced. No spa on site, but concierge will help you get something at the Hyatt directly next door.  Other than that, the place is great. The restaurant has great food for both breakfast and dinner. Bartenders are great and knowledgable, restaurant management is on the ball. The never ate at the pool, but it looked like a lot of people did so. The coffee bar on site (proudly serving starbucks) was good, quick and made great drinks.   Everyone, from concierge to front desk to valet provided service well

We, 2 humans and 2 dogs, had a great mid-week 'weekend' at Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort. We thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff are courteous, the facilities what you would expect at this level of hotel, and it appears the building's architect cleverly engineered a structure where practically every room has a water view (unlike the Hyatt next door).  Our fur kids were genuinely welcomed with little package for each of them (doggy biscuits, plastic bowl, info on dog friendly restaurants, parks and beaches in the area, poo bags). There's also a special Pet In Room Dining menu, and their dinner arrives on a trolley with a silver dome over it just like yours! :) The rooms have a little balcony which is particularly nice when you're traveling with pets. Some traffic noise from Pacific

We stayed for 10 days with elementary school aged kids. Beach is short walk across PCH & pool is awesome. Staff was super nice and helpful. Loved the free beach chairs, toys, umbrella, & towels. Was a great jump off point for Disney and other LA attractions.  We will return!

We went to Huntington Beach for the 1st time this past weekend and we loved it. Our friends gave us a list of hotels to choose from and I decided to take a chance with the Hilton again even though I had some issues with my Hilton Honors points. The resort was great from the minute we pulled up. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a great view of the pool and ocean while you waited for your made-to-order omelets that were part of the buffet. The resort was directly across the street from the beach so very convenient if you're planning on beachin' it while you stay there. It is a short walk to restaurants and shops so we didn't even need to rent a car while we stayed there. The VANS surf competition was going on down the beach while we stayed which was an awesome experience to

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and close to the beach.
Summary: Couldn't have asked for anything more on our recent visit.  The rooms we're beautiful and had a great view of the water off our balcony.  Plenty of room for our family of 5.  5 minute walk to the beach and 15 minute walk to  Main Street full of restaurants and shops. Staff was friendly and always willing to help.  Was nice to not have to mess with packing beach towels, toys, chairs, umbrellas and pool toys, all of it was provided free.

With it being on the beach, there are a lot of kids which is fine. But you can hear all the noise from the hallways in the room, for two night heard them after 1030 till almost midnight. the hotel is nice and the grounds were nicely kept.
Manager Response: Dear Michael R.,  Thank you for your very kind words... our hardworking staff and grounds team really appreciate that! Also, please never hesitate to let us know if you are disturbed in any way during your stay (noise, smoking, partying, etc.). Everyone who checks-in with us signs our "no noise, no party" policy statement upfront. Almost everyone gets it...but then, on occasion, we do need to remind our guests about the policy. Our security department investigates every call promptly, never discloses where the call came from, and issues a friendly but firm warning...once. The second time we are at the door is to assist you with your packing.  All the best, and come back soon!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing and Advertising The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: My husband and I have stayed at the waterfront resort several times.   This time was extremely special for us. We brought our grown daughters and son in law and my sister and her family It was a first for all of them.   It was wonderful.   We appreciate the kind and helpful staff and the convenient access to the beach and main street.   The only complaint we have ever had with the resort is the high parking fee and the charge for internet access. Some amazing memories were made.  Thank you!

Beautiful hotel.  Was there for business.  Pool guests were very noisy at night while trying to sleep.  Hotel was on PCH right across from the beach which was amazing.  I'd go back but would request a room far from the pool.

My wife and I are always looking for that perfect place to visit.  With 2 kids (ages 6 and 9) finding a place isn't always easy.  We decided to stay local and experience the Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach.  As we pulled into the valet lane, we were greeted by the most amazing young men.  They engaged our children in conversation and made them feel special and welcome.  One of the young men noticed a surfboard in the back of our car and had a long conversation with my son about surfing.    The second we walked through the door, we knew we were in a special place.  As we walked toward the front desk for check in, we were greeted by the concierge.   My daughter is very social so she took the time to speak with the concierge.   During this conversation, my daughter was

Definitely just Eh, have little or no expectations--everything is fine but nothing is special.  We got an eh room -- 701-- Oceanview, I am not sure of that.  If you are on the balcony, you have a view of what I think was the employee parking lot and then turn your head a hard 90 degress to get a glimpse of the ocean.  I asked for a room away from the elevator and of course, they could not accomodate me.  I asked for late check out, and naturally-- the answer was no because they were sold out.  Ok, so our room, it was dated, and there was even a note left in the room saying, "there is $500 dollars behind the mirror."  I mean really????
