As a Hilton Honors member, I hate to say it but next I am in So Cal--I will not be staying at this property.
Manager Response: Dear RMR3,  Thank you for your feedback. We do apologize for not being able to accommodate your requests for a specific room type, location, or view. All of our balconies are angled at 45 degrees toward the ocean with the exception of  our front "Ocean View" rooms and suites. These sell out early during the season, so we strongly urge you to reserve these room types well in advance. Extended check-outs during high season (memorial Day thru Labor Day for us) are also based on our ability to do so, which is rare as the hotel is sold out every day. We apologize for being unable to extend this courtesy during your stay with us. Always know that you can store your luggage and personal belongings with the bell staff free of charge, or ask for an extended room rate to go later in the day (again, price and availability may vary).  As to your room challenge, an amazing solution is in the works for you, however! Download the new Hilton Honors app and look for the new "E-Check-in" feature. Like many airlines with advance seat purchasing, you will actually see a map of the hotel's available rooms and pricing for those rooms. You can then "click and book"...just like that! get the room you want, when you want, and never wonder again.  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Room smelled fishy and was noisy.  It was above the restaurant which played music and was hard to sleep after a long trip.  Expected more for the price; room needed upgrading.  Old, poor condition doors, rust in shower lighting, etc.  Ridiculous to have to pay for internet service in this day and age.  Much better value at lower tier hotels.  THe only thing it has going for it was the location with the beach across the street.  Staff were pleasant; they can't help that they have a mediocre product.
Manager Response: Dear Mary M.,  Thank you for taking the time to alert us to a potential problem with your room. We have researched your reservation and located the room during your stay. Both GM and the Director of Engineering are currently conducting a full inspection of your former guestroom. Being that we have no guestrooms above our restaurant (our tower is opposite any dining, meeting, or group function space) it is most likely that you were hearing our outside acoustic guitarist who plays around the fire pit. We always stop the music by 10pm, but to be certain we have also dispatched a notice to our Director of Restaurants to make sure that policy is being followed. We apologize for any disturbance.  I researched both weather and oceanic conditions during your stay to see if that may have been a contributing factor in any way to the smell you encountered in the room. Occasionally, especially if a slider door is left open all night and either an upwelling or red tide condition is in effect (combined with an onshore breeze), one can detect the distinct smell of the open ocean. We could find no general atmospheric or oceanic anomalies for your stay period (nor were there any other notices or calls from any other guests). We will now focus entirely on the room itself and see if perhaps this was the result of the previous guest or something we have yet to discover. We will communicate our findings and solutions with you directly via private email. Again, we sincerely apologize for anything less than our ordinarily stellar service and accommodations.   At every Hilton property throughout the world, we will go to whatever lengths are necessary to "Make It Right", no matter what the concern may be. Please never hesitate to notify us immediately if there is ever an issue or problem you encounter in any of our hotels. We welcome the opportunity to assist you in every way.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The exterior and hotel staff were great. The room just seamed a little below my expectations. Not super clean, and some furniture looked hastily thrown in (like a small fridge sitting on a counter and a bathroom mirror that anyone over 5' tall could see themselves standing up. Also a dirty patio and patio furniture.

We looked all over the coast to find a great place to stay that had beach access and was a nice place.  We found it at the Hilton.  Located across the street from the beach and 2 blocks from the pier, it couldn't have been better.  Upon checking in, I upgraded our room to a suite that faced out to the beach.  Great decision.  Best views around and the room was incredible.  Bar and pool were both good - and prices were in line with what I had expected.  I will say, though, that I wouldn't classify this place as a "value" as it is quite expensive to stay.  We stayed 2 nights, and would have stayed longer could we have afforded it.  But with that said, we would stay here again and again.

This is absolutely the "un 5star" experience.  Super friendly staff and incredibly dog friendly.  We have a corner suite on the ocean and it's nice, it's not Four Seasons or Fairmont nice, but it's nice.  Grab a last minute special on hotels.com or Hilton's web page and bring the dogs :-)

My husband, daughter, and I just returned home to Arizona from our visit to The Waterfront Beach Resort.  I wanted to say thank you for your efforts in making our stay possible.  I was so excited when I won the "Ingredient of the Month" contest on your hotel's Facebook page and a night's stay at the resort, and I so appreciate that you were able to accommodate us during the summer.  We wish we could have stayed longer, but our window of availability did not allow for it.  We did, however, make the most of our stay, and I know that we will be back to visit again someday!  Thank you again for your help in making our brief vacation so wonderful.  Staying at The Waterfront is a real luxury for our family, so we are truly thankful for the opportunity.

This hotel is amazing.  To start off, we arrived without a reservation...not by choice...I thought I had booked, but apparently, had not.  The front desk staff was super accommodating while I checked online for a better rate than what they could offer.  We were upgraded to ocean view room due to our diamond status.  Our room was amazing with southern views for miles down the ocean towards Newport Beach.  The room was well-stocked with toiletries and brochures about things to do at the hotel and nearby.  The room was very clean, remodeled and quiet.  The pool staff was very prompt and informative.  The towels were plentiful.  There was a dj poolside on the weekend.  The breakfast at Shades was amazing.  I'm not a 'buffet-eater' as I don't usually eat that much to justify the

I live in Torrance, but spent my birthday weekend not too far away at this Huntington Beach location.  It felt like I was truly on vacation!  The staff were all very nice and quite accommodating.  We had a great time at the pool and stayed at the hotel for dinner.  Great poolside Polynesian fire show was a treat.  Definitely would recommend!!

Hotel was very clean and all staff was very hospitable and outstanding. The staff continually asked if we needed anything at all. They greeted us every time we saw them. It was awesome. Breakfast was good and sufficient. Pool staff very attentive. Concierges went out of their way to assist in our needs.

We spent the most fantastic 3 days at this hotel.  Everything from the service, rooms and other amenities were impeccable.  Watching the sun set over the ocean was a true "California" experience.   We cannot wait to go back again.

One of the best hotel experiences we've ever had!  The quality of every area of the hotel is excellent! And right across the street from beautiful Huntington Beach!  The view is amazing, food is delicious, staff is so friendly, efficient and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great place to rest. Easy walk to main street
Summary: Enjoyed much. Good clean, friendly hotel in great location. Very close to main street and pier and just across road from beach. Easy to walk to Tuesday Night street fair and farmers market on main street.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel,   Good Location,  a little noisy
Summary: We are spending two nights here.  The hotel is lovely and our room, an "Executive Suite",  is great.  The room is clean, the staff friendly, and the location a short walk to downtown and across the street from the beach.  We had room service last night and ate in the restaurant today.  I rate the food as 3* out of 5*.  Interesting side note...I had oatmeal for breakfast.  It came without milk and when I asked to have some milk, the server was very pleasant and asked what kind, then brought a small carton of milk and set it on the table.  That was a first for me...usually they bring a little cream pitcher with milk for cereal.  It just seemed odd.  As an aside, while this location is very close to everything, it should be noted that it is NOT a truly waterfront hotel.  Between

Summary Heading: Beautiful Oceanfront Property with Gorgeous Views
Summary: This is a really nice, high-end hotel with staff that goes above and beyond. Rooms are clean, very nice and with gorgeous ocean views. I really loved the small balcony overlooking the ocean. Great for families traveling with kids. They do tons of activities for kids, the pool area is also nice and beautiful. The concierge and front desk people will help you with every need you might have and provide ton of info and maps on nearby places to visit and activities. The beach is 5 mins walking from the hotel and there are lounge chairs, umbrellas and everything you need available for rent. Another great pro - you can rent a car directly at the hotel for no additional fee and also drop it at the concierge desk in order to avoid parking fees. Food at the Shades Restaurant and the Surf

My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and could only spend the night of the 3rd as the night of the 4th was booked.  We checked in on the 3rd with no problem, but on the morning of the 4th, we took an early walk (8am) on the beach and were told we could not enter the hotel grounds without a bracelet.  After walking around to the lobby, we were told we could not use the pool or any of the amenities because we were checking out on the 3rd.  If I were told this before booking I would have never used 80,000 HHonors points on a reservation. In addition to not being able to use the hotel amenities before checking out at noon, there were numerous hotel security staff, blocking the hallways and doors, and we were left feeling like criminals.  Very unprofessional actions of the
Manager Response: Dear John D,  Thank you for your feedback. I sincerely apologize for the manner you were treated. Due to the intense nature of the 4th of July "action and movement" seen in and around the resort, I suspect one of our associates took the morning security briefing a little too far and forgot that is NOT how we interact with our guests... checking-in, checking out or just visiting the property. While it was completely true that we were moving to lock down and secure the property (and yes, close it off to non-guests), I feel we may not have effectively communicated this with you. I am sincerely sorry for the way this may have come off and am adding it to our playbook for upcoming events as an example of "what not to do". I am further looking to see if our reservations department can assist in better communicating the "lay of the land" prior to a guest's arrival in, what is for us, the most challenging holiday of them all.   Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I will communicate your letter to all of our frontline and security associates immediately.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing and Public Relations The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We stayed here with our family during a recent vacation to Disneyland. The hotel is beautiful and very clean, and the staff was very friendly. The hotel staff also came around the pool to make sure everyone was a guest at the hotel.   It's just across the street from the beach, and a short walk to the pier and a lot of great restaurants. We would definitely come back again!

Summary Heading: Great spring break option for families!!
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised during our recent stay during Spring Break.  We were visiting Disney Land but wanted to stay somewhere near the beach so opted for the 30 minute drive versus staying in Anaheim.  The hotel is just a short walk from both town (with lots of great shops/restaurants) and the beach but most importantly is rather quiet at night so you can relax by the pool without feeling like you're in the middle of a frat party.  If you stay definitely check out the sunset bonfire on the beach ... a bit expensive ($100-150) but well worth it!!

Summary Heading: great hotel great service from concierge
Summary: my familly and i stayed here for 3 nights in june .the hotel is very nice . location is perfect to beach and town . hotel provides shuttle to town if needed . but the best asset to the hotel is the staff !i cant say enough about the staff and how nice and acomadating  they are, espeacially the concierge Rachel Butler ! she was pleasant to deal with and went out of her way to make sure any request was taken care of . I had previosly stayed at the Beverly Hilton and the conciegre made a reservation at a resteraunt that was closed ,( fathers day dinner ) so when i went to make reservations for dinner at this Hilton i was nervous . she assured methat everthing was taken care of,  and it  was, the place was great she even had an appetize sent over to our table  to make sure we had a

We had a terrific visit to the Hilton Waterfront during spring break, at the end of a business trip.  The staff welcome was enthusiastic upon our arrival, and signaled that we had chosen the right place.  As soon as we pulled up to the door, we were welcomed by staff, then the front desk and concierge, activated the change from work mode to relax mode as we checked in, and learned her local suggestions.  The room was excellent, breakfast terrific, and our stay too short.  Great location with the beach steps way, with a beach equipment rental and snack shop right there.  Ample activities to keep a teenager busy.   Restaurants and the Huntington Beach Pier a short walk away.  Definitely would suggest this hotel to friends.

This hotel was immaculate, everything about it was clean and modern and the staff were all too happy to help with everything.   We stayed on the 13th floor over looking the pool and had the luxury of a great view across the shoreline. It's the perfect location to put your feet up and enjoy the late afternoon sun before heading out for some great food and drink on main street.   Talking food, 'Taco Tuesday' is something you can't miss out on - head in to town and make use of cheap drinks and cheap mexican food as nearly all of the restaurants will have something on offer! Highly recommend Fred's and to take on their big burrito's with a giant goblet of beer to wash it down.   The shades restaurant in the hotel was great, the dinner options for me personally were not as extensive

this place is not a good place to have sunday brunch buffet. the quality of food is so bad and most of the dishes are tasteless. the cut back on food selection. it not big like it use to be. it hard to eat when people at the pool walk by with huge spare tire gut in tight short or  hairy body. hey,hey,hey fat albert!!! the music was so bad.
Manager Response: Dear Chauster B.,  Thank you for taking the time to express your disappointment with your Sunday Brunch experience. I can assure you that in all the years I've been answering TripAdvisor reviews, this was one of the most baffling. Perhaps you missed the seafood, sushi and crab legs buffet? Or somehow missed our made to order omelet and Belgian waffle station? In any event, I can assure you that we have added to our bountiful buffet, so much so that we have had to get creative with where to put it all!   You have given me a great idea though... maybe we could do a little roadmap to all of the food stations in advance and then you can decide what it is you want before making a move from the table! Brilliant!!! Thank you.  Side note: We do have tables inside that face away from the pool and would be more than pleased to allow you to sit at the bar thus solving your "scenery" issue. Just a big mirrored wall with TV's to boot... let us know next time and we'll put on your favorite show or sporting event...it would be our pleasure!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing and Public Relations The Waterfront beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: This hotel is very over-priced. Room was tired and in need of refurbishing. Road between hotel and beach was annoying.  Staff was not as friendly and helpful as other Hiltons in the area which I don't understand. You'd think Hilton would have uniform standards for their employees.  Pool/hot tub area is very nice.  Restaurant is okay but again, very pricey.

This was the second straight year we chose to celebrate our anniversary at this hotel. It was our 42nd anniversary. We live less than an hour away from the hotel but it felt the same as if we had flown to Hawaii. Same ocean, same ambience! And we plan to do it again!

This is one of the best resort hotels in which I have stayed, having stayed in many such hotels around the world.  I would definitely recommend this resort hotel to anyone traveling to Southern California.  One gets what they paid for at this hotel.

The H.B. Hilton is a beautiful facility and the staff is very professional and nice.  A little too much geared for the "kids" but overall a nice clean place.  The parking fees are outrageous.  $30 for overnight valet service and $50 to park your car yourself!  If you have two vehicles that is an additional $60 dollars added on to your hotel room charge.  WAY too much.  You should not be charged to park your own car.

I have stayed at the Waterfront Hilton in Huntington Beach, California quite a few times and the service gets better every time we visit. The staff is extrememly helpful. We have two dogs and everyone was very helpful, even when one of them got sick and needed help.

Hubby and I wanted a cozy getaway...and this was the perfect place! We are newly married, and just needed another quick trip just for us. There were a lot of families there with kiddos, so it definitely made us want to come back with our daughter. We were so close to the beach, and local restaurants. Overall, this was the perfect place for us to recharge our batteries. Not to mention that it was very romantic. The staff, from check-in to check-out, were so friendly! The room was a 10 out of 10!

I stayed there for a meeting, drove down from LA, the night prior, check in was efficient, and quick. I took my own bags up to the room. View was fantastic, with beach horizon view. Typical hilton room, lobby bar was packed, but quick service, and friendly. The meeting room the next morning was pretty, staff was efficient and friendly. Interesting family style foods.

Summary Heading: This is the only place to stay on PCH in Huntington Beach
Summary: This place has it all; wonderful location (just blocks from the Huntington Beach Pier; great food, wonderful rooms with views, and the best hotel staff I have had the pleasure of being with in literally 35+ years of travel and hundreds of hotel stays.  And as a Hilton Diamond Member, I have had the opportunity to stay at some wonderful locations and hotels.  You will absolutely NOT ever be disappointed, and on the very off chance something in your stay requires a little attention, just call down to the desk (Matt Strawn is the Front Desk Manager) and you will be well taken care of quicker than any other place you have ever stayed!  Enjoy your stay there!!

Lovely Welcoming Staff who couldn't do enough for you Clean & Tidy Rooms and very spacious with great views! Great Food Had breakfast and an evening meal here couldn't fault anything. Great location within easy reach of main promenade.

My daughter and I stayed in one of the suites offered at this hotel; it was fabulous! The room was comfortable and spacious, clean, and had a wonderful view. The service of the hotel staff was great, super helpful, and made our stay very pleasant. Location was great (right across the street from the beach), and near the downtown main street. I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

The Hotel was great - room spacious and clean and great ocean side view.  Staff were marvelous - went out of there way to be helpful and make your stay comfortable.  Also had shared access to Hyatt's  facilities right next  door which had nice shops and wonderful Spa.  The Gallery HB  at the Hyatt is a shop you don't want to miss Owner Peggy was wonderful and offered Great group fun with Ukulele lessons  - fun shared family time.  Great trip!

Beautiful hotel, nice pool and hot tub, clean rooms, pool and beach view, pleasant staff, good breakfast, perfect location across from the beach with walking access..Live entertainment at bar on Friday nite It was reasonably quiet and peaceful and lovely grounds.

I've stayed at this hotel numerous times for business travel. Like most full service hotels, the price is high and the offerings are low. Pool is nice. The only parking option is valet but parking anywhere in HB is expensive. Quite a hike to downtown HB, but they do have an hourly shuttle. A major improvement is the coffee shop that opened up, before you couldn't get a decent cup of coffee before 7:00 am. Rooms are excellent, most have views of the ocean and/or pool. If you get close to the elevator, you won't have a view. Comfortable Hilton beds, lighted night stand which is a nice touch in the middle of the night.

Summary Heading: The best view of the ocean and beach
Summary: Talk about a room with a view! It was perfect.  The furnishings were comfortable.  The room was clean and very well kept.  I was on the top floor overlooking Huntington Beach and PCH (toward Newport Beach).  I enjoyed the full moon from my balcony, with fresh ocean breezes and the sound of waves breaking on the shore.  My stay was a little slice of heaven.

Summary Heading: The place to stay at Huntington Beach
Summary: A great place to stay right in the thick of things. I did expect the mattress to be on par with the rest of the room, it was a little bit of a let down. When we arrived they did not have anymore 2 Queen rooms that my wife had reserved, so after a couple of minutes we were upgraded to the Governor Suite. It was huge!! I would have thought it was a 3 bedroom apt. The room was excellent, views of the ocean off one balcony and the pool from the other balcony. The only downside was there were only 2 beds and a pull out. That much room and only sleep 3?? I question the logic on that one, but a great room regardless.

Summary Heading: still a nice place to stay in hb
Summary: we've been here a couple of times and still like the waterfront resort. this time we had a king corner suite with two balconies and great seaview. all the people working there are very attentive and super nice, the proximity to the beach can't be beaten.  having breakfast outside is great if you are not too picky about food quality. the choices are okay but the quality could be better.  the gym hasn't been remodeled for years, is very tiny, dark and not exactly great but it will do if you take part in a lot of other outdoor activities. the pool area is well maintained and beautiful though sometimes a bit crowded and noisy. the hotel offers a lot of activities for kids.  as a downside you should be aware that everything is very expensive. renting a bike or a beach chair is

We just stayed here for one week and had two rooms. Our room/suites were perfect...on the 9th floor with 2 balconies facing the ocean unobstructed. Literally a room with a view. The location was great from walking the strand, renting beach cruisers across the way, walking to Main Street, riding into Newport on our bikes and a short easy drive to Laguna. The staff was attentive, friendly and extremely eager to please. Room service was good as was picking up dinners from Shades Restaurant. Delicious salmon! Our 11 month old puppy joined us and it is very dog friendly and easy to take her out with doggie spots on grounds with bags. She had a great time, loves the beach and the Hilton is close to the famed doggie beach which is a must for an afternoon. Beautiful, fun and clean. I'm

Hotel is normally great but they shut down the pool unexpectedly to host a business event.  that stunk.  the pool was one of the reasons I went in the first place, so annoying.  beds are incredibly small
Manager Response: Dear Mark,  I am so sorry for the inconvenience. We tried desperately NOT to have that happen, but the group in-house suddenly presented us with a last minute lunch request and the corner section of our pool deck was our last option for them. Rest assured this is not what we regularly do in the height of summer season and sincerely apologize. You may have noticed an inordinate amount of banquet servers and houseman moving at the speed of light to make it all disappear the second they were done, but we obviously tripped up your plans in the meantime.  In the future, do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything that dissatisfies you during your stay. I can assure you that we will do everything in our power to "Make It Right" on the spot!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing and Public Relations The Waterfront Beach resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The Waterfront Hilton is by far one of my favorite hotels in Southern CA. Being a resident in Huntington Beach, it's hard to find a nice little getaway without having to get in the car and drive for a few hours. This hotel is not your average Hilton resort. I've never stayed at a hotel where I felt at home. The staff is so welcoming, the decor in all the rooms is to die for, and the food at Shades is perfection. We recently stayed here the weekend of our wedding and enjoyed every minute of it's bliss.

stayed here for 4 nights whilst on a road trip to parts of america with my husband and daughter, fantastic hotel with staff who can;t do enough for you and who are so friendly and helpful. Valet parking (only option) bit steep at 32 dollars per day but we were given vouchers for breakfast to value of 45 dollars per day so this kind of cancelled out valet parking. We just had the continental breakfast as we were fed up with the cooked breakfasts while being in other areas. It was orange juice, tea or coffee bagels, toast cakes fruit cereals etc. Our room was lovely side view of the ocean and we could actually see dolphins in the water. Room had a free fridge, safe and coffee making machine. Be careful when getting a taxi bak from the main huntington street as we are scottish so

We had a wonderful, enjoyable and relaxing stay at this hotel.    The room was roomy with a beautiful view.  We were in the Catalina Suite.  It's a corner suite.  It's on the 11th floor, stunning view.  The balcony wrapped around from the front with an ocean view in the front to the side of the hotel where you could see much of the city.  There is some construction going on next door, but that is a minor sight compared to the expansive view of the pool on the ground floor and the view of Huntington Beach, the city.    In addition to the beautiful room, the people working at the hotel were extraordinary.  Every service person was polite and cheerful and always ready to be of service if you asked but never intrusive.    Sophia cleaned our room every day.  I asked her how long she

We stayed at the Waterfront for a week. Had a room ocean view. Nice room. It all started with the Valet parking. They are there to get you out of your car and give you instructions on checking in. Very friendly and nice men. Check in went very smoothe and the bell man took everything to our room and set it up. I was very impressed with every staff member at this resort. We sat by the pool one day and the Gentleman in head of Security came over and just visited with us. Come to find out he had ties in Utah where we are from. The Beach at Huntington Beach is one of the cleanest Beach. Every morning they are out there cleaning up the beach. Not one bad experience happened to us. We were very well taken care of. My only complaint was no free wifi. It was 12.95 a day for internet

EVERYONE from check in to bellman to waiters/waitress to valet were very, very accommodating to my husband and myself. We were celebrating our 21st wedding anniversary and really felt taken care of. I used my fathers timeshare credit and we tried getting the upgrade to either a oceanfront or 1 bedroom suite when we booked our reservation we were unable to to so but still had a wonderfully beautiful ocean view room and at check in we received comp breakfast for both mornings. And the complimentary wine to celebrate our Anniversary was an awesome touch and made us feel special! THANK YOU again for the great hospitality!!

I have stayed at this property over 200 times as a business traveler during 2012 - 2013 and have never had even the slightest negative experience. From housekeeping to valet to front desk to management this property provides an EXCELLENT guest experience.

This hotel was clean but expensive. No self parking except across street where you have to feed a meter. Valet parking was $32 a day and then a tip is expected. Room was over $250 and no breakfast included. Stayed in 909 and view of coast was very nice except we were overlooking a huge wedding tent and watched crew set up that started a little too early. Was too early to listen to set up workers rolling tables and talking. The room was on the side of the hotel but view of ocean was nice.  Room was clean and spacious. Bed very comfortable. We did have to call house keeping up to change the sheets as there were yellow stains in middle of bed. I don't think it was human.  The property itself was nice. There is a Whole foods, Target, Wallmart and some great restaurants in short

Summary Heading: Been Here Many Times. Never any major issues
Summary: I've been staying here on business 1-2 time per year for the last 4 years. As I have been staying on business though, I can't really accurately comment on the extra amenities that the hotel offers. I will however, give some positives and negatives based on what I use at the hotel.  Positives: -Proximity to the beach. It's right across the street! -Pool. It's a nice pool and I've never seen it overly busy. -Rooms. I usually stay in the standard double bed room. No complaints here. It is what it is. Try to get a room with an ocean view. It's a great thing to wake up to. -Staff are very friendly.  Negatives: -Proximity to Main st. I don't mind the walk (it's very nice to walk along the beach) but for young children or seniors it's quite a way to get to Main street or the Huntington

The hotel is located on the beach and the pool is beautiful.  The hotel provides a shuttle to and from the shops at Huntington Beach, which is so nice! Also, they provide beach equipment for your stay.  This is great if you have kids...a major big plus!

Summary Heading: Beautiful views...average accomdations for a Hilton
Summary: The views were priceless, the staff was helpful but there were stains in the carpet in my room and the bathroom was not cleaned.  I travel a lot and I could not get a good night rest in the bed...not what I am used to but that could be personal preference.  Finally, I could hear EVERYTHING going on in the room next door.  Overall, average experience but the view made it all worth it.

We stayed here about a month ago, visiting a friend. We have stayed in many Hilton's so we didn't realize how outdated this one was. The hotel itself was fantastic. The staff was nice & helpful, the great room was spacious and high end. The pool was large and opened up to the bar.  But the rooms we were highly disappointed. We are Hilton Honors Members and were upgraded to an ocean view room. You could tell that they tried to update it, but it was a sad attempt.  Some comfortable furniture outside would have been helpful. A lamp that worked would have been helpful. Free wi-fi would have been convenient since we were on the road for almost 3 weeks and needed to pay bills.  The one thing we did appreciate was we were allowed to bring our mountain bikes up to the room., and the

we enjoyed the hotel. lovely views, nice beds, very quiet. LOTS of weddings! much smaller than the Hyatt next door. pool area was maintained well (but full of kids). restaurants were good (the deli and shades). overall, for the much lower price than the hyatt - this is a great location. We walked to main street for meals (Dukes and Cucchina Alleso). Walked on the beach. Great weekend at the beach. Had some issues with a baby next door the first night (ok, 5:30 am but still).

We had a room on the top floor (as we had asked for) and it was very nice.  Bathrooms a bit small but all else was clean and modern.  View from the balcony was simply stunning.  It is a very easy walk to get to the main part of town or the pier and directly across from the beach.  The service (except for the restaurant "Shades") was nothing short of outstanding.  Friendly greetings with smiles along with helpful and attentive attitudes.  It is a place to stay that makes me want to come back to.

My friend was married on Huntington Beach and she chose this hotel to stay at so we also chose to stay here as well. We arrived way before check in time and they had a room available next to the pool. We had a great view of the pool and the ocean as well which was awesome! The staff were amazing and I don't think I ever opened the front door my entire stay. The rooms were clean and well arranged. The hotel itself was beautiful and it was right across the street from the beach which was convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Business brings me to Huntington Beach every quarter. The Waterfront is the place I always stay.  The staff is always very friendly and respectful, and you can not beat the views.  I plan on bringing the family out for the next trip for both business and leisure.

I want to sincerely thank you the entire staff and management of the Waterfront Resort for making our stay at your hotel on Saturday night one that we will remember for the rest of our lives!  While my original plan was to propose to my girlfriend on the beach, after seeing the beautiful view of the suite, I decided to propose on the balcony.  We look forward to reliving the experience in your hotel again in years to come!

Summary Heading: Great weekend, family loves this place
Summary: Took a last minute trip this weekend with the family.  I am very glad we were able to get a room for a couple nights. This was our second stay here and it is always great. Super views, amazing rooms great staff. Oh, and thx for the upgrade!!  Will be back soon.

Had a partial view of ocean which was very nice. Rooms are large, patios very small but service was outstanding.  The valets are extremely friendly and fast!!  The shuttle on the hour was great and the walk back was easy...downhill!.

We loved it here. Incredible, over-the-top service at every encounter with staff. Great location, easy walk to pier and Main Street. Easy drive down to Newport. The day we decided to spend time on the beach we thought we might have to sneak the pool towels down to the beach. No need! We were given as many towels as we needed, provided with brand new sand chairs (!), and a beach bag to carry our stuff/towels.  I believe they'd give you bikes or surfboards or whatever you need too.  We heard about the beach bonfire service, just didn't get a chance to take advantage of it. Will next time we are there, and there will be a next time. No question.  One word of advice - ask for a room with a view north, and at a higher floor than 5. Otherwise your "ocean view" might only be if you

We stayed here in Sept 2013-and had a great time. We were looking for a place to go this spring and after looking at many places--Bahamas, Mexico, etc. we decided to come back here because of the great experience we had before--we knew what we could expect. We were not disappointed, as a matter of fact the concierge remembered us and did an outstanding job before we even arrived to line up dinner reservations.   We took advantage of the Surf, Park and Eat program. It includes valet parking, free internet and a fabulous breakfast every morning. How nice is it to come back from walking on the beach and have a great breakfast outside with a view of the ocean. You can order off the menu or have the buffet. Service was great, food was great.  We requested a room on a high floor---we

Summary Heading: Great time, Great people and Great food!
Summary: We arranged to have dinner with a group of 16 through Catering.  Vanessa and Kathy were extremely helpful and accommodating not only for the meal but in securing rooms for our group.   From the moment we arrived the valets and bellmen were very helpful and grateful.  Anna at the front desk arranged to have glassware sent to the suite w/o hesitation. The dinner was absolutely fabulous.  The chef prepared a wonderful four course meal which all the guests enjoyed.  The waiter was on top of our every need and the atmosphere was perfect.  Thanks to all their efforts it was a night to remember.

I planned a trip to Long Beach for a conference, but wanted a better experience, away from typical business hotel travel. This hotel's staff does everything possible to provide the highest level of service. Room condition and facilities were quite impressive. This is a very professional world class operation. being in short walking distance to the beach and shopping areas was an added bonus.

Across from the beach, very tropical "feel" wonderful restaurant, live music, indoor and outdoor seating...very nice décor...and everyone on staff is most cordial. The balconies are private and quite spacious with fabulous views of the beach and the Pacific...right on the Pacific Coast Highway...easy access and very quiet..

Staff, except for front desk girl, were excellent. This hotel claims to be dog friendly, but in essence did not perform as advertised in that area. The AARP discount they advertised gave us a 2 pm check out time that the front desk girl refused to honor.
Manager Response: Dear 669cathik,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. I am extremely perplexed as to how we did not meet your expectations with regards to our pet friendly policies? If I may be so bold as to ask you to contact me directly at the email provided below and provide me with additional detail, I will personally look into this matter. We are extremely pet friendly...and we pride ourselves on this fact.  I do apologize for not being able to honor your late check-out via AARP. On occasion we are unable to extend this courtesy if we are sold out the following day. I suspect this was the case as we were at full capacity during your stay. I'd be happy to discuss this further with you as well. I am at your service.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel sohanlon@waterfrontresort.com

Summary: Everything about our stay was enjoyable and the entire staff was amazing!! My sister and I stayed here and we felt like super stars! Worth every penny. Not to mention the view!! Absolutely amazing!! Thank you for a great stay!

The location is awesome....right across the street from the beach and a 10 minute walk from the pier.  The pool area is somewhat sheltered from the mid day breezes and is well maintained.  Our room was nice ....just seemed odd that there was no fan for the bathroom...with the high humidity the mirror would stay fogged for quite some time.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating to our requests.

Summary Heading: Beautiful room great view, close to pier
Summary: The room was awesome except for the worn out old couch with the best view from inside. It was quiet enough to listen to the waves. Beer was expensive but expected. We walked to the pier, seemed safe lots of people and a surfing competition were fun to watch. Bed was comfy too but couldn't block out all the outside lights to sleep. I slept fine but someone else likes it dark! Breakfast was good. Oh you have to cross busy road to the beach, but there's a light.

Stayed for five nights in May '14. Check in was very quick, the rooms all face towards pool area or away from the hotel and cover over 10 floors.  My room was basic but comfortable, however it was clear that it had been a while since it was properly cleaned in both the bedroom and bathroom. That said bed was comfortable.   Hotel pool area was good but I don't get why music has to be played constantly.   Breakfast and food and beverage in General was good. The final bill was a little surprising as having to pay $30+ dollars a night to park a car seemed expensive.  Finally the service from all staff was excellent and really made the hotel.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Location; Rooms Could be Better
Summary: I booked this hotel because it was across the street from the beach. The location was perfect and the employees at the hotel were some of the nicest I've met. The hotel concierge helped me book a bonfire on the beach, which was so much fun. I rated this hotel 4 stars for the location and the friendly employees.   The rooms I would rate 3 stars. We had 2 adjoining rooms. My husband and I had a corner suite (I believe the same suite mentioned in another post). There was a big hole around the window frame in the bedroom which let noise in all night. If that window had been fixed, it would have been a very quiet room.  I complained about it the first night and no one came to fix it. There were some areas around doorways that were rotted.as well. I like to sleep in the dark and our

We stayed her for 5 days including a weekend and each staff person we encountered was fabulous. Always greeted us and asked if they could help us with anything. From check-in, to the pool, restaurant, and passing housekeeping staff in the hall- they were all fantastic.

Summary Heading: The location is great, the hotel is nice, but the staff are amazing.
Summary: My family stayed at this hotel for vacation for five days over Easter and truly, it was the nicest visit. The hotel is directly across the street from the beach and a quick shuttle ride to downtown Huntington Beach. The staff at this hotel couldn't be nicer or more friendly. The room was comfortable. Incredibly quiet. The bedding was lovely. The pool was small, but nice with nice towels and the little poolside fire was really appreciated in the morning since it was still a bit chilly in April. But the standout in all this hospitality was Cathy Weaver. She ran the Easter egg hunt by the pool and was such a charming, sweet person, I would stay at this hotel again just on our experience with her alone. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Nice hotel with great views over the beach.  I say it's on the beach but you do need to cross the road, for those that don't like walking! - It's not far.... Just along the road is the pier if you do like an evening walk and watch the sun set. The restaurant is good with some healthy options and the rooms are very comfortable -  I had a beach and pool view.  Onto the opportunities (bearing in mind this is not the cheapest place to stay):  The plumbing was a bit noisy, so if someone next door had a shower at 5am you will hear the pipes.  The parking was very expense - I think it was $32 a night.  After one day I realized you could park on the main road on the beach side of the hotel which has metered parking and cost me approx $16-18 a night.  Breakfast started at 6:30am.  For

Stay at this property every time I come to Southern California.  All rooms have great ocean view and are very nicely decorated.  Facilities are impeccable and staff is wonderful.  Such an enjoyable place to stay.  I spend over 100 nights a year in hotels (mainly Hilton properties) throughout the world and this is certainly in the top 5%.  Great location walking distance to pier and town shopping and restraunts and bars - great stay!   top

Summary Heading: Ritz Carlton Service at a Hilton!!
Summary: I am a Hilton Diamond member, so I visit a lot of Hilton properties.  I have never experienced the level of service I received at this hotel anywhere in the Hiltons I have visited over the years! You cannot pass a hotel employee without receiving a hello and how is your day going.  The Chef Concierge, Tammy, was without a doubt the finest Concierge I have ever experienced at any hotel property.  Tammy was so focused on your needs, and paid incredible attention to detail.  She wanted you to feel special and have the best experience ever.  Even if you don't require her services, stop at her desk just to say hello and experience her general concern for your wellbeing.  This hotel should pay her double whatever her salary is to make sure they never lose her...she is a Waterfront

A very good hotel, was there for a business meeting. Located just across the beach, easy access to shopping places, diner. Food quality was good. Hotel crews were nice and pleasant. Environmental friendly hotel. Would recommend guest to get the room up higher to get a better view of the Pacific. Each room has their own porch which is a plus. Clean room. Would come back for sure.

Unfortunately had to work the entire time but the Hotel was exceptional. While it was a little dated, the rooms, staff and overall experience was great. Just a short walk down PCH to take in dinner at Duke's. Across the street and your in the sand and surf - great location.

Great hotel, great service and food.  All around a very top notch experience.  Dinner by the pool with the fire and the musician was a terrific way to end the day!!  I will definitely stay here again!  Terrific all around experience!

The staff were all very friendly and helpful - from the front desk, valet and food service.  The room was a little larger than I was expecting with a sofa and work space with ample plugs.  The wifi worked fine for me my entire stay.  All in all a solid Hilton-like experience.

We stayed at the Waterfront for 4 days at the beginning of a 16 day road trip taking in LA, Grand Canyon, Vegas etc. We wanted somewhere by the coast to relax in the sunshine to kick our trip off nicely.  All the brochures seem to suggest Santa Monica but that sounded too crowded and touristy to me so, after plenty of research, we decided on Huntington Beach.  We were really glad we did as the resort had exactly the sort of laid-back vibe we were looking for (and a visit to Santa Monica later in the holiday confirmed my reservations on staying there).   The Waterfront resort is situated probably 7-8 minutes walk along the boardwalk from Main Street and the Pier.  As Brits we found it hysterical that there should be a shuttle into town! Why does no one in America walk anywhere?

First, I will say all the employees at this resort are super friendly and knowledgeable.  Pool is spectacular!  Perfect location.  Stayed in a Suite #826 on 8th floor, corner room, great views! Only 20 minutes to Disneyland.  Second, This Hilton needs renovated, At $350 + a night its in pretty rough shape.  1.  Dry rot by doors and windows, and rusty. 2.  Black mold in tubs and showers. 3.  Holes around the window framing as large as a nickels, and rust.  Winds and outside noises came thru, making it hard to sleep and having to turn the television up to hear.  Rooms were cold from all the holes in window framing. 4.  With all the technology devices that we travel with, this suite made it very hard to even find a plug in, unless you pull the king size bed out away from wall,
Manager Response: Dear Sunbaby39,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with the condition of your guest room. We are completing a renovation that includes guest room enhancements that will fix some of the issues you experienced. We apologize that you were disappointed in our dining offerings and will keep your recommendations in mind. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you, if your travels bring you back to our area.   Kind Regards,   Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: The hotel is clean, pool is warm and big, restaurant is delicious! Bed is super comfortable! All good things...it's Hilton! But service takes good to great.  Thank you bellman Chase for taking good care of us!!!  Without hesitation, there was an issue with the assigned room to get us a better room with a great view and even surprised us with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our 1st yr anniversary and 1st visit to CA.  This hotel is expensive for us but CHASE'S service made us happy to spend the money, happily!

Summary Heading: Beautiful view, perfect location, and a nice heated pool with good drink service.
Summary: Me and my family went to the hilton hotel over April break and it was probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at (and we travel quite a lot to nice hotels) the pool was very warm and there was a nice hot tub as well. They served Starbucks next to the pool also. Some seats were faced towards the pool, and some had a great view of the beach. On the hour, you could take a shuttle into the center of the Huntington Beach town which was very lively and definitely worth spending some time in. You could also get a shuttle back on the hour. On Tuesday nights, there is a fair with street venders and more which was GREAT me and my family loved it. The service at the hotel was also great and everyone was so nice. There was one man named Romelle (I'm not sure how to spell it) and

We had four nights here to enjoy the famous surf city and found the hotel to be ok and nothing more than that. The rooms are comfortable but a little old style and could do with a refresh, especially the bathrooms which look like something from the 1970s - although they are functional and everything works fine. Our room had problems with the air circulation and we woke up every morning to condensation on the balcony door even if we left the air con off. In addition sound proofing is awful and we were woken up so many times by banging doors and people coming and going. The maid service is though very thorough and the maids really do an exceptional job.  The restaurant is good but it serves nothing special or memorable. The breakfast buffet has a good choice but as with all

I had a business trip to Huntington Beach, and the company paid for us to stay at the Hilton. Top notch meeting facilities, restaurants, and pool area. The beach is directly across the street. It's about two blocks from downtown Huntington Beach and the pier, just an absolutely fabulous location.

Summary Heading: Great resort, lovely facilities, shame about 'extras'
Summary: We had a wonderful stay with our 2 daughters at the resort - good access to Disney and main street for dining etc. including Shuttle and good facilities including pool and restaurant. My only gripe would be that there is a charge for internet and also that parking is so expensive plus there are charges for everything eg bike hire when you expect to get some benefits from paying £200+ per night ! Overall happy though

We enjoyed 3 nights at this hotel in a one-bedroom corner suite. The room was very clean and the furnishings new and in good condition. Only issue was that the living room was only just big enough for the fold-out sofa bed on which my 2 children slept. Staff very helpful and friendly. Pool and surrounding area very well maintained and clean. We booked the sleep/eat/surf/park package which was well worth the extra as it included internet access, breakfast (for 2 only) and valet parking.

Summary Heading: Hilton Huntington Beach Waterfront is wonderful!
Summary: Wonderful staff, location, beautiful hotel, grounds, pool are just perfect. Outdoor dining/fire pits. A walk across the road to a gorgeous beach. Doesn't get any better. The staff goes out of their way to be of assistance and to make your stay comfortable.

Took the family here for a little Spring Break trip. What a great place as soon as you pull in they are there welcoming you with smiles and help through out. I made a request to have some chocolate chip cookies ready for us at check in. Just as we checked in Ramil "i think that was his name" had them ready for us and also included some easter eggs and bunny ears for the kids. Already here for 10 minutes and the staff is great. There are so many great things to say about this resort one that we all enjoyed is they let you get chairs umbrellas and boggie boards to take to the beach. The shuttle service to downtown was also a plus. We will be back for sure.

very friendly staff,nice walk to town,nice pool service and nice staff at deli and restaurant..everything great..breakfast great beers on tap to bring to pool and poolside food very good..quiet stay for good sleep nightly..amazing bars and food downtown and zachs at the the pier best for surf lessons and bikes..cool people and great vibrant beach town

This hotel is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for!  Location is excellent; across the street from the beach with a crosswalk.  Facilities are very nice, we especially enjoy the pool and hot tub.  The staff was super friendly- every single person.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a Sales Meeting!
Summary: We had a group of 12 for our spring Sales Meeting.  The Staff at the hotel (100%) were incredible!  They never said "no" to any request - they even helped us assemble metal detectors and "bury" treasure for our team building event on the beach!  Rooms were all very nice and clean.  Pool Side bar served great drinks - service at pool side was a bit slow.  If you are looking for a great room, "PCH" front corner rooms are amazing with nice balcony.  (I was in 226).  Uou can walk everywhere from this hotel so "no cabs" were required.  Quick trip from SNA airport!  Hats off to the staff - they were all wonderful!

Summary Heading: Loved it here! Perfect for our family!
Summary: Our family of four had a great time and we were glad we picked this hotel with a view and beautiful pool over staying somewhere by Disneyland. We had a spacious room with a great view of the ocean. Great service, good food and excellent facilities in a lovely location!

I went out to Huntington Beach for a group offsite meeting so wasn't expecting much. I'd never been to Huntington Beach California. This hotel is a nice little gem across from the Beach. Granted most of my time was spent in the meeting rooms looking out towards the beach but we had lunch by the pool twice, a catered dinner then smores by the campfire. Dinner at Shades one night. The food and service were great. The rooms small but clean. The staff very helpful. Not sure if I would vacation here, I'm used to staying on the beach, not across the street from it but to each their own.

Myhusband and I traveled to Huntington Beach to meet his friend from childhood, and his wife who flew in from out of state to go on a week's cruise.  We were greated with such warmth and friendliness. Matt at the front desk was great explaining everything, including information for our little Cocker Spaniel which was welcomed with open arms.  Jeffrey the bell man was very helpful and friendly as well as all the staff in the hotel.  We had margaritas on the patio, dinner with our friends at Shades's on the patio, which is beautiful, with a large firepit, and breakfast the next day on the patio.  Our servers again were grest.  Our room was beautiful with 180 degree view of the beach and the mountains.  We enjoyed the Jacuzzi and pool area.  We will be coming back.  A great place

This was our first stay at Huntington Beach, and the Waterfront Hilton was excellent. The pool area is fantastic (poolside mai tai!), and the buffet breakfasts were great. Loved the ocean views from our balcony, and the service from everyone there is top notch. You can't beat the location since it is so close to the beach and the walking distance to the main street area. The only downside is the double beds rather than queens for a family of four. They are a little small.

Great hotel to just get away and relax. Relaxing pool area, good bar atmosphere and nice walk to many popular sites in the area. Rooms have great view especially suites of the ocean and rooms are modern.

We stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Resort at the end of a Cruise from South America. Its in a great Beach Side location and the Staff are very helpful with information, directions etc. Its in an ideal location wether you just want to hang out and relax or even if you want to sight see. There is a Tour desk available were tours to the Hollywood attractions and theme parks can be booked, (however Hollywood is quite a distance away) its not too far to Disneyland though as its in the same county. If you want to do your own thing a Car is essential as its some distance to the local shops and other attractions. Parking is avail;able at the Hotel (charges apply). The Bus to South Coast Plaza in Newport Beach terminates near the Hotel, its a cheap bus ride but takes about an Hour.

Summary Heading: Great hotel- clean, great decor and oceanfront location
Summary: From my call to book a room last minute to the moment I checked out, I found the staff to be friendly and accommodation. Room was fantastic- beautifully renovated, clean, a wonderful little balcony to enjoy the sun and ocean breezes, and very spacious. The exercise facility was dark and cramped, but with the Pacific Ocean sand and boardwalk immediately across the street who needs a treadmill? Would definitely stay here again.  Only drawback was broken elevators and a 5 minute wait to catch a ride down the 8 floors with my luggage.

The Hilton Waterfront in Huntington Beach was the perfect Hotel for a beach vacation.  The service and food were great, but the friendly and helpful employees put it over the top.  The rooms and amenities were of high quality.  I will definitely return.

Beautiful Hotel with extremely professional and helpful staff. Great location. Restaurant excellent. From the Bell Captain, to the valet professionals everyone was wonderful. Ramel was exceptional and acted as if we were the only people he had to take care of. All of the staff were happy all of  the time

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but I didn't like Shades Restaurant
Summary: I stayed here 3 nights during a conference in March.  I loved the hotel overall but did not like Shades Restaurant.  First, the great stuff about this hotel:  I got a room on the top floor (12th floor) and had a great view of the ocean (looking northwest) and the pool area.  It had an extended little balcony where you could sit and relax and enjoy the view.  The room was so clean and had hardwood floors -- I was glad I brought a pair of slippers.  I had some trouble with the tv cutting in and out but really didn't use it much anyway.  I was able to use the wifi easily enough. The beds are really comfortable.  And the temperature controls allowed me to make the room as warm or cool as I needed.  The staff were extremely friendly and helpful -- they made me feel so welcome.  One

Last October, I got to stay at the Hilton Waterfront and this time it was for five days. It was great!  I'm a Hilton Diamond member, and I appreciated the nice oceanfront room upgrade, as well as the complimentary breakfast. Breakfast was good, and I was happy to pay the modest charge to enjoy the entire hot breakfast buffet.  I was going to upload a couple of photos, but I don't have anything to beat the sunsets on my earlier review.  There are a few things they do or have that I especially appreciate (and I recognize that not everybody will feel the same).  1) They have the Wall Street Journal for their guests. 2) They have lots of high definition channels. OK, nobody goes to the beach to watch TV but sometimes there are football games to be watched. :) 3) I can plug devices

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel in Huntington Beach, California
Summary: Huntington Beach is an urban beach. The beach is wide, with excellent walking paths. On week-end nights, residents light bonfires on the beach, which I find charming. This hotel is not brand new, but it is in excellent condition, and it is handy to the beach. The hotel is very clean, with nice facilities. Would recommend staying there if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, with the beach across the street.

The Waterfront Hilton is a nice enough place - large comfortable room that had everything we needed.  From our limited interaction with the staff they were friendly and efficient.  I'm giving it three stars based on the type of hotel it is - somewhat upscale, and I think it is average for its type.  It's obviously better than any Motel 6.    I had a issues with noise at night.  Voices were fairly well contained, but the tv next door seemed pretty loud (who knows how high they had it) and most of the noise came from under the door between the two rooms, which had a gap at the bottom.  The noise level was a bit better when I put a towel to cover the gap.  We had the first room toward the elevators, and there were some noisy people coming off late the first night.  Once awake I

Stayed here for a one day for a quick get a way for Spring Break Good: Got an early check in and a late check out Bad: check in by desk clerk was unwelcoming. Sheets on bed had big stain. (Did call to have changed)  Had an issue with the shuttle into town. Jacuzzi closed at 4 on Sunday for repair was not open on Monday Jack hammering on the pool area began on Monday morning for the whole time while we were trying to enjoy the pool area.  When at check out I mentioned the noise I was told we could have gone to the Hyatt pool.  Not sure why we were not offered this at check in and given the choice to move there if that was an option. Not sure why we would pay $289 a night at the Hilton to use the Hyatt pool .
Manager Response: Terry,  I appreciate your review of your recent Spring Break getaway at our hotel. I'm very sorry you had a disappointing experience with us in regards to our pool area and I have addressed these issues with our staff to ensure our guests know exactly what options are available to them upon check-in. We had been scrambling to make repairs and adjustments to our physical property for the spring break season and then were hampered by some minor earthquake damage that had to be addressed immediately. Also, I apologize for the cleanliness of your sheets and can assure you that your concerns have been addressed with both our housekeeping and laundry departments; because exceptional guest service is the foundation of our brand promise. Thank you once again for your comments as your feedback will help us improve.  Kind Regards,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Trust me - do not stay here!  Not worth the price!
Summary: I've traveled a lot and I'm not sure what others are thinking who have rated this hotel so highly.  Super nice staff and handy location to the beach and pier area, but the property is terrible especially for the premium price they charge.  It is painfully obvious that Hilton purchased this older property without putting much into it. They spent some money updating the rooms, but that does not cover up the fact that the rest of the hotel is dated circa 1990; you can see and feel the wear.  Also, the only bed options are king or double, no queens so close quarters or you better get two rooms.  The pool area is basic and the hot tub is TERRIBLE!!  Small, in a bad location with cracked tiles and the sign says maximum 7 people, but hopefully those 7 people are ok with close
Manager Response: Dear June475,  Thank you for your recent review. You were quite succinct in your comments, which we always embrace as an opportunity to improve and better our guest experience. As you accurately pointed out, our hotel is underway with room renovations and suite upgrades. In fact, it sounds as if (unbeknownst to you) you may have been in one of our brand new rooms. We also are moving throughout the property's public areas as well, honoring our philosophy of continuous improvement and enhancement. The spa area is currently closed and being remodeled as I write this... but the pool and hot tub will never compete with what most of our guests come here to experience: over 300 days of sunshine and a sparkling blue Pacific shore!  As for the "tip" from the "local", I encourage you to look for yourself. Our pricing is extremely competitive for a beachside location...and we do not have a resort fee of any kind. No hidden charges or fees to surprise you anywhere along the way (a fact the "local" may have not mentioned). I'm confident you'll find The Waterfront not only a better value, but with the exceptional and personal service we are able to provide, perhaps just a bit more worthy of the wonderful comments we see posted daily.  Best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Outstanding venue for an organization's conference.  Rooms were spacious and well-appointed.  All rooms had nice views of the ocean and beach.  Hotel facilities were excellent for food and the catered meals for the conference above the norm.  Hotel is convenient to the beach, pier and other shopping/eating venues on Main Street.  I would definitely come back.
Manager Response: Dear Gene T.,  Thank you! Its comments like these that bring us back to work day after day...striving to do even better.  Please come back when you can, we look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: As soon as we checked in I said to my fiance "this is one of the nicest places we have ever stayed", as it was.  From the staff to the room to the restaurant, everything was great. We had one of the cheaper rooms, garden view, it was a good size and very clean, we did have a plumbing issue and it was handled quickly and with service recovering of offering to move us, we had already unpacked and had stuff everywhere so did not bother, but they did give us free breaky which was perfect. I honestly don't know what else to say, except I cannot wait to go back!

Summary Heading: Find a better hotel for this rate!
Summary: The hotel is across the street from the beach area. The room, we got ocean view not ocean front room, was older and more worn out than we expected based on the photos from the hotel site.   The only thing I found to be great is their service in some areas. Some staff was very well informed about the hotel while other did not know the hotel well. The valet service was exceptional. They were always polite.
Manager Response: Dear Lan N.,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. You are absolutely correct about The Waterfront being across PCH. We never hide that fact. Additionally, if you gazed up and down the coastline you might have noticed there are NO hotels built on the beach. This was a decision made long ago by a very wise city council and a protective Coastal Commission that ensures unfettered access to everyone, visitors and locals alike. Frankly, we're kind of proud of our ten miles of uninterrupted shoreline. There are not many places in the world that can boast about that anymore!  I was very sorry to hear that you were not pleased with your room or its appointments. We strive to maintain one of the cleanest and highest rated hotels in Hilton's resorts division. You'll be glad to hear that (once again) we are underway with our room and suite makeovers. This is done very quietly and only as the rooms become available to us. In fact, our newly refreshed rooms and suites are now beginning to make their way into social media. We'll be debuting the new photos soon as well...so be on the lookout for the best that is yet to come!   Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: View of Oil Refinery at a premium price
Summary: Advertised as a waterfront hotel with waterfront views, our experience was a waterfront hotel with views of the OIL REFINERY next door (see pictures attached).  The only thing missing was a train rolling through every few hours.  And, it is an expensive hotel.  We stayed at the hotel early in our trip and had a spectacular waterfront room.  So, we decided to return a few days later and called to reserve the same room and thought everything was all set.  Until we arrived.  Our "waterfront view" was of an oil refinery complete with a smoke plume from the smokestack. When we called the front desk to get the correct room the clerk was less then helpful.  But, Hilton advertises a "make it right" policy.  So, we sent an email to them, but, there was never a response.  However, a week
Manager Response: Dear TX_Traveler_2014,  Thank you for taking the time to alert us to your disappointment with your view from our hotel. To be completely accurate, that is not an oil refinery. There are no train tracks. That is an electricity generation plant (owned by AES) and is over 2 miles away. You are actually seeing steam, not smoke, from the boilers used onsite. We have for years, in Huntington Beach, battled the dilemma of the need for electric power in Southern California vs. the "not-in-my-back-yard" response of visitors and locals. To their credit, AES has undertaken a multi-billion dollar make-over of the plant and increased capacity/efficiency while becoming leaner, greener, and even blending in more with the environment of Surf City USA. You can see those plans yourself here: www.renewaeshuntington.com and the change over is already underway.  I am, however, much more concerned with an apparent failure somewhere in the "Make It Right" chain and have begun to research your report. I will be contacting all departments involved, reviewing policy procedures and getting back to you in short order. As this is "online review", it may take some time to establish you identity...please accept my apologies for any delay in response.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: This property is gorgeous.  The staff was amazing.  The rooms were perfect.  The only thing I didn't like was on the oceanfront rooms the sound of the traffic is loud, which can't be helped by the hotel but if I would of known ahead of time I would of just booked the Oceanview room for cheaper.  Also the $30 a night for parking that is added at the end of my stay was a surprise. Overall it was a great stay with beautiful scenery and grounds. Close to main street Huntington, the ocean, food and shopping. I will definitely stay again

Hotel was nice,very Dog friendly,i chose the "Wonderful dog/s Life package (since i brought my 2 small dogs with me during the stay). Had to complain about the bed frame though ( i got a scratch on my lower L leg),staff were nice to check on it quickly but i refused to have it fixed that very moment 'cause we were checking out by noon and have to get our stuffs packed. The Shades restaurant was just "ok",gotta give high 5 to the guy who was playing the guitar,he did really good! Before i forget,what happened with the 2 towels i requested? though it doesn't really matter now,but i would suggest checking on guest/s request before they check in coz its making no sense of taking time to put on our request before check in if it won't be granted,though i know  it's just a towel. : )

We had a beautiful room facing the ocean. We enjoyed perfect weather and lovely sunsets. I enjoyed the staff very much as they were all very freindly and very accomadating. The resturant in the hotel by the pool is lovely.

This is a great place to stay.  Rooms were clean, beds sleep well. Great pool and view of the ocean. Staff were wonderful. Chelsea desk manager was very friendly and helpful.  Hotel store has great gifts "surf hero" merchandise.  My only complaint is parking.  No self parking. 35.00/ night is way to high.

Stayed here twice once in August 30th 2013 with my two teenagers and again during spring break March 13 to 14, 2014. It is a luxurious beach front hotel busy at times. The staff in the restaurant downstairs are very pleasant and warm. Upon check in however on both occasions I found the staff member to be rushed and just short of being abrupt. The Hyatt down the road was booked otherwise I would of stayed there given the prices are similar.  Rooms are were always clean and roomy. Only negative thing to say about the rooms is that they have double bed not queens.

Suites are very small, they were clean, no extra bedding for pull out sofa, mini refrigerator came in helpful, Breakfast buffet very good, bar service around pool was slow,Staff helpful,Great Bell man named Eric

In fact it is one mile away from Huntington Beach attractions and downtown. We got "ocean view" room, which was really facing the highway 1 along the coast. Only the higher-floor rooms have really nice view of the beach. Reception was refusing to move us despite my HHonors membership.  Food in the hotel was mediocre and too expensive. Parking and wifi were at sky-high price levels as well. All in rush and denying the "relaxed beach life" concept.  Really poor experience... Will not come back.
Manager Response: Dear Miramaks,  Thank you for your review. We appreciate the time you took to let us know how you feel. Somewhere along the way we failed you and that does not make me happy at all. I will share your comments with our entire staff and, where we can, make every improvement possible.  Occasionally, due to circumstances beyond our control (like a sold out hotel, as was the case during your stay), we are unable to accommodate a room move under any circumstances. It is rare, but it does happen from time to time. To do so would mean asking another guest to move or leave, and we could never do that. I am very sorry this colored the rest of your stay and time you spent with us.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: From the moment my husband and I set foot out of the car, we were amazed by the excellent service.  The staff offered great ideas for activities and tended to our every need.  The only complaint we would have is the ridiculous parking rates.  Be aware that the valet is considerably less expensive than parking yourself.  Really...$30 a day?  Otherwise, the food is great and the atmosphere wonderful.  We will be back!

Always enjoy my stay here.  Views of ocean and spectacular.  Easy access to beach.  Nice pool area.  Huntington Beach is a quaint beach town, with ample eateries and shopping for a town of its size.  Beach is superior to Santa Monica, Venice, and other beaches further north.

For the price you pay the customer service is EXCELLENT. The staff is extremely welcoming and help you with whatever you need. We also had a beautiful room on the 11th floor. The views were amazing and definitely well worth the price we paid. The only negative comment I could say about this hotel is the valet parking.. $32 a night. But if you don't mind spending the extra money this is a gorgeous hotel.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Resort Near the Beach
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a business trip, and it was a very comfortable stay. The room I was in had two queen beds and was quite large. Top notch decor, and the staff was very friendly and efficient. Beds were very comfortable. Note, that there is a daily parking fee of $35 for valet and $50 for self-parking. The wireless Internet access is not free in the hotel room, but my company had a special deal with Hilton which allowed me access. Internet speeds were fine.  This hotel has a very nice restaurant (6:30a breakfast open time), pool, hot tub, and fitness center (with free weights, universal machine, and treadmills, elliptical trainers, bike).  The hotel isn't actually on the beach, but right across the Pacific Coast Highway. There are no other restaurants

I stayed at this resort hotel in June 2013 and it was such a wonderful experience.  I scheduled the trip last minute after my original out of country vacation had to be postponed.  This turned out to be a fabulous vacation.    Since I had to change plans at the last minute, my chihuahua was my traveling companion.  This resort if VERY dog friendly but still very clean and beautiful.  I had a beautiful room with  the best view you could want.  The property is just across the highway from the beach and the location is perfect for walking, shopping, dining, and just enjoying the sand and sea!  ALL staff members were helpful, friendly, and willing to go above and beyond.  I found the little market perfect for snacks and small meals and the restaurant and room service were great as

I had another great stay at the Hilton Huntington Beach for an annual leaadership program alumni conference.  The meeting room, accomodations, meals and location are perfect for this meeting.  I am looking forward to attending again next year.

Pricey but worth it if you get a room a with a balcony. The grounds are outstanding and several places to choose to eat some excellent. Lovely pool area.The staff goes out of their way to be accomodating. My daughter and I had a lovely time.

We spent a week at this beach resort in late February. It was good on many levels. It is fairly close to the beach, has nice clean rooms and good housekeeping services, and has a welcoming happy hour. But it was also not so great on other levels. The staff were rather distant and snobby, the restaurant served mediocre food, and the resort was rather pricey for what you got. It certainly is a great location and a fairly nice property. But we doubt we would return.

For walking the beach into the main street, this hotel is very nicely situated. It also has a good, albeit expensive, restaurant. But it was lacking in the sort of ambiance that is needed for a relaxed resort. First, as a diamond member I was disappointed with the lack of privilege. A very limited cold buffet breakfast (although the coupon could be used as a discount on hot items), and a 20 % off coupon for the restaurant was scant reward compared with other locations with nice executive lounges etc. Overall, the staff were business like and not particularly friendly -- unusual in Hilton brand hotels. And some of the wait staff were very patriarchal -- even asking my husband if he would like coffee and orange juice and then giving me whatever he said he wanted. In addition, the

Spent one night in a $400.00 suite and it was dark, furniture broken, lights delayed in turning on, and television connection went in and out.  I had to pay for internet connection which I thought was a little ridiculous.  On the internet it made it seem like the beach was right there.  I was on the second floor and had a great view of the RV parking across the street.
