Manager Response: Dear Michelle J.,  Thank you for your review. Your comments were instrumental in having our ownership conduct a complete review our suites, amenities, and their overall condition. As a partial result, we are now underway with renovations and upgrades to all of our suites in the hotel. Give us a month or so to complete these upgrades and then, if you would be so kind, give us another chance. I have seen the designers upgrades and you will not be disappointed!  Most Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Make sure to ask if there are any obstructions when upgrading to ocean view. Nice place, very clean!! but I expect to receive what I pay for. The staff was friendly. be aware of parking fees.. no complimentary parking option available

The Hilton in Huntington Beach is excellent! Perfect for walking directly across the street to the beach and up to the funky Main Street there.  Although it was not a pleasure trip, next time I will bring the entire family. My grandchildren love the beach and the amenities at the Huntington Hilton are perfect for them.

Beautiful property and relaxing stay.  We had an oceanfront room with an amazing sunset view.  Relaxing room setting with comfortable bedding.  All updated amenities.  Shuttle service to and from restaurant row.  Pleasant staff took care of all our needs.  Quick valet service.

Summary Heading: Individual Touch from a Big Hotel at the Waterfront!
Summary: I have stayed at the Waterfront several times now and have to say that I absolutely love it there. I ate and enjoyed dinner both nights at the restaurant and requested Christina as my server--she is simply terrific. The entire staff, from valet, front desk, restaurant, store, and everyone behind the scenes, seems to be happy and ready to serve each guest! I had yet another great experience and will be back on my next trip to OC!

Stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort this past weekend from February 8-10. The hotel is located across the street from the beach, and has views of the water from all rooms, which is nice. As the waterfront rooms were only a little more, and the aim of the game was to see the beach as much as we can this is what we opted for.  The hotel is very spacious, clean and quiet, with large rooms and full amenities. It is only a ten minute walk to Main Street in old Huntington which is where you will find an array of great restaurants, bars and shopping. The beach is directly across the street which is nice, but the traffic is a little loud having the highway right below your room.  Staff are very friendly and willing to go the extra for you. Valet are quick to get your car and

The hotel is beautiful, my room was clean with a nice view and I found the staff to be friendly and attentive.  It was a good place to stay a night on a busy business trip.  If one chooses to stay longer, there is a large pool area, nice shops and restaurants within walking distance and, of course, the ocean across the street.  I will say I had a sense of being nickeled and dimed on some things that should be basic amenities, for the room rate charged. For example, breakfast, that should be free for my Hilton diamond level, was extra if you wanted hot food.  More surprising, when I checked out and asked for some coffee to go, they did not offer any, but directed me to a coffee shop somewhere in the area - not terrible, but certainly below my expectations for higher quality hotel

We have stayed at the Waterfront Hilton for over 10 years.  This is a beautiful, clean hotel with outstanding service.  Much of the staff has been at the hotel for over 10 years.  The hostess at Shades Restaurant is so sweet that I have to hug her every visit.  We feel so welcome from the first minute we enter the front door.  The hotel is beautiful and so welcoming that we will continue to visit the Waterfront Hilton every chance we get!

I have stayed at this particular hotel on several different occasions and have never had a bad experience here.  I would highly recommend this hotel while traveling for business or pleasure.  The last time I was there, I had a respiratory reaction to the air fresheners.  All I did was mention it once and immediately the air fresheners were discontinued and the common areas of the hotel had been aired out.  This, in my opinion, was way above and beyond the call of duty.

I frequently visit Huntington Beach and stay at another property. As a Hilton Honors member, I decided to try this one and I'm glad I did. From the time I checked in, through checkout, my stay was very pleasant. From the valet team that greets you upon arrival to the staff at Shades, every person I encountered was incredibly friendly and helpful. My room was very spacious and had a great view of the beach and ocean. And event the pool area was spacious with plenty of chairs and great chair-side service. I can't wait to come back!

Great location right on the beach.  Not real close to main restaurant / shopping area, about a mile so fine if you are driving. Bedding was nice, good heating/cooling in room.  Limited TV channels and very sub-standard bathroom, small, tiny bath tub, disappointing.  Common area's beautiful and great service all around

This hotel is stunning due to it's location directly across the street from the beach.  The rooms are clean, food is great and the pool is warm.  The pool staff is very welcoming and will go out of their way to provide great service. The hotel offers bike rentals, boogie boards and pool toys.  The pool has a perfect view of the beach.  I felt like I had the best of both worlds. The only drawback is that during weekdays, the bell staff was understaffed.

I am a very loyal hilton honors member, and this property is officially in my top five favorites. Our room was perfectly appointed with every amenity, beachfront views, and tons of space.  I lost my drivers license on the property and they sent a note to my room letting me know that it had been found. I didn't even know it was gone...  My only criticism, and it's really more funny than bad, would be these rediculous lamp shades on the bedside table. They remind me of Sharon Stone from Casino.  That said, the bedside tables had these super cool motion detecting floor light that come on at night when you you set foot on the floor next to the bed. I just love this property!

Summary Heading: Excellent Property in an Ideal Location
Summary: If you're looking for a great venue next to both the beach or shopping, the Hilton Waterfront is hard to beat.  The hotel and grounds are immaculate, with excellent sights, sounds, and even fragrances to put you at ease.  Staff was friendly, courteous, and efficient.  Rooms were adequately sized, but with amenities slightly lacking.  Air conditioning seemed to reset each night to a higher temperature, regardless of the thermostat setting.  A business colleague staying in another room experience the same issue.  Fitness center equipment experienced a few technical problems with treadmills and TV quailty issues, but the problems appeared largely resolved at the next day's visit.    Valet parking, courteous and expedient, will add to the bill, so be prepared for the extra expense.

We have a waterfront suite which is beautiful.  We really enjoy the stay and the staff were nice and very professional.  We will come back to this hotel. My daughter ia scare of dogs so its a problem for her since the hotel is a pet friendly.

This hotel was represented on the internet exactly as it is. It is beautiful and clean. They honored our special room request and the room looked like it was newly remodeled.  Every person we dealt with on the staff was very friendly and always eager to help. This was one of the best hotel stay experiences I can remember. We are already planning to come back this summer for another stay.

Summary Heading: bEautiful amenities, outdoor dining, close to beach
Summary: The hotel was warm and friendly yet professional and businesslike.  The staff was a reflection of that and tended to our group of 50 very well.  The ease of being able to step out of a conference room and get a breath of fresh air in a pretty environment was great.  Having the heaters out also allowed one to maximize the outdoor experiences.  Dinner outside with live music was excellent.

Finest and most expensive hotel on our trip, but worst experience.  Our 'ocean view' room turned out to be midway down the side of the building, and despite being called 'ocean facing' it's exactly perpendicular to the ocean, except for a tilt in the tiny balcony.  The desk clerk assured me that "you can see the ocean" -- but we couldn't, or barely, due to a swath of palms blocking the 5th-floor view.  The beds in our room were so tiny we had to sleep separately!  And we are not big people. The desk staff were clueless about local events or even the hotel restaurant.  Then the restaurant hostess allowed us to be seated in an area with no service! We finally drummed up a waiter, who was the only excellent person on the staff (along with the bartender), and the food was enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear A_T60713,  Thank you for your response...and all I can say is, "Oh my!". I can assure you that our mission is not to extract anything from our guests. We are all here to provide and create lasting and pleasurable memories for anyone who shares their time with us. I can only offer my sincere apologies and will review your comments with departments during our regular staff meetings. This, I can assure you, is NOT how we operate our property. I thank you for taking us to task where we may have failed and will see to it that adjustments are made.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Best trained most friendly staff ever!
Summary: The hotel was beautiful, the food superb and the staff were the best I've ever experienced. The restaurants, meeting rooms, lobby and guest rooms were second to none. I was there for business but will go back for a holiday.

Best hotel in Huntington Beach! Staff excellent and personable especially Bell Staff. Renovated rooms are brilliant and property is kept tidy and clean. Shades is an incredible atmosphere and PB&J on the menu is fantastic. Stop by Surf Hero and get a smoothie and hang out at the fire pit by the pool.

Summary Heading: Sometimes you just get real lucky !!!
Summary: Needed a place to sty for a couple of nights before heading home ... and this property came up on my Hilton search engine ... booked it and WOW !!!!  It is located just across the street from the beach ... we ended up with a room facing the beach and with a balcony ... perfect way to start the day with your morning coffee.  Even though we arrive in cool December we were able to walk the beach and local neighbourhood.  We really enjoyed the meals at the hotel ... they even have a Canadian Chef ... imagine my delight when we spotted "Poutine" on the menu.  All of the meals were high calibre and reasonably priced.  We loved the outdoor sitting area and the fire pit where of course we sat enjoyed a couple of after dinner beverages.  This truly was a visit to a resort ... sorry that

Loved this place. The pool area is awesome, they have a cabana that loans you beach equipment, and the restaurant is amazing...loved hanging out by the fire pit. Short walk across the street to the beach; be careful crossing this road its pretty crazy during peak times.

Staff was very kind and helpful. The location is charming, close to the beach and to many of the restaurants and shops.  We really enjoyed the lovely atmosphere.  If I am ever in California again, I would choose this hotel.  Also there are a number of restaurants in the hotel which are very nice.

Summary Heading: Hilton Huntington Beach Resort is almost perfect
Summary: We drove to San Diego and Los Angeles from SF Bay Area to seek the warmth of sun.  On the return trip, we spent +2 days at Huntington Beach (Surf City).  One of us is a Hilton Gold member with Hilton Reserve Card.  The overall experience is excellent.  I would like to give a 5-star, but, as my personal requirement in the past, parking fee takes one star away.  We dined at the Shades restaurant for 2 breakfast times and 1 dinner time  Pros: - beautiful and clean beach - clean hotel, quiet room - courteous, excellent hotel staff - one block away from Huntington Beach (aka HB) - walking distance (0.3 mile) to buzzling and vibrant downtown - Hilton Gold membership comes with nice complimentary benefits 1. free Continental cold American breakfast 2. Or, $15 credit applied to hot

We just returned from a great stay at the Waterfront.  Our view of the pier from the 7th floor was awesome!  We decided to stay here because our boys loved Huntington Beach so much the last time we were there.  We were not disappointed with the location.  Our main goal was to be close to the beach so this was perfect.  Overall, the hotel was great.  The room was a decent size for a family of 4 but the double beds are very small (but comfortable).  It was nice to have a small fridge in the room.  The room was very clean.  We didn't love that there is only valet parking and would have preferred a self-park option.  It is also ridiculous that they charge for internet!!  My husband was so ticked off by that he went onto Facebook and made some comments there.  He then ran into a

Summary Heading: Great location, not so family friendly
Summary: We stayed here last March on spring break with our elementary age boys. My husband is a Hilton Diamond member and we used points for our 3 nights here. Overall I think you pay for location - the quality of the rooms does not match up with the number of points per night required. I did not find the hotel staff to be particularly family friendly either. Other guests seemed perturbed there were children in the pool. It was nice being close to the beach and Huntington Beach.

We spent six nights here. The hotel is located across the highway from the beach and about a half mile from the pier and downtown area, an easy walk. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Many guests brought their dogs and some brought cats. That said, the price was a bit much for the quality of the rooms. The walls are thin; we could hear the guests next door. There is no fan in the bathroom. Guests must pay for wifi per device, not per room, making it spendy. The balcony was very small. The on-site restaurant has a limited menu. We ended up eating at the Hyatt down the block for greater variety, particularly for dinner. The small gift shop/coffee bar is very expensive and variety is very limited. $1.50 for a postcard was a bit much when they were available downtown for

Summary Heading: the water front Hilton in Hunington Beach
Summary: Great place to stay and it was dog friendly with a dog park 2 miles up the beach which was a pleasant walk. the hotel staff were great and the food was good. we went for a quick get away with the dog and as it went every one was happy

I stayed here for the Surf City Half Marathon.  Overall, it is a really nice property and I would like to stay here again.    Pros: 1) Nice ocean view 2) Friendly staff and concierge 3) Great pool and hot tub 4) Location - It is right by the beach and start line of the Surf City Half Marathon.  If you will be in Huntington Beach for the race, you should definitely stay here.  I didn't have to worry about getting to the start line area. 5) Many activities - The hotel hosted many events related to the Half Marathon including the pre race pasta dinner, post race lunch buffet, and post race Super Bowl party.   6) Comfy bed  Cons: 1) Price - Although it was a really nice property, it was my first time spending close to $300 per night.  For similar properties in other cities, I've

We had a corner suite on the 9th floor, the view was spectacular, we were lucky enough to get great view on the sunset.  We had dinner the hotel restaurant and had some amazing choices of cheeses and meats as appetizers before our main course.

We had a ocean facing King Suite for about $300 a night. Pretty pricey for a 5th floor room. Only because the room has a beautiful double balcony which to enjoy the ocean view, but on the 5th floor your view is blocked by the tops of palm trees and the sound of the traffic on PCH can be deafening. AS long as the patio doors stay shut the room was quite enjoyable. The hotel staff are attention 100% of the time. The hotel in all is a very nice place but for that kind of money you'd expect that.

Hilton is very nice with excellent service and good food.  The hotel I well maintained though the rooms were on the small side.  Everyone went out of there way to make sure I had a good stay.  Too bad I was on business and did not see much of the area

1) super comfy pillows and beds! 2) great duvet 3) great shower 4) free coffee in room! 5) excellent and speedier than quoted room service. (The waffles were way better than the omelet.) 6) a whole pint of Icecream instead of the tiny servings when asking for room service 7) kind concierge.  8) lovely pool 9) free laundry!  We had a great stay!  Everyone was so accommodating and kind.

This beautiful hotel is on the ocean in a fun neighborhood and the food is elegant. It is walking distance from many beach activities and the Hunington Beach merchants have a street Farmers Market on Friday night which is fun. Take a good appetite.

Had a nice stay with my family.  Hotel staff was great.  Good location across from the beach.  Parking is expensive with no alternatives but to use valet.  Not close to LA if you want to do the LA attractions, but if you want to hang out near the beach, this is what you would like.

Aside from its perfect location, this is a wonderful place to stay for so many other reasons.  The staff is incredibly attentive, from the front desk staff to the valet service to room service. We had minor requests, like needing a new box of tissues, and some issues with the in-room coffee maker.  They were literally addressed within minutes.  The food and beverage service is excellent.  We so thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and look forward to returning soon.  Do not think twice about booking here, you will not regret it.

The Hilton Waterfront is a very nice hotel.  The rooms are clean.  The location is great.  It's right across from the beach.  Nice pool.  Ocean views are very nice.  I would definately stay there again.  Note: valet parking only $30.00 per night.

We wanted a hotel with ocean view rooms; debated between this hotel & the other one nearby.  We're glad we chose this one.  Our room had a great view & was not obstructed by trees, as the other shorter hotel.  Service was excellent... front desk, concierge, housekeeping, valet.  Sunrise oceanview room... we got a room on the ninth floor and the view was great.  When on the balcony, we got to see much of the beach & ocean, along with the mountain range & city buildings.  When in bed or inside the room, couldn't see the ocean. I wasn't able to upgrade to sunset oceanview or oceanfront room before checking-in because I booked through a vacation carrier.  We ended up keeping the room and really enjoyed the sunrise every morning.  The sunset was so early in the day during this time

Was very nice and clean and very quiet.  staff was very helpful and friendly.Beautiful view from our room.close to stores and across for the ocean.  We found everything to be above our expectations.  We would most likely stay here again if need be.  We will tell our friends if they are looking for a place in Huntinfing Beach to stay at the Hilton Waterfront Resort.

was just here for the Thanksgiving holiday ...slept very well as it is a quiet property at this time of year. the restaurant Shades had great food .I had the Thanksgiving Buffet and it was plentiful nd very good and tasty . the staff here is very accommodating  Next time I am in town this will be the spot for me.

My husband and I stayed at the Waterfront Hilton Beach Resort in Huntington Beach for a long weekend getaway.  We took advantage of the "eat sleep surf park" package deal with included a full breakfast, internet, and valet parking for every day of our stay.  We stayed from 11/23/13 - 11/26/13, in room 801, for $259 a night.  Overall, it was a good stay and I felt we got a good value since the breakfast and parking was included.  Parking alone is $30 a day.  There are two things that stand out at this hotel - the staff and the views.  Every staff person we encountered from the front desk, housekeeping, and valet parking were informative and accommodating.   The ocean views from the rooms are fantastic.  Pacific Coast Highway is in front of the hotel and at first I thought we

Reason for trip  10 year Anniversary Room type Corner 1 bedroom suite Sunset view PERFECT  Staff It's the little details that made our stay at the waterfront hilton wonderful and memorable.  We would definitely recommend to friends and family.  THANK YOU AGAIN

Summary Heading: Hilton The Waterfront Beach Resort-Huntington Beach
Summary: My recent stay at Hilton The Waterfront Beach Resort - Huntington Beach was not long enough!  I wish I could have stayed a few more days.  I was really impressed with this beautiful resort situated directly across from the Beach.  Everyone I encountered from Front Desk, Housekeeping (Sofia & Team), Guest Services (Bell & Valet) to Concierge (Tammy) were excellent and provided fantastic, personalized service.  Tammy, Chef Concierge is a rockstar. She provided wonderful recommendations and was very helpful.  Thank you for a memorable stay!

We spent our 10 year anniversary at this hotel and highly recommend it. Feels like another world just down the street. Staff is refreshing and helpful, food is wonderful and the view can't be beat. Truly a wonderful hotel led by an amazing management staff. Love it!

this was my 5th stay at the Waterfront Resort and i can't wait for my 6th, everyone from the front desk, restaurant, bar, valet, cleaning staff, etc. loves their job and where they work as you won't meet a nicer friendlier staff of employees.....

this is one of my favorite properties worldwide, the staff and the rooms are exceptional, pool and bar is great with two fire pit locations to relax and enjoy.  there are options to use beach equipment at wf adventures.    on the beach walk into town, perfect... great place in a great town.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great food, great pool!
Summary: I love this hotel! It's modern-feeling, the staff is friendly, and the restaurant overlooking the pool is the best. The poolside service is awesome. The rooms are very nice and clean. The location is great too - overlooking Huntington Beach and is even walking distance from the downtown area.

Loved our two day stay at this great hotel.  Friendly and easy check-in and prompt, courteous and efficient staff.  Rooms were well-appointed and luxurious.  A small balcony allowed for a view of the ocean and the center court of the hotel with a pool and outdoor restaurant.  The pool area is supplied with very comfy chairs.  Sadly, no pool service this time of year but drinks can be had at the bar restaurant as short walk across the pool patio.

The service, ambiance and location of this hotel were absolutely excellent. The rooms are fresh and clean and almost all seem to have a great view of the ocean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the Southern California area. It's also less than a 20 minute drive from the Santa Anna John Wayne airport.

I stayed here with a friend for two nights in early November, 2013.  I am a bit fussing when it comes to hotels. This hotel did not disappoint at all.  The location was ideal. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Especially the valet service which was efficient, timely and very pleasant. We took advantage of the shuttle service to and from Main Street Huntington Beach. The pool looked lovely and I cannot wait to get back to use it. Time did not permit. Rooms were were very comfortable and we were fortunate to have a balcony overlooking the Pacific.  This was very special as it was my travel buddy 's  first visit to California and the Pacific Ocean. I especially liked the gift shop, it was great for gifts, tee shirts and cold medicine!!

This is truly a beautiful hotel. It is located right on the Pacific Ocean. The views are incredible. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Those ocean views are absolutely incredible. The staff was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

Superb hotel, stunning beauty in a comfortable environment. Gorgeous grounds and décor, yet very friendly to all types... including the surfers walking through the luxurious lobby with sandy surfboards under their arms.

Amazing staff that were so outgoing, friendly, helpful and really helped make our stay memorable! They went out of their way to make sure that we had everything we needed.  They made us feel as if we were the only guests in the hotel.  We came for our daughters 11th birthday and trip to Disneyland.  They were awesome making sure we knew where we were going and the best routes to take.  The bed felt a little hard the first night, but after that it was great!  The pool/spa wonderful and right across from Huntington Beach!  The breakfast buffet was outstanding!  We will DEFINATELY stay here again.  It is a GREAT family hotel!

I spent a long weekend at this Hilton and was treated well in peasant surroundings.  The near-by construction was no problem as it seemed to be moving very slowly.  I appreciated that, like French hotels, there was a Lobby and then a First Floor with the amenities of restaurant, pool, shop, etc.  Arrivals and departures were a floor away from leisure!

This hotel is one of the best locations to rewind and get energized. The staffs are warm & kind. A definite place to stay with family.   This hotel is one of the best locations to rewind and get energized. The staffs are warm & kind. A definite place to stay with family.  This hotel is one of the best locations to rewind and get energized. The staffs are warm & kind. A definite place to stay with family.  This hotel is one of the best locations to rewind and get energized. The staffs are warm & kind. A definite place to stay with family.

Beware major construction is happening in the property next door. It starts 7am to 4pm each weekday ie Monday thru to Friday. It also affects most rooms (at Hilton) which face the pool and the sunset view rooms. The work being done is jack hammering concrete and even with glass doors closed the noise is loud enough to wake you up and also makes it impossible to use the balcony between 7am-4pm.   The construction looks like it will be still going on late into 2014, so check with hotel if the room you intend to book is affected by the construction work.  We moved from our sunset view room and the rest of our stay was very pleasant. Staff friendly and helpful. Room clean and modern. Although we paid for valet parking I think the $30 per night charge is over the top and should be

Summary Heading: Poltergeist Week At The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort
Summary: I've traveled all over the world and one of the brand name hotels I had come to depend on was the Hilton up until my last stay this month at The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach California.  Upon check-in they gave us a room on the second floor which was so noisy we couldn't sleep in spite of the fact that my Hilton Honors Profile calls for a room on the highest level possible.  Then after they changed us to a room on the eleventh floor everything went berserk in the room first, the air conditioner wasn't working and after the engineers spent an hour or more trouble shooting they decided to remove the control panel and found none of the wires were connected! Next the toilet overflowed, then the refrigerator which comes with the room wasn’t working and spoiled

Summary Heading: It's has the WOW factor for a beachside setting!
Summary: The ONLY reason I'm not giving this great property an "EXCELLENT" rating is because the menu selection at the (only) restaurant is not as broad as I'd expected a Hilton property to offer. But first, the positivies. The location - deitrectly opposite the famed Huntington Beach (and one block down from the iconic Huntington Pier) can't be faulted. Even the Pacific Coastal Highway traffic can't be heard through the balncony doors. Next the property itself: it has 12 floors (we're on the third) all angled to the beach and the Pacific Ocean, immaculately maintained, with super-sized twin beds (or king beds) with pillows that you luxuriously sink down in to. The rooms are beautifully proportioned with all the accroutrements you'd expect, including a cooffee/tea making machine, mini

Gorgeous property and a great location! Able to walk everywhere - 1 block off the beach (no hotels are actually on the beach) and just a few blocks from a really cute town.  Friendly staff (provided to go coffees / security guard said hello etc.and provided a later checkout and arranged a taxi with follow up via phone). ....   Love that over breakfast you can look out on the pool (which overlooks the beach) - with the firepits and sit outside with the heaters.    Hotel rooms are also well equipped - mini fridge, gorgeous bathroom, balcony.  Would stay again anytime!

If you want to experience what its like to be an OC resident, and are not from around here, check into the Hilton for a few nights here.  You get the stereotypical California coast, the elegant Mediterranean, architecture, some cool California green grass to feast your eyes on, and and some surf style shopping and dining experience just near by.  Had Breakfast here and Cant fault the service or the food.   It was quite expensive but lots of the items can be found in the gift shop for cheaper (the oatmeal for example).  The rooms are adequate and the room I visited had a shoe valet and a Rain/trench coat hanger.   interesting for a place where you would ONLY think of flip flops and bathing suits.

Summary Heading: The most amazing hotel we've ever stayed at!
Summary: The hotel staff was amazing and more helpful then anywhere we've ever stayed before.  The room was immaculate. The bed and pillows felt like we were at home.  The breakfast was delightful.  The Valet staff ran everytime to help in anyway they could.  You will love this place.

We made a quick trip to So-Cal for the AVP Pro Beach Volleyball Competition. We chose the Hilton for the value and location to the pier. The hotel is about a two block walk to Main Street, however they do offer a shuttle every hour. Hotel staff was very courteous. The Valet attendants where also great. The hotel was very clean as were the rooms.  We had a great time and enjoyed staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Hilton Huntington Beach A great spot for Fall Break!
Summary: A great place to get away in the fall! Easy access to shopping and the beach.  Great for older kids and for those who want to lay by the pool without having a lot of little ones around. The Spa services next door are terrific and the hotel food and pool service is great.  Valet parking is your only option and at nearly 30.00 a day it adds up on your bill.  However, the service is professional and prompt and the valet is very helpful.

By far the most fabulous hotel experience of my life!  Walk time from my room to the ocean - 8 minutes flat.  My room was quiet, clean, and very comfortable.  Hotel staff was very helpful with directions and local information.  The hotel's snack shack near the exit toward the beach offers drinks and snacks at a very reasonable price.  The pool area has little cabanas and there's a spot for a bonfire too.  The pier is a short walk away, and Tuesdays in summer see a great street fair on Main Street.  For a pain free vacation:  take a cab ride from the airport to the hotel, sleep well, and spend your days walking the pristine, beautiful beach.  Relax and recharge!

We were very, very pleased with our stay at this hotel. Everything was super clean, food and atmosphere were great, and the bed was so comfortable it was difficult to leave it in the morning. We would return here in a heartbeat.

I really enjoyed my short holiday there. Of course the room was nice, clean, minimalistically well decorated- after all, it is a Hilton. I had chosen a Ocean view room, totally worth of the little extra I had to pay. But what set this hotel apart some other Hiltons and other brands( i have recently "converted" from another chain to Hilton), was the general friendliness of the staff: from  the resourceful and smiling concierge Tamara, to the cheerful valet parking attendants (i kept forgetting the card with my car #...they never groaned) , to the efficient  and meticulous housekeeper MAriCruz. The room service was fast and efficient (and the food was good!). The only exception was at the breakfast buffet where in couple of occasions waiters were not as hospitable (but Oskar was

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels I´ve been to.
Summary: Very nice hotel over the street from the beach (there is no hotel “ON” the beach actually, so this is the best choice). My corner suite was amazing and felt more like a beach apartment than a hotel room! It had an ocean and pool view with chairs on the terrace. I wish I could stay longer :) We didn´t try the pool because it was quite chilly outside. What we appreciated were their circular fireplaces with lava stones at the restaurant. It was an excellent place to sit down with a glass of wine after dinner. Hotel staff was very nice and professional. Wifi connection had a charge and I think, generally speaking about hotels of this price and standard, internet should be automatically included and free of charge. But it still was an absolute 5!

The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort is an amazing weekend getaway.  Right across the street from the beach and down the street from great restaurants.  This hotel is so beautiful! We had a balcony suite that overlooked PCH with stunning views of Huntington Beach.  Friendly staff, great food and atmosphere.  For a quick weekend getaway, I highly recommend this hotel.  Kid and pet friendly as well.

This is a great weekend get-away place!  Always clean, friendly and helpful staff and the most AMAZING views of anyplace along PCH.  Huntington Beach is all about doing nothing and relaxing, and the Hilton Waterfront helps you with that objective!  The only recommendation is adding more "Hilton" flair to the property and an mild update to the rooms and general area's.  All in all a GREAT place, Thanks Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort!

If your planning a trip to Southern California and want a taste of the California life style I would recommend staying at The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort rooms are 50 yards from the sand in beautiful Huntington Beach California, With so many daily things to do you can learn to surf or paddleboard or take a walk to the Huntington Beach pier or enjoy there awesome pool! The resort is always clean and the personnel are top notch and always ready to serve you.

The Hilton Waterfront Hotel at Huntington Beach is a terrific hotel, with great staff and an amazing view and access to the Pacific Ocean.  The business conference center was professional and well appointed and our rooms were delightful. We'll be back time and again for both business and pleasure.

People always kind! Food was great! Location great!y favorite place to stay!  My sister recommended it! Wonderful place and I love it! Best brunch ever! Best everything even decorations at Christmas! There was this card dealer who was amazing and I loved it! I I have wonderful friends and family down there! I want to go back real soon when I can! I love Huntington Beach! Great shopping at great prices! Honest people! I once lost my camera and they kept it for me! People should be more honest and the world would be a better place!

Hotel is located on the edge of Huntington Beach across the street from the beach. Our room was a corner suite with a good view, but the trees did a good job of blocking most of it. The hotel in general is old and in need of new ownership such as Days Inn, as the expected upscale quality of a Hilton just wasn't there. Moved on to Santa Monica for the balance of our trip and have a wonderful stay.
Manager Response: Dear Anonymous Reviewer,  Thank you for taking the time to express your feelings regarding your stay here at The Waterfront. I am sorry to hear that you did not feel your balcony view was adequate from your corner suite...and to think we just had those darned palm trees trimmed too! Nevertheless, I have asked our grounds keepers to take a another look and see if there is anything further we can do (without harming the trees themselves). We here at The Waterfront are both environmentally sensitive and keenly aware of what our guests expect to see when they get here (like palm trees).  I appreciate you giving us the opportunity to improve our AAA rated "Four Diamond" property yet again as we strive to continuously enhance the quality of our guest's experience. We take great pride in the hotel, her staff and the four-diamond status we have maintained for over 22 years (and counting).  Safe journeys to you and yours.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We stayed there for a week , the view was amazing , the room was spacious and the beds so relaxing , everything clean and well thought of, everything to feel good and relaxed, the staff are nice and welcoming, I had a great stay at this hotel and the pool is nice, I would recommend this hotel as a great place , great location and great vacation.

Summary Heading: From very bad to Very Good
Summary: Check in was bad...Our reservation was incorrect: wrong rate, didn't have gift bag and gift certificate we were to receive, and didn't have correct room. Most things were corrected right away except the room, because we were late getting there the room we requested was not available until the second night. I was extremely unhappy with this. HOWEVER, I must say the night management did everything they could to make it as good as possible that first night (above and beyond!) The remaining nights we were in the correct room (which was fabulous) and everything went perfect from there. The property is beautiful and all of the staff that we encountered were fantastic! Very knowledgeable and offered great ideas. We used the bikes offered and had a fabulous ride along the boardwalk. If

The Hilton is in a fantastic location. It is directly opposite the beach and a short walk to the pier and the main shops and restaurants.   The view from my room, which was a beach view sunset room, had a fantastic view. When laying on the bed, the beach and the pier in the distance could be seen. This was also the case from the furnished balcony.   The fridge in the room was a welcomed addition, along with the TV and selection of channels.  There were quality toiletries and the valet was very quick and pleasant. The cost of the valet isn't great, but this is typical for the area.   The pool area was nice and there was a small shop onsite also. There appeared to be lots of corporate events on, a reunion and wedding during my six night stay. This resulted in the pool being
Manager Response: Dear Ultimatelj,  We're so pleased to hear you had an excellent stay with us. Your note reminded us to talk about our balcony/lanai a bit more to our future guests. We forget sometimes those things that are right in our view everyday... that EVERY ROOM has a furnished balcony or patio area, and we're so glad you enjoyed yours!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary Heading: Gorgeous hotel, but watch out for those parking fees.
Summary: This was a beautiful place to stay; lovely, large, immaculate room with a sunset view. But I had read online that the parking is strictly valet and $28 a day, but it is now $30! Add tips for every time you take the car out and it really adds up. I also read a review from a guest on this site that you can use the beach parking lot across the street for $15 but you cannot leave the car there overnight or re-enter on the same day, so you don't have that option.
Manager Response: Dear Joanne,  Thank you so much for your kind words about the hotel. Our hardworking staff always likes to see that! With regards to parking, I'm afraid that is a necessary evil when you are managing very limited space with no real off-site overnight parking nearby.   You are correct in pointing out that there is no beach parking overnight (although I am hoping the city will one day change its mind, at least in the off season). An easy remedy is to leave the car behind if you can. I realize for some this is not an option, but if you're vacationing and just relaxing, well then let us take care of you! We offer complimentary transportation in and around town...and if you really need a car for the day, our full service concierge staff can arrange to have one dropped off, then you can return it right to the hotel (and never pay a parking fee unless you keep it overnight!).   We hope to see you again soon... and thank you again for staying with us here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: Awesome location.  Our stay here was just wonderful from the moment we checked in until the time we left. The food was excellent and our dinning experiences were made even more special by Jade.  His recommendations and knowledge of the food being served was just the best.  The only down side was that we had only allowed for a three night stay here.  We will try to get back to Huntington Beach at some time and will stay at the Hilton again.

Our family enjoyed this property a ton!  The staff was super friendly. The room and view were great. We enjoyed Shades for breakfast and lunch and took the hotel shuttle to the pier for dinner. Overall a great trip and we can't wait to come back.

I went to this property in September, which is just past the busy season.  I was pleasanly surprised with the staff and the attention to detail.  I would recommend this property if you are looking for a state side beach trip.  It is right across the street and an easy walk to the beach.  The hotel will provide towels, chairs and umbrella for the beach free of charge.  Main Street is about 5 minute walk north but there is a shuttle available hourly.  When you get to the beach, Jacks offers pretty much any beach entertainment item you need.  The food there is very reasonable and surprisingly good for beach food.    The pool was a little small but we didn't have  a problem since it was past peak season and there were only a few people.

This huge resort on the beach at Huntingdon is fabulous.  Lots of pools and parking, suites and balconies, sea views and sunsets.  I was given a Sunset Suite, situated on the southern side of the building. The balcony provided a nice place to sit and watch the sun go down.  The room was luxurious, but not huge.  The bed, sheets and pillows were excellent. The shower, towels and toiletries, too.  Breakfast and WIFI were extra. I used the free beach WIFI while sitting on the balcony!  There was a coffee machine, but no microwave, fridge or iPod dock.  A lovely spot to enjoy all that SoCal has to offer.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in SoCal
Summary: We moved down from Marina Del Ray as the next part of our west USA tour, have to say firstly the location was great, secondly the hotel was great.  Walking distance to everything that's going on and ideal for exploring southern beaches at Newport and Balboa. Staff, rooms, food, service all excellent. The hotel has a general classy vibe going on, not cheap but value for money

This hotel was exactly what we wanted for our So Cal beach holiday. The combination of up market luxury and laid back vibe was perfect. Staff were professional and friendly. Rooms were clean, with the most comfortable beds and pillows. Views amazing. Restaurant food expensive but worth it. One night my Son wasn't well and needed to go to bed after we'd ordered, waitress was so understanding and helpful and had my dinner boxed up for me to take back with me. Pool area great. Pool food on the face of it seemed expensive ie sandwiches but when they came they were HUGE. Good quality toiletries in bathroom. Everything you needed was there. Lovely smell in lobby. Great shuttle service to the Pier. Some nights we walked up and then called Hotel to let them know we needed the shuttle

After three years we came back. Also this time to relax after a road trip, Seattle-L.A.  Our memories of this place were good, even if there is some criticism in my review of 2010, which I wrote last time. The same criticism remains, namely the service at the restaurant was still slow, and there were some events, that caused the pool area to be partely closed for guests from the hotel.  Well, we dont´t use the pool area anyway, but go to the beach to swim and sunbathe. There is everything wonderfully organized from the hotel, you can take beach chairs and towels in a bag with you. Just across the Pacific Highway is the wonderful beach of the Huntington Beach.  I find the rooms are really nice at the Hotel, the 11th and 12th  floors (where we stayed) have wooded  floors in the

Just returned from a 5 night stay and although you always hope for the best you never know for sure. We had the sleep-eat-park&surf package. This stay exceeded all of our expectations. We had a sunrise view and our room was great-clean, nicely laid out, quiet and comfortable. We even had a small balcony which we enjoyed whenever we were in the room. The grounds of the hotel -inside and outside were beautiful!  I cannot say enough nice things about the staff. Checking in and out was a breeze. The concierge, Tammie, could not have been nicer or more helpful. She recommended great ideas of things to do and places to eat and made reservations for us. We went to Roy's one night and were treated so well-great table, complimentary appetizer because of the reservation coming from the

Normally I'm not a fan of Hiltons but had a chance to tag along with a friend so said sure why not. I was actually impressed by this Hilton. PROS: Staff were all really friendly, nice pool, fantastic location right across the street from the beach and a short walk from the pier and main street. CONS: hefty valet charge, small hot tub, only 1 onsite restaurant (food was only OK) room fridge had no setting and froze solid every bottle of water we put in it. Bathroom counter was higher than usual, which I rather like, but the toilet was so low both I and my travel companion nearly killed ourselves using it and we're both average height. Odd that one bathroom item was oversize and then the other undersize. Oh well, not a big enough deal to sully the overall impression of the room.

Every time I stay here the service is top notch, the views are unbelievable, and it is great to be back "home".  The rooms are always clean, and all of the staff is eager to help.  The front desk staff is top notch - especially Matt.  I also enjoy seeing the same valet team when I come.  They are always helpful and hospitable.

Summary Heading: Not really a resort, just a hotel by the beach
Summary: I recently spent 3 nights at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach, California. We were in town for a wedding and wanted to make a little vacation out of the long weekend. I booked a sunrise view room and did not use Hilton Honors Points for the stay.   After arriving at the hotel, and having my rental car parked (It is valet parking ONLY) I checked in. The check-in was fast, but having looked prior to checking in, I noticed there were many rooms available for the same amount of time I had booked. As a HH Diamond Member, if there is availability, the hotel is suppose to upgrade my room. I was excited about the potential of an upgrade to an ocean view room which was available. To my surprise, I was "upgraded" to a sunset room. I went from sunrise, to sunset. The

Stayed over Labor Day weekend and there was nothing that could have improved our stay.  The staff at Reception and Valet Services were friendly and helpful.  The resort was beautiful and our room was perfect with a partial ocean view and pool view balcony.  We enjoyed the live music from the restaurant from our balcony.  Beds were comfy and the room was spotless.  Easy walk to Main St or Beach Blvd for food and drinks.  Based on the children playing in the pool and all of the water toys provided to them by the hotel, it looks to be a great place for families.  I would definitely stay here again.

We usually stayed at the Hyatt Huntington Beach but could not get the last minute room for the Labor Day weekend... So we stayed at the Hilton. We got the sleep-eat-surf-park package with a partial ocean view sunrise room for $325 per night which is pretty good deal... This rate includes free breakfast for two (generally about $25 per person), parking (valet parking $30 per day, self parking $50 per day), wifi ($12 per day) and 12% tax.  The room is spacious, clean with wood floor, nice sunrise view, comfy bed and clean bathroom! The staff is pleasant! The location is excellent, right across from the beach and a short walk to the shopping area. However, there is no convenience store nearby so you will have to get some urgent items from their gift store which are very expensive.

This was my first time staying at this hotel and unfortunately it will be my last.  It is a beautiful hotel and great location but the fact that they allow animals on ANY floor was a huge thing for me. Animals in the elevator, in the hallway, and yes, they barked during the night.  I take some reasonability because I knew the hotel allowed animals but didn't know they would be on any floor.  I was unlucky enough to be next door to a small dog that barked when the owners left him, and down the hall were three large dogs in one room.  Don't get me wrong-I love dogs but I don't want to stay in a "four star" hotel with them.  The service in the restaurant was a little slow but the flood was okay.

Summary Heading: Great location! Great Service! WiFi not free ?!
Summary: Great rooms, quiet, clean, great views, patios, heated pool, bell staff, pool staff AWESOME! Make sure to ask about beach smores and free chairs/towels/bags/umbrellas for the beach!Would stay again! Very dog friendly.

Our stay at this hotel was wonderful, we got a good rate for the room that was fair and the room was as we can always expect. This is why we continue to only choose Hiltons for our hotel needs. We will look to returning to this hotel in the future. This was our first trip to CA. and we enjoyed this night and area, so please keep a room ready for us.

This is my second time staying at this hotel with my family of four.  This time we had extended family who met us here.  We loved the hotel as much this time.  Last year we were exploring the area but this year it was more of family reunion and stayed on the hotel property.  We had a very nice dinner one evening at Shades and then booked the cookout on the beach with 10 family members and had a great time.  The staff and services are wonderful.  The location on the beach and near town is so convenient.  The kids loved the pool.  Each day there was a poolside activity that the kids enjoyed including air brush tattoos, water balloons and portraits.  The only down side is the size of the rooms which are nicely appointed but on the small side.  Would love to come for a 3rd visit

Summary Heading: Great place for a short getaway
Summary: This was our second trip to the Hilton Huntington Beahopefully took our kids for the labor day weekend. The hotel was full that weekend but we did not feel that service suffered due to the high number of guests. They were not able to accommodate our request for a suite upgrade as we received on our last trip but this was to be expected given the occupancy level. From the moment the valet greeted us, we felt welcomed. Ryan, the valet, said he would have our bags brought up to our room after we checked in. We were given a double room on a high floor with a great view of the beach. PCH is right in front of the hotel, but the traffic noise is not very noticeable. The crosswalk to get to the beach is right in front of the hotel.   We ate at Shades, the hotel restaurant for both

I was worried about staying here after reading the reviews however we has such wonderful service from the moment we stepped onto the property. The check in was easy and fast.  The pool attendant saw us looking for a spot and found one for us and really hooked us up.  Happy hour at shades was super nice and the service was great!  No complaints at all. Will definitely be back again!

Summary Heading: Bring some earplugs and check the bill!
Summary: Location is great but the rooms are not very well insolated for noise. If you have room on sunrise side don't be surprised if there is a big party in the parking lot underneath your room, which in our case sounded like being at the MTV VMAs. You can also hear every conversation in hallways and rooms next door. We had two billing issues which initially could not be resolved, but at checkout were taken care of in minutes. Restaurant was great but not great enough to make up for other issues.   Consider other location!

We have been staying at the Waterfront Hilton every summer or the past few years and we love it. It's a great location, beautiful, with a lot to do nearby.  We have two young boys, and it is family friendly and works great for us!!  The best part is all the rooms have a view of the ocean. We prefer the sunset side, with a view of the Huntington pier.  We also prefer a high floor.... It seems quieter and gives a better view.   The staff has always been very friendly and willing to do anything to make our stay a pleasant one.  We've noticed the same people working there year after year, and they even remember us!!  The beach is just across the street....they provide all the beach toys, chairs, towels you need...it works out great!!  It's also an easy walk down to Main Street...a

What a perfect location, directly across the street from the beach, and a short walk to restaurants and shopping.  Quite honestly, the room I had was nothing special.  It was clean and comfortable, but not particularly spacious.  The small balcony did look over the beach, but its a balcony made for 2 at best.  That said, there's little reason to be in your room while here except sleeping.  Pool area was clean and well kept.  Others have mentioned the high cost of wireless, parking, etc, but if you go to HB, that's what you're going to pay.  Service throughout the hotel was excellent, and the few meals I had hear were a cut above the quality I expect from a hotel.  Would definitely stay here again

We booked in here for four nights based on previous reports from here, and because, sadly, the Hyatt was fully booked. We like the Hyatt's. For me the Hilton represents extremely poor value for money, out to extort money for basic services usually provided as complimentary by quality hotels. Firstly wifi is chargeable, at $12.95 per day, and per device! Secondly, parking is valet only, and a further $30 per day, plus gratuities of course. Be warned that there can be a wait to get your vehicle when they're busy. Anyone considering paying extra for an ocean view, be warned, don't! The view is interrupted by a 6 lane highway and parking lot, and all the associated noise. We paid for a sunrise room which was a big mistake. These rooms look onto a vacant lot with a marquee, which is

Great hotel, right on the beach and with an easy 10-minute walk to the pier & restraunts. Down side is you have to pay for wifi and only Valet parking is available but at a massive charge of $30.00 per night!!

Love the Waterfront Beach Hotel Hilton. Every year we have our girls weekend and staying here it's consistently great, clean, friendly and safe. Love the shuttle service, saves time from waiting for a cab. I will recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family!

Great hotel- very short walk to "Main Street" and the Huntington beach pier. Could not ask for better service, from the front door, to the shuttle driver, to the wait-staff. Very well run facility, in a superb location!

Summary Heading: Nice location across from the beach!
Summary: Pretty nice hotel. Needs 2 elevators. We had to turn 23 corners to get to our room. Cool staff, clean and great location across the highway from the beach. Parking is crazy but they have it all worked out.

My family and I have stayed at the Waterfront for many years, however our recent experiences have lead us to never stay there again. we stayed there several times over this summer. 4 of which we ran into incidences that did not make it a good experience. 1. we booked an ocean front suite for 4th of July for our 20 yr wedding anniversary so that we could watch the fireworks of the pier from our balcony. However, our entire view was obstructed by palm trees. we were forced to enjoy the fireworks front the street outside the hotel...romantic....not so much! 2. We again booked a suite and brought our daughter and her friend. When we got to the room the bed had looked like someone had been laying on it. In addition we were given a studio suite...it only had a curtain separating the

Fantastic location. Incredible view of the beach, pier and sunset! I could have sat on my balcony all day long, the view was so spectacular. Right across the street from the beach, easy 1/2 mile walk to Main Street. I didn't want to pay $30 a day for parking, so I parked for free on Atlanta Ave, and walked the 1/3 mile to the hotel. A bit of a pain, but worth saving $200 by the end of the week! There are also parking meters for $1.50 an hour on PCH that take credit cards. I didn't deal with the staff much except for them greeting me every time I entered the property. Only ate at the hotel once, for a continental breakfast. The muffins and bagels were fine. The fruit was really good, and the juice was fresh-squeezed. (I'd personally recommend having breakfast somewhere on Main

Summary Heading: Its not 5 star but We like it here.
Summary: This was our second time staying here.  We are Hhonors members so always use points to stay here. Otherwise it would be pretty pricey    We had a corner suite with large balcony ocean front on 3rd floor this time. Next time will request huger floor. Baths were good size. And had separate king bedroom and our 2 year old slept on pull out couch. Wasn't too crampy considering we dont spend a ton of time in the room anyway. View was nice except for a few large palm trees in the way over looking the pool but hey can't complain about everything. Always had great service here.  We love the location and short stroll to Main Street.  The breakfast here is good also. Overall we like it here. And we will continue to come back :)

We had a corner suite on the pier side of the Hilton hotel and really there is not one room that does not have an ocean view or partial ocean view there.  It was a choice between the Hyatt or the Hilton and we looked at both.  The Hyatt has the bridge and is larger but really the Hilton is just as nice and all the rooms ensure you have a ocean view unlike the Hyatt.  Both are nice and you can't go wrong with either one.  Hyatt more upscale and Hilton is really nice too.  We will stay again at the Hilton because we have such a great experience.  The concierge was fabulous!  She even located a gluten free store for our son to get gluten free graham crackers for our sunset fire pit / smores night offered through the hotel. We also checked out Rubys at the end of the pier and

The hotel is simply not worth the price you pay for it. Very standard rooms, rather dated/dingy bathrooms, terrible food - really awful. Good location, great staff but absolutely zero value for money.

My family and I were extremely disappointed to arrive at our destination and discover that "The Waterfront Beach Resort" Hilton was indeed rather a "Highway/Parking Lot Resort" Hilton.  We arrived  late in the evening.  I selected a more expensive "Ocean Front " rooms.  Upon looking out of the 4th story "Oceanfront" window, I was extremely disappointed to learn that I was indeed looking out to 6 lanes of traffic and a large parking lot, then the beach!!! Wow!! We were tired and went to sleep.  We were awakened by noisy traffic in early  Monday morning hours.  Well, that is not what we expected! I inquired if any other room were available and we moved to the 9th floor pool side where the rooms were smaller but it was quiet and we wee able to sleep.  These rooms were less

As nice and accomodating as this hotel is, there were some minor downfalls. Don't let the check-in desk tell you that your room is almost ready, unless you ask how long "almost ready" is. The valet parking can be inconvenient and time consuming if you are going to use your car often. We were very disappointed that there were no smores at night at the hotel site. It was one of the few things at night to keep a child busy and happy, but in order to have smores, you need to pay for a package that allows you to use the firepits on the beach. This would be great if you have a group of people I suppose.

We planned to stay 2 nights for vacation as the hotel is not inexpensive, but were so impressed with the property and the service the staff provided we extended another night. They were very accommodating as we have 2 kids under 4. Not the most luxurious Hilton property I've stayed at, but by far the best service I've received!

Summary Heading: Second stay - disappointing - won't be coming back
Summary: This is our second visit to Hilton Waterfront. We loved it last time we came which is why we chose to come again.  We are disappointed this time with the service and won't be coming back.  We didn't receive a room upgrade as Hilton Honors diamond members - this is on availability but something we have always enjoyed in the past.  Breakfast was a nightmare - so slow!!  Every morning we had at least a 20 minute wait for tables - whilst we looked at empty tables in the restaurant.  This morning, again we were told a 20 minute wait. 30 minutes later when we still hadn't been seated, I returned to the girl at the desk to find that she had forgotten about us. Goodness knows how long we would have been waiting for!  Location is great.  Cleanliness is not as good as last time. Queen

We had a room on the first floor, facing south.  The patio was large, but only had 2 chairs.  Pretty views, but I imagine that the higher floors enjoyed even better views.  The pool area was nice, offered cabanas and pool service, I wish we would have had time to enjoy it! The room was very spacious, but the 2 beds were a full.  Definitely should have been a queens, there is more than enough space, and 2 people in a double is tight, even with both only being around 125 pounds!!  The room was nicely appointed, but very dark.  Additionally, we had to unplug the lamp on the night stand between the beds, as it randomly turned off and on, as well as the refrigerator was not operable.  We were only there 1 night, so not a deal breaker.  Surprising considering the $$$ they get for the

This Hotel is right across the street from beach. Hotel and staff were tremendous. Great location close to the action of main street, but far enough away to enjoy the tranquility. Pool area is fun, staff very helpful. If you want to have a bon fire on beach be sure to stake out your claim to fire pit early and be ready to fight off the locals. Hotel Beach Adventure does offer fire pits for a fee. Great Beach Vacation! Love SoCal!

We have stayed at the Waterfront Hilton many times over the years.  You just can't beat the location.  On our last visit, a business trip, we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite on the top floor.  Sometimes life can be good!  But even if you stay in a regular room you will have a great time here.  The restaraunt is impeccable.  Hotel staff is very attentive to guests.  This is a family friendly hotel.  If you have young children they will just love it here.  Surf City USA!

We recently stayed here for a wedding and it was a wonderful experience. Every member of staff that we came into contact with during the entire stay was just lovely, helpful and professional. The staff was very accommodating. They allowed us to check in 4 hours earlier than normal which was a real life saver as it gave us time to settle in and rest and get dressed for the wedding. They also accommodated our late check out.The wedding was held at the hotel and the food was superb!  The rooms are spacious, luxurious and all have some kind of view of the ocean. We had a suite and it was large. The only negative I would say is that for the size of the hotel, the pool area is really not sufficient. Having said that, the beach is right across the street!  We shall stay here again.

The front desk did a terrible job! He said our room is not ready and will be cleaned right away. We checked in at 2pm...waited for over an hour to ask again... No luck!   Worst of all, we stayed at the Hyatt the last time we were in HB...darn, I picked the wrong hotel!!!

Great location and beautiful hotel.  We loved the hotel and the beach.  The pool at the hotel is great and the concierge set up a great cabana at the beach for us. Also the US surfing championship was going on and that was really cool.

The HBHilton is perfect for families wanting to enjoy the beach lifestyle. You can walk to beach and all of the downtown restaurants.  It's just far enough from downtown that it is a quiet place to stay!  The service was EXCELLENT!

I stayed here during the opening weekend of the US Open of Surfing.  Here are my thoughts:  Location - The hotel is right across the street from Huntington Beach, so there is no need use your car.  The hotel is also within walking distance (about 5 minutes) to all the shops on Main Street and the pier.    Pool - The weather was pretty cool - 68 degrees during the day, so I was appreciative that they have a heated pool.  Laundry Room - There is a laundry room on the 1st floor.  All you need to bring or buy is detergent.  The washer and dryer are free.  Parking - Valet parking is the only option for guests at the hotel.  Staff - Everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful!  Room - The room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable.  I also had a great view of the beach and

Summary Heading: Avoid, do not waste your Money!!!!
Summary: Horrible!  Do not stay here!!!  There is an area they rent out to private groups.  Extremely loud and completely unreasonable!!!!  The base was turned up so high I could feel it on the 11th floor.  So loud I couldn't stand it anymore and had to leave my room.  I called front door to ask them to just turn down...No Help!!!  When paying $350 per night, I expect to be able to relax in my room.  Front desk said I was notified at check in...completely untrue!  Stay at Hyatt and enjoy your vacation!

We booked last minute to treat a couple teenagers to the US Surf Open. We dropped the teens, arriving at noon, early for 4 pm check in, to a great greeting, had us on bikes, on our way quickly while readying our Garden View room. Returned about 2 PM, Desk told us "Putting finishing touches on your room right now." Wife wanted to wait, I'm glad we didn't. Room wasn't ready until quarter to four.  Shuttle We took the hotel shuttle to downtown HB but were misinformed about the pickup time. We were told variously, "just call" and it runs "the top of every hour."  Neither are true. We departed for downtown at 2:15.  Additionally, the hotel has no radio communication with the shuttle. Result: we called from downtown, were told at 4:10 "it will be there in a few minutes."  An hour

This hotel completely lives up to Hilton standards for quality, service and congeniality. Every employee at this hotel is very courteous and helpful. One of the best we've stayed at.  All rooms have an ocean views of some sort. The rooms are clean and comfortable. If you use the valet service for your car, it will be kept safely in an underground parking area. the restaurant is fantastic. The menu is very unique and diverse. And the daily specials should not be missed. sit around one of the fire pits in the evening after dining and enjoy a drink of your choice. The pool has ample seating and the poolside service is excellent.  The beach walk is a short walk across US 1. You can rent whatever you need at the beach from the hotel from beach chairs to a fire pit in the evening with

The service and amenities at this hotel should earn it five stars!  This is our second visit to the area and our second stay at this gem of a hotel.  Staff makes you feel welcomed, location can't be beat.  Highly recommend this property.

My dauthers and I stayed here in May for a mother/daughter getaway and had a wonderful time! The property is clean and meticulously groomed, the accommodations are luxurious, the food is delicious, the staff is very personable, and the views are unbelievable! We were on the top floor and enjoyed sunrise rooms. The balcony was a wonderful place to put up your feet and look out over the ocean. The hotel is within walking distance to the beach, the pier, and the many shops and eateries on Main Street. I would hightly recommend this property to others.

First time visit to this location and it was really nice.  Great staff, especially Tammy Thurlow at the Concierge desk who gave us all kinds of recommendations on places to eat, visit and directions.  No matter what we asked she spent the time investigating it until she had the answer.  She was excellent.  The room was clean and well kept.  There were some minor issues but future capital spending at this Hilton will correct those issues.  Overall I give our visit here 5 STARS.

After just completing my 3rd stay at this Hilton I have again had a great experience.  The first two times I came as a teenager with my family. Had good memories and just brought my wife back this past week to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. Everyone including the Valet guys, front desk staff, restaurant servers, and pool staff were extremely friendly!   They knew it was our anniversary and had a bottle of champagne in our room for us one evening!! I really like the location. Not so close to downtown HB that it's hectic, but close enough that its an easy walk to shopping, food, and the pier!

This has been the best Hilton I have stayed at. Love the hotel and its surroundings. There health club is amazing. You have to check it out.  I love the fountain with the view. You are walking distance to beach,shops,and dinners. Everything about this hotel is five star. I will for sure be back to visit some day.

My recent stay at the Hilton Waterfront Resort far exceeded my expectations! I was instantly captivated by the stunning ocean views and the overall beauty of the hotel and the property. Although the hotel is not literally located directly on the beach, the beach is easily accessible via a crosswalk. The staff was truly excellent - very friendly and welcoming. The room itself was quite clean, cozy, and comfortable. I wish I could have stayed longer! I will definitely be back to this hotel in the near future!

Summary Heading: Great for family not for couples
Summary: I would expect with the large number of children at this hotel there would be more than 1 pool and spa. Excellent if you have lots of small children, rethink this hotel if you are with adults. In general the staff was nice but clearly summer jobs for high school students. There was little hotel pride shown by most staff. I expected better.

The Huntington Hilton is a wonderful place to stay with small children.  Our 4 year old behaved quite well during meals and had a great time at the pool.  The hotel was so kid friendly, we actually had the majority of our meals at the hotel (we usually like eating off site).  We will be back!

We had no idea that this hotel was less than 1 mile from a power plant.  The "Sunrise View" should be named the "Smokestack View."  The service was great.  Food and entertainment was good.  But the view was very disappointing.  Good location with regard to places in the area but I will not go back there again.

We stayed for 4 nights over the 4th of july and had a good time. I have to stick with just 3 stars because there are some areas that need improving. First the location, it is right across the highway from the beach but it is about a mile away from the shopping and resturantes of Huntington beach. The walk is not bad the first few times but it gets old quick. I think they should have a shuttle bus running like the Hyatt does. The other thing they should have is some sort of help with going on the beach. There are no towels or chairs available so unless you want to rent an expensive cabana, you are on your own. The Hyatt has a bridge across the highway and staff there handing out beach stuff right on the beach. When my wife cleaned up some spilled water on the tile floor of our
Manager Response: Dear Magg200,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write your review. I was glad to see that you were here for the 4th and had a good time! I have shared your comments with the necessary staff for immediate attention, most especially housekeeping and engineering. While you were here during the 4th (which is beyond the busiest time for us), that is when we really should shine the most for everyone, most especially our guests. It was a bit of a tough weekend for Huntington Beach in general as we somehow attracted more day visitors than ever (an additional 100K over last year). It is always a challenge to manage crowds of that size, so we go out of our way to secure the hotel for you, the guest, and close the property to outsiders.   Also, I'm not sure why you didn't know that we DO have a free shuttle for downtown use? However, if this was something needed on the 4th of July, then we didn't deploy the shuttle and informed our guests of the road closures. All hotels in the area (including the Hyatt) were asked by the Huntington Beach Police Department to stay off the already congested roads in and around our downtown shopping district and we felt it wise in the interest of safety as well. Beach towels and complimentary beach chairs are always available at the pool hut for you to take over to the ocean. Just sign them out and you're on your way! Again, because the crowds were so large and the demand so high, we felt it best to restrict this service to the pool area on the 4th.  We hope that you do give us another opportunity to showcase our hotel for you. And please never hesitate to ask any question or report any issue or concern to our outstanding staff. If there is a way to make it right, we're all over it!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: This great property has friendly staff but is poorly managed and lacks attention to detail.
Summary: We stayed for a week first in a two bed ocean room and then after 4th July in an ocean facing Suite. Friendly mostly very young staff give the hotel a welcoming and laid back vibe. There was mostly families at the poolside, many with young kids. Nevertheless it was very relaxing to hangout. The negatives are mostly with poor housekeeping, the rooms are quite dirty, and the crazy stupid breakfast which is expensive, poor and badly organised. This is down to bad management, which is a shame.

Very nice hotel.  Had a few problems with the number of dogs in rooms and with people smoking on their balconies.  The tv in our room did not work very well and I had to clean off the outdoor furniture on the balcony because it was very dirty.  The location was nice with a beautiful view from every room.  Visitors need to realize that it is a little bit of a walk to the pier and main street.

Truly an amazing stay!  First of course its on one of the most amazing beaches.  It has great services.  Fantastic staff who were SO helpful.  Great restaurant.  Excellent recognition.  A nice (though not great) pool.  Very nice rooms.  Can't say enough good things about this place--will definitely be back!

My husband and I were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary.  After reading different reviews, we debated between this hotel and the Hyatt Regency which is across the street.  But ultimately, I had always wanted to stay at the Hilton Waterfront and it was about $75 cheaper per night, so we decided to try it out.  We stayed 07/05/13 through 07/07/13 in a King Sunrise Room.  The Good: The location is awesome.  Although, the ocean is across the street the view from the balcony was very nice.  Vanessa from the Front desk sent complimentary champagne to our room as an anniversary gift.  The bed is super comfy.  Loved the Peter Thomas Roth bath products.  Had different food events, our first night was all you can eat In N Out and games for $20 and the next day was a BBQ.  The
Manager Response: Dear OCMaMa05,  Great review! Loved reading the good, the bad, the ugly...now let's get down to brass tacks. First of all, thank you. Thank you for bringing to our attention any service or housekeeping issue. It is genuinely welcomed. I have alerted our Director of Housekeeping about your review and have asked him to probe even further. I will have your room thoroughly examined and, if necessary, put on "maintenance" until these issues have been resolved. I can assure you, this is NOT how we desire to run our property...busy or not!   In the future, please call us right away if something isn't "up to snuff"...no matter how small you think it might be. Our guests are always treated with respect when they call and we will do everything to ensure your complete satisfaction. It is also very helpful to jump on a situation right away. Whether your paying $75 less than somewhere else or not, we'd rather give you a million dollar experience everytime you're here. If you should decide to come back and see us again, please feel free to reach out to me personally so that I can see to your stay. I would love the opportunity to welcome you back.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Spent 4th of July weekend here in ocean view king.  Superb ocean views, and fabulous fireworks view.   When we first arrived, since itvwas juky 4, there was a chain blocking driveway because they needed to control non guests from invading,understand and appreciate.  However, our name was not on the "list" which freaked me out, had my reservation been given away??  After digging up my reservation number in my email, we finally got through.  After a 7 hr drive, looking forward to getting settled.  Vanessa behind the counter could tell iwas a little agitated and then she told me my room was mot available for few minutes.  Grrrrr!  But, she immediately offered to take us to the bar for a cocktail while we waited.  She walked us over, told waitress to get us a drink, and then 15

There really isn't much more I can say.  Our eight days at the Hilton Waterfront was just simply awesome.  Paulette Fischer is one of the most fantastic hotel managers I have EVER dealt with.
