She single handedly made my wifes 40th birthday unforgettable.  From small touches, to unbelievable large touches, she was simply awesome.  The hotel is beautiful, the beach is great, everything is clean and well manicured.  But perhaps the best part is the hospitality.  I have spent many weeks at the ritz carlton maui, and the service there reminds me of how we were treated here.  The staff truly goes OUT of THEIR WAY to assist you in any way.  The valet was the best I have ever used.  I truly cant say enough.  I would NEVER hesitate to recommend this hotel, and cant wait to stay again.

Summary Heading: Fantastic location, pet friendly, great service
Summary: Stayed for the July 4th holiday weekend and they added lots of special touches to make sure our stay was enjoyable. We spent multiple days at the beach and could just walk across the street to use our nice clean hotel bathroom. We also walked to downtown for dinner. The hotel hosted a s'mores bonfire and in n out party one night, had live jazz music playing at the pool, and gave our pups treats and doggie beds. Would stay here again.

You need to improve the nocturnal environment conducive to a good restful night for the gusts. We had a misfortune of having rude and unruly people as our next-door neighbor.  There were at last half dozen kids and several adults who were having a very noisy party which spilled out to the hallway late into the night.

I have stayed here for business purposes with a group of customers. Nothing beats a morning walk on the beach, which you will find right across the street. I had a corner room (suite I believe) with ocean view. Traffic on the PCH can still be heard inside the room when the windows are closed, however it didn't wake me up. Next time I will probably ask for a room that doesn't look over the PCH, just in case. Anything else is just as you would expect and even a bit beyond the expectations from this type of hotel.

Spent the night for anniversary and had a great stay. Hotel was very clean and the staff was outstanding. Eveyrone was friendly and helpful. Pool was clean and plenty of spots around the pool to relax and enjoy the weather. Shuttle service to main street is great! Beach is right across the street and hotel is located in a perfect spot close to lots of restaurants and activities. Rooms were very clean and had plenty of space.

Wonderful service!!!  Great location!!  Beautiful sunsets!! If you need a short little getaway, this is the place to stay.  Room service was prompt, and the food was good. TV did not work at first, but it was fixed right away.  Thanks for the great service!

Summary Heading: This hotel on the ocean is simply fantastic
Summary: This the finest Hilton I have ever experienced.  I'm shocked this isn't considered a luxury branded hotel.  Great rooms, many facing ocean with real balconies.  Excellent food, outstanding pool area.  Location in the heart of Surf City, USA.  Workout room is nicely appointed, and I love the shop just off the pool area.  Tonya at the front desk should be recognized for her consistently excellent service.  I stay in many hotels across many different brands, and I consider this property one of the very best.  My highest recommendation.

Awesome hotel a must when visiting Huntington Beach. Hotel and staff are second to none. Great whether your on business or pleasure. Have been going for 21 years since the hotel opened up. Plan to go another 20 plus years god willing.

Everything about our stay was fantastic. The hotel is very beautiful, clearn, and the hotel personnel are very friendly, personable, and extremely helpful.  The restaurant serves quality food that is very tasty.  The waiters are on top of their toes.  The service was excellent.  The pool area and jacuzzi was very nice.  I love having the ice water available at all times.  It was a great experience.  My daugher loved the pool.  The water temperature was perfect.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

My sister and I just spent her birthday at this great hotel. Everyone we encountered greeted us, offered to help us if needed and generally went out of their way to make sure we had a great time. Get a corner suite if possible sunset side. The views are spectacular the extra space welcome. Shades is a good restaurant with their breakfast Buffet being the best for both price great choices. Highly recommend it. If you want a beach vacation that won't break the budget I highly recommend this hotel. Been here many times, will be back again!

I was very disappointed with my stay here for several reasons.  I should have done more research about the location of the Hotel, and its valet only policy.   We usually stay in Newport Beach but we thought we would try this hotel in Huntington Beach because it looked like a great location.  The hotel is too far away from the heart of Huntington Beach to walk to.  The beach that is across the street is crowded and is the heart of the fire pits.  The smoke from this area is overwhelming and can be smelled from the balconies of the hotel.   Since everything like the pier and the restaurants nearby are too far to walk to, we were constantly forced to drive everywhere.  Since the hotel is valet only, every trip required waiting for the valets and the car was never accessible any

THis hotel was most exquisite. For the price I paid, I expected the best and got it. However the customer service was unbelieveable. The staff here treated me as if I was the most important person in the Hotel. I couldn't have paid for better service than this.

For couples very good. Nice ocean view.  Good breakfast, do not miss it. Very easy access to Ocean. No need to carry your own towels for Ocean, hotel will provide. Good staff.   For couples very good. Nice ocean view.  Good breakfast, do not miss it. Very easy access to Ocean. No need to carry your own towels for Ocean, hotel will provide. Good staff.

Summary Heading: Huntington Beach --- The # 1 City On The Coast
Summary: Honestly I Can Not Stand The West Coast, Except For One City, That Would Be Huntington Beach, CA! Huntington Beach Is Heaven On Earth! This Hilton Is Fabulous! In Fact My 2 Favourite Hiltons Are Of Course This One In Huntington Beach & The One In Suburban Dallas {In Grapevine} Near The Dallas/Ft Worth Int. A/P---"DFW-Lakes!" But This Is About Huntington Beach! The Hotel Was 5 Stars All The Way...............Breath Taking Views Of The Huntington Beach Pier & The Pacific Ocean! The Restaurants Were Great Also! The Tropical Landscaping By The Pool & Restaurant Were Outstanding Very Much Like One Would Find In A Florida Or Hawaiian Resort! The Weather Ideal---KQQL & Mild {Summer 2012} Bravo "Surf City!"

The hotel and its staff far exceeded our expectations and we will definitely be back soon. The staff at the restaurant were awesome and gave 5 star service. I drove 8 miles from home to stay here for a romantic weekend and it was more than worth it. it was also great being able to put on our wetsuits and grab our surfboards then head down the elevator and across the street to surf.

Our stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort was nothing short of amazing.  From helpful and friendly staff, to beautifully appointed rooms, this hotel is one that we will stay at anytime we are in Huntington Beach. We were greeted by one of the nicest and most genuine front desk personel I have ever experienced.  We arrived at the hotel at 11 am and check-in was not until 4, but after taking our bags they let us know they would call us to let us know when our room would be ready.  After walking into the main street of Huntington Beach (about 2 blocks), an hour later they called us and we checked into a Sunrise Ocean View Room on the 8th floor. The pool and amenities made our overnight visit something to brag about, and I will reccomend this hotel to anyone!  Thank you Hilton

Nice hotel.. You have a choice of sunset or sunrise beach views. I choose sunrise. The rooms that a water facing look amazing. Has a very nice pool area. You must walk across the street to get to the beach. Room service was great. Had both dinner and breakfast. Great hotel for families. Not really located near other things that I noticed.

We stayed at this hotel or four nights and we liked it a lot! We were greater by the staff at the valet parking after which we checked in.   Rooms are nice and spacious, including a fridge and coffee maker. We had a sunset side room which I can only recommend. The hotel has a very nice pool with plenty sun beds.  The breakfast was OK but nothing special. I had much better at other Hilton properties.   Hotel is located next to the beach and downtown Huntington Beach which is a nice little area.   All and all we had a good stay and will come again.

Great hotel.  You will not be disappointed in anything.  From the moment you drive on to this property- customer service will be at its best.  The rooms are superb.  The pool area is outstanding.  The staff are wonderful.  Its a great property.  And you are walking distance to some of the best surf around.

The staff was wonderful and knowledgeable. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights. The Catalina Suite is absolutely AMAZING. We loved the whirlpool tub in the room and the bed felt like we were sleeping on a cloud. I had a minimal issue with payments afterwards, but, quickly got that figured out thanks to their awesome manager, I believe his name was Andrew, but, I'm not 110% sure, but, whoever he is, is awesome that's for sure. I have no complaints towards this hotel. The Eat, Sleep, and Park room package is totally worth it, their breakfast buffet is delicious and filling. Our room had such an amazing ocean view, 11th floor :) We also brought our puppy, when I told them we had brought him, they immediately gave me a big, fluffy bed for him along with a dog bowl and

What a great hotel, great view.  We had a great time.  The staff was good, the room we had was fantastic with a sunrise view.  We kept the sliding glass door open to hear the ocean waves, what a way to sleep

Summary Heading: 1 week of royal treatment and relaxation
Summary: The staff was wonderful!  We we enjoyed our stay had a beautiful view and room.  Shades restaurant and bar has a fire pit every night.  We received complimentary shuttle to and from Disney as well as downtown.

I've been here before, and as always, it's a beautiful hotel.   A few things that bugged me this time around though - I had my tiny little mother with me (she's 5ft) and she had a hard time reaching the taps, much less the sink! I had to get her a box to stand on. I requested a stool or something from housekeeping, but unfortunately never heard back from them.   Our gardenview room was in an awful location, across from the maintenance area, which meant there was a constant loud humming we could hear all night. It's a good thing we were so tired, most of us slept without too much difficulty.  The rooms here are huge! So why the two doubles? We were three adults, and although we managed, two queens would have made a big difference. I've never slept as 2 adults in a double in North

We had a great stay at the Hilton Waterfront. Just across from the beach and near the Huntington pier. We had a beach front room. Nice interior and the breakfast buffet was super. Night dining was excellent too. Internet worked well. Definitely would stay again.

We really enjoyed our stay and appreciated the upgrade to the front beach corner.   Hilton's the best! We really recommend to stay here on your next vacation.  It's a good place for a nice vacation, walk at the beach or to surf! There are lots of places to eat good food and drink!

Summary Heading: Really great hotel with excellent location
Summary: We couldn't have been happier with this hotel.  We came for Memorial Day weekend for a little "staycation" since we live 20 - 30 minutes away and we will definitely be back.  We brought our daughter and went bike riding on the beach and had a blast.  Perfect location and you can walk wherever you want to go, we never even pulled the car out.

My husband and I stayed here for a week while visiting our son and his family.  The location is wonderful and right across from the beach.  Great walking and shopping in close proximity as well.  The service at this hotel was superb and the food in the restaurant was excellent.  It appears there is a lot of pride in a job well done here, throughout the hotel.

Fantastic Stay! The location is Phenomenal, service was fabulous, and beds were very comfortable. The property was right across the street from the beach and easy to get to.  The pool area has complimentary beach chairs and boogy boards and towels you can take to the beach. They have nightly entertainment on the weekends. The pool area is fun with music. They have a restaurant with a Happy Hour and a little shop that serves Starbucks, bagels and snacks for the kids. Downtown Huntington is just a mile away and they do offer on the hour complimentary shuttle with tons of shopping and restaurants. We did not even use our car the 4 days we were there. Loved it! rooms are a bit small and do have a fridge only in a standard room.   The pool area does have fire pits going all the time

Summary Heading: Hilton waterfront compared to Hyatt Regency.
Summary: To be fair I must say it has been over a year since I spent  time at Hyatt regency. ( I did compare to memory and previous tripadvisor review.)   The Hilton waterfront is an amazing hotel, it is the kind of hotel you could spend a week at. The entrance is beautiful, I don't think lobby is enough different from hyatt to make a decision, staff was friendly and helpful at both, the  Hilton  Valet staff was very quick, and not annoying at all. I was not made to feel guilt because I wanted to carry my own luggage.  We we upgraded to a better room when we got there.  ( I have no complaints about hyatt either. fyi these hotels are next to each other. )  The gym was sparse at the Hilton the solitary stationary bicycle broke while I was on it. I do not remember if I used the Hyatts.

Summary Heading: Best Stay Ever! Hilton Beach front resort in Huntington!
Summary: Paulette Fischer Hotel Manager is the best! she went way beyond my expectations To deliviver a peaceful relaxing stay for me & my newly engaged fiancee.  from A 1-10 scale 10 being the best.  I would have to give Paulette fischer an 11 truely exceptional Thank You paulette & the rest of the Hilton beach front resort staff in huntington beach

We stayed for a couple nights in May and had an excellent stay.  Upon arrival the bell desk gave our kids a sand pail and shovel and a bottle of water for each of us.  Check in was quick and easy.  We had an ocean view room with two doubles.  It was a very nice, large room with a good size balcony and decent bathroom.  There is a fridge and safe in the room.  The room we got was a "hypoallergenic" room with wood floors instead of carpet.  It was strange that it had all feather pillows, and the room seemed rather dusty.  The rate we had included continental breakfast at the "surf hero" market.  This was Starbucks coffee, muffin and fruit.  The hotel is across the street from the beach and the bell desk will lend you umbrellas, beach chairs, sand toys, boogie boards, etc.  Another

Summary Heading: Beautiful Rooms, Great View and Amazing Food!!!!
Summary: Had a great time here from beginning to end.  The staff is friendly and knowledgable.  I visited here with my wife and we would both highly recommend a stay here.  One of our most memorable experiences happened at The Sunday Brunch at their restaurant Shades.  We were pleasantly surprised when a magician approached our table.  The surprise was that this was the same magician that we saw when we visited Maui, John George.  In Maui we spent a lot of money to see him perform in a theatre.  He was worth every penny.  He performs at that theatre several times a year.  At the Hilton he isn't doing the show but he does close-up magic table-side.  It was nice to get to meet him.  Apparently, he has been performing at the brunch at the Hilton since 1995.  It isn't a surprise that he has

This is a great hotel to stay and play at. The rooms were great, bed was fantastic, and the Staff was out of this world. Food in the resturant was a little high but still very good. Would recommend this to anyone!!

I visited H-Beach for work and was able to stay at the Hilton.  Having stayed at the Hyatt on my last trip (and having a very mediocre experience), I was looking forward to trying something new.  The hotel did not disappoint.  The room, grounds, and staff were top notch.  While there's no pedestrian bridge over PCH, I didn't find it to be a drawback.  Beach is easily accessible, and if the weather is nice an easy walk to the main drag for restaurants/shops.  The pool looked great, but I didn't give it a try.  I would happily recommend this hotel for business or vacation.

My husband and I went to California for our 20th wedding anniversary and stayed here  and the hotel could NOT be better ! What a beautiful hotel and the location is amazing ! Such a classy, beautiful Hotel, actually it's breathtaking and I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone ! OUTSTANDING !!!!! Thankyou for all you do , the staff is awesome !!

A very memorable one-night stay in Huntington Beach was made even better by the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort. I will recommend this hotel most highly to anyone traveling to the area.   We were going back and forth between staying in Newport or Huntington and ultimately went with Huntington and are very glad we did. Our ocean-view room was beautifully appointed, the view was perfection and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful!   During our very short time at Waterfront Beach Resort, we walked on the beach to downtown Huntington for breakfast, shopping, walking on the pier and watching beach volleyball and then headed over to Newport for more walking, shopping and sightseeing.    While we didn't have time to enjoy the resort's restaurants or pools, we walked

Summary Heading: Great Stay During CalTravel Association Board Meeting
Summary: What a fantastic two day stay at this beautiful property. The ocean view from my 9th floor room was panoramic, the room above average and spotless and you could not have asked for a better level of service and attention to detail.  My stay was for a business meeting, a meeting that included a reception, dinner and next day luncheon. The food and service was was amazing. During the reception the biggest broiled shrimp I have ever seen and hand passed baby lamb chops made for great appetizers. The servers and Bartender with so attentive and professional. They all had smiles and there was no tip jar on the bar.  Lunch the next day was something special, In & Out Burgers, Cesar Salad and Root beer floats.

Great experience from arrival to departure!  One of the most friendly hotel staffs I have ever encountered.  I asked for directions to a meeting room, and the staff member said "I was just going that way anyway, I'll show you."  She wasn't going anyway - she was just going out of her way to provide great service!  Excellent food, rooms with views.  A GREAT stay!

Beautifully situated hotel with an awe inspiring view of the ocean, allows business professionals to take a deep breath of ocean air and relax and enjoy a truly peaceful and enchanting sunset after a busy day. I wish all my days could end like this!

We spent four nights at this lovely hotel and it will not disappoint! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and take time to make conversation and ask how you are enjoying your stay.  They really cannot do enough to make sure you have everything you want.  I'm very fussy about cleanliness of hotels and I'm happy to say that this hotel met my high standards.  As it is a Hilton hotel you would expect high standards and as said before I was not disappointed.  The beds were extremely comfortable and the hotel environment a quiet one despite being fairly near a wide road.  However, across from the road is the lovely Huntington Beach which is a pleasant view.  They also have Starbucks coffee on site which is a bonus!  Although we didn't go in it, the pool looked lovely and

We were there just one night this trip, but everything was perfect - from the hospitality on our arrival to the wine waiting for us in our room to just hanging out by the wonderful pool.  A fabulous stay - and just across the street to the beach - watching surfers, jogs on the walkway, and a pleasant walk to the shops in town.  Kathy Nosek - made everything so nice for us!!

Summary Heading: Best Place to hold a wedding receptioin.
Summary: Perfect place to hold a wedding reception.  The balcony for the cocktail reception is so classy.  Their attention to detail is amazing.  Vanessa is the best.  Church as the banquest  coordinator was great.  I would not change a thing.  It also has WOW factor.

Summary Heading: First time and hopefully not the last.
Summary: We recently had two weeks vacation on the West Coast and marked a day in Huntington as our "beach day". We love Hiltons and the Waterfront Beach resort seemed an excellent choice in terms of facilities and location.  The kids made straight for the pool on arrival and were safe and had lots of fun. Copious towels available to get warm and dry. The bar was excellent for snacks and both nights we enjoyed a great dinner with excellent service.  Just a shame that the high winds made the beach impossible! Still we strolled into the town (a Shuttle is available from the hotel) and had a nice time around the shops, pier and restaurants before walkig back to enjoy the hotel's facilities again.  We'll be back one day - just to get that beach day in!

Summary Heading: Site visit for future possible booking
Summary: I recently had the pleasure of traveling to So. CA for a site visit for work to determine future locaton for a meeting. I am only reviewing the one property that I stayed at overnight. I had the most fantastic time at this property. The staff (dir. of sales and his team) were amazing. This hotel is perfect for families and business alike. The conference space is large enough and perfect fit for those small to large groups. The decor is outstanding, rooms very cozy and the view unbeatable. The food was the best I've had on travel in a long time. Definitely the type of location that I would stay at personally.

The hotel accomodations were excellent, the staff very helpful and polite. The bathroom could use additional ventillation to exhaust steam from shower. The food was high quality. The area is beautiful.

What a great resort in Huntington Beach!  Outstanding customer service, convenient, well maintained and the employees are approachable.  Room product is fresh and vibrant.  I will keep coming back year after year as JD (Resort GM) and his team are top notch!

Summary Heading: Terrific Resort On Pacific Coast Highway
Summary: We've come back to this hotel 5 or 6 times over the last few years because we love the views of Huntington pier/beach from the oceanfront rooms, are always treated very well by all of the staff, look forward to eating at "Shades", enjoy the updated clean rooms and because the beach is only 194 steps from the hotel door...(really).  If you have never been to Huntington Beach you need to know that this is not a narrow & crowded beach like that of Waikiki Beach. Huntington Beach is over a 100 yards deep (maybe close to 200 yards) and several miles wide so 95% of the year you can actually find "your own spot". However during the USA surf championships the beach within a 1/2 mile of the pier is pretty crowded. The beach is actually cleaned or raked every night so it looks like a

nice hotel; great location but full of young boisterous people drinking and up late at night. we were awoken twice at 2am and had to complain to security.  Also our first "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke though we were promptly and courteously given a new room.

Summary Heading: Waterfront Hilton is TOP NOTCH in Guest Service
Summary: The executive staff and every Waterfront Hilton team member is 100% focused on excellent guest service delivery. From pre-arrival, to arrival and during the stay, this property is #1 in Huntington Beach, Newport Beach and Laguna Beach.

As part of a Southwest airlines vacation, I picked this resort for a beach location. There is plenty of good beach along this part of the CA coast, but this area in Huntington beach seemed the best for myself and my wife because of miles of boardwalk(paved) that we enjoyed riding and also riding to Sunset beach to rent kayaks. I did not realize how far the hotel was from LAX and that is a bit of a problem since this hotel is valet only parking at $28 per night and there are no other options. I called ahead of time and worked with the concierge , Sam. She had the best and least expensive idea and put in a lot of effort to hook me up with the least costly alternative. The hotel works with Enterprise so I rented one way from LAX and dropped the car off at the hotel for Enterprise

Summary Heading: Great hotel w/ a great location across from the beach!
Summary: Stayed on a Thursday, we had the Sunrise/Oceanview room. I requested a room on a high floor and we were put on the 12th floor. The view was outstanding! The access to the beach was great! A simple 10-15 minute walk on the beach get's you to the pier, restaurants and shops. You have to pay $28 to valet your vehicle, but you're allowed unlimited in & out privileges and the valet staff was very friendly.   The only issue I had was the Wi-Fi was not free! Unless you’re a Honors Gold or Diamond member, if not it’s $12.95 PER device. Call me cheap, but when I am spending around $300 a night, including free Wi-Fi would be nice.   The bed was very comfortable and with the nice sliding glass door you're able to open that up and get a very nice breeze in the room and since we were on the

Summary Heading: Weekend @ Hilton Waterfront Resort - Huntington Beach
Summary: Great resort spot, close to fun, food, and beach/sun - loved it. Duke's restaurant was great too, Ono was great! Wait staff was excellent and very hospitable. Made our anniversary a real enjoyable evening.

Wasn't sure were to stay during our trip to southern California and this place looked nice enough so decided to burn some points on a cash+points deal and try it out as we haven't stayed in this area before.    Arrival:  We arrived from SNA (John Wayne) and the hotel is not very far away and it was a pretty easy drive.  Don't remember exactly how long but would say about 15 minutes.   Upon arrival at the hotel the valet attendants where very friendly and helpful and it is $28 for parking and valet only.    Check In:  Check in was efficient enough and the check in person explained we were given an upgrade to an ocean view room as a Diamond and given information about internet and breakfast coupons (Diamond benefits) which basically amounted to free continental or $15 off menu or

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel across from the beach.
Summary: I have stayed here often on vacation and during trade shows.  It's close to the airport, the beach, golf and great restaurants.  The rates are high during the summer but they have some great prices during the winter and off season.  The rooms are always great with an ocean view.  The brunch on Sundays is the best.   Cooked to order eggs, crab legs, sushi, waffles, etc.  The pool is a great place to relax and have drinks.  My favorite time was right after kidney stone surgery.  Spent most of my time in a lounge chair by the pool having cocktails.

Only stayed one night during my last vacation to CA, but the hotel was very nice. Because of my husbands Hilton Honors status, they upgraded us to an oceanfront suite, which had a comfortable living area and bar/refrigerator. Unfortunately, the Pacific Coast Highway (PCH) is between the hotel room and the ocean. So, even though it is oceanfront, had a nice breeze, and the room had a very nice wrap-around porch (we had a corner room), the noise from the PCH kept us from sleeping with the doors open. Overall, a really nice hotel with friendly staff. It was too cold to swim, but the pool area was nice and what I liked most was the fact that they had designed the pool area so that the view was directly over the PCH toward the ocean (you could not see the PCH unless you walked right

My sister and I came for a girls weekend in March and were very pleased with our stay. It was quite full when we stayed, but you would not have known. Very quiet. All the staff were helpful and friendly. Shades restaurant had excellent food and  ambiance. The ocean view on the balcony every morning made our coffee taste even better. The fitness center is small, but quite sufficient. We enjoyed being right across from the beach and bike path and a few short blocks to Main Street. The only fault I could find was that there is only one Jacuzzi in the pool area and it was quite crowded in the evenings. This is a hotel I'll be revisiting.

Stayed 4 nites at this hotel for Spring Break with my family. GREAT room with wonderful view. The staff everywhere were very friendly from check in to valet to the Shades Restaurant.  There is a small shop that makes sandwiches and 2 college recently graduatde girls (one went to UCLA) who were both so helpful and kind when we made purchase. When those girls were not working, the other staff would always get my husband's order wrong . We would order white mocha and it was NEVER white (3 times this happened).  The Shades restaurant we at at a lot. GREAT breakfast, lunches and dinner. Great caesar salads, deviled eggs and one time I had a great lamb meatball appetizer.   Right along Pacific Coast Highway and several minute walk to the beach

Hilton Waterfront  stands tall facing the West onto the Pacific Ocean. The Hotel is positioned so that most rooms have at the very least have a partial oceanview (and I don't mean if you lean a little past the balcony you'll see the ocean )  The Hotel is clean and well polished. Service starts at the Valet, very courteous and accommodating they even informed us about the free shuttle to Main Street. NO SELF Parking BUT Valet @ $28.00/Day ? Whaaaaaat? At least we got our $ worth probably because we were driving in; dropping stuff off at the room , freshen up get ready and have the car waiting up front. Though me and my girlfriend arrived from an event and was waiting for the Valet for almost 15 minutes ( and it shouldn't matter if its 3 am ;) ..)  The Rooms are tidy and spacious

Summary Heading: Great family vacation stay - love HB and loved the Hilton
Summary: To keep it honest - we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite due to hubbie's status with Hilton Honors - but that is one of the reasons we had such a great stay.  We were blown away (this has never happened) and my kids felt like rock stars.  Loved the ammenities - beach chair?  No prob.  Boogie board? No prob. Great staff, great view from the pool of the gorgeous beach.  Beds were fantastic - slepts like a baby.  Would recommend this property to anyone who wants to check out HB, be walking distance to town and be pampered by a well trained staff.  Will be back!  PS - the dolphins jumping out in the Pacific one morning didn't hurt either.

Summary Heading: Went for business, would return with friends or family for sure!
Summary: Great hotel, not overly expensive. Right across the street (PCH) from the beach. Lots of places to eat/shop in walking distance. Great breakfast buffet ($22) at hotel. Rooms are quiet, beautiful and clean. Too cold to swim when I was there, but jacuzzi was nice( a little small), Staff was friendly and very helpful. Would stay again for sure.

We concluded a fantastic trip down the coast with our teens at this awesome resort. Is this a Ritz or Four Seasons?  No. But this is my fav Hilton in the country. Service is fantastic and the rooms are very nice and there are always chairs available at the pool. This is a family resort. If you are looking for seclusion you may want to looks elsewhere.   The onsite restaurant Shades is good but has a limited menu. Actually, the lunch menu is more appealing than the dinner menu. Service was friendly and unpretentious. Everyone from the font desk to the bellmen were friendly and helpful. Monique in particular deserves high praise, as well as the women working the surf hero shop.   Our only complaint was the bed. It was extremely soft and we both tossed and turned more than usual..

My wife and I selected the Hilton Beach Resort because it offered "Ocean Front" rooms. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and were looking forward to a romantic view from our balcony of the beach and ocean. We were given a second floor room with heavy automobile traffic noise and a row of palm tree's that blocked most of the ocean view. I figured that booking during the week and off-season would afford us a better opportunity for a nice ocean front room? Not the "case"!!! When I inquired about getting a room on a higher floor I was told that everything was completely booked up. The hotel parking lot was almost empty and the hotel was noticeably empty? To be honest, we offered a room on the 6th floor with a hotel parking lot view!!  You would think that when you spend

Summary Heading: Great hotel except the double beds
Summary: Very nice hotel with nicely decorated and clean rooms. Each room has a little balcony which over looks the ocean. Ours also overlooked the pool and restaurant area.  It was super nice to sit out there at the end of the day and watch the sunset. The pool area is really nice with pool side waitresses. It was very nice to sit out and get some sun. The bar, Shades was  also nice and "Jami" can make a really nice cocktail and do some really cool magic tricks. My husband, daughter and I were very impressed. As much as we like the hotel I don't think I could ever go back there unless I was able to have a Queen or King size bed. There were three of us in our room and when we walked in the two beds were double size.  My daughter got one and my husband and I got the other. We are not big

This hotel is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for.  The rooms are spacious, comfortable, quiet, and well provisioned.  The pool area is nicely landscaped and has a fire pit when cold.  The restaurant has a nice menu, and food and drinks are brought to the pool.    The staff is friendly and efficient.

My wife and I stayed here last year.  It was my wife's first trip to California and I had only to been to California once before for a very short stay.  This hotel was close to where we needed to be, otherwise I don't know if I would have selected Huntington Beach as our location, not knowing the area.  As it turned out, we loved it and were glad to be there.  The hotel is clean and the pool area is very nice.  The restaurant served quality food and the Sunday brunch was incredible.  We were upgraded to a corner suite and it was a great room with wrap around balcony and a 2nd balcony.  The only down side, were views of a some sort of factory or plant, but it in no way spoiled our room.  There are other rooms that are on the side of the hotel, but I would request one that is
Manager Response: Dear Jeff A,  Thank you for your kind words and excellent review. We agree that LA and Orange County are two different animals although just next to each other. You, however, nailed it when you hit upon our friendly and laid back atmosphere...and proximity to our wonderful downtwon for shopping and dining options (when you're not too stuffed by our endless brunch buffet!). That makes us your perfect beachside getaway, no passports required!  Soon the view will be different too as the electrical power plant you could see off in the distance will be radically altered to blend in with our surroundings (no more towers or exposed structure). While we can't wait for that day to come, it is nice to know that for Huntington Beach (and our coastal neighbors) clean and affordable power is avaiable for us when demand rises. Recently the power company presented its final plans to the city and coastal commission for approval...and their committment to our environment (and sightline) is to be commended.  We all look forward to your return and next time, by all means...bring the kids! We have a wonderful activities menu all planned for the kick off to summer (and complimentary too) along with plenty of beach options thru Waterfront Adventures directly in front of the hotel on the sand. Hurry back, we'll be ready!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I stayed for 3 nights with my young children. The customer service was excellent and I was very satisfied with my stay. My only complaint is that they do not offer any type of kids club such as the Hyatt Regency next door. Other than that, the pool area was lovely, the location superb, and the rooms very nice.
Manager Response: Dear KittyTX76,  Thank you for your very kind review. You'll be glad to know that beginning Memorial Day weekend we will have childrens activities every day of the week...arts and crafts, cookie decorating, caraciture artistis, ballon toss contests and more...all complimentary. And remember, at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel, there is NO RESORT FEE! No hidden fees for fun... ever.  Now that I've got you smiling, give us a call and book you're next stay... we're ready for you and the younger ones whenever you come back.   Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights and loved the location.  An easy walk to the main stretch of shops and restaurants.  Our rate included continental breakfast which consisted of toast and coffee from the coffee shop.  One morning we went to the restaurant and had a la carte breakfast - well worth it.  Staff were really friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.

the hotel was great you can walk to the main street where all the shops are or there is a shuttle bus that runs every hour just take their card with the number to call we were waiting for the shuttle and it was not there at the time they stated so after waiting 10 min extra we called and they said they should be there any min and it showed up 5 min later(i think they left when we called). I wish the bathroom was split so if you have a few people getting ready like we did you would have two area instead of just the one full bathroom.  overall it is a great hotel and the staff is real really helpful.

We were on our second stay at this property this year. The hotel has been nearly completly sold out. After staying in a 2nd floor Oceanfront studio in 2012 we now got a Sunrise room on 12th floor. Less noice from the street and nice view but fairly tiny with a small balcony. We usually do get up late in the morning, sunrise side means no view on the evenings and way to much sun for the shades early in the morning. The front desk worked straight forward, nothing more to say. Only Cerra Meyers had an eye on customer orientation and did an excellent job. We like the quality of food at breakfast and getting enough time to start the day (til 11:00am)! The service at breakfat is ok. Don't expect finding a wide breakfast selection on the buffet like at other category 7 Hilton family

We recently travelled to southern California and flew into LAX but wanted to be away from LA and stay a few days near the water. We chose the Hilton and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff from check in to directions were extremely accommodating and friendly. Kudos to those who hire and train at this property.  The restaurant at this hotel was so good we only ate away from the property once which is unusual for us as we like to explore restaurants allot. Right across the street from the beach and a short walk to shopping it is a great location with great views. We would highly recommend this property.

This Hilton is right across the street from the beach and since it's a few blocks away from the town center, it's not quite as crowded. We rented bikes and rode down to Newport Beach. It was a great ride because the path is fairly level and follows the beach for most of the way. There are a number of restaurants in Huntington Beach, but be prepared for crowds on the weekends. It's near enough to Disneyland without the madness.  The room we had was very comfortable and the view of the beach was fantastic. The hotel personnel were very attentive and the service was great. Although my husband stays here often on business, this was my first stay and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

We recently stayed at the Hilton Waterfront. It offered great staff and easy services to navigate.  We were driving to the convention center in Anaheim every morning and the commute was ok. I am glad I stayed here rather than anywhere near the convention center. Waking up to see the ocean every morning was worth it all! Thank you to the Hilton Waterfront staff their team of people were fabulous.

Summary Heading: could not ask for a better place to stay
Summary: Stayed at Hilton Waterfront for 2 days. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Close enough to everything so we kept the car parked and walked. Would stay here again if we come back out to the west coast. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was very good. Wish we could have been there for the Sunday brunch. was told it was great

Summary Heading: Clean, good location, overpriced for what it offers.
Summary: I stayed here for one night before boarding the ferry for a weekend on Catalina. The hotel is right on the beach and if you're looking for a decent location for a family vacation or a romantic getaway this might suit your needs. That being said my overall response was - "Ehhh."  I'd have rather saved a $100 per night and stayed at another hotel or spent another $100 and spent the evening at a better hotel. The rooms are clean and the staff was friendly and efficient but that doesn't justify out pricing similar hotels by about $100 (Every hotel in the area offers the same great location for beach activities and sunset viewing).   The parking is $28.00 per night and wi-fi is an additional cost, which should be figured into the cost when booking a room. While this seems to be a
Manager Response: Dear Spencerz_13,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review for us. I, and the entire staff, am very happy you chose to stay here as our guest. We know you have many options for accomodations here in Orange County... and the fact that you chose us as your beach destination over any other is greatly appreciated. I have posted your comments with our service staff, front desk, and housekeeping so they may all share in your kind words about the very hard and dilligent work they perform everyday. Cleanliness, efficiency and friendliness are all huge compliments, so thank you for that!  While it is true that you may find another hotel or resort with a lesser room rate (which is always dependant on time of year, occupancy, events in the area, etc.) may I also point out that we have no resort fee or hidden charges of any kind. When you book a room with The Waterfront Beach Resort, the price is the price... no gimmicks, no surprises. As for parking, like all beachfront hotels, space and security are the issues. In order to provide consistent, secure, 24 hour parking services, "valet" is our only option. We are the least expensive valet option on the beach and we strive to keep that committment to our guests while still providing the service expected of a world class, four diamond resort. In Huntington Beach there is no 24 hour "overnight" parking option except at a hotel or resort. All other vehicles must move off or park inland to eliminate congestion and to ensure everyone has a place for their day trip to Surf City USA!  We certainly hope you can stay with us again in the future... and remember to call us directly for the best rates! Sometimes you can get a steal of a deal just by speaking to our in-house reservationists. Ask for the best available advance purchase rate (non-refundable) and you might be pleasantly surprised at what you hear! (And now that I've let THAT secret out, do it soon... I imagine anyone reading this will be doing the same.  All the best,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Spent one week with children. Room a bit small for 4 with two beds a bit small for 2 adults . Very small bathroom . Apart from that, the location is unbeatable, the scenery of sunset over the pier is magic. Service is Hilton class , breakfast is good.

This was a girls getaway and we got a weekend special. We had a room with ocean view (sunset) and pier..beautiful, about 1/2 mile to main street and pier (easy walk). Lots of restaurants to choose from on main street and beach across the street.   Nice place for romance and special occasion, this is a upscale hotel and staff was great!  Only downside is $28 nightly parking which is valet only. We only stayed 1 night,

Summary Heading: You can't go wrong with a stay the the Waterfront Hilton Resort!
Summary: From the moment you step out of your car until you return to your car you are greeted with friendly faces who seem to truly have the desire to make your stay exceptional.  I stayed one night after a community event and I wished I had booked it for the whole weekend.  We requested a late checkout and they readily agreed!  We ordered room service after midnight and the server who brought our order was just as friendly as the valet who parked my car 8 hours earlier!  Do yourself a favor and enjoy this fantastic resort even if you are a local!  It's a great getaway!

Have stayed here a couple of times and love the property and location. Also, they are very accommodating to pets and kids. Enjoyed the pool, spa, and restaurant, as well as the easy walk to downtown HB.

The hotel was lovely.  My room had a balcony with a table and two chairs and a beautiful view of the ocean.  The outdoor areas of the hotel were very nice and since it was a cool week in HB, the lava fire pits with comfortable seating was a welcome necessity.  What a gorgeous view!  Although I stayed 3 nights, I did not get to enjoy all the hotel and local had to offer.  It is a bit of a walk down to the night spots, but easily doable and makes for a quieter night once you decide to turn in.  It was nice leaving the door open at night and listening to the surf.  The valets were very nice and very efficient at retrieving quickly.  A selection of newspapers was available each morning.  The hotel desk staff were excellent.  On checking out, the nice woman at the desk printed out my

The hotel, the room and the view was beautiful!  We paid extra for the Waterfront room which was expensive but in the end,  totally worth it since we didn't need to look at any other room or the pool or the restaqurant.  I would recommend this hotel over and over again.  Service is warm and friendly.

A great Hilton experience. Ask for the large corner suite on the first floor, facing the ocean. 1500 sq foot outdoor deck and patio on the beach.    We sat around the fire pit in the bar and pool area, they have great music on Friday nights. The salmon was a stand out on the menu.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels I've been too!
Summary: The hotel was in a perfect location! Right across the street from the beach. Excellent valet service. The bed was very comfortable. The nicest staff in the world! The only downside is that there isn't free wi-fi and had to pay about $12 for 24 hours of internet in my room.  I will definitely be coming back here to stay!

Summary Heading: The good, the bad, and the surf :)
Summary: I stayed here for six days while attending a workshop, but unfortunately in between the spells of what locals assured me was 80 degree weather - it was not so warm weather wise for us :) However, I was told that the swimming pool was heated, and I am sure it would have been nice to swim in its warmth under the graceful palms that circle the patio areas. My room was clean and pleasant with a balcony on which one could sit outside. The public areas of the hotel are nicely appointed, creating a real California feel. Our meeting room was ideal, and the food service for that workshop was very nice. However, I must say that despite the friendliness of the wait staff, the Hilton's menu is not as extensive or appealing (at least after the first day or two) as the Hyatt down the street.

I looked high & low for special winter rates before booking here but the 20% winter rate didn't apply for the weekend we chose.  Couldn't understand why this was the case until we checked in - our stay coincided with the Surf City Marathon which explained the lack of specials.  Anyway, at $429 a night plus taxes & valet parking fees,  it was a painfully expensive Sunset view King room on the 6th floor - ocean view was very obstructed by trees so definitely see if you can get a room on a higher floor than we had.    Location right across from beach was excellent.  The room was very nice, bathroom was modern but small, bed very comfortable & nice little balcony with two chairs.  We were within walking distance (10-15 min) to Main Street & the pier so we were happy with walking all

We had an excellent stay at the Waterfront Beach resort.  The top shelf service starts with the valet parking staff, extends to the front desk staff and is evident with every encounter with employees of the hotel.    Our room was large, comfortable and had a postcard view from the balcony.   The bed was comfortable and the room was spotless.  Comfortable furniture added to our enjoyment.  Seldom do we want to dine at the same restaurant three nights in a row, but the restaurant here is an exception.  We had great food and great service every meal.    The deli is a nice touch.  From coffee to ice cream to sandwiches, the deli has it all!  We look forward to returning to this this hotel in years to come.  Thanks to the entire staff!

Great view of the beach, located just across the highway from the sand, this nicely featured hotel is perfect for the vacationer looking for a beach experience.  Know that you're a distance from shops and stores, but if your intention is to enjoy the sun and surf and sand, you'll get that.  My room was nice, with a great view of the ocean.  Staff was consistently friendly and helpful, several went above and beyond the call of duty.

I stayed here and was not dissapointed. The rooms were excellent, clean and comfterable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was heated-always a plus in winter and the Merket was both clean and affordable with good sandwiches. With a convienent location, this hotel is a winner!

Summary Heading: A Friendly Oasis for the Whole Family
Summary: We stayed there the night before our cruise. When we arrived we were tired from a long day of traveling. The desk clerks were very friendly, the buffet food was fresh, healthy and just a little bit tropical. It was so relaxing with the palm trees, the band with the steel drums, the gentle sound of the ocean in the background. The rest of our party spent the day at Disneyland, and it was the perfect peaceful retreat far enough from the hustle bustle of the park to be enjoyable for all. There was a nice path right in front of the hotel on the beach. People were roller blading, walking, jogging and bicyclying on this path. We will definitely return to this haven when we were in the area.

Summary Heading: Like the locals - go for the "Happy Hour"
Summary: This is an OK Hilton, but not really a "resort" as it claims to be.  Clean, efficient, well situated. Not sure of the value, nicely set back from the centre of HB.  Best is their "Happy Hour" by the fire.  Amazing onion rings. Great Calamari.  Would we go back? Probably....

I have wanted to stay at this hotel for quite some time.  It did not disappoint!!  I stayed during "off season" just before Thanksgiving and got a great rate.  The hotel was very quiet and relaxing.  Although I checked in at 8:00 p.m., I had requested a high floor, non-connecting room in advance and it was waiting for me.  The rooms appear to be newly renovated.  They were stylish, clean and quiet with great views.  It's an easy walk into Huntington Beach and a quick drive to Newport Beach.  I also thought it was convenient to Anaheim as well.  I was able to get there easily on the freeways and off.  I couldn't have asked for a better stay!!  Hope to return next year!!!

My positive experience with the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort started with Cathy in reservations about a week before my visit when I called to make sure I had noted a late arrival.  Cathy was extremely friendly and courteous, which set my expectations high for the level of customer service we'd receive during our stay.  The location cannot be beat - right on the Pacific Coast Highway across from Huntington Beach, and a short walk on sidewalks to Main Street.  My husband & I booked a King Sunrise Oceanview room.  The room was spacious enough for a cot to be brought in for our teenage son to sleep on without it being in the way.  The room was very clean, with modern decor and a very comfortable bed.    Though a little pricy, the Surf Market was rather convenient and served

Great location ,good bed, but 2 things here:we were enjoying our dinner (we were very pleased by the quality of our dinner) and telling to each other some fun stories when our server interrupted us for checking on our meal (which is ok of course) but then 2 minutes after when I was in the middle of a very funny storie and my wife was laughting the other server asked us how was the dinner (so had to stop my story to reply) then 1 minute after the manager asked us how was the dinner (and this time my wife had to stop talking to me) then 3 minutes after our waiter asked again how was everything. and it went like that during our entire dinner lol!.I know this is crazy but I blame the manager for that not the staff..Second thing;they had a convention so the people next to our room

I stayed here in early January. The Hotel is in a great location, right across a busy road from Huntington Beach. Great views and you can see surfers. You are about a 5-10 min walk to main street where there are lots of shops, bars, etc.   PROS:  Rooms were decent size and bed was very comfortable. The room even had little motion sensor lights on the floor under the nightstand so that if you got out of bed in the middle of the night the light turned on when your feet hit the floor. I've never seen this before and thought it was pretty cool. The food was all good and the staff was all polite. Didn't have the opportunity to use the pool - it was kind of cool out- but I dipped my hand in and the temp was great - heated.    CONS Bathroom was a tad small- not a super huge deal - but

Good ocean views, Comfortable rooms although mine smelled a little musty and damp but cleared up when the A/C had run for a while. The staff went out of the way to accommodate requests - even went downtown to purchase a universal plug adaptor as the front desk didn't have one to lend. As in many similar US properties the bathrooms are a true disappointment, with shower-curtained midget sized tub squeezed into a tiny space - honestly motel-ish and a disincentive for me in future.

This hotel is spot on the water and in a fantanstic location if you want to be near the water.  If you have business in So Cal or in Orange county you need to remember that you are at least 10-15 minutes from the 405 so keep that in mind.  The hotel is also in walking distance to great shopping in restaurants beach side.

This is a full service Hilton across the street from the beach..most rooms have ocean views from the patios. The location is perfect for going anyplace in the Huntington Beach area. Rooms are well sized and the valet team, as well as the rest of the staff, is very pleasant and eager to help.   Very good restaurants nearby on the HB Pier  as well as the usual tourist shops.

We spent 7 nights here in Huntington Beach for a wedding, and had a great time. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed with coffee making machine and fridge. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: BEST family friendly hotel. Here's my tips...
Summary: Free guest laundry on first floor, just buy detergent for 75 cents. (one washer one dryer so best to do at night) Free kids sand buckets ask front desk or bell. Free evening room cleanup with chocolates and bottle of water. Free wifi for gold member. new updated workout equipment with TV in the front of each machine. Heated pool, this is actually working heated pool as mention, not like others that won't work. So nice and warm. Actaully warmest outdoor pool we ever been to, great for small kids. We stayed at front Oceanview double bed suites with balcony, amazing view! Both garden view or ocean view are great. But we got the best view with gold member upgrade There's short cut from pool area to beach, just cross the street and you are there. Great fresh food from shades

Summary Heading: All the basics plus a little extra...
Summary: The location is great, right off the beach , making it great for running, walking or meeting up with friends for a drink in town. Terrific young staff makes this place really fine for business or pleasure. They respond to every need quickly and with a smile. The restaurant has better food than most places in this class and is in a lovely setting. The coffee bar opens early and has whatever you need to fill in. The small gym is clean and has everything, but if you want to work out, go early because there is not a lot of equipment. The room was small and nicely laid out, but the bathroom could use an upgrade. (Be careful when you shower. The water leaks outside the curtain onto the marble floor and is a slip hazard. It can also flow into the closet, so be careful what you put on

Our trip was for my dad’s 60th birthday and doubled as a Veteran’s day celebration as well (as he is a Veteran Marine).    Our room was ready when we got there, even though we were early.  What impressed us the most was that they knew who we were and why we were vacationing.  This made us feel special and important.  It was also amazing to me that a manager, Annica, took care to make sure this happened for us, even though she was grieving for the loss of a close family member and could not be there to greet us.  I thought to myself, “WOW! That’s being focused on the customer."  We were so overwhelmed we bought her a thank you card while we were there and delivered it in person.  The hotel was beyond beautiful it was meticulously clean, and homey.  We really enjoyed the outdoor

We stayed here for 2 nights on short notice, and it was great.  We had a room on a high floor looking southwest.  The room was well appointed, with high ceilings, all the usual amenities, and a balcony.  The balcony might be a little small for a family, but for a couple, it's perfect -- we had drinks and snacks out there.  I went to Catalina for the day, but my wife used the beach and pool and enjoyed them both.  The beach is right across the PCH, but there are crosswalks and traffic lights, so it's easy.  There's also a footbridge next door at the Hyatt.  You can walk up PCH about 10 minutes to get to "downtown" Huntington Beach with tons of shops and restaurants.  We didn't try the restaurant, because we were going to a friend's house for dinner, but the menu looked good.

Summary Heading: Make sure to booked thru their website
Summary: I was suppose to win the $12 per nite room but I ending up getting the 50% off. I am cool with it, LOVE this place.   The restaurant also offer salmon fish. but most important when you check in request the 12th floor much better view from the top of the hotel. Breakfast is also great . Brunch can be a little expesive at 50 bucks a person. pool is very warm and the cleanniness of the proerty is lovely.

Summary Heading: Never fails to meet or exceed expectations
Summary: We just returned from a stay at this wonderful facility and as usual, it never disappoints. The staff is exceptionally courteous and helpful. We had a wonderful room on the 9th floor overlooking the Huntington Beach pier with sunset views each evening. Rooms are good size and have contemporary furnishings. The toiletry products are very nice- Phillip and Roth, and they even provide travel size after-sun aloe gel in case you get too much sun. The location is directly across PCH so you are on the beach in minutes. Nothing but raves from us on the wonderful Waterfront Hilton.

We had a very nice room on the 11th floor looking south toward Newport Beach. The view was great, the room clean and comfortable. Being a "resort" there was nowhere casual or inexpensive close by to dine. We did not have a car. Expect to pay. It is a nice Hilton, but we encountered a problem when we left. We had left our computer cord in the room and they kindly sent it to us in AK, Fed-EX (though we explained we did not need it quickly). Then to our surprise our credit card number was stolen and someone tried to spend over $9000 on an online purchase the same day our card was charged for the mailing.  We can't know for certain but no one else had our number and address - so do not give out your credit card info over the phone.

We spent a week from December 21 - 28 to spend the holidays with our son, who lives in Costa Mesa.  He advised us to stay on the beach and i am glad we took his advice.  We had an ocean front room on the 10th floor. ($349 a night + $26 parking per day + exhorbitant California taxes, lol!)  Beautiful view!  Rooms are not large.  I'd guess the building was constructed in the 1970s.  The bathroom has been updated with a more contemporary sink area.  The balcony was small, but nicely furnished with two chairs and a small table.  Rooms and common areas are kept immaculately clean.  The employees are well trained, friendly and very helpful.  Shades, the restaurant/bar operation has surprisingly good food.  My husband commented that the food was the best he has eaten in a hotel in

Came here for a two-day conference. The decor is casual but tasteful with an understated "beachy" or tropical theme. Service from the valet, to check-in, and every staff I came in contact with was friendly and attentive.  The beach is across the road, restaurants and shops an easy hike if the weather is fine and not too late at night. It was overcast and/or raining when I stayed there so not a lot of foot traffic. I imagine during summer or spring, it would be an enjoyable walk to the shops and restaurants. I heard they had a shuttle but I didn't use it during my stay.  I gave a 4 because the rooms were on the smaller side and the cost was a little steep, even in December (Hyatt next door was cheaper for the same nights, with bigger rooms but my conference was at the Hilton and

Reception staff very helpful and friendly. The furnishings of this Hilton Hotel are stunning. Our room was very comfortable with a balcony and excellent views of the Pool, Beach, Sea, Pier and Town. 5 minute walk to the beach. 25 minute walk along beach to the Pier and Main Street Huntington. Called Surf City and you can see why. Loads and loads of surfers are in the water from very early morning to late evening. The beaches are vast and very well covered by life guard huts. If you are a surfer this is the place to come and this is the hotel to stay in. Nice Pier to stroll on with nice 'Fonz' style Diner at the end. Try the Fish n Chips lovely.

After almost 3 weeks of long haul travel I had three nights in the OC to catch up with a friend so I wanted something with a little luxury and to relax. I have always loved Huntington Beach and the Hilton is in a fabulous spot so why not!  I spent a buit of time looking at various deal sites but there was very little to be had at the Hilton. This resulted in having to accept $400 a night for a corner suite which I thought was a little expensive.   Upon checking the valet guys and front desk were very friendly and helpful. I was a little disappointed that although they were obviously not full and I had a reasonably expensive room, they put me on level 2 with limited views and road noise.  The suite was fabulous in terms of size and layout, and although the Hotel is getting a

We used our Hilton points to stay at this hotel and it was fabulous. We were on the top floor overlooking the ocean. Our room was clean and included a light next to the bed that lit up when we  stepped down from the bed so that we could see in the night. We took the hotel shuttle to Main Street. We had some delicious oatmeal brought to our room in the morning which we ate on the balcony. The service was excellent and the employees were incredibly friendly. I would definately visit this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Will try the Hyatt next time
Summary: Not a bad hotel, good location 10 minute walk from Main Street. Booked a room on points, am HHonors Gold but no upgrade. Was given the wrong time for breakfast so missed it but the ladies at the cafe did their very best to try and accommodate with a coffee and pastry. Was charged for a rollaway after checked my statement so had to call to get this reversed. Think will try a different hotel for my next stay

Work weekend break in southern California. I'm a Hilton Diamond member and wanted to find a resort not far from my work location in Long Beach. The Hilton Waterfront in Huntington Beach had positive reviews so I made my reservation.   Having stayed at various Waldorf Astoria and Conrad hotels, the Oceanview Suite that I had the pleasure of staying in over the weekend is the nicest hotel room I've stayed in - ever. If it had a small kitchen - the hotel would have had to forcibly evict me. Large open space interior, wet bar area and a patio that wrapped around the outside of the room offering broad beach and ocean views.  The service upon check in was excellent. The restaurant service was attentive and competent. I would have liked to see more seafood options as opposed to the

Summary Heading: Clean, updated rooms, great service, beach right across street
Summary: Stayed here for 4 days on business that was for an event next door at the Hyatt. Room was clean, updated, bed was very comfortable, room was quiet. Service was great. Food was good at the gift shop grille area. Starbucks is there too. Beautiful lobby area. Pool area is pretty. I would stay here again.

I stayed here for one night on my way to San Diego. I loved the feel of the town. Hotel staff was great and friendly. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was great. Even thought temperature was in 60s outside pool water was nice and warm. We loved the fire pit and lobby. Beach was great. Lots of activities on board walk just across from the hotel. Parking is expensive  I would definitely come back here for a longer stay.

Summary Heading: Good property for a relaxing stay
Summary: I stayed at this property during a business event next door at the Hyatt Huntington Beach and found it to be very comfortable and a bit less "corporate" than a lot of the places I stay.  The rooms were up to date and lovely - I had a very nice balcony that looked out on the beach and the restaurant, while small, had a good menu and provided better than average service.  I stay in a lot of Hilton Hotels... this is a step up from most and, while it's not a Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton, it is a relaxing place to stay and very comfortable.  I would definately stay there again in the future.

Summary Heading: Perfect relaxation and service at the beach
Summary: For the end of another West Coast road trip, we chose the Hilton here again.  This was the RIGHT choice!  Lovely property, well maintained, super staff, perfect location.  We made use of beach chairs and boogie boards which were FOC, and really enjoyable.  Nice small pool area, close to the beach and a nice walk up to Huntington Beach 'town'.  Surf Hero shop/cafe is a new addition and super one at that - lovely sandwich and a cocktail.  Shades restaurant is perfect for breakfast and dinner - food and staff are both absolutely 1st class.  The local Hertz rental will collect your hire car from here I learned this time - useful.  Enjoyed the evenings sat round one of the large gas firepits.  The perfect place to relax, unwind and enjoy the sea.  For us Brits, the sea was plenty

Spent 4 nights here.  Room was small and clean but bathroom not quite as clean as I'd like it.  The service at Shades was terrible.  Had to ask for our wine again after 15+ minutes and flag someone down to order our food.  Bus person was attentive though.   The girls working at the Market were very friendly and highly recommend grabbing drinks, etc here.  Jack the concierge was fantastic!  Wish everyone was great as he was! While the valet staff were nice, didn't really like being forced to use valet at $26 per night. Wish they would include internet in the room cost or at least have complimentary wi-fi in the lobby area.

Spent two wonderful nights in the HB Hilton Waterfront Resort.  Had a great room on the 12th floor.  The room was fresh and updated and we had a great view of the beach & pier.   Resturant was good with live music in the evenings.

Stayed here for two nights on business.  They upgraded my room, so I stayed on the tenth floor with a nice view of the ocean.  The room was large, clean, and updated.  Location is just across from the beach and a short walk to shopping and restaurants.   Access to Pacific Highway is right in front which made travel to and from meetings a breeze.

Fabulous property with lovely pool area, restaurant, and gorgeous views of the Pacific Ocean from both our room and at the Shades Restauant. Extremely courteous staff, friendly, and very hospitable. Great food at the restaurant including both appetizers and main course.

This hotel is in a great location with great views. The service is great and people are friendly. The rooms are upgraded and comfortable as well. A great hotel for honeymoon or with family! They allow dogs as well. There is only one thing that could be improved. They need more servers for breakfast at Shades!

This is a nice hotel right at the beach. Not more or less than 3 stars. Biggest disadvantage - you pay for the beautiful view with an incredible noise level. The street in front of the hotel kills about 50% of the romantic sunset. When there are constructions going on in the hotel (incl. air hammers) - which were not announced on the website when booking and a new surface going in on the street than another 50% of your 50% left over romatnic is gone. But I guess that was just a bad time for me and my wife.  I read about the extremly friendly staff - absolutly right for the front desk! For most of the others (specially at breakfast) - I guess it was just a bad time! (irony!) I think for the value you get it is overpriced. Next time I would try to stay in the neighbourhood again

Summary Heading: The Best Hotel & Service I have ever had!
Summary: The hotel is so beautiful; of course it's a perfect location right across from the beach.  They hotel is pristine and always well maintained! They really do a number decorating during the holidays!  It truly feels like paradise!  The staff can't do enough for you.  I always feel like a VIP at this hotel.  The rooms are beautiful, always a great ocean view!  The property has wonderful amenities.   We live in Los Angeles, but frequent this hotel for staycation getaways!  Thanks to all the wonderful staff!  I have had events at this property too, and they make sure every detailed is handled perfectly!  Thanks so much to Karen Anthony for always making sure our events goes off without a hitch!  Hat’s off the the GM J.D. Shafer great leadership!

The rooms all have a view, as far as I can tell.  Enjoyed the spacious room and property amenities.  You are directly across the street from the beach, but I could see the beach from the bed as well.  I had a Sunrise room.  Sunset rooms may be even more spectacular.  I visited on business, and if you like to work from your room, you can't ask for a more relaxing view.

Beautiful hotel - rated a #7 by Hilton and it is very nice. Two things I would change are 1.) The bathrooms in the room has no fan so almst impossible to see in mirror after shower and 2.) They need a MUCH better hair dryer. Everything else was very nice. Restaurant was good, pool is lovely, people could not be nicer! It's in a great location as right across the street from ocean and Main Street and Pier are just a 10 minute walk. Had room service for breakfast one morning and it as right on time and delicious!!

I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights on business travel. It was fantastic! The service was the best I've had in a long time- everyone was so friendly and accommodating. Our dinner waiter remembered my drink from one night to the next. I had a problem with the shower head, a maintenance man materialized moments after calling the front desk.   I believe all the rooms have ocean views, and balconies. The traffic from the PCH is a little loud but if you stay on one of the higher floors it won't be much of an issue. At any rate, you don't hear the noise when the balcony door is closed.  The pool is salt water (nice!) and heated (also nice!).   Great hotel!!

Summary Heading: we can't wait to go back!
Summary: The smiling faces and helpfulness of the staff made our visit outstanding!  Everyone (especially the valet guys!!) was super friendly...  the property was well maintained and beautiful.  I wish they had 2 queen beds in their rooms - with a party of three the double beds were a disappointment. The walk to the beach was super easy and we enjoyed the surf and sand in the morning and the late afternoon. We've also stayed at the neighboring hotel but enjoyed the easier beach access at this hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort for 5 nights during our honeymoon. There were a number of issues that arose throughout our stay but the staff at the hotel were quick to deal with all of them. They went above and beyond with their customer service. I have to admit one of the main reasons I chose to stay at this hotel was because I had seen the hotel manager had responded to reviews on trip advisor. I thought if they have the time to do that then the hotel must be good and they didn't disappoint. The only reson I have not given it 5* is because the valet parking is pretty steep at $26 a night with no option to park your own car and the internet is charged at $13 a day. Other than that we had a great stay and Shades restaurant was very nice and I would

What a treasure!  This hotel is the one for you if you love to be pampered, enjoy numerous emenities, and love the beach.  This hotel is located right across the street from the beach.  The hotel restuarant is excellent! Room service was prompt and delicious.  The pool was like a tropical oasis, with draped beds outside for you to enjoy.  The staff was helpful and nice.  The rooms are decorated very nice and beds are comfortable.  The price is a little high but you definately get what you pay for.  High end toiletries in the bathroom, don't drink the bottled water unless you wont to pay $6.95.  There is a Starbuck less then a mile away.  Great location to restaurants and beach activities.  I highly recommend this hotel and will definately go back.

Summary Heading: A Great Getaway at Surf City
Summary: Excellent, the service was wonderful, friendly and professional. Shades Restaurant was very enjoyable on the first night of arrival, good food, service and ambiance was lovely- to sit outside, enjoy the ocean breeze,  fire pit and  look over the pool to the Pacific. Room service was good, the hotel is spotless, a total success!

just returned from a 10 day stay at this hotel. It was my second trip there in three months. My first trip was in May/June. I had such an enjoyable time, I stayed for three weeks. Everything in this hotel is excellent:  the rooms are nicely appointed as well as much larger and quieter than any other hotel that I have ever been at; the location could not be any better, it’s right across from the beach and less than a mile from town; activities galore. If an evening beach fire with smores, hotdogs and champagne appeals to you, the hotel has all of the supplies necessary for your romantic evening.  Lastly, but most importantly, the service at this hotel is superb. Each and every staff member goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome and enjoy your time with them. You will be

we enjoyed four nights at this hotel and it was even nicer not to have paid for it due to points on my american express card!! Its right across the street from the beach in huntingdon beach calif home of the surfers!! We dined for breakfast a few mornings in the shades restaurant there at the hotel and the food is quite good. Very clean, the pool area is average size with bar and food service available. My only disappoint came from the fact they only have valet parking at 26.00 a day!! I find that quite high esp that you have to tip the valet driver. Felt really great being in such a lovely place the exterior is sharp looking I would go back.

I actually just got back from this place yesterday and couldnt wait to do a review on it. I went with 2 other girls for a friend trip. From the moment you get there everything is pretty much just handed to you. We were there an hour before check in and it wasnt even a problem, they looked up a room that was ready and put us in it. Most hotels I go to make you wait. When I got in the room I noticed we would need more towels, no sooner did I hang up the phone requesting them,someone was at my door with them. This seemed to be the trend when I called for an extra bath robe and pair of slippers,also when it was time to take our luggage downstairs.     Our room had an amazing ocean view along with a view of the pool. We all sat by pool drinking bloody mary's and it was the best

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel steps from the beach
Summary: Lovely hotel located in a great spot; it's an easy walk accross the street to the beach.  Rooms are nicely appointed and spotlessly clean, with great amenities. I really liked the hardwood floors too; very clean and neat. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Parking prices are a little steep, and the restaurant service was friendly but a little "off"... my dining companion and I wanted to split some dishes, and they just brought extra plates that were awkwardly sized, they brought the wrong wine ( and charged us for more expensive) and forgot to add our discount coupon even though we pointed it out. Other than that, great experience. I'd defiintely come again.

Not much to say other than this is a great hotel.   Well maybe a bit more.   Great beds, great linens, excellent service. Killer views of the Pacific. Excellent service, I know I said that before, but really, they have excellent service.  The rooms are nicely decorated, although our room did have some dust on the flat surfaces that should have been addressed. Ammenities are great, hotel staff goes the extra mile to make sure that you are comfortable and feel like you are valued.  Only problems I had were.
