Saturday night, valet parking was swamped from a wedding, we were late for our dinner reservation due to this, waited 20 plus minutes for our car.  The other problem was small, housekeeping didn't replace the door hanger room service menu for morning breakfast.  Also, be aware

Summary Heading: Excellent Customer Service and Beautiful Views
Summary: My wife and I recently stayed at this amazing hotel the night of our wedding.  From the moment we arrived, the valet and bellstaff were very welcoming and friendly.  The check-in process was swift and we were able to enjoy the amazing view of the Pacific Ocean within minutes.  After mentioning we just arrived from our wedding, the entire staff congratulated us and made us feel so special.  Room service even arrived later that evening to provide us with a few extra treats!  Breakfast the next morning was so relaxing at the Shades Restaurant.  The wait staff was courteous and genuine.   Do yourself a favor and experience the Waterfront Resort.  You will not regret it.

Very nice resort-type hotel.  Across the street from Huntington Beach State Park, so beach access is easy and the beach  is huge.  Has a large pool and poolside area, so one need not venture off the property.  Has pool-side wait service, so one need not move once at the pool.    Has a well equipped fitness center.  Rooms are extraordinarily nice and have refrigerator and safe.   Restaurant has a very good buffet and dinner was outstanding; menu features some uncommon items.    Has a small business center, with somewhat slow internet.   There is a charge for computer and printer use (why is this usually free at mid-level, lower cost brands, but not so a Hiltons?).  Parking is valet only; expensive, but cars are retrieved very quickly.  Staff are very attentive.   Adjacent only to

This is a hotel that screams customer service. Other hotels could and should take lessons. All the way from check in to check out. Extra kudos to the valet guys they gave excellent service went above and beyond.. This property is being managed very well.Thanks again..

Summary Heading: Hilton Waterfront Hotel, Huntingdon Beach, CA
Summary: My partner and I have just returned from our first ever trip to the US and the first 3 nights were spent here at the Hilton Waterfront Hotel.  It was an amazing hotel, very clean, huge and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  We had a lovely side view of the beach from our hotel balcony, it was just a pity we couldn't have stayed longer.

I give it five stars for location, customer service, room decor and friendliness.  We only stayed one night to attend a wedding but we plan to return for a longer stay.  We were able to check in early at 10:30 and had time to enjoy the pool, bar and restaurant prior to the 5:00 p.m. wedding.  My son had the Sunset suite on the 10th floor and it was huge with great views.  There was enough room to gather several family members for pre-wedding snacks and beverages.

We were surprised with an upgrade to the Twin Dolphins Suite (#1205) when we arrived. The views from this room are spectacular - it has three balconies, all facing a long stretch of beach. The sleeping part of the room is very good - very comfy bed with luxe sheets. The nightstands have motion sensitive lights underneath that help light the way for midnight trips to the bathroom. The bathroom is fine, but not really anything special. The bath towels and products are good quality. They thoughtfully included some aloe for after sun soothing!  A true suite, there is also a living room area. This room has two sectionals, 4 chairs, several occasional tables, and a giant tv. There is also a high dining table with stools, plenty of bar/counter space with a bar sink. There are a variety

Summary Heading: Great location and vacation with the kids
Summary: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights last month as part of a trip covering the OC to San Francisco.  I picked the location as we were looking for a couple of days to enjoy the beach and southern CA.  We loved the hotel and the service was great.  The room was adequate and the bed very comfortable.  We had the sunset view balcony that overlooked the pool and the pier beyond.  We barely used the car expect to attend an A's game in Anaheim.  We walked to dinner each night and loved the sunsets outside our balcony or while on the beach.  The pool area was wonderful and the kids really enjoyed themselves.  Being able to sign out towels, boogie boards, skim boards was a real perk and gave the kids tons to do on the beach.  Another perk was the free laundry which was a welcome after a

Stayed during labor day weekend with my son and younger brother and this hotel is wonderful! the views from the rooms are spectacular and since its the only structure that is 12 stories high, you get to see so much more than any other properties around Huntington Beach!! The food at the restaurant was great and the best part of this hotel is that they provide towels, beach chairs, umbrellas, sand toys, balls, anything you can thing of to bring to the beach... the hotel provides it all at no charge at all!!! Makes your stay at the beach such a joy.  Will come back again and again

Summary Heading: Beautiful beachfront hotel that allows dogs up to 75 pounds.
Summary: We had read previous reviews about Hilton or the Hyatt here in huntington beach, and Hilton won. The people here are so accommodating and just plain nice. The view from our room was awesome. Make sure you try to get a room 10 or above for the best views. The best part you can bring your dog, they even have dog walkers and sitters!

We just got back and all I can say is, "wow"!! We had purchased a package @ a silent auction . It was a two night stay in the presidential suite plus a joining room.   The service was a 10!!!! We had such an amazing stay cation !!! S'mores on the beach dinner @ their restaurant by the pool, pool cabana and Dukes Dinner, and a Fab beach day.  They have everything for you. Beach toys, bikes, beach towels, beach chairs. They even allow dogs to stay!!!  We will for sure go back!!!!

My family came to the hotel for a weekend getaway. Nice rooms but very small pool area and not enought space to sit and relax.. People are putting towels by chairs very early Across the street from the beach.

I was looking for a quick beach getaway where I could be a little pampered and totally relax, and found it in the Waterfront Beach Resort.  I called the concierge on the way down and he arranged an afternoon at the spa on Main Street, and even drove me himself. The service was exceptional from everyone I came into contact with. The room was beautiful with a sunset view of the ocean and super comfy beds. Staff was great about making arrangements for whatever I needed - bike rental, extra towels, ride to downtown, etc...the restaurant was even yummy! Parking the car was pricey, but then didn't need it the whole time. It really was such an enjoyable few days! The last minute price was pretty high, but would have been lower had I booked more in advance. Traveled alone and was

Summary Heading: Wonderful location to enjoy Huntington beach
Summary: Although there had been mixed reviews on this hotel we could not find a fault. It's location across from gorgeous Huntington beach was excellent. We would stay a gain for sure. Very friendly waitress night we arrived despite being late and almost at closing for kitchen she sorted out something for us to eat and made us feel very welcome. She should be on reception as the girl that evening was not overly friendly.

Granted it took me 16 years to review it, the place is pretty cool.  HB is pretty easy to like so a 5 star hotel in top surf spot is even easier to judge.  The best place to actually enjoy the city is not by staying in it but if you are getting married somewhere by the ocean, I suggest this one...

Everything at this hotel is excellent: staff, rooms, location, amenities, activities, food, and anything else you can imagine!  If you're looking to stay in Huntington Beach and want a resort, DO NOT hesitate and reserve at the Waterfront Beach Resort.  This is seriously one of the best Hilton I've stayed in, comparable to the Hilton Bentley in South Beach.  I have no negative comment to say about the hotel, maybe the $45 lunch for 2 sandwiches and 1 grilled-cheese, but hey... you are in a Hilton facing the Pacific Ocean!  They have activities all week at the pool to entertain adults and kids (DJ, band, hairbrush, caricatures, etc.), plus they provide you with beach chairs and beach toys for your children.  What else can you  ask for???  Nothing...

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel - Great Location for Business Meetings, San Business Feel
Summary: Our company held one of our large sales meetings here.  It is a very prime location in Huntington Beach, and is walking distance to downtown Huntington Beach for dinners and after-hours nightlife.  Reasonably priced, compared to the Huntington Hyatt next door, and not as family-oriented in the spring (which is good for business people.)  Right across the street from the beach, the only downside is if you don't get the room view facing downtown HB, then you have the view of a big dirt lot that was a hotel that halted construction as well (borders the hotel.)  Meeting spaces are ample and distanced well from the regular hotel guests, but the hotel isn't so big you'd get lost in it.  Has a clean, quiet gym next to the pool.

Summary Heading: too much money for poor accommodations
Summary: 24 dollar pro night for the car : not in Europe so far. Breakfast can't reach by far the one of the Hyatt hotel nearby. This buffet is divided in two : cold or warm, and poor choice (melon had no taste and was still ice-cold from the refrigerator). We made a tour and visited 6 hotels, the queen-beds in the Hilton were the smallest of all and we did not sleep well.  One positive thing : the staff was very friendly and helpfull and the pool was very nice and clean as well.

Stayed for 2 nights.  We previously stayed at Hyatt.  And, I must say the Hyatt is nicer(with larger rooms, more dining options, pools) however this is a perfectly nice hotel option for less money.  The staff is great, they try to keep it lively by the pool with entertainment/happy hour, with acitivites for kids(spray tattoos, characatures, etc)  It is a great location, and they have a free shuttle to the town(hourly), although it is easily walkable.  They provide free beach towels/chairs/toys from the pool and you walk right across the street.  Very easy and really cant say a bad thing except the double rooms are on the small side and the beds are fulls- not queens.

I live in Southern California and was invited for an overnight get away to this hotel. What an incredible beach resort!!!! We loved it!!!!     They upgraded our room to an ocean view without requesting. The pool area with dining has a beautiful view of the Pacific. Our room was clean and very modern in design. The bed was extremely comfortable. We ate in the cafe for breakfast and lunch. The service and food met our expectations.The beach is right across the street with lots of dining options. They will even set up a picnic wagon to take over. How cool is that!!! Thanks Hilton for a fun girls night out!!!!!

When I arrived at the hotel, the valet was very helpful. In fact, the valets were some of the best I have seen. I told the valet that I was going to check in & leave because I needed to pick someone up at the airport. He quickly unloaded my bags & parked my car off to the side so that it would be quickly available.  The front desk staff were just as efficient & friendly. Check-in was easy & without hassles. Our room was clean & well appointed. It had a small refrigerator which I always like. Ice and complimentary water were both waiting for us in the room. It was a very busy weekend as the US Open Surfing championships were in town. So, the hotel was crowded and a little noisy. There was a band and outdoor party we could see and hear from our room. But the music died down by

Just returned from our week long vacation at the Hilton Waterfront and to sum it up in two words, Totally Awesome!  Everything from the valet personnel to the pool wait staff,  nothing but spot on!  When we arrived we had no idea that it was during the US open of surfing literally taking place right out back which I'm sure was unreal pressure and stress for the staff to have to deal with but on the contrary, we were treated like royalty!  We traveled with our 7 year old son who had the time of his life! All of the servers whether in the Shades restaurant or out by the pool made sure that he was having fun!  The hotel is great, location perfect, staff is well trained and professional. We will without a doubt be returning to the Hilton  Waterfront.  As a H. Honors Diamond member I

Beautiful property directly across the street from miles of soft Southern California sand.  Withiin walking distance of shops, restaurants and nightlife.  Fun for families, couples, or singles.  The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating in every way possible.  Beautiful pool area with pool side drink and food service.  You never have to leave your lounge chair.  But do yourself a favor and walk across to the beach for sunset.  Simply spectacular!

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort
Summary: My wife and I and our 2 kids just completed a stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach. We had stayed previously at the Hyatt next door and decided to give the Hilton a try and were very glad we did. We were celebrating a special occasion and the staff (especially Scott) went out of their way to make our stay special. The room was fantastic and the Beach was just across the street. The Shades Restaurant, Pool and gym were great. I stay at a lot of Hilton properties and this one was memorable on many fronts. Complimentary shuttle to main street is a nice touch as well, Phil took great care of us and our kids.

First off, request for a room at the higher levels . The view from the top is always awesome. They have a great restaurant but there's more options in Main Street which is about 3 blocks away. The staff in Hilton are just over the top friendly. The rooms are clean, I think each room has a patio with a view of the ocean and PCH, i really just love everything about this hotel so there, you want to stay here really rather than the one next to it;)

Being right across the street from the beach and being just 2 blocks south of Main Street, the location could not be better. The room on the 5th floor provides stunning views, was quite nice and appointed, and was maintained with evening turn down service giving chocolates, water, and new towels. The pool was heated, the jacuzzi was very hot, and food/beverage service at the pool was great. Order the tortilla chips with the salsa and guacamole, which was the freshest we ever tasted. In fact, I totally spilled my drink 2 times, and the waiter replaced it twice at no charge. Great service!

Spent 5 nights here.A beautiful hotel.Everyone was so nice and very helpful.The free laundry was amazing. only had to buy detergent.The only negative would be they only have one washer and one dryer. It was so nice to be able to go home with clean clothes. The valet was very prompt. If you get a chance go to Ruby's restaurant on the pier. Just a short walk from the hotel. Our daughter fell and bumped her head.Security was prompt and she just happened to be a nurse too.

Spent two nights here for the second time and loved it!!!  They really take great care of the property and all the staff are very attentive!  I was able to check an item off my bucket list: beach bonfire with smores!  For around $15 per person, they load a wagon with wood, blankets, ingredients for smores and hot chocolate!!!  A wonderful thing to do in HB since they have the most fire pits in OC.  The sunset was amazing as we roasted our marsh mellows and spent time with good friends!  A must do!  Breakfast was great, it is close to Main St and the Pier.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in HB
Summary: We love the Hilton in Huntington Beach.  This was our second time staying here, and both visits were enjoyable.  The pool was never crowded, and always warm.  They have drink specials every day at the pool.  The $6 Mojitos on Fridays were good.  It's about a half mile to the pier, but it's an easy walk.  The hotel had a 20 minute Hawaiian fire show by the pool on Friday night at 7pm.  It wasn't well advertized, and we stumbled upon it by mistake - pretty cool.  The valet parking is a little pricey ($24/day, I think), but the car always arrived quickly and easily.  As Gold VIPs our room was upgraded to an oceanfron room and free breakfast at Shades restaurant daily.  We used points to stay here.

Stayed for 3 nights, could of stayed more.  Across from georgous Huntington Beach, walkable to Main Street and the pier.  Large, clean rooms.   Ate breakfast buffet and late night snacks, very attentive staff.  Pool area was great, DJ on Saturday by the pool, free chairs, cooler  and sand toys from the pool hut to take to the beach!  Great time!

This hotel is situated across from the ocean, in the morning you can wake up and see the waves crashing in, dophins swimming and surfers trying to catch a wave. We enjoyed our stay at this luxery hotel, the decor in our sunset room was nice and update, the only thing we would of liked to have had was a microwave, but it did have a fridge to keep your drinks cold. The bed was as soft as a cloud and the room was a nice size. the bathroom tub was old, which was shocking because everything else, including the toilet was new. Our sleeps were very quiet except for our last night, when there were people with dogs next to us, that barked and barked, and the people thought by leaving there tv blasting would cover it up :( I think that the adjoining room doors need to be made more sound

We had my daughters wedding reception in the Cielo Mare room. Fabulous ocean views, great food.  Everyone said it was the best food they ever had at a wedding (filet mignon and halibut).  Everything was done perfectly!  Staff was very attentive and professional.  We stayed at the hotel 2 nights and had a room with an ocean view.  The room was good size and modern.  Finally a refrigerator that was empty and you could actually put in your own food and drinks.  Most hotels these days fill the refrigerators with their own expensive amenities for purchase.  Would definitely stay here again!

Great location - walk to the beach and attractions. Beautiful rooms - spacious, clean, lovely bathrooms, great view of the ocean. Beautiful pool overlooking the Pacific and nice outdoor dining onsite. Only downside, we could hear neighbors in the hall occassionally and I should have chosen a hotel with a more mellow atmosphere for relaxation; but, they are very dog-friendly and I brought my little dog and she had a great time = they treat your pets fantastically! This hotel is better suited for younger travelers or families rather than relaxation I feel. I was looking for more of a spa retreat. However, the location was fantastic, it was very clean, and the restaurant was great! Fantastic pool area!

Summary Heading: If you're younger than 35 and still like to have fun find another hotel
Summary: We traveled with a party of 20 people for a 3 night 4 day getaway and found the Hilton to be much more conservative then prior visits.  The evening security staff was borderline STALKING guests within our party. I had the privilege of walking down the hall to see a security guard at 10:30pm standing in front of one of our group members room.  When addressed he shared he heard "rattling."  He hurried on his way down the hall looking back multiple times with a very suspicious look.  During our evening activites such as hanging around a fire and enjoying wine outside of the bar the security guard must have passed by a minimum of 5 time in a span of 60 minutes.  Beaches are a destination to visit with the intent to have fun.  If you are younger than 35 and still like to have fun I'd

We stayed here since we always stay at Hilton's across the country and they usually are incredible. I was very disappointed by the accommodations for the price. I couldn't sleep well because the "queen" beds are really an oversized twin bed. In fact, my son's roll away bed was just a few inches smaller. The beds were very uncomfortable and then I get woken up early by someone being VERY loud in room upstairs not to mention the noise out in hall. We were with children but it didn't stop the drunks from hitting on me in the elevator! Not many classy people around here after 9pm and very loud! I'm very upset by this Hilton and I wouldn't feel comfortable recommending this to anyone especially for 400.00+ a night and you have to pay for valet! Location is nice but not worth it! We

The accomodations and staff at the Hilton Waterfront are exceptional. We stayed in a sunset/pier view room with awesome views of Main Street, the pier and the ocean. Defintiley worth a bit extra to experience the view everytime going onto the balcony. The Surf Hero market is a great place for coffee and lunch/drinks by the pool. Bell, valet and front desk staff very helpful.

Stayed two nights with my girlfriend.  Very good service and friendly staff. Had a nice view of the beach -- the only downside of that was that we were right across from the starting line of the Ragnar So-Cal Relay Race from Huntington Beach.  Not the hotel's fault, but the teams started at 5:00 am, with an announcer on a loudspeaker, lots of honking & cheering, etc...  Might have asked for a different room if we had known what was coming.

We have just returned from a week at the Waterfront Beach Resort Hilton in Huntington Beach CA.  The location is great, the facilities the pool etc are first rate, the pool staff were always friendly and ready to assist you with your requests, whether you were staying by the pool or going to the beach. The valet guys were amazing and a credit to the hotel, they were so helpful, polite and informative, they made it a pleasure to return each day, they are the best set of valet guys I have ever come across on my travels, they go the extra mile for you every day, and with good humour and always a smile. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful, the Shades restaurant must have the best chefs around as the food was always excellent. Restaurant staff were excellent, attentive but
Manager Response: Dear ana c.,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay with us here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. In all my time at the resort I don't think kinder words have ever been said to or about our valets. These guys really do try to keep it all together for us (while wearing our their sprinting shoes all the time!). They are your first impression upon arrival and often the last you see here at the resort...and that can make all the difference in world.  As for the rest of our staff (poolside especially), they are a constant source of pride for us all. With summer season in "full bloom", this is an area that can really make or break a stay with us. I am so proud our team did not disappoint you...and I will be sure to share this with all of them as well.  It would seem to me however, based on the last few reviews, we may need some "polishing up" (as it were) with our housekeeping duties. I'm not one to make excuses so suffice it to say that your words have not fallen on deaf ears and the appropriate actions will be taken to make the necessary corrections with our staff and proceedures. It was very helpful to let me know the exact room you were in as well, so thank you for that.  If and when you decide to return to Surf City USA, I certainly hope you decide to stay with us again. It would be a pleasure to have you as our guest.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Loved this hotel! Great place to stay. Would definitely go back!
Summary: This hotel is great! The staff were so friendly and eager to help. Our room was big with a wonderful view of the ocean and pier. The beach was just across the road. The hotel assist guests by lending towels, chairs, sun umbrellas free of charge! The restaurant provided a good choice for breakfast which was good quality. The pool area was nice with plenty poolside beds available. There is also a separate shop/ bar for snacks, amenities etc. and an unusual feature of external hot coal ( gas) fires which you can gather round in cooler weather. The air conditioning in the room is surprisingly quiet, and keeps the room at the temperature which you set. My review is shorter than normal because I don't really have many negative comments.  I was not too happy about the forced valet
Manager Response: Dear Simon P.,   Thank you for your post regarding your recent stay with us here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. We are so pleased you chose us for your stay and the staff will be thrilled by your kind words. We really do a substantial amount of training to achieve the levels of service you expect and enjoy while here in Huntington Beach.  As you can well imagine, parking is always an issue in Southern California (and even more challenging on our coastal beaches). Our only way to provide safe and secure parking for all of our guests is to have a "valet only" service. Hopefully the lack of any kind of resort fee (or any other hidden hotel charges) more than made up for your parking. To those considering staying with us in the future, I would like to recommend taking a shuttle to and from the airport thus eliminating the need for a car.. We have a house car at your disposal to take you around the area...and if you truly need a car for a day to yourself, the concierge can arrange for door-to-door drop offs right here at the resort.  I have also shared your concerns with our director of housekeeping regarding the care of your guest bathroom. I will personally follow up with her and make certain this is not an area of concern for us. The last thing I want is you to be dissatisfied with us in any way.  Again, many thanks for staying with us and please come back soon!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort from 9th - 15th June this year and I cannot think of one thing that I would change! The location is lovely, sure it is a little walk from the centre but walk along the board walk and you'll still have no complaints! The bed was super comfortable as soon as my head hit the pillow I was fast asleep! Great beach location, my favourite place on earth. We had a room with a view of the pool area and the beach - amazing! Even the toiletries supplied in the bathroom were lovely! I took my spares home to England!! Also the girl on the front check in desk on the day we arrived was fantastic, so helpful and friendly :) as were the security staff letting me back in to the room after we had checked out because I had left my
Manager Response: Dear katedil,  Thank you so much for taking the time to let all of us know about your stay here in Surf City USA (Huntington Beach). We here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel, strive to provide coninuous five diamond service to you...so it really makes my day when I see that we are doing just that for all of our guests.   During the summer peak season we can really be challenged when the hotel is running at 100% occupancy everyday, but this is where we can really shine too. There is nothing more fullfilling for our associates than caring for you, our most valued guests.  I trust your long journey home was swift and safe...and just in time for the Olympics to hit London. We'll be watching the games from afar and thinking of you...and the beach will be ready for your return when you're ready.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: One of THE best hotels to stay at!  Location was great, close to bars and restaurants but not too close.  Great access to the beach and they lend out beach towels, chairs, boogie boards, umbrellas, etc.  This was the first stop on our week long trip to Cali, and our last (we changed the last night front Santa Monica to here).  Staff was super friendly and helpful.  I already miss my Chips, Guac and Salsa poolside with my Mojito from the Surf Hero.  Can't wait to find an excuse to go back!
Manager Response: Okay DessertsByDebbie, print this out and give it a try:  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Dear DessertsByDebbie's "boss",  Please allow this letter to serve as an excused absence for at least four days of her chosing. She needs emergency sunshine; poolside chips, guac and salsa; and Mojitos "stat". It is the opinion of the staff here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel, that her return be expedited as we already miss her and need to see her as soon as possible! Our entire team is having a hard time not having her here with us at the resort. Even the dolphins keep popping up in front of the hotel looking for her.  Please help us bring her back!  If you have any questions concerning the authenticity of this note or its contents, please contact me directly. I am at your service.  Sincerely,   Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Great hotel - lots of unadvertised extras!
Summary: We stayed here at the end of our 12 day LA area college tour.  It was the perfect place to relax and have a real California beach experience.  As others have mentioned, the property is beautiful, well maintained and across the street from the beach.  The rooms are modern, spacious and comfortable, and ours had a wonderful view of the beach and the pool area.  However, the best part for us was discovering all the extras that we were not aware of when making our reservation.  The drink specials each day at the pool (printed on the boogie boards and beach balls around the pool), free beach chairs and umbrellas to take to the beach, the free caricature artist at the pool one afternoon and the Mankota show at sunset  all added to our wonderful experience at this lovely hotel.  We ate
Manager Response: Dear jogom,  We are so pleased you were able to enjoy the many extras we put out there for our guests to enjoy here at The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel (and still with no resort fee, I might add). I'm especially happy that you were able to see our Mankota Fire Show which only happens on the weekends (words to the wise; book a stay that includes a Friday or a Saturday during the summer and you are set for the adventure!). As you know, the Legend of the Surf Hero (Mankota) tells the story of what gives Huntington Beach our perfectly shaped waves...and brings the worlds most accomplished surfers to our shores year after year. Then again, it could have been those drink specials too!  I do have an instant solution to your only negative experience (of leaving all too soon)... COME BACK! We'll be here with towels, beach chairs, cocktails...and Mankota.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: I have visited Southern California many times, but I had never spent a night in Huntington Beach until 2011 when I spent a night at the Hilton Waterfront. The only problem was that I only spent one night - so this year I spent two nights. Again, it was just too short.  The Hilton has been there for some years, but everything looks just like new. Housekeeping does a great job, and the staff is just wonderful and is extremely helpful about anything and everything.  The rooms are bright and cheerful, views are generally great, and the beds and furniture are quite comfortable. The restaurant is good, and prices are about what you expect for the area.  I am a Hilton Diamond member for some years, and I have been very happy with the rooms that I have been assigned at the Hilton
Manager Response: Dear davidfhale,  From Madison, Alabama to the Pacific shores of Huntington Beach, California is roughly seven hours of drive/air travel (with a connection...I looked it up!)... and so my thanks starts right there; for taking the time and energy to make the journey to,The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. And now you have discovered one of the best kept secrets in the world... Huntington Beach, California!  We truly value the opions of all of our customers (and most especially our loyal Hilton Honors members such as yourself). You pretty much nailed it all into place for me, so I don't need to repeat it... just our sincere gratitude and thanks all the way around.  Two things to consider for your return to us: First, stay at least four days so we can really spoil you; second... you've got to let me set up a beach bonfire for you! That is the ultimate Waterfront experience and if the diet allows (and c'mon, you're on vacation and deserve it) S'Mores are a must. Our chef even makes handcrafted marshmellows right here in-house... to die for!  We're ready when you are, so come on back... your complimentary sunset awaits.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: For anyone looking for a little R and R, I highly recommend staying at this resort. I travel often so staying in hotels is not always restful and relaxing for me. This place beats all of the hotels that I've stayed at; including several in the Newport Beach and Laguna areas. This place did so many things right, where do I begin. First of all, the staff, all of them, are superb. From the reservation desk to the housekeeping staff and valet parking, I was impressed with how friendly and accommodating they were. Everyone I met or passed in the hall greeted me with a smile and friendly hello, which to me, is a sign of excellent management. As they say, it starts at the top... This is a large group of people that appear to love their jobs and are happy to come to work, Kudos to the
Manager Response: Dear Bluelight2104,  Thank you so much for your recent post and also for chosing to stay with us at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. Our staff was so delighted to be part of your "R & R" getaway...and all of us look forward to your return (with your dog too!).  Here at The Waterfront we do take a lot of pride and ownership in everything we have to offer. Every staff member is highly trained and knows that they are empowered to make the right call for any of our guests. Our GM, Mr. JD Schafer, likes to say "you don't work for me, you work with me...we are all in this together. One team, One Dream!". We hear it everyday from him and it feels good knowing that philosphy is not just some catchy phrase on a pocket card. It is real and very satisfying to hear that you noticed!   Thank you for the kind words. I will be sharing them with all 300 of our employees!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: We live in the OC but decided to have a family get together by the beach.  The hotel is very nice, but not extravagant.  Rooms were comfortable and the pool was lovely.  The hotel hosted live music and Tahitian dancers during our visit, and had tattoo artists, ballon animals and live bunnies for the kids.  The bath sheets provided in rooms instead of bath towels were awesome.  There is a small shop by the pool with very limited offerings so I would suggest you not forget anything on your trip.  I was looking for swimming goggles with no luck.  They did not have swimsuits either.  You can find clothing down on Main Street and there is a shuttle that leaves on the hour to take you there but when you are at the pool already the last thing you want to do is pack up and leave the
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer W.,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. While much of what you wrote made me happy, I can see that we might have a few adjustments to make. As they say, "close is not enough!". And the goggles... oh my goodness, you are so right! That left a mark on my forehead and I have shared your request with our Hotel Manager to see if we can get some ordered for The Surf Hero Market.  I do apologize for the delay in the answering any of your calls for assistance regarding your TV remote. This not something that should have ever happened and I am reviewing our standards of operation with all of the appropriate managers throughout the hotel. You have given us a chance to improve on our service and it shall not be wasted.  Please let me know when you are coming to stay with us again. We would love another chance to really  make your stay picture perfect... and I think I have a few brand new bath sheets laying around and I would very much like you to have one of your own.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Location, On the Beach
Summary: This hotel is located less than one mile from the "strip", which is downtown Huntington Beach including the pier.  And it is across the street from the beach.  There are no obstructions so the rooms truly have a ocean/beach view.  You can be on the sand in less than one minute from the hotel lobby.  This hotel is a bit expensive but that is probably because of its great location and up to date ammenities and rooms.  Everything was very clean and modern looking.  The rooms have updated TVs, wi-fi, balconies, and refrigerators.  The last item was especially helpful since we traveled with our 20 month old baby.  They had pack n plays also available for no extra charge.  The in-hotel dining was great.  Again, it was slightly overpriced, but the quality was top notch.  I don't think
Manager Response: Dear Tony B,  Thank you for staying with us here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. As has been said so many times before, its all about "location, location, location!". We do everything we can to not only provide the best staff, service and outstanding ammenities, but also strive to make a visit with us affordable for a range of budgets.   If price is ever a concern keep this in mind: in Huntington Beach our summers last thru the end of October (and sometimes right up to Thanksgiving...try roasting a turkey in 85 degree weather just once and you feel like tossing the whole thing and pullin' out the BBQ!). Come outside of peak summer season (Memorial Day thru Labor Day) for the best values, packages and wide open beaches. You'll really feel like a true local and give up none of the pleasures due a valued guest such as yourself.  We look forward to seeing the three of you agin very soon!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary Heading: Family trip for the week...to the beach!
Summary: We're realistic about beach properties that they are about access first and then there's the rest.  Though reviews comment about not beachfront, there's NO beachfront in Huntington Beach at all.  You have to go up to Santa Monica for the select few true beachfront properties.  Even then, it's a hike to the ocean since Santa Monica's beach is quite deep.  As with an alarming trend in LA, the forced Valet is a bit over the top and considering the ample parking compared to Santa Monica, it's a bit silly to charge for this here.  No Club :(  That said, that's about it for the negatives.   This is a 20+ year old property that has been nicely maintained.  We received Diamond upgrade to the corner suite and the standard 2 continental breakfast coupons.  Nice bonus is that it can be
Manager Response: Dear Stevenli9999,  Thank you so much for your recent stay here at The Waterfront Hilton Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel. I am so glad that we were able to exceed so many of your expectations during your beachside stay. You are absolutely correct and it is true that we fiercely protect our wide and open beaches here in Huntington Beach and thus, with one grandfathered experiment with a two story condo complex, we allow no buildings, hotels or homes on the beach! As a lifetime local I can tell you that nothing makes me prouder, especially when I get to hear the gasps and see the wonderful expressions on our guests faces once they see the continuous and uninterrupted sand and seascapes unique to our city.  As for our staff and service, I'll be sure to share your kind words with them all (including our Mankota Show dancers celebrating the life and sacrifice of the greatest surfer who ever lived!).  You are correct in identifying one of our most diligent goals, that being the continuous and ongoing upgrades and improvements. We never stop! (And to that end, I'll thank our tireless engineers for you as well).  With regards to parking, this has always been a challenge at the beach...any beach. And since we allow our employees access to our one and only lot for parking, this leaves us no choice but to offer safe, secure and covered underground valet parking. With all day, 24 hour valet, you may come and go as wish as many times as you may need. Meeting staffing requirements so that you have you car when you want it is very important to us, thus valet is our only option. I’m glad you found that the nominal fee was more than made up for in all of the other areas of the resort (and, unlike many other hotels, you are correct again... we do not charge a resort fee or have any hidden charges whatsoever).  On behalf of our entire staff (and in the spirit of Mankota)... Thank you and come back soon!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon

Summary: My husband and I stayed here in June 2011 on the tail end of our honeymoon after being in French Polynesia for 10 days.  We had a lovely time!  The property is beautiful and in a great location! You can walk to many shops and restaurants and of course have access to the beach right in front of you.  What a great area! The reception desk at check in was wonderful, and they upgraded us to the Sunset Suite upon arrival which was a nice surprise! As both of us are Diamond members, we appreciate when we receive such upgrades.  We were able to walk to breakfast and dinner at nearby restaurants and shop at the stores nearby which we love to be able to do.  Huntington Beach is relatively close to the other attractions that we wanted to and did visit during our time there.  It was
Manager Response: Dear Kjunk13,  First of all, on behalf of our entire staff, a heartfelt and genuine congratulations on your recent nuptials. Second, thank you so much for your kind note of thanks! We see many a newlyweds here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel...and it is so wonderful for all of us to be a part of your memorable days and weeks surrounding your wedding. Thank you for allowing the resort and all of Huntington Beach the opportunity to welcome and pamper you with all we have to offer.  Think about making us part of your anniversary celebrations...and be sure to let me know you are coming. I'll have the red carpet shampooed and ready for the roll-out when you get here!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary Heading: GREAT VIEW, BUT NOT WORTH THE PRICE
Summary: My husband and I decided to stay some place different in Huntington beach so we decided to stay the waterfront hotel. We booked the sunset view room for one night and upon entering our hotel room the view was spectacular, but that was about it. The room had wooden floors that creaked with every step. The bathroom was quite small and the air conditoner didn't work for peanuts. I was sweating at night. When we got to the pool area we were so surprised at how tiny it was. Maybe about fifty lounge chairs for sunbathers. We couldn't even find an open spot at the pool and once we did noisy kids the whole entire time. The hotel staff was very friendly and the hotel did have a little market although I was surprised they didn't have much of a selection. The hotel is right across from the
Manager Response: Dear Krazygirl,  Thank you very much for writing your review...and you are right, no matter how often I am here at The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel, I can never seem to get over the views! From spectacular sunrises to evening sunsets (and everything in between), nothing can compare to our perspective of Huntington Beach and the California Pacific coastline.  I was very sorry to hear that you were not completely happy with your guestroom accommodations. You might be interested in knowing that only the top two floors of the hotel have the laminate wood flooring. We added the flooring to give the rooms a more authentic Huntington Beach "bungalow" look and feel (the beach bungalow homes being one of the most historic features of our fair city), but you certainly do not have to have a room with wood flooring. We have plenty of standard rooms and suites without any of the custom floors. If we are lucky enough to have you back again, please make sure you mark this as a preference with your reservation or call us directly and we will make every effort to accommodate your request.   With regard to the pool deck and the availability of lounge chairs, this is always a challenge for costal resorts and hotels during the high season, but we think we might have a solution for you as well. Our professional team of surfside experts at Waterfront Adventures can set up private beach chairs, umbrellas and cabanas for you at the beach itself. We can even provide “beach butler” service and start a beach bonfire for you at night too (great for making Smores or just admiring the fire with an incredible sunset for a back drop). Waterfront Adventures is located directly across from the hotel on the beach proper and can accommodate guests and non-guests alike with surf lessons, bike rentals, beach chairs, fire pits, food & fun & more!  One more secret I can share with you is about crowds and pricing. If I'm not mistaken you sound as if you prefer a more serene atmosphere with a surfside ambiance. Thus, after the summer season ends (Labor Day) and the kiddies are all back in school, the resort offers incredible packages and deals that will knock your socks off! Be sure to look on our Waterfront Resort website or call us directly and we can tell you what is available. From packages that include parking and internet to romantic stays or breakfasts in bed, the best deals can be had while the weather at the beach is still spectacular…and with school "in" it’s the perfect time for and adult beverage and book by the pool. If it fits within your schedule, this kind of stay truly is one of the best kept secrets around.  I hope this encourages you to return to Huntington Beach soon and , should you return to the hotel, please ask for me personally so that I may introduce myself. I want to make sure you are well cared for and that your next stay creates all the "wows" we can muster!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Direct

Summary: Rally enjoyed this hotel which is almost on the beach. The staff are exceptionally helpful and the concierge in particular went well out of his way to ensure our stay was enjoyable.  The rooms are large and most have sea views. The hotel is well situated relevant to the centre of the town. All the meals we had in the hotel were excellent

This was the friendliest staff.     They practically fell over themselves to make the stay great.     I was disappointed in a couple of things and they more than made up for it.     Beautiful grounds, balconies, short walk to beach, and regular trips to the Huntington pier.    Pool area is small but absolutely beautiful.      I recommend to all.
Manager Response: Dear Cindylou,  Thank you so much for your kind words. It is nice to know our staff more than made up for any shortcomings you encountered, but being a perfectionist... I want to be certain we address any disappointments from our guests. Feel free to contact me anytime and let me know how we can improve our service.  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: I have stayed at this location a few times in the past years. The service is impeccable ... the facility is clean. Chelsea at the desk went above and beyond! My daughter accompanied me on this business trip. (Part business and part pleasure.) Since I am a diamond member, we were upgraded to a top floor suite with wrap around balcony. It was spectacular!  The staff was extremely accommodating.  This has been the case every time. Prices to stay at this location are not cheap, but it is worth the splurge. The pool area is nice...wait staff there are attentive. You do have to cross a street to get to the beach.  It is very easy to navigate though with push button crossing lights. The pier is very close with shops and restaurants nearby.  A 10 minute walk. I would definatley stay
Manager Response: Dear Batsey11,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your impressions of the hotel. Your words delighted the staff...and we all look forward to seeing you again as soon as you can get here. Your sunset awaits!  Cheers,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: The customer service at this hotel is outstanding. The view from our room was picturesque. The pool and hot tub were clean and the lounge chairs were comfortable. We ate at the restaurant twice and were impressed both times. It's proximity to the pier and shopping is walkable, or they provide a shuttle service, which we used once. I will stay here again if i'm back to Huntington Beach!
Manager Response: Dear layne17,  On behalf of our entire staff, thank you! It was so nice to share your kind words with our entire operations staff. We are also very proud of our restaurant and bar, Shades...and our executive chef, Chef Jeff. who is always looking for new and creative ways to delight our guests. I'm glad he (and the rest of the team) made your stay with us as comfortable as possible. From now on, please think of us as your home away from home in Huntington Beach. we look forward to seeing you again in the very near future!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: We stayed on the 9th floor and loved it! We had a sunset view which was a little more expensive, but worth EVERY penny! What a beautiful view. We also had a death in the family and had to delay our trip a couple days. When I called back to reserve our room, the price had gone up by a lot. All it took was a phone call and they met me in the middle on the price of our room. I was very grateful for their understanding in the situation! This hotel is in a great location, couldn't be any closer to the beach! We will definitely be back as soon as we can!  Front desk service upon check in and check out was wonderful! So was bellman service. My only small complaint was the valet attendants were not focused as much as they could be. But nothing to be too concerned with. Wonderful stay,
Manager Response: Dear Tyler N,  Thank you for your review. Words like yours are worth their weight in gold as we continously strive to meet the highest level of our guest's expectations here at The Waterfront Beach Resort. I have shared your note with valets as well (albeit with a raised eyebrow) and they will redouble their efforts as well. Service, smiles, attention to the smallest of details and, of course, "focus" are all part of our core values. Rest assured, we will continue to strive for perfection whenever and wherever we can. I hope that you join us again soon... we can't wait to "hit it out of the ballpark" for you next time!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: I had a easy check-in. My room was on the 18th floor, I loved it. I had the most wonderful view of the ocean. I could go out on my balcony and sit. I had a sitting room with a sofa and T.V., I never used neither one! I had the ocean right across Pacific Coast Highway! Very Beautiful, I will be staying a week this Sept, so I hope I can get the same room I had before. A little pricy, but worth every $ spent.

The Hilton is a fantastic place to stay in Orange County/LA. The beach is spectacular and most of the rooms have ocean views. The pool area is beautiful and very well maintained. The staff were excellent, all in all we were incredibly impressed.   I worked for a 5* travel company for several years staying at Aman's, Four Seasons etc and I would say this hotel is on a par with these top 5* hotels.   Do walk down to the main part of Huntington Beach (10min walk) and eat at Sandy's, really great atmosphere and food.
Manager Response: Dear KT80,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know that what we all strive for here at the Waterfront Beach Resort (five diamond service) is indeed what we are providing. Our staff trains continously to meet the highest levels of service the industry can provide, and sometimes its just nice to know when guest notices! We wish you and yours all the best this summer and hope you can return again very soon!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: I live in So Cal so it's very rare I stay in a hotel near home but it was worth it for our girls trip. I loved the understated and yet very cool beachy ambience throughout the hotel. The staff is beyond friendly from the valet to room service to and restaurant staff to the cleaning staff. Every single staff member had a smile on their face which can make or break a hotel in my opinion. I wish the hotel had a spa but I hear they are building one soon. In no way should that be a deal breaker since you have the beach right across the street.
Manager Response: Dear tpackman,  Thank you for choosing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel, for your stay. I am so glad to hear that we were able to meet and exceed your expectations... and those smile, 100% authentic! The staff here rarely turns over and we enjoy providing you with excellent service. It truly does make our day when YOU are happy with us, so on behalf of the entire crew,  :-)  !  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary Heading: Great location, great facility, beautiful grounds.
Summary: Our room was overlooking the pool however ALL of the rooms on the north side face the pool and the Huntington Beach pier. Night woes were awesome but in the morning, watching the surfers was great!  Restaurant was good, bar at night was fun, deli was poorly stocked, beautiful pool and hot tub.  Once you get off the hotel grounds, wifi is all over. The hotel wants $12.95 for Internet. Valet at $26/day (good and prompt service). It seemed they nickel and dimed for everything including extra chocolates at the turn down service after the first night and a paper after the first day too.  Walk across the street to the beach. Rent bikes on the east side of the Huntington Pier about 3 blocks inland. $7/day compared to $30 at the hotel.  Ride to Newport Beach and have a decent dinner at
Manager Response: Dear Longfortropics,  Thank you so much for making us a part of your stay here at the Waterfront Beach Resort. I have sent your comment on to our Surf Hero Market manager to make certain we are more prompt in keeping our deli stocked (especailly during such busy times as your stay). We wish you and yours all the best and look forward to serving you again in the near future!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: Myself, friend and service dog stayed at the Hilton waterfront for 2 days.  We were treated so well.  Help was there at all times, no one ever ignored us or treated us badly in any way.  ALL staff was wonderful, helpful and always willing to help.  The food was fantastic, and we had the best time in total comfort.  The beds.....oh what comfort, large rooms, can't brag about the Hotel or staff enough.  We say a very sincere Thank you to all!! Debbie Z, Cynthia and Bear  :)
Manager Response: Dear Bear (and Debbie),  We could not have been more pleased to have all of you here at the resort with us during your visit to Huntington Beach. Bear was such a loveable dog...and quite the hit with both the staff and locals alike. Please know that we would love to have all back anytime you hunger for the Pacific. The Waterfront Beach Resort will keep Bear's dish and snacks handy!  Many thanks,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Super clean rooms, comfortible beds & pillows, friendly staff and beautiful views. Easy walking distance to beach, restaurants and night life. Made for a lovely place to stay while on my last business trip.
Manager Response: Dear JulesJim B,  Thank you so much for your kind words... you thrilled our operations staff! As they like to say, please come back and then let us know if there is anything else we can do for you!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: Stayed there for one night before moving as this is the worst service we have ever had in the US. We arrived by super shuttle from LA International.     Concierge found his magazine far more interesting than helping with our luggage and I eventually found a trolley and loaded it myself. At the check in we were the only people there, but both staff were more interested in their computer screen for around 10 minutes before finally asking if they could help us. Breakfast was included in the booking, but we were expecting a bit better than a coffee and an apple from the take away shop.  Even internet was an extra cost.   They have a nice bar there which served good meals.     The next day we left this Hilton with the same level of assistance and moved to the Sheraton in San Diego
Manager Response: Dear Peter D.,  The Waterfront Beach Resort takes very seriously any guest complaint or service issue and promptly directs any corrective actions that needs to be taken by our team. While incidents such as the failures in service you mentioned here are very rare here at the resort, they are none the less a concern to everyone who works within our walls, most especially our executive team.  We always appreciate any feedback and are committed to our core mission of giving all of our guests the "wow" experiences we are all trained to provide. Our standard proceedure in  this event would be to immediately call together the team members or departments in question and find out what may have happened here during your stay. This action will be carried out today by our front office staff.  That said, if you ever in the area again, I would like the opportunity to personally see to your stay with us.  I hope the rest of your time spent in Huntington Beach, California was an enjoyable one.Again, I sincerely apologize on behalf of our entire hotel operation for your experience and would be grateful for the opportunity to make this right . Please never hesitate to let any of us know if there is anything else we could do for you. It would be our (and my)  pleasure to assist you.   Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton hotel

Summary: This Hilton does it right.  From the time we checked in until we checked out, everyone was pleasant and friendly.  I felt like they truly valued me as a guest.  Housekeeping was outstanding.  Our room was clean and with turn-down service our room was refreshed and restocked at night.  The pool service was couldn't have been better.  The service was prompt.  The concierge staff was helpful in arranging a car service to take us to various places.
Manager Response: Dear LiJo4145,  Thank you so much for chosing The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel, for your stay in Huntington Beach. We all look forward to the day of your return and i can assure you, the same friendly faces and attentive service will be waiting for you as well. Have a wonderful summer!  Sincerely,  Scott O'Hanlon Director of Marketing

Summary: While staying at the Hilton Waterfront my MP3 player was stolen out of my room.  I came back to my room to find the maid in there and my MP3 player gone.  Some type of manager was called, but he obviously had little authority, and even more obviously was simply trying to get me to go away.  Finally security was called and I was able to speak to someone with the title of Director of Risk Management.  This man, while being polite, was also trying to get me to just go away.  He said no one other than the maid had been in my room, and he trusted the maid completely.  I told him that I wasn't trying to accuse anyone, only laying out the simple facts: my MP3 player was in my room, and now it is not.  He told me he didn't know what else he could do for me.  Are you telling me that a
Manager Response: Dear Casey B.,   Thank you for your feedback regarding the report of your lost or stolen MP3 player during your recent stay here at The Waterfront Beach Resort. I was made aware of your issue soon after it had been reported to our Director of Risk Management and I am sincerely sorry that we were unable to immediately resolve this incident to your satisfaction. I can assure you that the safety and security of our guests (and their personal belongings) are of the utmost priority here at the resort and all Hilton Hotels world-wide. In fact, the Hilton Corporation several years ago mandated that every guest be provided with access to either a personal in-room safe (or a secure safety box area) at no charge to you, the guest. The Waterfront also has many more safety and security measures in place including fully monitored and video surveillance of the property, electronic key entry and muti-lock guestroom doors, state of the art fire suppression and alarm systems, mandated and ongoing safety and security training for all of our associates, and much more.  Additionally, we are also bound by the laws of the city, county, and State of California and as such, without positive proof a loss has occurred or a crime has been committed, we cannot make any false accusations in any direction. In a case such as yours, we strongly encourage you to file a report with the Huntington Beach Police Department, with whom we work very closely. You can reach the HBPD at 714.960.8811. If you have insurance covering personal belongings, be sure to file a claim with them as well.   We will continue to vigilantly watch for your missing MP3 player to turn up and promptly notify you when it does. In the past we have been able to return lost computers, phones, jewelry, loose diamonds, cash... you name it, we've found it and returned it! Personally, I know how much a music or data player can mean to someone, so I will be sure to follow up with our Director of Risk Management as well and check on the progress of his team’s search.  In the meantime, feel free to call upon me here at the hotel and let me know if there is any other assistance I may provide. I am at your service.  Sincerely,  Scott O’Hanlon Director of Marketing		        The Waterfront Beach Resort, a Hilton Hotel

Summary: We were two families from the uk with kids 13,12,10,7 the hotel was lovely, clean the pool was small loomed bigger on website, but kids still enjoyed it. Had a lovely evening meal, sat outside with the fire pits lit and live music which was great. Had to pay extra for Internet which I thought was bad and had to pay $29 a day to park car plus tips! But I did love the hotel and the beach was fab

I stayed here in April for 2 nights.  I was upgraded to a 1BR suite on the 9th floor.  My room had a balcony and faced the ocean.  The suite included a living area with desk and tv with a balcony and amazing ocean views.  The bedroom was small but included a tv and dresser.  The bathroom was luxurious and had a separate shower and a separate tub with shower.  The vanity was large and the floors and counters were modern.  I was very pleased with the room.  I also ordered room service and ate in the hotel restaurant for breakfast and dinner.  The food was really good, modern CA cuisine.  I would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

We were treated very well as Hilton Honors members.  Breakfast was fabulous and location was beautiful.  Parking is expensive but to be expected in that area.  Entire staff was friendly and helpful.  We were also treated to a complimentary room upgrade with a wraparound deck and great view of the beach.  Our room was fantastic.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but too far away from LA attractions!
Summary: We traveled here for 4 nights over the Easter weekend.  Although the hotel was beautiful and located in a nice area we wouldn't stay here again.  We had 2 older teens with us so we got a second room for them.  Wifi (which we almost all use nowadays) was $12.95 per 24 hours per room.  Parking... no option to self park... valet only at the rate of $24 per day plus don't forget the tips each and every time you need you vehicle.  If you wanted Easter brunch you would have had to cough up $75 per adult.  Not for us.  But... on a positive note...they did give us vouchers for the full 4 mornings to use in the 'surf' store.  We could have a fruit & a muffin & a  coffee or juice.  This helped out a lot as that saved us about $40 each morning. Liked the location if you didn't want to see

Stayed 3 nights at the Hotel and had a great experience.  Location is ideal as it is across the beach and very close to Main Street (restaurants, bars, shopping, etc.).  They had a great pool and an awesome outside area that included lounge chairs, fire pits, sitting areas, etc.  The parking is pretty expensive at $26 a night, but the views and location make up for it.  Staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms are newer, with comfortable beds and pillows, and a good size bathroom.

Nice location across from beach, rented bikes and rode to pier on a great sidewalk right next to the beach, it wasn't crowded so it's a nice time to ride (April).  Rooms - Smaller than I expected but wonderful view of the pier, if you pick that side of hotel. Very pretty lobby and grounds. Wonderful buffet breakfast that we got with our rooom. The bathroom was very small but it was clean.  They had a shuttle to the main street, however too many people for a small van and people were fighting to get on, it's a good 15 min walk to town. I was surprised they didn't have this shuttle running every 15 minutes from 6:30 on for a saturday night, about 30 people were waiting and a 8 passenger van pulled up and they said they ran every half hour. Not very realistic if you have so many
This hotel was very pretty, and conveniently located to Main Street. I did not like the beds, they were way too soft.  Shades restaurant was good every morning. The cost of parking was exorbitant.
Very nice hotel directly across from the beach with great ocean views.  Non smoking resort great service.

My family really enjoyed our stay here. We felt relaxed and enjoyed the proximity to the beach. The hotel staff was very helpful. The hotel offers free towels and beach chairs.... which was very helpful as we travel light!

We stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago for one night and i have to say the service here is incredible. I'm in the hotel business (no relation to this hotel) so service is a huge area for me and I always like to recognize those that go above and beyond. From the guy that greeted us at the entrance while we were still in our car, I believe his name was Trevor, to the front desk, room service, restaurant - service was outstanding. Matt who checked us in had a great personality and was so helpful and informative. We completely forgot to request a pack n play for our 6 month old and he said no problem we will have one sent up right away. The guy who brought up the pack n play was so friendly as well - bonus...the pack n play came put together with sheets already on it. If you have

Summary Heading: Private Patios & Balconies with a Pretty Ocean View
Summary: It's been forever since I had a hotel room window that opens onto a balcony with a small table and chairs and sunset ocean view. The sea breeze is refreshing on the balcony and is perfect for a morning cup of coffee while gazing at the ocean. The hotel is conveniently located across  the road from the Huntington State Beach which is clean and long and wide for walks and beach activities. A bike path parallels the beach and can also be used for walking the dog, although I don't think dogs are allowed on the beach except at nearby Dog Beach. The hotel is recently redecorated and is clean and seemingly well-run. Previous reviews warned of stern pool guards who gruffly asked for ID, but they have been replaced by very friendly towel girls who wish you a nice day. Pool chairs were
Upgraded us to a King Sunset Ocean view which was very comfortable. Had a great view. Food in hotel was very good. Service was wonderful. Pool area very nice. Would stay here again.

This is really a nice Hilton property located in the heart of Huntington Beach across the street from a huge beach with surfing, bike rentals and bathrooms. The hotel has a nice pool, the restaurant is very good a service throughout the hotel was uncommonly friendly and helpful. Choose a sunset room from a great view of the beach, pier and CA sunset. Hotel also has a beach bonfire package including firewood, s'mores and chairs all loaded on a wagon to take to the beach.  Nice value for Honors members with breakfast included. Valet parking is easy, efficient and well staffed.

Summary Heading: The best view from one's room on Huntington Beach
Summary: The hotel has seen better days, but it is the only structure that is 12 storeys high in the area. The NW facing rooms above the 4th floor all have a small balcony which barely fits two person, but offers the best sunset view of the beach. Also, the location is very convenient for a m/m roast on the beach in the evening, and a nice walk along the paved path on the beach. The facilities are fairly standard, the bathrooms small, the sink a bit too high and a bit hard to reach. The tennis court needs repairs. The rest is standard good Hilton service. No parking on the streets within 300 yards of the hotel. Camper park across the street, but it is not rowdy.

We booked for 6 nights and are checking out after 1. Our Corner King Executive Suite is medium sized, but that is still fine. The interior however is level garage sale. many years of hard use, should have been discarded years ago. It is simply junk. The room has no curtains but only wooden blinds. Nicely coastal, but these do not shut out the light.  No risk of over sleeping here!  Add a crummy bath, basic shower, only one wash basin for two people and you are getting it. I appreciate one pays for location, but at $500 per night this is simply not acceptable.  so we are voting with our feet.....

We just returned from a visit to the LA area. We stayed at the Hilton Waterfront and were so pleasantly surprised at the quality of our visit. The entire staff was so pleasant and eager to help us, from the valet (who offered driving directions) to the concierge service. A big thank you to Ramel, who was so kind to us, offering us bottled water for our trip back to the airport. We would definitely stay here again. Shades restaurant was top notch, as was every other aspect of our stay. We enjoyed dinner with live music on Friday night. We sat outside by the pool, and even though the weather was cool, the hotel provided outdoor heaters to take the chill off the evening air. Rooms were immaculate and we loved the access to the nearby beach. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Property; You pay Top Dollar but don't expect some basic amenities
Summary: I was initially excited to check in to a $200 per night room that was spotless, had a comfortable bed and a spectacular view. (actually Ocean to the left, construction straight ahead and a mobile home park to the right!) The property is nicely configured, with a restaurant, store, pristine pool and spa all nearby. The fitness center is small but well equipped.  If you are traveling with youngsters, be advised that you must cross Pacific Coast Highway (3 lanes in each direction) to get to the beach. Once you get to the sand, there are almost endless bike, jog and walking "roads". Of course plenty of "people watching" opportunities.  Where I was disappointed was three area's. First you really must park on the property. They Charge $24 a night!! Next, if you want to check you email

Summary Heading: A Great Hotel Experience from Hilton
Summary: Wonderful Pacific Views from rooms and poolbeautiful lobbyThe place to stay in Huntington, no doubt about it
Beds are wonderful, great location. Wouldn't vacation here...but worked for a business trip.

Summary Heading: good for business trip not for a vacation
Summary: I would not stay here for a vacation since the property is just average.  Rooms are average, no upgrade for diamond member.  The room patio's are so small they are unusable in my opinion.  The property did handle our large group of people (100+) very well.  The restaurant and bar were nice and the service was good.

My most recent stay at this hotel was great. My company has booked a conference there 2 years running, and my second stay was perfect. The first year my room had some maintenance issues, which I did complain about.   When I checked in the second year, my room was in perfect condition and the staff even called me to make sure that there were no problems, specifically asking about my previous issues. I appreciated the attention to detail that they had actually noted my previous problems and followed up with me right after check in to make sure i was happy.   The rooms are clean, with very comfortable beds. The location is perfect. You can walk across the street to the beach, or a few blocks and be in downtown Huntington Beach. The pool is beautiful, with a great view of the ocean.

Summary Heading: A great resort for a great town
Summary: Stayed at the hotel for the surf city marathon.  Staff was excellent.  The restaurant, pool, and grounds were really nice.  All rooms have a view.   Hotel was clean the room was nice.  Price is a little higher for marathon weekend but was well worth it.

I recently stayed at this beautiful hotel~ great location, you can drive 2 minutes to the beach front~ take a strole thru their shopping district and enjoy the night life~ We ate at a wonderful diner called: Mama's in 39 diner. Wow! great comfort food~ we loved it!! very reasonable. Our room was comfy~ we had the view of the beach~ we were on the 8th floor~ breakfast was delicious~ please be sure to visit their on site restaurant 'Shades'... you won't be dissapointed~ I would return to this hotel for a weekend~

My wife and I have stayed here twice now, both times for 5 days.  My wife and I make about 4 trips a year to Huntington Beach area. The hotel is very nice and great location. The problem is the hotel staff has treated us very poorly both times.  As our trips are for work pleasure combo we check in wearing blue jeans, teeshirts or shorts depending on the weather.  The hotel staff is very rude and condinsending towards us both times.  If you don't show up wear a suit they act like you don't belong there.  Which is really crazy as they like to give an image of a surf hotel.  If I can afford to stay there for 5 days a couple of times a year I can obviously afford to stay there.  The way a hotel staff (female) spoke to my wife at check in we almost left on the spot, as she almost

My friend and I were on a World Wide Country Tour for the 2012 Rose Bowl Parade.  The tour company picked this hotel, and it was fabulous!  It was exquisite both inside and out, the staff was very friendly, and the food quite good.  We had a wonderful view on our balcony--towards the ocean and the other and east was also pretty.  I would definitely recommend this facility to anyone.

Summary Heading: Nice Resort Hotel with Great Views
Summary: Stayed here for about one week over the holidays during visit to my old hometown.  Hotel was very clean, staff was excellent, and restaurant pretty good.   We had a room on the top floor, view was excellent towards the pier.   While I was never excited about HB going upscale during the redevelopment of the last couple of decades, I must say they did it right at the Hilton.

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The staff was so friendly and welcoming, I felt like VIP.  I really appreciated that they accommodated our last minute date changes due to weather in Seattle.  We loved the view of the pier from our sunset view room on the 9th floor.  The room was very comfortable and perfect for the 3 of us.  Bed were comfortable, not deluxe like some hotels but still slept fine.   Not a fan of the little single cup coffee makers with the coffee pods - they only make half a cup at best.  Went downstairs to the starbucks instead.  It was nice to have a little store to buy some extra beverages.  The weather was not so great during our stay but we still enjoyed the pool and hot tub area.  It would be really nice on a hot day.  The fitness room looked

Summary Heading: Good hotel in a great location
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for one night as a little “alone time” getaway.  We live fairly close by, and have been here several times for drinks, but I had never stayed here before – although I do remember that my senior prom was held here!  Happily, the place has been updated and renovated since then.  :)    My room was very nice – love the hardwood floors! – with a very comfortable bed and a little sofa/chaise lounge with an ottoman, which was a perfect place to curl up and read.  The tv was bit small compared to other hotels, but I didn’t think it was  a big deal.  I got a sunset view room, which was nice, but beware: the balconies are tiny.  I mean teeny-tiny.  Mine had two chairs and little table crammed onto it, and I literally had to climb into the chair, there was no room to

I stayed at this hotel for 2 days for business in December, 2011 and then my husband met me and we stayed for the weekend.  I am a very frequent business traveler, and read many of the reviews on TripAdvisor prior to choosing this hotel.  A couple of things that should be noted before I talk about the hotel itself: My company has a preferred list of hotel chains and Hilton is one - so that played into my selection. I wanted a hotel on the beach near Newport Beach, so this also worked for that criteria. We wanted to see the ocean and have a balcony.  I thought the hotel location was pretty good - there weren't restaurants or shopping right next to the hotel, but a pretty short walk (15 mins or so) down the main beachfront street got us to a number of restaurants such as Duke's.
Manager Response: Dear oahulady66, Thank you for submitting a review with tripadvisor. We appreciate your feedback from your recent stay with us. I completely understand that we may have not been the ideal hotel for you. We do our best to make every guest's stay a memorable experience.   I sure hope you would be willing top try us out again in the near future.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel overnight for my anniversary. This is a beautiful hotel. Our room overlooked the beach (and beach parking lot). The sea air was wonderful at night. The room decor was modern and very clean. The room was fairly expensive, but I understood why. The bed was comfortable, linens crips and the staff was friendly.
