This is a great area for restaurants and movie theaters.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great view, great value
Summary: Been selecting this hotel when in the area for awhile now.  They continue to deliver great service, a great view and at a great value.  My suggestion is to book the "Surf Hero" package, as it includes not only a great room, but breakfast credit for $14 each morning, a $25 credit at Sandy's (right accross from the PIer), two hats, a postcard and a certificate for a 20% dicount for dinner at Shades (the hotel restaurant). The breakfast menu has a variety of great items to choose from.   We selected a sunset view and had the entire Pier as part of our view with a balcony over PCH and partially the pool area.  There is a fire pit outside and it is very nice for sitting out on some cooler nights to enjoy the stars over the Pacific.  Truly a great expereince here.
Manager Response: Dear tracie b, On behalf of all of us at the Waterfront, thank you so much for taking the time to complete your review on Tripadvisor. I will definitely share your positive comments about the hotel with the staff. I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and thank you so much for being a loyal guest and we look forward to welcoming you back!

Summary: Unfortuantely we only stayed here one night Jan 3rd before flying out of LAX the next day. Just what we were looking for after visiting the city for over a week. The location was excellent even though we felt no need to leave as the resort had just what we wanted. Gorgeous sunset view of the ocean and pool from our balcony. Wonderful setting for pre-dinner drinks. Dinner in the restaurant was excellent, however, a bit of an odd ball but nice waiter.  Male valet and front desk clerks offered exceptional friendly and attentive service. Only rude encounters were from two ladies, one at the evening front desk and one at the afternoon concierge.    Will definitely return for many more days!!!
Manager Response: Dear wideworldtravels, On behalf of all of us at the Waterfront, thank you so much for taking the time to complete your review on Tripadvisor. I will definitely share your positive comments about the hotel with the staff. I apologize for any rude encounters you experienced here, that is not something we tolerate.  On a lighter note I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and hopefully you can stay longer next time!

Summary Heading: Blisfull place to relax and do business.
Summary: We spend 3 nights at the Hilton Waterfront as part of a business trip to Costa Mesa.  Not many good options for lodging in Costa Mesa, so we booked here.  I must stay, the location of the Hotel is prime.  It is close to the beach and the main street where all the restaurants and night life is.  The hotel itself is very clean and simple , same goes for the room. The mattress in the room was one of the best I have slept in a long time :-)  The Ocean view balcony was a nice touch where you could have coffee int he morning while watching the sun rise. Service was all round 5 stars. I have no complaints!

Summary Heading: Good but expected more for the price.
Summary: We spent 5 night of our honeymoon here and this was the most expensive hotel but we rated it bottom of the hotels we stayed at. Location is great (which is why they can command such a high rate I suppose), although a 10 minute walk into Huntington Centre. The rooms were fine but nothing special. We paid the extra to get the ocean view which, considering it was our honeymoon, was worth it.   Pool area was nice but pool was too cold to go in (and this was August!) We had some food at the poolside which was good but a bit expensive. The service was very slow but the poor waitress was on her own.  They had a fire pit outside which looked great. They had some great deals on cocktails and drinks - a different deal every day.  We found out halfway through our stay that we got

This was the best hotel we stayed at during our stay in California this year.  Superb hotel.  Superb rooms.  Superb amenities! Great location being both next to the beach and a short car ride or a little walk away from the town.   Restaurant and bar were fine.  Very nice touch with the outdoor fire-pit for those cooler nights. Pool area is great, but I could imagine that it might get a bit crowded during peak season. The room can not be faulted!  Modern, clean and lots of room - Perfect! Generally the staff were very friendly and helpful, even though I have a small reservation with this statement concerning the staff at the front desk. I did not find them particularly warm and welcoming.  On the other hand the Car valet staff were exceptional!  Thanks guys! I would most

Nice facility, well located. However, you better bring your own pillow, as the bed pillows smell and are obviously not being changed. Be sure to ask if they have any groups comming into the hotel, otherwise you will not be able to sleep.  I do not recommend this hotel for business travelers, not even for HH Diamond members I will certainly not return to this facility

We stayed on thanksgiving week and hotel wasn't too terribly busy so I think I could have gotten a little better of a rate but that is my only complaint. This was a great location with all the amenities I could ask for. Fitness center was really nice and shuttle to the main street was a great perk. I would come back in a heartbeat.

We stayed from October 30 - November 3, 2011.  Every one of the staff from the reception desk, to the waiters, to our housekeeping personnel, were the most wonderful and  friendly staff, all very helpful.  The hotel was very clean and inviting.  We were guests during Halloween, and the different departments had a decorated pumpkin on display for the guests to vote on Halloween day.  There were fresh cookies in the lobby all day also.  We took advantage of the S'mores Wagon, and walked across the street for a romantic fire on the beach, pot of hot chocolate and all the fixing for desserts. Everything was thought out and available in our wagon. We stayed four days, and our room was so very comfortable and always clean.  It felt like we were leaving home when it was time to check
Comfortable, clean, great, fun place close to beach.

My girlfriend and I stayed just for the night on November 12. We both wish it were longer, however. Although I tend to be more critical of our vacation stays, the Waterfront experience was nothing short of fantastic. And we checked in a bit late...but made our way to dinner reservations at their award-winning shades ( I thought I was heading straight for the Crab Cakes on the menu, but decided to go toward the Prime Rib). What better setting in our coastal destination for dinner. We enjoyed the guitar player that must have seen us coming in and dialed the right mix of background ambiance.  We both had the Prime Rib and I believe what I enjoyed was just as good as the famous House of Prime Rib in San Francisco. Lillie agreed. Along with the wine and this now beautiful coastal

Stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort November 10-13 for business. Polite check in and helpful staff.  Shades is the restaurant on property. I thought it was reasonable with good service. Beach was directly across street however, never had a chance to visit. Overall this was a clean quiet hotel who was attentive to our group and helpful in ever way.

Was at the Hilton Hotel in Huntington Beach over Halloween this year with my two small children and the staff there is very courteous, they have a shuttle to Main St which is convenient with 2 small children.  On Halloween, they had cookies and candy for the kids along with a Halloween contest on the pumpkins the staff made.  It was a great time for the kids.  The hotel is very beautiful from the moment you step in the front door.  Everyone there that we dealt with was very helpful and friendly.  My husband forgot his cuff links and collar stays and they searched all over for him to help us out.  We would definitely go back to this hotel.  The location was perfect to Main St and to Newport Beach.  We walked across the street to get to the beach which was super close and we could

Summary Heading: Even when it's cold, it's warm at the Waterfront Beach Resort
Summary: This property was recommended by a friend who knows the area well.  It has been quite some time since I have been to Huntington Beach and it has undergone a noticeable uplift to further accent the gorgeous beach.  This particular trip it was unseasonably cold for the locals, though welcome for someone from Texas - quite comfortable.  5 star views and service!  Check In, restaurant, valet - all service was impeccable.   I overheard others at checkout saying precisely the same thing.  The rooms are well appointed with 6 glasses - 4 water & 2 wine, generous stainless ice bucket, coffee maker, lovely bathrooms and toiletries.  The room also came with a refrigerator which was handy for dinner leftovers.  If interested in local flavor, a 5 minute walk south to the pier and local shops

We were here for a wedding held at the hotel in October.  Although we had a minor issue before check-in, it was quickly resolved via email with the hotel general manager, Mr. Shaeffer. Thank you for your quick response!  It saved us from an unpleasant check in experience.  That set an upbeat tone for our stay.  The hotel is across PCH (Pacific Coast Highway) to the beach.  Cut across the hotel pool area to the stop light and a quick crossover, and there's the beautiful beach.  It's swept every morning for by tractors and results in a clean sandy beach.  Plenty of beach volleyball, bike rentals, boogie boards, and wet suits can be rented at nearby kiosks.  Lots of surfers out there too!  The hotel is clean and staff is friendly.  Valet parking out front, though on the pricey

I'll add my positive review along with all the other good ones.  And it looks like most of the negative ones are from years ago.  Was here for six nights for a conference.  The staff was great, asked about a Hilton Honors upgrade at check in, and they offered me an ocean view room instead of what I booked without hesitation.  And it was worth asking for, what a great view.  The room was very nice & comfortable, clean, well appointed (no mini-bar -probably a good thing LOL) with a nice balcony overlooking the pool.  House keeping service was very good, the person cleaning the room left a pleasant little note each time thanking for the tip.  Very satisfied with the room, bathroom and bed.  Didn't use the pool or other facilities, but they looked fine.  The restaurant and bar were

Summary Heading: A little bit of tranquility in a lively area
Summary: Usually I stay closer to whatever business event brings me to Orange County when I'm in the area. However, this time we were on vacation, and I wanted my husband to enjoy what makes the area so special.  Huntington Beach has two lovely properties overlooking the beach and the incredible sunsets. The Hilton is one of them. The rooms right along the beachfront are just large and lovely with multiple balconies.  The property is quite lovely, and the staff works hard to make sure guests enjoy being there. Everyone on the staff was friendly and professional. We were especially impressed that the valet offered to have our car waiting at 4:30 AM on the day we checked out so that we didn't need to phone down in advance.  If you don't need to be right in Santa Ana or Costa Mesa for

Summary Heading: A wonderful place to get away!
Summary: The rooms are well appointed and the staff is extremely helpful and intent on making sure every guest enjoys their stay.  The views from the ocean front rooms are beautiful, especially at sunset.  The hotel is 100% non-smoking, which I love, but when we arrived at our room it smelled overwhelming of cigarette smoke, and there was a cigarette butt on the balcony; we notified the front desk and within 20 minutes they had another identical room ready for us.  There is plenty to do, whether you just hang out and enjoy the amenities of the hotel, or take advantage of the beach, or explore downtown.  Definitely my favorite Hilton to stay at.

This Hilton absolutely exceeded my expectations. It had all the qualities of a much more expensive hotel: the incredible service, extra amenities in the room, high quality furnishings, and exceptional food options. It was also a great location and surprisingly kid-friendly. We stayed only one night, but will definitely look for a good excuse to return.
Manager Response: Dear liburdke, We were humbled to receive your generous feedback and thank you for your high praise of your experience at The Waterfront Beach Resort.  We were thrilled to hear that we exceeded your expectations in providing you with a positive experience for you and your family. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional levels of guest service and I am personally proud that our colleagues were successful in achieving this with you.   Thank you for the recognition and we look forward to the right opportunity to welcome you back!

Summary: Staff were friendly the moment we pulled up. Room was nice (3rd floor, gardenview), furnishings looks like new to great condition. A decent view from the balcony. Went to the pool in the evenings. A nice size pool, heated, wasn't too crowded. No noise problems or pet problems (I don't remember even seeing a pet, although I like them!). My only complaint is the cost for parking (Valet only) and a daily charge for internet, which is not uncommon, just annoying especially since it's a top-notch hotel, which one would expect less petty fees. But despite that, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Huntington Beach. It's in a great location and a lovely place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear bub816, Thank you so much your generous feedback and for sharing your experience at The Waterfront Beach Resort.  We were delighted that we succeeded in providing you with a positive experience from our clean guest accommodations to our tastefully appointed amenities. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional levels of guest service and I am personally proud that our colleagues were successful in achieving this with you. I was sorry to hear that you felt the valet and internet  was overpriced. Please understand that we try extremely hard to be competitive with surrounding hotels in Huntington Beach.  Thank you for the recognition and we look forward to the right opportunity to welcome you back!

Summary: Wonderful place to stay.  Fantastic location, great views of the beach, easy walk to the pier and main street.  Great friendly and helpful staff.  Easy place to stay with kids.  Warm pool, snacks at the surf hero deli, toys available to take over to the beach, bikes for hire.  Loved staying here.
Manager Response: Dear AA1974, Thank you for taking a moment to share your feedback from your recent stay. We are so pleased to learn you are a fan of Surf Hero and took advantage of all our luxurious amenities and that our staff took great care of you during your stay.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: I split 4 nights between this resort and the Hyatt next door.  The Hilton wasn't quite as large and fancy as the Hyatt, but it was incredibly clean.  All the rooms had angled balconies and many had a view of the Pacific Ocean.  The thing that set this resort ahead of the Hyatt in my mind was the service.  It was absolutely incredible from the doorman, restaurant servers, the front desk ... everyone was well trained and wanted to make the experience enjoyable for all of the guests.  The other thing I have to mention is that the internet was lightning fast which was not the case at the Hyatt resort. The restaurant at the Hilton was pricey, but very, very good.
Manager Response: Dear bohste, We were so pleased to receive your generous feedback and thank you for the high praise regarding your experience here at The Waterfront Beach Resort.  We were delighted that we succeeded in providing you with a positive experience from our amazing staff to our tastefully appointed amenities. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional levels of guest service and I am personally proud that our colleagues were successful in achieving this with you.   We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: walk across PCH and you are on the beach, nice large pool, convention rooms,  We had a big party of over 100 people there with D.J. and open bar. Was a blast. MeuterMedia
Manager Response: Dear MeuterMedia, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on the resort.  I am so happy to hear you had a great time here.    Thank you for the recognition and we look forward to the right opportunity to welcome you back!

Summary: This is a great location and very clean. The staff here is first class and they treat you that way also. Rooms are big and the restaurants are great.
Manager Response: Dear tim b, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on the resort.  I am so happy to hear you enjoyed the restaurant and found our staff "first class", we think so too!  I will make sure to pass on your praise to all involved.  We were delighted that we succeeded in providing you with a positive experience. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional levels of guest service and I am personally proud that our colleagues were successful in achieving this with you.   Thank you for the recognition and we look forward to the right opportunity to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: One of the Best Hilton's we have stayed at!!!
Summary: We decided to spend a long weekend here and could not have enjoyed it more.  The staff at the front desk were awesome.  Check in was great.  The food at the restaurant was excellent.  We ate breakfast two mornings (order off the menu as the buffet was not worth it) and had dinner.  Our waitress was excellent and the food was just as good.  The hotel is just across the road from the beach.  You can get chairs and towels from the pool and take with you.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and we will be staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear baksdak, Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on the resort.  I am so happy to hear you enjoyed the restaurant and our staff at the front desk.  I will make sure to pass on your praise.  We were delighted that we succeeded in providing you with a positive experience. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional levels of guest service and I am personally proud that our colleagues were successful in achieving this with you.   Thank you for the recognition and we look forward to the right opportunity to welcome you back!

Summary: My husband and I spent 3 days here prior to a business meeting in Laguna Beach. We were very impressed with the service, staff, meals and accommodations. Everything was perfect! We ate breakfast twice in the restaurant and everyone was courteous and accommodating. The room was very clean and well kept up during our stay. I am a clean freak so the room condition is very important to me. The bed was comfortable and the traffic outside could not be heard in the room. I would recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear LouLou88-11, We were humbled to receive your generous feedback and thank you for your high praise of your experience at The Waterfront Beach Resort.  We were delighted that we succeeded in providing you with a positive experience from our clean guest accommodations to our tastefully appointed amenities. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional levels of guest service and I am personally proud that our colleagues were successful in achieving this with you.   Thank you for the recognition and we look forward to the right opportunity to welcome you back!

Summary: Stayed here as part of a company meeting.  Room had ocean views and proximity to the beach during our very limited break times made it possible to enjoy the beauftiful beach.  Meeting rooms were well appointed.  Evening drinks on the patio were made more enjoyable by the awesome large fire pit.
Manager Response: Dear 284Ont, Thank you for taking a moment to share your feedback from your recent stay. We are so pleased to learn you are a fan of our amazing fire pits and took advantage of all our luxurious amenities while away on business.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: I spent 3 days at the waterfront for a conference. I was amazed at the excellent service we received from the moment we arrived. At our lunch break, that was catered by the hotel, I overheard a staff member say to another "please hurry, people are waiting!" One of our members had dinner in town the night before our conference was to start and unfortunately her and her husband were stricken with a severe case of food poisoning. The hotel staff not only brought them complimentary clear sodas and tea, but went as far as to have the chef make a clear chicken soup especially for them!!! The rooms were beautiful, the beds were comfortable and the the grounds of the hotel were impeccably groomed. On pacific Coast highway across from the beach, I'd recommend this hotel to everyone!
Manager Response: Dear grnidgal, We sincerely appreciate your taking the the time to review our hotel - and are so delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! It is always a pleasure to hear such wonderful comments from our guests.  Thank you for recommending us!

Summary: What a great hotel! Easy walk to the beach-they give you free-chairs,towels,body boards etc. to take to the beach-how cool is that? Was with family enjoying the beach for 2 nights so we had a 2 bed room. Very nice and well maintained. About a 10 miute walk to the pier and main street where the shopping and action is. Pool was great also! We will defintely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Richvegas, We sincerely appreciate your taking the the time to review our hotel - and are so delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  It is always a pleasure to hear such wonderful comments from our guests.

Summary: Stayed here only 1 night in May as part of a California vacation. Every single staff member   ( I mean every one, from the front desk, to maintenance to housekeeping), welcomed us and said hello when passing. We had a server- Mitchell in Shades restaurant who was the most professional, outstanding server we have ever had! Greatly appreciated! Used HHonors points and were able to check in before noon in an oceanview room. Stunning views and hotel vibe. Definitely one of our favourites, we left with a very positive impression!
Manager Response: Dear christinern, We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your wonderful experience. It is a pleasure to hear your experience with our staff!  We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you are in Huntington Beach!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, great locations, great service
Summary: Throroughly enjoyed the hotel.  Great sunset views of the ocean.  Nice pool and great staff.
Manager Response: Dear coloboarder,  Thank you for the review and for the wonderful comments about our hotel. We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed the pool and had a great experience with the staff. Thanks for choosing to stay with us, we look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary Heading: Felt Like a VIP from Start to Finish!! Great Hotel...A+
Summary: This room was booked for us by our friends who were getting married at the Hyatt just next door. This hotel was wonderful!!  Check in was speedy and we had a Bellman help us get our luggage to our room.  He stuck around and made sure we had all our questions about the hotel and the area surrounding the hotel answered.  Turn Down Service was nice as well.  The pool was wonderful and our cocktail waitress gave excellent service. All around great service, wonderful staff, beautiful accomodations.  Thank you so much for making us feel welcome.  I used to live in the area and have many friends in Newport/Huntington Beach....I will be back and will be sure to spread the word about your property!
Manager Response: Dear travelgirl8704, Thanks for the great review of our hotel and for returning to HB and choosing to stay with us. Glad to hear you enjoyed our hotel and the staff took good care of you from arrival to departure. We appreciate the comments and your help spreading the word about our resort!

Summary: We spent a week at this resort and enjoyed every minute of our stay, so did our dog. The service was fabulous, from the valet to housekeeping. We booked an oceanfront room and we were very happy with it. If you don't want to spend that much, I would recommend the Oceanview sunset rooms. They overlook the pool area and you have a view of the pier. Our dog was able to hang out at the pool with us and she was brought water and dog biscuits. The staff seems to want every guest to be happy and enjoy their stay. We loved being there and will be going back. We recommend this resort to everyone.
Manager Response: Dear Gwendolyn P, We sincerely appreciate your taking the the time to review our hotel - and are so delighted to hear that you and your dog enjoyed your stay with us! As you can tell...we love pets!  It is always a pleasure to hear such wonderful comments from our guests.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: This hotel is definitely one of the top beach resorts in So. California!
Summary: Every time our family visits the Hilton Waterfront we say it couldn't get any better, and our September getaway visit last weekend was no exception. At check in we were greeted by the friendly valet and had our luggage delivered propmptly to our room. One of the first things you notice is the cool ocean air and the bright decor and cleanliness of the rooms. The mattresses and pillows are probably the most comfortable you will ever sleep on. With three kids, we had a connecting rooms that work out just great. We enjoyed room service the first night while watching a beautiful sunset over the ocean. (The bacon cheeseburger was fantastic and has to be in the top 5 i've ever had.) The Waterfront is always adding new amenities like the outside fire pit, complimentary beach toys and
Manager Response: Dear craig_bgi On behalf of all of us at the Waterfront, thank you so much for taking the time to complete your review on Tripadvisor. I will definitely share your positive comments about the hotel with the staff. I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and that you enjoyed our amenities!  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: Pro's:  Staff are excellent Shades restaurant great Free umbrella's and Boogie Boards at poolside to take to the beach Location Housekeeping are really thorough Good Value 368/night for Ocean front (worth the extra)  Con's:  13.95 a day for wireless (joke) Rooms are dusty  Rooms are dusty
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your experience. I was sorry to hear that you felt the internet l was overpriced. Please understand that we try extremely hard to be competitive with surrounding hotels in Huntington Beach.

Summary: This is wonderful hotel in a great location! Our studio ocean view suite was perfect for a family of 4 with two teenage boys. The location also fit the needs of adults and teenagers. The boys loved the beach and the complimentary boogie boards and chairs offered by the hotel. My husband and I loved the pool. The service, beverages and food was outstanding. The hotel is also within walking distance of main street with wonderful shopping, restaurants and clubs. It was also a huge plus that the weather was absolutely perfect. We can't wait to go back and visit "Heaven on Earth" at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort!
Manager Response: On behalf of all of us at the Waterfront, thank you so much for taking the time to complete your review on Tripadvisor.  I will definitely share your positive comments about the hotel with the staff.  I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and that the boys loved the beach.  I hope you got a chance to check out our newest addition Waterfront Adventures, where you can rent bikes, boogie boards, beach cabanas and firepits just to name a few.   We look forward to seeing you again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Always my favorite hotel in HB!
Summary: I live in HB and had my wedding reception at this hotel in June 2010. We had our 1 year annivesary here and, as always, they exeeded expectations. The suites are the best becaues they are on the end of the hotel floors looking out at the ocean. You will not be disappointed in this hotel.  The pool is clean, good sized, lots of chairs, and has nightly shows on the weekends in the summer. The restaurant, Shades, is nice with a beautiful outside seating area. The food is usually very good, but pricey. They also have a small snack shop next door that serves food, too. Lobby is gorgeous and pool grounds are also amazing. Excellent hotel staff and conveniently located within walking distance of Main Street, the HB Pier and the beach.
Manager Response: On behalf of all of us at the Waterfront, thank you so much for taking the time to complete your review on Tripadvisor.  I will definitely share your positive comments about the hotel with the staff.  I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us!  Happy Belated Anniversary!    We look forward to seeing you again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Absolutely loved it here - but overpriced!
Summary: We stayed  here for 10 days - 2 adults and 2 children.  We absolutely loved it!  Great location, great room with great views of sunset.  We had 8 of our 10 nights through Hilton Honors reward scheme - so those didn't cost us anything, we only had to pay for 2 nights.  If we had to pay for the whole 10 nights then our opinion might have changed. The staff were absolutely amazing - the friendliest we have ever experienced in any Hilton hotel and we use Hilton a lot!  The complementary breakfast was good, although the service at breakfast was a little slow - our plates were just left on our tables to pile up and didn't get cleared away!  The hotel arranged a beach buggy for us to do a camp out BBQ on the beach and, whilst this was also expensive, we absolutely had a great time.

This property sits next to another nice hotel but this place has unbelievable views, excellent service and is situated directly across from Huntington Beach. I've stayed here many times but each return visit is as good as the last.  This is definitely my favorite place to stay on the California coast
Manager Response: Dear Loves2TravelALOT_11, Thank you for taking a moment to share your most rewarding feedback from your recent stay. We were delighted to learn we overall exceeded your expectations. We pride ourselves in ensuring our guests’ experience is seamless and are proud to have achieved this with you.  We look forward to welcoming you back home soon!

Summary Heading: It was a great hotel! I'd stay there again.
Summary: The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and the furniture looked modern.   The hotel is close to the beach, shopping, and restaurants.  Our package included breakfast the next morning and it was a buffet style at Shades Restaurant (appeared to be the only restaurant on the property so the wait can be long).  The food was great since it was included as part of the package, but I don't think I would have spent $22 per person normally.  They even charged $22 each  for my 4 year old and 16 month baby, but then they discounted it after receiving the meal vouchers.  I will say the service was excellent.  When I asked the front desk where I can get milk from and it was about 10pm, they informed me the guest shop had just closed but room service was available.  I must have looked a
Manager Response: Dear threekitkats, Thank you for the positive feedback regarding our staff here at the Hotel and the great time you had during your stay.  I am glad to hear the front desk was able to take care of your little ones needs.  We are a family friendly resort and the staff is really great at taking initiative.  Thank you for choosing the Waterfront Beach Resort we hope to see you again really soon!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days, bringing along my mother.  I had to do work in the area, so I wanted a nice hotel for my mother to be at while I was gone all day.  This hotel is very close to downtown Huntington Beach, right on the Pacific Coast Highway.  It's hard to tell in the photos online, but it is across the street from the beach.  We didn't mind this.  It was a very short walk, and the traffic lights for pedestrians were very timely.  The hotel had a nice pool (although a tish cold) and great restaurant called Shades.  We ate here twice, and had great food both times.  I recommend the filet!  They gave us free breakfast coupons when we checked in (Honors member perk), so that was helpful as well.  The only thing I didn't care for was the fact that there was no self
Manager Response: Dear Affable_Dane, On behalf of all of us at the Waterfront, thank you so much for taking the time to complete your review on Tripadvisor. I will definitely share your positive comments about the hotel with the staff. I am so happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and the filet, it is a personal favorite of mine as well.   We look forward to seeing you again in the near future!

Summary Heading: The hotel that has it all!
Summary: My husband and I stayed a night here to celebrate our promotion. We were amazingly surprised. The rooms were big, clean & fully supplied. The beds & pillows make you want to sleep in all day; the waterfront view is fantastic; we awoke to the beautiful sounds of the waves hitting the shores. The staff is friendly; valet is prompt & on top if their game; the hotel offers lots of recreation for kids ( so we will def be back w/ the family) The location is fantastic to walk to shops. I can't say enough good things. The only thing we found was that bar drinks are too steep for us; expect to pay $10 dollars a drink.   Great hotel & wonderful staff!!!
Manager Response: Dear Disneykinfolk, Thank you for the positive feedback regarding our staff here at the Hotel and the great time you had during your stay. Sorry about the pricing at the bar, next time your here if you like us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter we send out daily drink specials with discounted pricing. Thank you for choosing the Waterfront Beach Resort we hope to see you again really soon!

Summary: If you are a dog lover, then this hotel is for you.  We are not, so we found that there were way too many dogs in this hotel. Also, the pool is not as long as it appears in the picture. Staff members were generally friendly. If the rate is approximately the same as the Hyatt, the Hyatt would be a much better hotel to stay in.
Manager Response: Dear Washington0089, Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I’m sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. Our dog occupancy does go way up in the summer months, as people enjoy traveling with their pets.  We appreciate our guests’ feedback, it is a very useful tool and it really helps us improve our customer service goals.

Summary Heading: Not really happy about this Hilton
Summary: The room is really small, there is not space enough to put the things and above all the clothes. After this, at the lobby no one had tried to take out luggages to the room. The structure seems to be really old, above all the bathroom. Very good the beds, really comfortables. Nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn
Manager Response: Dear Francigiaqui,  Thank you for submitting a review with tripadvisor. We appreciate your feedback from your recent stay with us. I completely understand that we may have not been the ideal hotel for you. We do our best to make every guest's stay a memorable experience.   I apologize that no one helped you with your luggage, our bell staff is one of our top departments so I am surprised to hear that they did not take care of you. Again, I am very sorry you did not enjoy your experience with us. We strive to exceed every guests expectations and in your case we failed. I sure hope you would be willing top try us out again in the near future.

Summary: We were lured to this hotel because of its beauty in the photos and its proximity to the beach during early summer fun days. First of all, parking staff valet folks were absolutely great and friendly - prompt and professional so I give them an A++ rating.   I was really disappointed to arrive and find people bringing their pets into this establishment.  I love animals and have several including dogs, cats, chickens, and a turtle - but I didn't realize places like this would actually allow people to bring dogs into their rooms, on just any floor. I assumed they would isolate them to their own private floors. I was wrong. My two biggest complaints about this situation was that a lady on our floor, probably late 30's or early 40's, came home at night and her little yiping dog
Manager Response: Dear PhilThePhotographer,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your stay here. Let me first apologize to what seems like a plethora of problems during your experience. I did some research and we don’t have any incidents reports about the disturbances mentioned in the review.  When did you stay here?  If it was recent our dog occupancy does go way up in the summer months, as people enjoy traveling with their pets. I am sorry to hear that a few of our pet owners were difficult. Our staff does everything to keep the peace between those who have dogs and those who don't. We usually do not have any problems as the one you described.   As for the guests smoking on their balconies, we do everything in our power to deter that, but unfortunately people are going to do what they want to do.  We have little control over it unless we know about it and then we send Security up to the room to advise guests of our non-smoking policy.

Summary: We enjoyed the quick check in and split a great dinner at their resturant and the next morning breakfast on the patio a stroll to the beach to touch the water watch the people and enjoy that California sun. Back to the pool to relax and swim and enjoy some goodies by the poolside. overall another great stay at a hilton! WoW I should get paid for this but it is true they do a great job providing enjoyable stays.
Manager Response: Dear mrbeco,  We are delighted to hear you had a great anniversary experience here at the Waterfront Beach Resort!  It sounds like you had a fabulous time.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: Stay here-We had an absolutely wonderful weeklong stay.  We had an oceanfront room (much better than the ocean view rooms).  The oceanfront room was pretty large, with a patio and very large bathroom.  The hotel is kept very clean; the staff is superb (front desk and valet areas stand out, but others were good as well).  We had a very good breakfast daily at the hotel restaurant Shades – however, it's a bit overpriced if you’re not a Hilton member.      The location could not be better- walk through the pool area (pick up your beach towels and chairs there) and a quick walk across the road and you are on Huntington Beach.  It’s a 5 minute walk to the pier and downtown.   The Huntington pier is good for the view, and downtown offers a few good surf oriented shops and decent if

Summary Heading: Great location, close enough but not too close to the action.
Summary: Great location, well maintained & staffed with a great team. Doormen, valet, bell desk & concierge are knowledge & helpful. Rent some bikes, go into town &/or down the beach & enjoy the spirit of Surf City.

Great family resort. Special pool for kids. Close to beach. Excellent mall 20 minutes away. Beautiful grounds. A bit spread out, though...lots of walking to get to our room.Would stay again, however. Did not like that you had to buy the rewards package to use the workout facilities, but I suppose one could run along the beach.

Summary Heading: Memorable Experience for my entire Family!
Summary: Okay so I read many reviews prior to my stay here and boy was I scared.  The only reason why we still booked it was because my sister wanted us to stay closer to her house.  On that note, I am SO EXTREMELY HAPPY that we chose this hotel.  My Husband and I took our 3 kids. 16, 8 and 2 ½. **THE ROOM REVIEW… We stayed on the 6th floor in an Executive suite.  They placed us in a Corner room with the most spectacular view EVER!!  We had 2 balconies.  One just off the master bedroom and one that wrapped around the suite and had a seating area.  The bed was Comfortable and the extra long “L Shaped” couch was perfect for our 8 and 16 y/o to sleep.  The bathroom was roomy.  Loved the Shower!!  The wet bar was a nice addition but was a little disappointed to find that a Microwave was an

I am a Hilton Diamond Member! I checked in on line the day before arrival. My profile states that my room selection is away from the elevators. When I formally checked in at arrival and went to my room, it was next to the elevator. With an apology, the room was changed.  The rooms are of good size and in working order but tired. They are in need of a total make over to bring them up to today's standards. The bathrooms are somewhat small and also need a complete make over. All the fixtures need replacing and I would suggest removing the tub and replacing it with a up to date shower.  Now to the good points of the hotel, the food! I stayed for four nights and three of those night an associate and I had dinner in the hotel's restaurant. The food was excellent, fairly priced and the

Absolutely gorgeous hotel.  All rooms abo ve the 4th floor are oceanview - anything below would be partial ocean view.  Rooms were absolutely beautiful!  Spacious and very comfortable all will great balconies.  Located directly accross from beach this hotel is a 5-minute walk from the pier and all the shopping/restaurants.  Restaraunt and Bar and Pool area are wonderful!  Great music all day Saturday and Sunday!

Summary Heading: Satisfactory stay- expected a bit more
Summary: For the price you would think this place would bend over backwards for you, not the result.  We did have a great view of the pool and ocean from our room.  The room was standard, had a nice patio area with two chairs and table to sit at.  The pool area was good, plenty of deck chairs and the pool was big enough to accomodate and never felt crowded.  Great views from the pool over to the ocean across the street.  The 'Shades' restaurant had good food, lousy service but a slim selection on the menu.  Valet was a bit slow at getting our car (we learned later to call down ahead).  The worst of everything was the overpriced pool bar.  The bar is located inside the gift shop area (not even a bar, more of a walkup area), they do have pool waiteresses but the drinks are HEAVILY

A quality hotel close to the beach and within walking distance of the town of Huntington Beach and the famous pier. All the rooms have a sea view and as you would expect the room quality was superb. Also close to the main freeway into L.A. Only disappointment is the $13 daily cost of the Wifi and th $24 valet parking.

Summary Heading: For OC, not so bad...not the best Hilton either
Summary: We stay at Hilton as a standard of practice. We booked this stay as a reward, too...I booked it on my hhonors points, and I'm only a silver, so no free wi-fi, no free printing of boarding passes, either ...note to self use hubby's card next time.  We were placed on the 2nd floor right over the hot tub (not great placement for our kiddos when they were trying to get to sleep with guests enjoying themselves. We used the hot tub - it was quite small for the size of the hotel, but we shared nicely & hope we did not perturb anyone... The pool is not heated, so it was quite chilly for me, but the kids enjoyed it. The kids liked the kiddie sand area, too - no one else was playing there, so it was kind of fun...  We had HORRIBLE service at the restaurant...one hour wait for lunch in an

We stayed at the Hilton for father's day weekend. My husband and I are 30 and we were with our 3 year old daughter. We were there earlier than check in but were able to get our room right away, with a big balcony overlooking the pool and beach. The front desk lady was the only person who wasn't very friendly.  We had a late dinner at Shades. The food was good and the service was excellent. The father's day brunch was very good, although I'm not sure I would pay that much for regular brunch without the BBQ.  The pool was fun, our daughter loved it. The food and drinks from surf hero were good (especially the pina colada) and the staff at the pool was great!  We had a great weekend but definitely want to try the Hyatt next time.

Summary Heading: This hotell is #3 in HB Choices - I have stayed in them all!
Summary: I live in Huntington Beach, HB, and trust me, here is how the hotels rank:  1.  Hyatt Regency Resort & Spa 2.  Shorebreak - no pool though 3.  Hilton Waterfront  Don't waste your money on the other hotels mentioned - they are run down and not near as nice as the three I mentioned above.   If you have kids under 12, choose the Hyatt.  If you are a couple looking for a cool getaway, choose Shorebreak.  The Hilton is a good alternative if the Hyatt is too pricey.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights while we were on vacation. There are five of us so we had to get a fold-out bed to go with a sleeper couch.  My husband travels a lot so we did get some perks. We were upgraded to a corner room on the first floor overlooking the beach.  We had a huge room with a king bed with a heavy curtain separating the bedroom from the sitting room with the couch and other bed.  We also got breakfast vouchers so we ate in the restaurant every morning.  The buffet was excellent! They turned on the heaters on the patio so we could sit outside.  They probably preferred our kids being out there anyway since the clientele seemed pretty upscale and we can be a little loud.  We easily walked across Pacific Coast Highway to the beach.  The hotel

We have stayed in many Hiltons and this is supposed to be in the top category 7, but it is not a patch on other category 7's we have stayed in.  The walls are paper thin and you can hear the person in the next room having a wee!  The rooms are not large. The front desk are not very friendly and certainly even as Diamond Honors member they could not have cared less.  Parking is only by valet and is expensive.  Whilst visiting there were several functions, a commercial for Pepsi was being filmed; this took a whole day of the hotel grounds and various functions in the grounds.  These were quite noisy.  There is certainly no chance of any peace or an afternoon snooze.     On the plus side the restaurant Shades is good.

A friend was getting married at the Hilton so we stayed at the resort.  The room was very clean and well equipped but the best part was the bed - which was super comfortable.  There were a good number of products in the bathroom and the room had nice lighting, new flat screen tv, and room darkening curtains.  We were on the bottom floor so our room had a decent sized deck, but I think if I stayed there again I'd ask for a higher floor. Parking is expensive ($24 per night valet only) as are most things at the hotel.  The hotel is across the street from Huntington Beach and a 5-10 minute walk away from downtown Huntington Beach - which is where we went for the bulk of our meals and nightlife.

Stayed here end of April and were welcomed in style. Staff were excellent, room was elegant with plenty of space and a bathroom we only dream of. Our room was on 6th floor overlooking pool and restaurant. Our balcony had plenty of space and faced the boardwalk and Huntington Beach. The local shops were only a short walk along the boardwalk or the free Hilton shuttle runs every hour. It was a perfect place to rest up after travelling on a long flight from Australia. Well done Hilton, we would certainly stop here again

What a memorable experience to stay in Orange County! This was our first time at the Waterfront Hilton and lets just say we would go back in a heartbeat for our next trip to the OC! We found the service to be great, a very friendly staff as well as great food at the restaraunt Shades! The proximity to the beach and downtown HB couldnt be any better either. Definitely recommend Waterfront Hilton!!

Summary Heading: charged extra and having problems getting it properly corrected
Summary: I stayed at the hotel the end of April for two nights.  I could have stayed at the Hyatt next door (where the conference I was attending was held), but I need two more stays to get Diamond status back, so I paid the higher price.  Unbeknownst to me, I was upgraded to an oceanview room, the cost of which was $20 more per night.  When you are paying $259/night when you could get a room at the Hyatt for under $200, any additional cost really stands out.  I thought something was off when I got home, so I looked at my reservation confirmation and saw I paid the extra $20/night.  I contacted the hotel and was told that I was told the upgrade would cost more.  I was never told I was getting an upgrade, only that a room on the 10th (or 12th?) floor wasn't ready, but they had something

Fantastic location in the Surf City!! You are in front of Pacific Ocean in a very confortable hotel. Very nice relaxing area and good food!! Perfect to stay close to Los Angeles but in a better location!! You are on the Pacific Coast highway and it is perfect to drive to south trhough Newport beach...till Sand Diego. If you are a surfer you are on heaven!!!

still in two minds about this place.. rooms were OK, i guess.. seemed a bit dated.. in room fridge was empty, and it stank so bad that i couldn't even keep anything in there.. shower was barely useable..  buffet breakfast was a total joke.. truly awful.. i only used about 2 of my tokens ( from 10 ) really, there wasn't much to this hotel at all.. bare and not really looked after..  staff were all friendly etc.. location isn't really beach front.. i dunno.. i guess overall just not worth the price they were charging.. 285 usd / night for what was really just a room with nothing special about it at all.. oh, and they didn't even have 24 hr room service !!! that sure did annoy me.. had to order out from some local fast food joint..  shame on you hilton hotels.. also, whats with

Summary Heading: A Great Easter Getaway at the Beach.
Summary: We just returned from a terrific long weekend at our favorite beach vacation spot, The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort. We have found springtime is a great time to visit Huntington Beach, because the weather is sunny, the beach is wide open and there aren't a lot of crowds. The Hilton was bright and sunny too, with an Easter egg hunt held for the kids Sunday morning. We relaxed alot, and ordered room service for several meals. Every time the order was perfect, the food was great and it arrived earlier than promised. There are always plenty of great local restaurants nearby. The hotel staff is always friendly and helpful and to us that says this must be a good place to work, where they really care about the guest experience. One day our entire family rented bikes and just rode up

The Hilton Waterfront is a beautiful hotel that is not pretentious or "stuffy."  It provides amazing amenities but still feels extremely comfortable.  The rooms are big, clean, and well appointed.  The pool is dreamy...the view is breathtaking.  An added note, the staff is polite, friendly and extremely helpful.  6 ****** if I can give it!

Summary Heading: Incredible Hotel right on the beach
Summary: We stayed at the Waterfront Hilton for my son's wedding. It was incredilbe! The location is awesome, right accross the street from the ocean, the service was so friendly and immediate, the rooms were beautiful and clean! I was so impressed, as all of our family and friends that also stayed at the Waterfront Hilton for the weekend! I would highly recommend the Waterfront! The location is walking distance to town and you have the Pacific Ocean right accross the street with bike paths and great surf! Highly recommed and we will be back soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for the complimentary comments regarding your recent stay here. We are thrilled to hear you had a great stay!  Thanks again for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: What a way to celebrate my 50th birthday.
Summary: I cannot complain about any of my service.  Since I myself work in the hospitality industry, we tend to hold other hotels to a much higher standard than the average Joe.  And I cannot give them a bad review on any of their service.  Everyone was Johnny on the spot.  And I couldn't have found a better hotel with a more spectacular view.  Even if you were not on the end with the straight ocean view, their balconies lean out to where there is an awesome view from all rooms.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone and hope that someday I may have the pleasure of going back.

We stayed at the Hilton Waterfront for nearly a week with our teenage son and elementary aged daughter.  Service was great.  Hotel was beautiful The location can't be beat.  It's a 10 minute walk to the pier and Main Street restaurants.  We loved walking the beach everyday to go to breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The hotel itself was surprisingly quiet for as booked as it was.  Pool area is comfortable and clean. All rooms have an ocean view.  2 issues I have with this hotel: The $24 a day parking fee seems ridiculous.  Service at the pool is extremely slow and it wasn't that busy.  Also, they ran out of towels in the pool area one of the days we were there and there were towels left on chairs everywhere people had been earlier, but no one picking them up and making sure vacated

We stayed her for spring break season in late March.  It was in the 60's so we never used the pool.  It looked nice, but judging from other reviews wasn't heated??  The rooms were nice and spacious and had refrigerators.  We had a sunrise ocean view that looked away from the Pier side but it was just as nice.  The staff was helpful and knowledgeable about area restaurants, attractions, etc.  It is two BIG blocks from the Pier and downtown area(10 minute walk) , but not an unpleasant walk at all.  If you want something more in-town there is the Shorebreak (appeared to be similar caliber) and a Best Western more in the thick of it.  The hotel appeared to be primarily a convention hotel, with lots of business people rather than spring breakers, but it was very quiet and calm.  At

When speaking with the front desk, it was indicated that the owners are constantly renovating, and it shows!  Rooms were large and well appointed.  We were upgraded to a "sunset view" and were it not for a cloudy weekend, it would have been gorgeous (can't fault the hotel for that of course).  We went to the restaurant and found very inspired cuisine that was simply delicious.  It was a little pricey, but to be expected at a hotel restaurant.  Staff was amazing and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed.  Concierge sent us to a dud restaurant and followed up with us that he had talked to the restaurant directly about our experience (nice touch).  Our only issue was the city itself.  Not much going on for a young couple in the middle of the winter, but was a a relaxing

Wow!  Two words...AWE-SOME!  We loved this place.  Spent the extra $50 or so to get an ocean view room.  The room itself is clean and beautiful.  Everything is quality.  The view from the 9th fl was spectacular.  HUGE view of the beach, the pier, and to the east the snow-capped mountains.  We went out in Huntington beach at night and had the hotel shuttle take us.  The walk back to the hotel took 10 mins.  This is the hotel you want to go back to when you're tired at the end of a busy day.  During the day, we sat at the pool, had a few drinks and simply lounged in the sun.  Hot tub and heated pool.  What could be better.  Everyone here is friendly and the staff is simply different and better than ordinary hotels.  Do yourself a favor and spend a few extra bucks to stay here.
Online photos of this hotel don't provide a good representation.  Very nice and would stay there again.

The Hilton Waterfront is a bit of misnomer.  The hotel is near the water but not on the water.  One has to cross busy Pacific Coast Highway to get to the beach.  Otherwise, I was pleased with the accomodations.  The rooms were clean, attractive and quiet.  The restaurant offers nice sandwiches and lunch fare in an outdoor area.  The immediate neighborhood is rundown but it's just a short walk to the charming little tourist town which offers many restaurants and shops.  We enjoyed our long weekend stay at the Hilton Waterfront Hotel.

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort from December 28, 2010 - January 5, 2011 and had a really nice time.  The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and was located right across the street from the beach.  My husband is a Diamond HHonors member so we were upgraded to a corner suite on the 6th floor.  The room was not huge but was a very nice size compared to the regular rooms.  We had a sunset ocean view with a wrap around balcony where we had beautiful sunset views every evening.  The room had both a walk in shower and a full tub which made it easy to get ready in the morning.  Sink was outside between the two so it made for easy access.  The room had a nice sitting area and lots of windows that faced the ocean.  Beautiful in the mornings and

Hotel is located directly across the road from Huntington Beach and a short walk to the downtown area.  The hotel is laid out with the rooms in one building and the ballrooms and other meeting rooms on the other side of the pool, with the lobby area connecting the two.  This keeps the noise of the parties away from the rooms.  The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, but are starting to show their age, and quite frankly are not worth the price charged.  For these rates I expect "Wow", not "Nice".  The staff was friendly and helpful, and we were able to get an early check in.  The parking is valet only, and $24 a day.  The on-site restaurant is expensive and the food is fairly ordinary.    We were staying there as part of a wedding, and overall the arrangements for the
Beautiful rooms, view, etc. Close to the Huntington boardwalk. Loved it!

Location is great, very pet friendly. During better weather than we had, it is a great place to stay.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Valet parking is all that is available, which is $24,00 a day.  The pool area is quite large and  pool is heated.  There is an adequate fitness center.  All in all, it is a nice faciliity, and as opposed to the Hyatt next door, pets are not banned.  All rooms have at least a partial ocean view which is across PCH from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Wish I had stayed next door.
Summary: Horrible reception from the front desk.  In dire need of customer service training to one individual.  The room was oceanfront and I knew the traffic below would be noisey, but it was really really loud.  Sitting on the very small balcony were a couple of plastic type chairs, and the neighbors on both sides could look over and talk to you.  They could also see in your room quite easily. The hotel is now dated and somewhat dingy. Even the bath towels were dingy.  I wish I had chosen the Hyatt next door.  Much more elegant and also has a bridge across the highway; much safer.  Breakfast was small buffet, boring. Similar to a Comfort Inn type of motel. Service at the restaurant was ok.  I will not stay here again.

The hotel is a gorgeous property but don't let the advertising fool you where they say every room has a full view of the ocean.  This is not accurate!  We paid extra for a full sunset view but we had to lean out of the balcony to actually see it!  The rooms are clean and the staff for the most part were excellent!  The restaurant is limited in choices and very pricey!  However, the food was excellent.  We ate at the restaurant for 6 days straight and asked about reservations for Christmas Eve and were told it wasn't necessary.  When we arrived to eat dinner....you guessed it, there were no tables available.  We sat in the bar to eat and the manager said he would take care of our bill but he did not!  However, he took care of the couple next to us which didn't sit well with

Summary Heading: Phenomenal Resort and Staff - Best Stay of My Life
Summary: My recent stay at the Waterfront Beach Resort in Huntington Beach was sheer perfection.  Every member of the staff made my husband and I feel extremely welcome.  As to our room itself, we had an 180 degree view of the Pacific Ocean, the room was spotless, and the bed was exceptionally comfortable.  Additionally, the resort was breathtaking.  The marble flooring and spiral staircase in the lobby are second to none.  The grounds were expertly landscaped and maintained.  Not only would I recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Huntington Beach but my husband and I are already planning to stay there in February.  I know you will enjoy your stay there as much as we enjoyed ours!

I went along with my sister who went to a huge conference in Hyatt next door, to do some R&R on the beach and shopping. Overall I quite enjoyed the stay, the hotel looks nice and almost on the beach, the rooms are comfy, reasonably clean and the beds are great, that´s for sure. However I got really annoyed by the fact that you pay extra for everything else, even the things I consider basic. I don´t understand why in 21st century you pay 13$ daily for internet that is even not that fast, 14$ for reasonable breakfast and the valet parking in such an expensive hotel. Also the front desk staff wasn´t the most helpful, I experienced much better even in lower class hotels. Luckily we weren´t paying for the rooms ourselves, if we did, we would be plain dissapointed.

Summary Heading: A good location for a holiday at the Huntington beach
Summary: Only the Coastal Highway separates the Hilton from the Huntington Beach.  You can hire bikes and ride on the paved bike/pedestrian ways along the ocean f.ex. to New Port Beach and Balboa. The beach was at the end of September rather quiet, perfect for long walks and sunbathing, as well. From the hotel it is maybe a 10 minutes´ walk to the "centre" of Huntington beach with restaurants and shops.  The hotel itself is nice, the rooms spacious enough and very clean. From the upper floors you have nice views. The pool area is also nice, but during our stay it was occupied on two afternoons by private weddings, and thus closed for the other guests. This was not very relaxing, and the preparations started already in the morning with chair arrangements etc. There is a place particularly

Summary Heading: This is a first class, family friendly hotel with a great beach experience.
Summary: We have been bringing our family to the Hilton Watrefront for years and it is our "go to" beach spot. The hotel has great amenities, the front desk, room- service and housekeeping staff are alway freindly and provide great service. We are impressed that we see the same staff members over the years, which tells us they treat their employees well. Miles of clean sand beaches and and paved boardwalk are right across the street from the hotel.Great walking and bike rentals. Balconies have great views of Hunington Pier and the ocean. This Hilton has really good mattresses so we always sleep well. We order a lot from Room Service and it is always good and delivered quickly. There are also a bunch of great restaurants in HB and Newport as well. This Hilton has always given us a great

Summary Heading: Obstructed Ocean Views:  Construction Site & RV Park & Oil Rigs
Summary: The hotel is nice, somewhat friendly service. The beds are fabulous.  We went to this hotel for great sunset ocean views and leisure time by the pool.  The unfortunate experience we had was that they had events by the pool four out of the five days we were there.  They clear away the chairs in that area, the ones that face the ocean view and get the afternoon sun.  They had two weddings on the Saturday we were there and corporate events:  buffet and tables right by the pool.  In eating at the hotel restaurant, you are viewing these events...no getting away from them.  One thing I did not realize before going to this hotel, but is good information is they allow dogs/cats.  The beach is beautiful along the boardwalk and you can give hotel restaurant a miss by going into town about

This hotel is located very close to the beach in Huntington Beach. The hotel is in walking distance to down town Huntington Beach with a nice selection of restaurants different levels. The hotel offres nice rooms with a great view to the sea. I'd recomment to book a sunset romm as this gives the best view with Huntington Beach bridge. Breakfast and dinner in the restaurant in the hotel is very good. The pool is nice and staff very helpful and proactive. Hotel parking is quite high. A great place for holidays even if the prices are quite high.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, super friendly staff, great location.
Summary: We stayed there for the second time and had the same overall nice experience. The welcome was exceptionally warm although the room key machine had stopped working so the bell boy had to bring new guests to their rooms many, many times that day (and was still smiling and laughing). The pool area is not very big but nice, the gym could be improved (some machines are out of order) but is sufficient for a halfway decent workout. Running or walking along the beach is better anyway :). It's only a 2 minute walk to the beautiful and never crowded beach and you can rent bicycles and go on nice rides to Newport Beach etc. Valet parking is expensive as in most hotels but the staff are very efficient and helpful!  It' a very quiet hotel and the room was nice and clean. We'll definitely be

We stayed here because we were going to Disneyland, but still wanted to be beach accessible and "vacation" like.  It was the closest beach to Disneyland.  It is a great location and beach, unfortunately the weather wasn't "typical" California weather.  The hotel itself is right on Pacific Coast Highway and just a 10 minute walk to Main Street, Huntington Beach.  Comfortable, relaxing atmosphere.  There is a nice pool and gym at the hotel.  The rooms are clean and spacious and all have balconies with views of the beach.  We stayed in a King room with sunrise view.  The hotel staff were friendly but not very helpful when it came to options/suggestions to getting around (ie. Disneyland and South Coast Plaza)  We didn't rent a car because I don't really want to deal with the stress

I have mixed feelings about the hotel after our recent stay.  We went for a business conference, and had no problem checking in or getting to our room.  Staff was pretty friendly and attentive.  The room was amazing - not a single complaint, and it was beautiful.  Not sure if it was worth the $250 a night my company paid, but the room was really nice.  The king bed was wonderful.  There was plenty of space to do work with and plenty of space to lounge around, and the decorations were beautiful.  Didn't even consider room service; the menu was outrageously overpriced.  (Drinking one of the bottles of water will set you back $7) Our company had a breakfast and a lunch here ($30 and $50 a plate) that were mediocre and way overpriced.  The ballrooms/meeting rooms we met in were

Summary Heading: This is a friendly, comfortable hotel.
Summary: Our room was clean & nicely decorated.  The bed was very comfortable which is vey important to us.  The balcony was large enough to sit & enjoy the busy beach scene.   We were disappointed that they still charge for wireless.  The restaurant is quite noisy & the service a bit slow but the food (we only had one lunch there) was pricey but delicious!    All in all we would stay there again. Every employee we met was friendly & helpful.

I don't think this place is worth the money you pay for it. Rooms are clean and have good mattresses, but the furniture is dated. Charging for internet is so 1990s. They even charge by minute if you use their business room (in addition to per page printing charges and such). The restaurant menu was bare minimum and I did not like whatever I ordered. Tastes were very bland. Also no option of self parking. So basically you pay 24$ for parking and then in addition have to tip the valets everytime you get your car in and out. It is a wannabe 4 star place, but it is not really one. Service of the employees in general was good though. If internet/business room was free and if it had self parking option at a reasonable price (like 15$ per day) I would have given this hotel 4 stars.

Summary Heading: Ok beachfront spot...some weird experiences, though.
Summary: Nice hotel, was traveling on business so the cost didn't bother me, although I'd definitely opt for the Hyatt next door if I was traveling to HB for personal reasons. Our conference was there, and thought its a HUGE property, it is far nicer than the Hilton.    Totally agree with soccer21's review about the strict security at the pool. We'd been there for four days and on a redeye the last night so we got a late checkout and were killing time by the pool. Within 5 minutes of sitting down at the completely empty pool (it was 4:30pm on a Friday) we were approached by the extremely abrasive security guard and questioned like criminals. I understand and appreciate keeping non-guests out of the pool area, but I have stayed at many upscale properties that have been able to manage that

Summary Heading: I think we bought home bed bugs from this place
Summary: By review originally would have been this:  great location, great beach, small-ish pool, nice staff, somewhat noisy rooms.  Overall, 3-4 starts.  However, we are pretty sure that we bought home bed bugs with us from this hotel.

Summary Heading: Well maintained place right on the beach...
Summary: Well maintained place right on the beach - well just across the coastal highway but that's as close as they get. The HB pier is a ten minute walk up the beach.   Spring for an oceanfront room. They're a bit larger and the view is great.

Summary Heading: A nice stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort
Summary: My family of 4 just returned from a 2 night stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  We loved the location just across the street from the beach.  We had a room with a sunrise view, and enjoyed sitting on the balcony watching the beach.  The room was spotless and a good size, although it was a little crowded for us as we had a roll away bed--with an additional fee per night-- in the room too.  We ate dinner once at Shades restaurant and enjoyed both the food and the atmosphere of the restaurant.  We also had breakfast there twice, once ordered off the menu and the second time had the buffet, both were good. Many restaurants, the pier, and Main Street with its shops are all within walking distance.  A great location and nice hotel.  We would stay here again.

The Hilton Waterfront is beautiful, clean, friendly, and accommodating. Our room was very comfortable with ocean and pool views. Could watch sunsets from our balcony, and fire dancers around the pool. To turn on the lamp, just tap it on the base. Very convenient.  Hilton offers free shuttle to Main Street, although you can walk it if you choose.   One night went to Shades Restaurant for $5 Happy Hour items.  Small plates with incredible flavors. Enjoyed gouda cheese plate, crab cake, and trio of skewered items.  Jesse the bartender was very friendly and hospitable.  Next night had dinner at Shades.  Scallops in lemon and coriander oil with risotto.  Best scallops ever.  Also had filet mignon and ribeye that were outstanding.  Breakfast there on Sunday was also excellent.
Manager Response: Dear AZMon, Thank you for the great feedback regarding your stay here at the Waterfront Beach Resort. I appreciate all the detail in your review and will be sharing with my staff. It was so nice to hear that you had a wonderful stay. Congratulations on winning our promotion, we hope to see you again here soon!

Summary Heading: Very expensive, with constant supervision by secret service like pool guard
Summary: The location was nice, and the hotel/restaurant staff were polite overall. What bothered me was the pool security guard. You pay 400 dollars for a room and they have like a secret service guy hassling you and your kids the whole time you are by the pool ("Are you staying here? What's your room number?") He comes and puts his hand up very aggressively in your face, then you want to leave the pool and just go to your room, and then you start thinking, "why did I pay for such a nice hotel when I can't leave the room and go to the pool because they have this intimidating guy?"  I felt like I was in a police hotel, which is not a vacation feel.
Manager Response: Dear soccer21 Thank you for writing a review about the Waterfront Beach Resort.  I want to thank you for taking the time to come on tripadvisor and share your experience. Our goal is to ensure every guest has an exceptional stay and it seems as though we fell a little short during your visit. I apologize for the security issue, unfortunately we were having people coming from downtown trying to use our pool.  We want to ensure that our facilities stay open and are strictly for guests so that guests like yourself can enjoy all we have to offer.

Summary Heading: Overpiced and a bit away from the downtown, but a nice place
Summary: This place will set you back 300 plus on a regular basis. This is a lot for a hotel that is nice, but, you can get a lot more for your money elsewhere, or through Priceline/Hotwire in the area, for less.   It is a bit of a hike, although not terrible, from the downtown fun stuff to eat/drink/shop at.   Rooms are fine, but not 300+ dollars fine. Not at all. Nor is the service, which is average at best. Breakfast was over 20 minutes late and it needed a call to see where it was.   Pool is awfully small for the # of rooms as well. Bar in the hotel is nice, and this is a good family type place. However it would be quite expensive for a family, and I could see someone getting a much better bang for their buck elsewhere. Wouldn't call this a spot for romance either. It is recommended
Manager Response: Dear GlendaleCA Thank you for writing a review about the Waterfront Beach Resort.  I want to thank you for taking the time to come on tripadvisor and share your experience. Our goal is to ensure every guest has an exceptional stay. I am disappointed to read that you do not feel we are worth the price. Please accept my sincerest apologies for a visit that did not meet your expectations.

Summary Heading: Not what I had hoped for......
Summary: My husband and I booked a night at the Hilton for our anniversary in hopes of a romantic night away from the kids. Maybe my expectations were too high however I was definitely disappointed.  The Good Stuff: 1. Location - it is an easy walk to downtown and beach. 2. View from room - almost all rooms have a great view The Bad Stuff: 1. Room Service - I tried to order room service and was told the wait would be 1 1/2 to 2 hours - I explained no cooking just wanted some ice cream, they said no difference. I would have expected better. 2. Too many teen's and kids for a romantic getaway. We tried to use the VERY small hot tub and it was overrun with teenagers. 3. Noise Level - You can hear what is going on all around you the walls and doors are very thin.  Very disturbing a disruptive.

Summary Heading: Very good, 11 years ago, and still today.  Clean and great location
Summary: Loved the waterfall at the entrance.  The female desk clerk who checked us in was adamant that it was a non-smoking hotel.  Our room was lovely, very clean and spacious.  It had a coffee maker (Lavazza coffee) two robes, flat screen TV and desk, mini couch w/ ottoman.  I had morning coffee on the lanai which was very peaceful!  Our room near the elevator was very noisy and it was a 3-day holiday, but that was expected as the hotel was full.  The sink water was very hot very quickly, and we loved the desk chair which was very comfortable.  A big thank you to Andrew who got me coffee before the 6:30 am table was set up downstairs.

Summary Heading: No Worries when staying @ this property!
Summary: My husband and I were nervous about staying at this property... mostly because of a recent review about bed bugs. However, we had the hotel already booked and it was too late to change hotels, so we decided to test it out ourselves...First and foremost, this hotel showed absolutely no signs of bed bugs (trust me, we looked!)  The room was clean, comfortable and we had a beautiful view of Huntington Beach.  We also loved how warm the outdoor pool was! We are already planning our next trip to CA and we KNOW that we will be staying at this property when we return. If there ever was an issue with cleanliness, we never seen any signs of it!
Manager Response: Dear Sarparker, Thank you for your kind words regarding your stay here at the Waterfront Beach Resort. It is so nice to hear that you had a great experience with us.  Thank you so much for staying with us and we hope to see you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Amazing location, beautiful resort and excellent service.
Summary: Last month, I stayed at Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort for 2 nights while traveling for business.  From the moment I walked in the door the service was impeccable.  My room was spotless and the bed was incredibly comfortable.  The amenities at this resort were great as well and perfect for squeezing in a few minutes to myself, including an oceanfront pool and workout room.  I ate at Shades Restaurant and Bar a few times during my stay, and the food was absolutely amazing and fresh. I would absolutely recommend this resort to anyone traveling on business or leisure!

Please DO NOT stay at this hotel. My fiance's brother and his wife woke up to severe bed bug bites. They saw a doctor immediately after we got from vacation, who confirmed it was bed bugs. We actually got to see ten or twelve of these guys crawling around their bedding, too bad it was after they had slept a full 8 hours. The manager took about 15 minutes to come to the room and seemed to care less. He refunded our room charges (yes, we paid for valet!) and offered free breakfast...like we would want to eat there after that! We have since emailed the general manager. Bed Bugs travel, our luggage and clothing was ruined and tossed because we didn't want them to infest our homes. I adore the Hilton family of hotels, but this is just uncalled for. These bed bugs were large enough to
Manager Response: Dear SweetAmy218, I have been in correspondence with your fiance's brother and his wife with regards to this matter. We take great pride in the success of our property and our Housekeeping team has an exceptional track record. I sincerely regret how thier experience may have impacted the time they spent with us. The Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort has an impeccable reputation and your continued loyalty and patronage to Hilton Hotels is very much appreciated.

Summary Heading: Great location in Huntington Beach area
