Summary: We stayed a couple nights in Huntington Beach after a trip to Disneyland. We wanted a relaxing time at the beach in a place that also had a pool. The view was very nice (we chose a northern view)- but as with most CA properties, the hotel is across the street from the beach. Location-wise, this is exactly what we wanted (to be close to the beach). The hotel's also close to Main street which has lots of shops and places to eat. The kids really enjoyed the nice-sized, heated pool. We were able to borrow towels and take them to the beach, as well. The room was a good size (I didn't think it was small as one reviewer stated) with a balcony. The bathroom wasn't large and there is no separate shower - but the toiletries were nice. Three annoying things: 1) you have to pay for

Summary Heading: Great View - small rooms and uncomfortable beds
Summary: We stayed 1 night (Sat night) for Easter. We asked for a king bed with a sofa sleeper, but they do not have sofa sleepers. They do have a roll away (twin) which for a 15-yrs old high school student is rather small. We opted for the double/double. We were on the top floor. The view was great. The room was really small. The beds were not comfortable. The service was great!  They did not have an executive floor (we are HHonors Diamond members), but we received 3 - $14.00 off coupons for breakfast, (or free cold continental breakfast) and 20% off dining at the Shades Restaurant. Breakfast was very good and for the 3 of us after the coupons (did the hot buffet), was $21.00. I would stay here again only for the location to the beach.

Summary Heading: A fabulous and beautiful place to stay!
Summary: We stayed at the resort from March 14- 20, 2010.  When we arrived our room was ready for check-in.  It was emmaculate and beautiful with a gorgeous view of the ocean.  The bathroom was very clean and spacious.  The beds are so comfortable.  The pool is relaxing, warm and very clean as is the jacuzzi pool  There are plenty of lounge chairs and fresh towels all the time.  The staff is so courteous and friendly and helpful.  They could not do enough for us. We needed to do laundry during our trip and they even provided the soap at no charge.  The complimentary shuttle to Main St. is so nice and convienent.  The Concierge staff was always available and went out of their way to find things for us to do.  The only negative would be that the restaurant is very pricey and the food is

The rooms are kept to the Hilton high standards and the views are great from almost every room" I suggest the Sun Set room". Only down falls are the outrageous bar prices " 10-11 $ a drink", parking is a heavey at $24.00 dollars a day.  Food prices are also alittle high but you can live with them.  Due to high bar prices we ate downtown on the strip and found alot of nice pubs walking distance from the resort. If the Hilton brought the drinks down to something in the 5-6 $ range like downtown I would recommend this hotel on your next stay.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for service and style
Summary: I was here for 2 nights on a work trip and have to say I was very impressed by the overall standard of the hotel.  I have stayed in other Hiltons and usually find them to be very 'samey' ............ what I mean is that a Hilton in Thailand could be anywhere in the world!  However, the style and design of this hotel is lovely.  It has a very touchy/feely aspect to it with great detailing in the surrounding.  Plush decor, intelligent lighting, lovely ambience, beautiful views over the beach etc etc.  The resturaunt food is to die for!  I had the salmon one evening and would highly recommend it.  The only downside (not really a problem) is the so called beach front location.  There is a very busy road between the hotels and the beach on this stretch.  The Hyatt down the road has

Nice clean rooms, great ocean views from every room. Only complaints are the outrageous fees for parking and internet. 24 Dollars a day mandatory valet parking. The internet is 13 dollars per day. We had 3 laptops and had to pay for each one. They do not give you an internet code to share per room. Their internet attaches cookies to your pc and remembers you or however they do it.

We stayed for 4 nights in January 2010.   The staff was excellant.  Very good front desk staff, concierge, and valet service.  We were disappointed in the high cost of internet service and the high priced restaurant.  We were most surprised that the room fridge filled with extremely over priced goodies had a SENSOR in it.  We pulled things out and joked around about how much they cost, and then put them back.  All the item touched were on our bill!   We complained and the extra charges were removed.  It also provided costly over night parking of our rental car, and all services in the business center came with a fee.
Amazing service, beautiful and ultra convenient location, across the street from Huntington Beach and down the road from downtown Huntington shopping and dining.

Summary Heading: the ultimate chill out hotel in the ultimate chill out town
Summary: A great setting with great staff is the first thing to say.  We've stayed here and the Hyatt.  Whilst the Hyatt has more modern rooms, the Hilton exceeds it in terms of service and atmosphere.  Having dinner by the superb firepit is really a holiday show-stopper.  The restaurant is so laid back and the food is really first rate.  (In fact I'd say the restaurant really is better than most "hotel" restaurants".)  The pool is beautiful if slightly on the small side. The hotel staff couldn't do enough for us.  They sorted us a late check out to meet our flight home.  Will definitely go back!

We stayed at the Hilton, October 20-27, 2009. We loved it. This is a beautiful hotel. From the Lobby to the Guestrooms. The staff is wonderful, extremely helpful, always available to assist in anything you need 24/7.  Complimentary coffee available 24/7 in the Lobby. Our room was on the 10th floor on the "sunrise" side of the building. Every single morning, we awoke to bright sun pouring in our room overlooking the beautiful Huntington Beach. Each morning we could see all the surfers in the ocean. The room is totally equiped with coffee maker, hair dryer, water, HD LCD tv, free USATODAY! The bathroom is spacious. The beds were very comfortable but they are not queen size only full. We called to see if we could get queen beds but they only had full and king and a limited number

Summary Heading: Amazing room with great service and view!
Summary: Our family of four stayed in the one bedroom deluxe suite for you stay of four nights. You walk in and there is a full bathroom to your right and to your left a doorway leading to an extra bedroom if you choose to add on extra bedroom. You continue to walk in thru the hallway and there is a living area then a dining area. The large tv swivels so you can view it from anywhere.  In the living/dining area there is a mini fridge, sink and large wet bar area. There is a large bedroom area with minibar area and large mirror. There was a large closet area also. THe bathroom has a big tub and nice 5 piece shower. There are 3 large balconies which had amazing views of the ocean and pool area. This room was very comfortable for our family and worth the extra money.  The pools are nice. I

We stayed here on our last night of a week long trip to California.  I wish we would have stayed here the whole time.  My three year old walked into the room and said, "this is a MAJOR hotel" and she was right!  : )  We had a huge suite for 4 people, with a deck that overlooked the ocean.  The rooms were stunning and how great to just walk across the street and be at the ocean.   The only downside is that there was only one restaurant at the hotel and I thought the prices were outrageous.  However, there are a ton of restaurants a couple of blocks away and the Hilton offers a free shuttle.

Summary Heading: nice hotel, but why not stay next door?
Summary: i stayed at the hilton waterfront for a conference, and it was a pretty decent hotel, right across the street from the beach.  room was in good condition, staff and valets were friendly and informative.  problem is that the amenities weren't quite up to par with the hyatt right next door.  the pool was smaller than i'd hoped.  only one restaurant in the hotel, though is walking distance to main st and the pier.  parking is a mandatory $24 valet per night, with nowhere near to park on the street without paying meters as well.  they charged me for an extra night too, which i had reversed 2 weeks later.  overall a decent stay, but if i had to return i'd stay at the hyatt which was a monstrous property with shops, spa, and gave you the real 'resort' feel.

Summary Heading: Nice but expensive - and everything costs more money, even parking!
Summary: The hotel rooms were really nice. We stayed there for my friends' wedding and the beds were super comfortable. But it costs $24 a day to park there and they are not helpful to tell you where else you might park. If you go out the driveway to the left, and then take your first right. Go 2 blocks and there's tons of easy neighborhood parking. We left the car there all weekend and it was fine. Also, the breakfasts are $14 for a bagel and some cereal. My parents stayed at the Ramada Inn and while it's not as exciting, it was 1/2 the price. It all depends on what you're looking for!

We ended our wedding day at this hotel and i was very pleased with the choice of hotel! i had ordered a couple small bottles of champagne with chocolates and fruit and we were also given a full bottle of champagne on the house. it actually turned out that we received it all free out of the kindness of the staff so we were ever so thankful. we had a sunset room and the view of Huntington Beach pier was lovely. We didn't get to use many of the facilities or restaurant but they all looked very good and to the usual high Hilton standard. we really enjoyed our stay here and as such would totally recommend staying here.

We stayed a week.  The location is great, right across the street from the beach and just south of the pier.  They have everything you need to go to the beach-towels, boogie boards, chairs, toys, beach bags.  Staff is very nice and responded to every request we made.  We had a room overlooking the HB pier, view was great.  Two full beds, and kind of small overall but definitely recommend it.  Clean, beds were very comfortable and we didn't spend much time there anyway. If you want to go to HB this is a great choice.  Internet isnt free, but we were using points so I called and they gave me the code.  If you are staying here, you should be at the beach instead of the internet anyway! Hilton has great pics on their website.

I do not think "resort" is a fitting title.  Nice property with spectacular views of the water and sunsets indeed, it simply is not what you'd expect from a "beachfront resort."  It is VERY low-key, which is not necessarily a problem, but if you're expecting the typical resort atmosphere and amenities, you will be disappointed.  This is a far smaller version of other Hilton properties, and definitely "sleepier".  I suppose the atmosphere is in keeping with the general feel of the block it is located on, which is shared with the Hyatt (a monstrous property that definitely embodies the concept of "beachfront resort").  The pool is *very* small (picture a little bit bigger than a residential pool) and the cabanas, which cost $100, are not even the remotest bit private or staffed,

Hilton Waterfront was a excellent surprise weekend getaway.  I do suggest too everyone!! Make sure you try to book a Oceanview  Sunset room.  Room 1010 or any oceanview sunset  room its the way to go.  From the time we arrived to the time we left, the customer service was a 5 Star rating, nothing less.  The room service  for dinner was excellent, the Sunday Breakfast  donstairs  was excellent..  Don't forget there is plenty of shopping  and places to eat within walkiing distance or you can take the hotel shuttle, ask the valet person.  On Main Street one block try Hunington Beach Beer Company upstairs, excellent food and Mircobrew.  Don't forget to try Dukes right across the street on Main street, excellent indoor tiki bar.

Summary Heading: Beautiful California Sunset right in your room
Summary: The view at this hotel can't be beat.  You are in a high rise right at the beach in the middle of Huntington Beach.  Surf City USA.  This place has the ideal location for a day at one of the most famous beaches in world and some of the best ammenities.

We were thrilled when we were able to make our 1 night reservation into a 2-night stay-at the height of the US Open of Surfing! Thank you to Jonathan in reservations!  Even though it was a busy busy time for the sold-out hotel, we were greeting with smiles and professional, friendly help with parking, bags, and check-in.  Having travelled in Laguna Beach area, I was expecting some snobbiness, but so relieved at how friendly EVERYONE was.  The sunrise-ocean view room on 5th floor was a great size, great view.  My family of 2 big teenagers was very comfortable and happy.  Convenient walking distance to beach, pier, downtown area.  Besides the choices at the hotel, I recommend Lughatti's Italian Grill (yum calamari) and Ruby's on the Pier(go early for Breakfast and great views!!).

I have had the pleasure of staying at the Huntington Beach Hilton many times over the years. I have had no problem with any type of service from any of the hotel staff members, they have always been very professional. I love the room design, since they remodeled them a few years ago. I like the room layout of most of the rooms, the sunrise and the sunset rooms layouts are great but I don’t really like the layout of the full ocean view rooms. The location is good but it is unfortunate that the hotel is not oceanfront and right on the beach, as PCH runs between the hotel and ocean. I have stayed at the adjacent Hyatt Resort as well and although the Hyatt has more amenities (like the full spa that I use), I prefer staying at the Hilton due to the height of the building thus

Stayed for one week, everything was excellent.  Check in was flawless, and we were able to check in three hours before regular check-in time with no hassles.  We had an "oceanfront" room with two double beds.  Great balcony, with a direct view of the ocean looking out over Huntington Beach and Pier.   Only glitch in the whole stay was the A/C went out on our second day, but no problem, we were immediately given another room and were given assistance with our bags.  My only recommendation for the room would be to have an easy chair - the only chair in the room was the desk chair.  Other than that, the room was great.  Only parking option was valet at $24 per night - a bit steep, but seems to be pretty standard at upscale hotels in the LA area.  Great pool area, easy walk right

Summary Heading: Quick visit - wish I could have stayed longer
Summary: A nice clean hotel, just away from the centre, but right on the beach. I was only there for one night, but will go back with wife and daughter, as I  loved huntington beach. The beach camp fires looks great fun!!
Stayed here for one night in June. Great location, great ocean view from my room. Check-in process was fast. Room was clean and modern. I would definitely stay here again.

My family any myself decided to stay at the Hilton waterfront after a previous ok stay at the Hyatt down the street. After we got here the power went out, they forgot to bring our bags up to the room. After the power went back on half the plugs didn't work. That was nothing compared to waking up the next morning and finding my wife and daughter scratching like crazy. I realized the were bit by bed bugs. They got bit all over there back and legs. I wore my sweats so I didn't get bit. I cant believe this would happen in  a "luxury hotel". The front desk to a very casual attitude towards this. I definately would not stay her again. 300$ + rate are you kidding! Shame on you Hilton.
Manager Response: Dear Vegas531363,  Thank you for sharing your recent experience at the Hilton Waterfront.  We appreciate you bringing the bed bug incident to the Front Desk.  Our Housekeeping management is very skilled in the prevention and detection of bed bug infestation, and our manager immediately inspected your room upon your departure.  We are pleased to report no findings of any bed bug, as we have never had an outbreak in the history of our property. What we believe may have been the source of the bites was mosquitoes.  We have found when the guest room balcony sliders are left open or opened frequently, insects may enter your guest room.  We are sorry that you and your family encountered the rare occurrence and we were glad to discount your room rate for the inconvenience.  We have attempted to contact you by phone to follow up and we have been unsuccessful in reaching you, please contact us at your convenience.    Thank you again for bringing this matter to our attention.  We appreciate your comments and hope to welcome you back to the Hilton Waterfront in the very near future.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: It started with, You have to pay daily to park even when u are staying in the hotel.  The SO-CALLED free breakfast wasn't. The full-ocean view was the side of another building. THE HOT TUB WAS BROKEN MY ENTIRE 5 NIGHT STAY.
Manager Response: Dear Kujo2,  Thank you for your feedback.  You do us a great service by taking the time to comment on your stay.  It is through concerned guests, such as yourself, that we gain insight into areas of our business that require attention.  While we appreciate your taking the time to provide an account of your experience, we are very sorry that it was necessary for you to do so.  We do hope you will accept our apologies for your disappointment in our hotel.  Thank you once again for your comments.  Management

Summary Heading: Really expensive for what you get
Summary: Of course since we stayed during the 3rd of July, we had the jacked up rates of $340+ a night, in addition to the $75/night pet fee and $24/night valet fee.  Definitely not for value weekend.  However, the room was clean with a nice balcony with the view of the ocean, wonderful sunsets.  The service was mediocre, because after paying the pet fee, they should have brought up the bed/dish as promised but didn't.  The pool is ok, pretty average with a small hot tub that at every moment had about 10 people in it. It looked like they had some nice amenities for kids and it is perfect, since it is directly across the street from the beach, however they charge for beach cabanas at $100+ per day when it should have been included like most beach hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Jen from LA,  Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay.  We were pleased to know that you selected the Hilton Waterfront to celebrate the holiday weekend.  As with most hotels located on the ocean, over a holiday weekend, our rates do increase.  We are sorry that you did not feel value for the price paid.  We at the Hilton Waterfront, feel value is important to our guests and that is why we offer many complimentary services to our guests, such as live poolside entertainments every weekend, complimentary use of beach chairs, boogie boards, umbrellas, sand toys, complimentary morning Lobby coffee, free children’ activities such as airbrush face painting, story hour and arts and crafts.  Our pet fee has been implemented to ensure guests traveling with their pet can enjoy all the services the hotel has to offer.  The majority of the $75 pet fee is used to purchase bio-degradable doggie waste bags, pet bowls, pet beds and a very thorough and deep cleaning effort of the guest room.  All fabric items are removed from the guest room and professionally cleaned, as well as the carpet and walls.  As you can imagine, this is a very expensive effort but we feel it is important that guest who wish to travel with their four legged furry friend can.  We are proud to be one of two hotels in Huntington Beach that is pet friendly. We are sorry that you did not receive the bowl and bed as promised; this oversight has been brought up to our staff for prevention of a future occurrence.   One again, thank you for your comments.  It would be our pleasure to be of service to you again in the future should you be kind enough to give us the opportunity.  Sincerely,   Management

Summary: My 11 year old son and I stayed here over Easter break. The hotel is just as I remembered it, having stayed about 10 years prior. The room was very comforatable, the view was awesome and the room service and food was very good; albeit extremely expensive. Nice "in and out" valet service, which we availed ourselves of every day. Walked across the street to the beach almost every day and picked up shells. Balcony was the perfect size for 2 or 3. The service was great; the front desk staff were very helpful. I enjoyed this hotel very much and would stay here as well as the Hyatt next store. The Hyatt is a little nicer, but then it's newer.

I stayed at this hotel one night with my boyfriend in April 2009. The only downside is that we only stayed one night! When we arrived, the staff was very efficient and our bagages were quickly brought to our room. The bed was large and very comfortable, the room was modern and clean with a balcony with view on the water. The hotel is very well situated, its only a short walk, by the water, to the center of town where you can find many cute restaurants and bars. In the morning we had room service for breakfast, which we enjoyed on our balcony. I cannot find anything negative to say about this hotel, I will come back next time I come to Huntington Beach!

Summary Heading: This place has gone down hill fast.
Summary: My family and I have come here for the past several years with a couple of other families.  This year we find a new "valet only" parking with no self parking option.  You have to be accompanied to your car even to retrieve a single item.  Then they start this new "Therapy Sunday" which ends up being this huge loud party from 2:00 to 7:30 PM that encompasses the entire facility.  The place was packed with young drunk people all day and the music was unreasonably loud.  It became apparent that we, the hotel guests were disregarded the entire day as we had to surrender the pool area, restaurant and lobby to a bunch of young, half naked drunk kids.  After feeling we were held captive in our rooms as not to expose our children to all the inappropriate behavior, we finally decided we
Manager Response: Dear nomorehilton ,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review about your recent stay.  Many of our guests, such as yourself, were either directly or indirectly impacted by the events that transpired at our pool, and we want to apologize for the offensive behavior of the attendees at the "Therapy Sunday" pool party.  The initial presentation of the event by the event management company was for it to be an upscale pool party with high energy, but with a sophisticated crowd to include our hotel guests, so that our guests could enjoy the experience.  Obviously this was not the case and it quickly turned into a disaster which goes against our image and reputation as a family friendly destination and as a Hilton property.  As much pain as the event caused many of our guests, it too caused us an enormous amount of grief.  It has jeopardized our commitment to you and goes against our ethics and values as an organization.  At the conclusion of the event we terminated our agreement with the event planning company for any and all future events associated with our hotel . Had we known, we never would have considered a pool party at our location.  Once again, please accept our sincerest apology.  We regret this event ever occurred and do hope you will keep your annual tradition and give us another opportunity to regain your confidence and to demonstrate our concern for guest satisfaction.  Sincerely,    Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort Management

Summary Heading: Stunning Views, Excellent Service (but everything costs extra)
Summary: This was an exceptional hotel.  Greeted by name upon arrival, and upgraded without hesitation or extra charge to a waterview room.  Rooms are spacious, each with it's own balcony.  Hotel Concierge service is well above average.  Easily able to recommend an authentic, but inexpensive Chinese restaurant.  Also, readily planned an entire day of sightseeing in Los Angeles, complete with printed directions, estimated travel times, and more.    Must pay for internet - even in the lobby.  Also, as a Hilton Silver member, I am usually entitle to complementary water in my room, which this hotel did not provide.    Beautiful, relaxing, and classy.  Also, it's close to LA, but still outside the fray (and smog) of the big city.

We live in Palm Springs which is an easy 2 hour drive to Huntington Beach. We had read about the Huntington Dog Beach (www.dogbeach.org) and wanted to give it a try. The Hilton was amazingly open and friendly to us with the dogs. We had a beautiful room with a view of the coast (most of the rooms do) along with dog beds and treats. The dog beach is a treasure ... well maintained ... friendly folks with socialized dogs. It is very close to the Hilton. So...if you want to treat your dog to a fun time here is the recipe ... Hilton Huntington Beach ... Huntington Dog Beach and (most important!) finish at Dirty Dog Wash, 504 Main Street, Huntington Beach [--] ... Nick Gillespie will help to make your dog Hilton Hotel presentable after their visit to the beach. Have  fun !!
Great Location. Bicycle Rental. Surf Lessons. Pool. Beach across the road. Shopping within walking distance. Safe area. What more could you ask for.

Summary Heading: It was the worst experience at a Hilton--ever!
Summary: I was stunned, actually.  My husband and I travel out to Huntington Beach every year, and really wanted to try the Hilton.  Our first room that was assigned to us wasn't cleaned (beds were unmade, etc.), so we had to haul everything back down to the front desk.  The second room was fine...until the coffee maker exploded (literally), and I obtained a 2nd degree burn on my arm.  After requesting to speak to a manager three times throughout our stay, no one ever returned our calls, nor came to our room.  I finally had to call security to get first aid for my burned arm (front desk didn't answer)---and asked again to see a manager--to which NO ONE responded.  On our way out, we asked once more to speak to manager...to be told that "no one was available".  We will NEVER return to
Manager Response: Dear Couponcathy -   While feedback from our guests is always welcome and of significant value, we were disturbed by our failure to meet the high standards we strive to maintain and of which you have every right to expect at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  It seems that everything that could go wrong during your visit did go wrong, and for this, we offer our sincerest apologies.  We will not dwell on the specific reasons as to why we disappointed you at every turn.  We can assure you that we have addressed your comments with the managers of the departments involved.  If a positive side could be found in this, it would be that your input will have helped us to sharpen our policies and procedures to further minimize the possibility of a recurrence in the future.  We regret if this incident may have marred what would have otherwise been an enjoyable annual visit to Huntington Beach.  It would be our pleasure to be of service to you again in the future should you be kind enough to provide us with the opportunity.  Sincerely,  Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort Management

Summary: Traveled to SoCal to attend taping of The Price is Right with wife for our honeymoon.  Decided to stay away from the hustle and bustle and relax the evenings away.  Booked using some well saved Hilton points for 4 nights.  Once we arrived at the hotel, we were swept into a time-slowing relaxation.  Mentioned it was our honeymoon and the hotel staff did their best to make accomodations for us.  First night it was impossible to upgrade us due to the late check-in, but the front desk staff assured us that they would move us the next day and they certainly did.  We had a suite on the 9th floor that overlooked the beach, the pool, and the pier.  The wraparound porch was amazing and afforded us the views that you see in books and travel brochures.  The staff did their best the

This hotel is ideally located with a beautiful view of the ocean.  It is in walking distance to many restaurants and shops.  I cannot comment on the food as we did not eat at the hotel. Very comfortable beds.

My husband and I stayed one night for our anniversary trip all over socal. We arrived very early and were able to check into the room which was super nice so we didn't have to worry about our luggagfe and everything later. After telling the front desk it was our anniversary they put us on the 12th floor with amazing pier, ocean and pool views. The room was very clean and pretty. We walked across the street(PCH) to the beach and about half a mile to the pier and main street with all of the shopping. The view was beautiful at night. We spent alot of time on the balcony watching all the camp fires along the beach. The grounds and the lobby were beautiful. The pool was closed but from our room it looked really nice. This was our favorite hotel of the whole trip and we will definatly

Wonderful Staff, Great hotel & Location.  One of the best vacation experiences I've had.  The staff went above and beyond to help with our TV issue, even gave us a complimentary breakfast in bed for the trouble!  Management is doing a great job!

Summary Heading: My Favorite place to stay in OC!
Summary: I have now stayed here 2 times recently.  I love to try new places when possible, but when the plan was to go to Orange County for the night, I couldn't wait to stay at this HIlton again!  It's beautiful inside and out, has a great pool area, and uhh....right across the street from the beach!  The staff is ALWAYS nice and extremely helpful, the room is always perfect.  My only complaint would be the room service.  Both times we stayed here, when we ordered food, they were always out of something.  That was frustrating but the food was always delicious!  I love it here!
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback regarding recent stays at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  Guest Service is our number one goal, as we want to ensure our guests experiences are memorable. From the moment of arrival to the time of departure, we want to ensure that everything in between is a “Perfect 10”  We generally receive positive comments with regard to our room service, so we were disappointed by the experiences mentioned.  We appreciate this matter was brought to our attention, as we will properly address with our team to ensure that proper inventory is available to room service and all of our food outlets.    Once again, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention, as it is through concerned guests that we may be made aware of situations that might otherwise go unnoticed.  We look forward to welcoming our guests back to the Hilton Waterfront the next time travels bring you to Orange County.

Summary Heading: Terrific hotel, staff, location in Southern California
Summary: My husband and I recently stayed at this property for a birthday weekend celebration.  We have family in the area and chose this hotel based on proximity to their home and overall guest-satisfaction rating.  The hotel is large (conference-type hotel) and set across the PCH highway from the beach.  The beach access and pier are within easy walking distance.  There is a "Main Street" a short distance up the road (north), you could walk it on a nice day, that has shops, bars and many places to eat (high and low end).  On the last Friday of every month, Main Street closes off traffic and sets up for live music and vendors in the street.  This was a fun way to mingle with the locals!    Most of the hotel rooms have ocean view - as I was told - floors 4 and higher have better beach

Summary Heading: Doors slam loudly every time they close
Summary: This hotel has a lovely facility and location, but I was extremely disappointed with my experience there.  The first room I was assigned smelled strongly of cigarette smoke, despite the hotel's 100% non-smoking policy.  Then, once I was relocated to a better room, it was impossible to sleep because the hotel was so noisy.  The front doors to each room slam loudly every time they are allowed to close on their own, so I was hearing guests entering and exitting their rooms at all hours of the night, despite the ear plugs I use when sleeping.  I travel frequently for business and spent roughly 3 months of the last year in hotels, and this is the worst hotel experience I have had during that time.
Manager Response: Dear Flying Fish 21,  Thank you for providing feedback from your recent stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  We were sorry to ready about the disturbing factors which impacted your overall experience with us.  There is simply no excuse for the shortcomings you experienced with the cigarette smell of your guest room and the noise surrounding your guest room.  As we try hard to enforce a 100% non-smoking policy throughout the hotel, there is the occasional guest who does not adhere to the policy and smokes in the guest room.  Our Housekeeping team works extremely hard to cleanse the room of the cigarette smell.  We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, as we can work alongside our Housekeeping team to ensure that when an opportunity like this arises, we can immediately resolve the matter.   We realize how disturbing it must have been to be bothered by the sound of adjacent rooms and slamming doors.  Had this been brought to our attention, our Security team would have gladly assisted and asked the neighboring rooms to be respectful of the adjacent rooms,  The comfort of our guests is of our highest priority, but we are unable to correct areas of which we have not been made aware of.  We would like to express our appreciation for bringing these matters to our attention.  We are most concerned with the satisfaction of all of our guests and feedback such as yours is of great value to us.  This allows us to ensure and improve the quality of service we offer our future guests and it is our sincere hope that you will be among them, and allow us another opportunity to provide you with an experience more typical of the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  With regards,  Management

Summary: Went to Hilton for a family event.  Positves - Sales and catering staff and food, Restaurant has good food. Nice location to beach and downtown,  Not so good - bed was broken, hot water for bath/shower had problems. rooms are a little old. guy mowing in the morning right below our room. no self parking. only one place to eat at hotel.when explained to mgr. the broken bed problem only offered to cut rate in half. we did not sleep the first night. I prefer the Hyatt next door.
Manager Response: Dear Willbo,  Thank you for providing feedback from your recent stay at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  Please accept our deepest apologies for your disappointment in your overall stay with us.  We want to assure you that your experience is certainly not typical of the quality of service and hospitality we offer our guests.  There is absolutely no excuse for the condition of your bed and plumbing issues you experienced.  We pride ourselves on the constant upkeep of our guest rooms and preventive maintenance we perform on each of our guest rooms several times a year.  It therefore causes us great concern when something like this does happen.  You can rest assured that we have shared your comments with our Maintenance and Housekeeping team to ensure there are no further occurrences of this nature in the future.  Again, thank you for sharing your experience with us.  Candid comments from our guests are of great value to us as we continue to improve our overall enhancement of the guest experience.  Thank you,  Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort Mangagement

Summary: From start to finish, our experience at this hotel was fabulous. The hotel was impeccable and right on the beach, which afforded us the ability to be close to various attractions. The valet staff was exceptional. They even helped my husband find a tire pump for our bikes. The entire staff was exceptionally helpful. The rooms were gorgeous and had lovely views of the beach. We will definitely be staying here again!

Summary Heading: Nice Hilton property with great cuisine
Summary: Stayed at the Waterfront for 2 days for my wife's birthday. While the property is located in sunny California and right across from the beach, it is also surrounded by oil field installations and powerplants so if you want the view, just look straight at the ocean! I am a Gold VIP member and used points for my stay. Two breakfast coupons were included for use in the very nicely decorated Shades restaurant. Actually, the restaurant is the best part of the property. Overall, the Waterfront is quite small (at least compared to the Hyatt right next door). Shades offers very high quality, innovative cuisine and the service (we had breakfast and lunch) is excellent.  The rooms are clean and well-equipped thanks to a recent renovation. As others have noted, some parts of the hotel

My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort for a weekend after meetings in LA. We have stayed in the Huntington Beach area before - at both the Hyatt and the HIlton. Both are lovely hotels. The beach at HB is long and wide and there are paths to walk, run or ride a bike for miles and miles. We particularly like running along the paths.  The Hilton is a beautiful hotel with gorgeous artwork throughout the common areas. Our room was oceanfront- it was called an executive suite. We had a 300 degree view from our balcony that wrapped around the corner of the building. It was spectacular! There were fires all over LA this weekend and we could see them from our room. Plus we got the sunrise and the sunset every day- just incredible!  The employees are very friendly-

I stayed at this beautiful hotel the last week of August.  It was beautiful.  I had a  great room that over looked the pool and the beach.  The bed was comfortable and nice sheets.  I really liked that you could walk to "downtown" Huntington Beach from the resort.  I thought the staff was very polite.  The food in the restaurant was very good as well.  The only problem we had were some intoxicated patrons who were very loud late night hollering down our hallway....  A hotel rep did come and quiet the group down and I did not hear them anymore.

The hotel itself was excellent.  The room was very clean and the bed was great with nice, comfortable sheets and pillows.  The major disappointment was the location.  From the photos, it looked like you were actually on the beach but you aren't.  There's a street separating the beach from the rest of the resorts/hotels.  This is my first time coming to CA so I don't know if this is common or not but I was nonetheless disappointed.  I had a major snafu at the hotel's restaurant, "Shades".  It started out very well.  The bread (garlic-encrusted and olive-encrusted) and bread sticks were delicious with their non-traditional spread.  I'm not sure what was in it but it wasn't your usual butter/olive oil.  Even the Coke was good.  However, when the main entree came out, it went

Summary Heading: Excellent Location on beach, quiet but close to hustle/bustle
Summary: Though this hotel was a little pricey, we wanted to have an ocean front room and this fit the bill.  We were 8 floors up, so we could see over the trees and be a little further away from the busy street right in front of the hotel.  The room was elegant, comfy bed, etc.  The road noise quieted about 10pm.  It was a 10 minute walk to the pier where we had dinner at  Duke's on the Beach and coffee at Starbucks the next morning.  Parking was extra which I didn't appreciate.  We didn't use the pool or restaurants as we met friends at the pier.  There were wedding receptions and birthday parties so it was a busy hotel but that didn't bother us.  There was a live musician at the bar when we returned.  We would stay there again.

A king room, sunrise side, was available early, so they let us check in.  There's only valet parking at $24/day, and I informed management that their website needs to be updated (the website says the self parking is free).   We pretty much forgot about the parking fee when we walked into the hotel room:  his/her robes, high showerhead to go with the full-force shower, huge, thick towels, a very comfortable bed,  flat screen TV,  sofa with a large ottomon, and sensor night lights at the bottom of the night stands (pretty snazzy!) .  When you open the drapes, you see Huntington Beach out your window (see our photo attachment).  It was a wonderful choice to end our week of cruising before returning back to civilization the next day.

I was working in California and decided to extend for a few personal days. I booked a Hilton Honors reward stay for one night at Huntington Beach Hilton. (40,000 points). Arrival from LAX was easy I got off I-5 early and enjoyed a ride down Pacific Coast Highway. Parking is Valet, but I don't remember the cost. We were met at the door by, not one but two, Concierges who were very helpful. The young man behind the counter was extremely polite as he rewarded me with a great "Sunrise View" room -- as it turns out the better view is the "Sunset View" rooms - they have Huntington Beach Pier as a back drop. (One laugh about the SunSet side - there is a huge hole in the ground where it looks like they started building another hotel and stopped) One thing I have noticed about using

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a convenient location to see Orange County
Summary: My husband and I stayed in Los Angeles for the weekend and needed a place to stay for one day and evening before flying out early in the Orange County (SNA) airport.  We wanted something that gave us an ocean view, convenient location to both the SNA airport and to explore Orange County.  We thought it was perfect! Our king bed room had nice and clean rooms, well decorated and spacious, comfortable beds.   The service was great - everyone was so friendly and helpful (front desk, concierge, restaurant/bar staff, valet).  It is not directly on the beach, but across the street from it so you can see it from most all rooms.  It is not right in the middle of the Huntington Beach action (pier and promidade), but just a short distance down Pacific Coast Highway if that is where you

From the moment we arrived, the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.  We stayed 5 nights.  They shuttled us around to  local destinations and gave excellent directions for places we drove to ourself.  They made excellent recommendations for activities and services in town, such as a manicure & pedicure.  The bell & valet staff were always prompt ... never had to wait more than a minute or two, and they were there.  They definitely made the stay a great one.    The hotel is very clean and well maintained.   Valet parking is $24 a day with 7x24 in & out.  It is located directly across the street from a wide, clean, groomed beach, about 1/2 mile from the town of Huntington Beach.  It has a pool & hot tub with pleasant landscaping around it.    Our room, 918, overlooked
Hilton was absolutely great!  Room was spotless, the view was great!  Huntington Beach area is a great area!  Staff was friendly and very accomodating!

we got a deal on this hotel late may 2008. we had one night left in California and wanted visit Huntington beach, so I got on my laptop and Hot wire gave me the Hilton and a very good price, I got lucky.  the room was a tad bit small but he beds were very comfy and the bathroom was very tidy,we got a deck that viewed the ocean and that was very relaxing. the lobby was gorgeous and very presentable.   we went  into the heated pool later at night around 10pm and had a few drinks and hung out with a local the front desk  don't really mind as long as your relatively quite and respectful.  the guys went out to the bars which were only a walk away and  the area is Very safe. They both ended up losing their cards to get into the room and the front desk did not hassle to give them
Was a nice hotel near the beach, pier, and main street.

Summary Heading: A favorite hotel stay every time! Superb!
Summary: We have stayed here twice for four nights each time - once in March 2007 and once in March 2008. Management addresses guests by name and is professional, accomodating and first class in every way.  The hotel lobby is marble and glass with beautiful furnishings. The rooms are lovely, the beds VERY comfortable and many rooms have views of the Pacific Ocean. Their concierge does a great job arranging tours or dinner reservations or whatever one needs. The pool area is lovely and they serve food and drinks under the palm trees. Their breakfast is first class with many selections. Overall this is a wonderful resort to spend some time and enjoy the beach scene or just sit on your balcony and enjoy the sunset! It's within walking distance of the Huntington Beach Pier as well as

We just got back from a week at the Hilton Waterfront Beach Resort.  My husband was in the area for business so I went along with our 1-year-old baby.  Overall, we had a very nice time at the Hilton and in Huntington Beach.  We stayed on the 7th floor on the "sunrise" side of the building.  In hindsight, I would have preferred the "sunset" side because the light in the morning did make our baby want to wake up even with the dark curtains.  The hotel was very clean, and the room nicely appointed.  I had called ahead to reserve a crib for the baby (free) along with renting a fridge for the week ($30) to make my life easier.  They brought both up very promptly upon our check-in.  We got a lot of use out of the pool area and it was always relatively quiet and easy to find a chair.

Stayed at this hotel during trip along the west coast. It has good location right beside a surfing beach, and is well placed for disney(about 20min drive), universal or downtown L.A.. Hotel has good ameneties, pool is quite small but in nice surroundings.Rooms are a good size and nice and clean, balconys have good view of the beach/sea, restaraunt a bit formal with silver service but food very nice, i guess what you would expect from a Hilton.Would definitly recommend for good base or as a beachside hotel.

Summary Heading: Pricey Rooms But Nice View And Beach Access
Summary: We just returned from our stay in the LA / SD area, and chose The Hilton for our last night stay.  The Hilton is everything that you'd expect; luxurious, well-appointed, quiet, very comfortable in all regards including comfortable beds.  We had a small balcony with an sunrise, ocean view complete with surfers riding the waves but it was partially obscured by the palm trees, and rooms overlook the somewhat noisey Pacific Hwy and the Huntington Beach parking lot prior to the beachfront.  You can rent a fire ring and blankets for an evening beach fire.  The morning buffet breakfast was great, and they have covered outdoor seating which was wonderful.  Valet Parking was available at $22.  Overall a nice stay!

Pros: 1. Every room has a view of the beach. 2. The beach is easily accessible. 3. The staff is very nice and accomodating. 4. The rooms are adequate with adequate amenities. 5. The restaurant serves good food. 6. The pool is nice with plenty of lounge chairs.  Beach towels are provided. 7.  Room service is prompt.  Delivery person was very friendly. 8.  Maid service is friendly and does a great job! 9.  Free coffee with real half and half available in the lobby each morning along with a free newspaper.  Cons: 1.  I have never been to a restaurant with such incredibly slow service!  They have both poolside dining and inside dining.  We tried both.  It took AN HOUR to get the drink I ordered poolside and in the restaurant wasn't much better.  INSANE. 2.  Everything is incredibly

I frequently stay here when traveling on business.  This was the last  time I stayed.  This is a "high end" chain and resort so it is expensive.  When I was there, there was some problem with the parking.  They had started mandatory valet parking to space restrictions.  Several times it took way too long.  I made a comment on this.  The manager contacted me personally.  Apologized.  Credited my valet cost and told me she would make it up next time down.  I haven't been down since, but I gave decided to give my wife and her best friend a weekend there and the manager has bent over backwards to make it up.  This is what customer service is about.    I've never had any other problems with this hotel.  I love it

My wife and I stayed here for a weekend using Hilton points.  We had a room on the 9th floor which appeared to have been recently renovated.  It was all new with an LCD TV.   We had a balcony with a great view of the beach and ocean.  Note that the hotel is across the street from the beach, so there was a fair amount of traffic noise, but the view was great.  All rooms appear to have a balcony with an ocean view.   Our room was the farthest back from the beach, so as long as your up a few floors, even the worst view is awesome.    We stayed on the "sunrise" side of the hotel on the recommendation of the front desk clerk.  She told us about the construction on the "sunset" side of the hotel.  So even though the "sunset" side had a view of the pier and the sunset, immediately

I spent three nights at this hotel for a business trip and l had an enjoyable stay.  The hotel was beautifully presented, and right across the road from the beach and in close proximity to shops(note: the shopping options next to the hotel are pretty limited however  there is a huge shopping mall(south coast plaza) around 20 minute drive from the hotel-definately worth the trip).  Nice lobby area, good sized pool and decent sized clean rooms & bathroom.  The balcony offered great views of the beach & pier, and georgous sunset views.   The staff are extremely friendly, accomodating, professional and aim to please.   The food from the hotel restaurants was not the best however the service was good.  Overall, l had a very pleasant stay and would consider returning to this hotel in

Summary Heading: Not bad, but way too pricey
Summary: Stayed here the last week of February and enjoyed the hotel. It is very nice and modern and kept very clean. I think that all rooms have an ocean view, which is across the highway. It has a great location as you can walk to the beach or walk less than a 1/2 mile to dozens of restaurants and other shops.  This hotel is nice when works pays for it, but i would not pay over $100 a night myself for this because of all the other charges. $22 for parking, $10 for internet, $6 a beer at the hotel bar, $18 for a burger........

Definately not worth the money.   I've stayed at the Best Western off PCH (Huntington Beach) for a lot less money.  The Best Western  was ten times better than the Hilton Waterfront.  The hallway noise in the hotel is very LOUD.  If you are a light sleeper like myself then don't even bother with this place.  My room was next to the elevator and it was very noisy!  I even requested a room away from the elevator and that request was ignored.  The staff was nice but it just looked like they were going through the motions.  Here a tip for Hilton Waterfront... Hire older staff.  The teenagers that you have on staff have other things on their minds than service.    On the Hotel website they stated that they have live entertainment in the Shades PM lounge every Friday and Saturday

Summary Heading: Okay hotel - Too much money for what you get
Summary: I live on the beach, so seeing the ocean isn't the most important thing for me in a hotel.  First the good news, the location of the hotel is great.  It is right on the ocean and, with an oceanfront room, you have a nice view of Catalina Island and some offshore oil rigs...vestiges of Huntington Beach's beginnings as an oil town.  The service from the valet and at the front desk was excellent, as was room service. (As for room serivce the actual service was good, the price was crazy, but hey, it's room service!)  We did get two free cocktails at check-in, which I like.  I was not sure if everyone got one or if it was because I'm a Hilton Diamond member, but it was nice.  What disappointed:  1) The shower was lukewarm at best, even when turned all the way to Hot.  Come on, for

Excellent location and service at this hotel.  The gentlemen at the valet stand tried to help us get our rental car convertible down - must have been broken - we had 3-4 guys helping us out!  The doorman gave excellent suggestions for a drive down PCH.  The front desk was o.k., but the others were great!  I needed towels for the pool area at night, and they got them right away.   The hotel was clean and open, and the bed was wonderful!    One complaint is that the turn-down service showed up after 8 pm.  Sorry, when you come in from the East Coast that is a little late for turn-down.

The location and the general property are all nice, what you'd expect from a Hilton, although things look a little dated, but overall good. Bar and bar service were great at the restaurant. The room was very nice as well. Shower could have had better water pressure, I know it's nitty, but c'mon, I have certain expectations when staying at a Hilton. My real complaints are that in today's technological age, and at the price of this hotel, I'd expect wireless internet service to be free, but alas, at this hotel, it's something like $9.95 just to connect. Pretty much every thing is nickel and dimed here, i.e., don't move the beer in the stocked fridge to see what's behind it, it'll cost you the price of the beer ($9) just for moving it. Yep. Also, don't put any bottled water in the

Beautiful beach view ("Surf City") overlooking busy and noisy Pacific Coast Hwy.  Noisy construction next door (pile driver starts at 7 AM), smelly powerplant down the road.  Inside the facilities are beautiful but small touches are missing: no nightlight in the bathroom, chairs and table on balcony covered with grit, no ventilation in bathroom, slippery tub, no food service at the pool.  Food was adequate to good, service was excellent, especially consierge.

I travel a lot on business and I have seen many hotels. I can confidently state that this hotel is an excellent choice for businessman, singles, couples and families alike.  The conference room is nice and bright, not tucked away in the cellar like in many purpose built hotels.  Rooms are stylish and lovely (see pictures).  I got a room with a wonderful see view. The hotel has got a nice pool and a jacuzzi.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Like everywhere in US you are expected to have a car but the High street is a 10 minutes walk away in case you prefer walking and the beach is just across the road.  There are several bus tours available that take you around Holywood, film studios, QE, vineyards etc. but they are quite popular and you might need to book places even before you

Summary Heading: Great Service, Great Place to Relax
Summary: We decided to prolong our stay in Orange County and came across this lovely hotel.  Just looking from our room we could see the pool and the ocean.  It was wonderful.  The staff was top rate.  Room service was fantastic.  They were very helpful when I needed some extra help after having a petite mal.  Very professional in everyway.  I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Perfect end of summer family trip
Summary: We've stayed here on and off over the past 16 years, but haven't been in about 5 years or so. We had reservations at both this Hilton and the new Hyatt Huntington Beach. We were down in the area two weeks before, and decided to check them out before making our decision. The Hyatt is beautiful, but overwhelmingly huge. When we walked into the lobby of the Hilton, it was like coming into a small inn, in comparison. For about the same rate, we chose the Hilton, and had a beautiful oceanfront room with endless views of up and down the coast. The hotel has been renovated over the years, and our room was just lovely for the four of us. The staff was friendly, and the valet was quick. We only had drinks at Shades, and while my cosmo was yummy, it was the smallest martini I had ever

Summary Heading: Already considering rebooking for next year
Summary: I just returned from a 3 night/4 day stay at the Hilton in Huntington Beach... we had a large party (4 adults and 6 kids), and everyone had a great time!!  The staff was top notch- helpful, friendly, willing to go the extra mile (and I'm a customer service snob!).  They even sent someone from engineering up to my room to hook up a complimentary DVD player for our kids!!  The guys in valet were quick with the cars, and always had a smile and a restaurant recommendation.  The beds were HEAVEN.  What a great way to rest after a day of body surfing.  The location is divine!  We walked to the beach, the pier, Main Street... and we aren't in tip top shape.  On the downside, we had dinner in the Shades restaurant one night, and I would never go there again.  The waitress was deficient,

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel with Great Ocean Views
Summary: Me and my family went to the Hilton Huntington Beach in July,and it was a great hotel.    The rooms were great, they each have a flat screen tv and a balcony.   The beds were extremely comfortable.  We were on the 11th floor and had a beautiful view of the ocean.   The pool area was also very nice and the pool was very warm.   It was also in a very convenient location right off the Pacific Coast Highway.   It is a short distance to the other beach towns.   Everyday we would also walk to Main Street to grad a bite to eat, it was a short walk.   We had a great time in Huntington Beach.

When going for a stay in my home town, we thought that this time around we would spend a little more to stay directly at the beach, rather than a few miles away.  From the pictures, the Hilton looked like a beautiful place to stay with lots of amenities. I even called to make sure things would be as they seemed.  I have two words for our stay at this hotel---BIG MISTAKE!  The grounds were beautiful and the rooms were fairly nice for the most part, but that's where the any good part of this stay ended. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by a snotty, self-important front desk clerk, who graciously (not) gave us a room on the 2nd floor (out of about 12 floors) on the side of the building facing a parking lot.  Mind you, we were staying for 8 days, so I asked if possibly

This is the third time I've stayed at a Hilton. The first time (Pittsfield, Massachussetts) was good, but my last stay (Niagra Falls, Canada) and this one (Huntington Beach) proves that Hilton is merely living off its' name. The property in Huntington Beach is old but has recently been remodeled. However, it is not what I call "upgraded". The hotel was clean as was the room. Yet, the room was small with two  very "uncomfortable "double" beds that were actually more like twins. The pool was warm but a little dirty (cloudy water and sandy). The Jacuzzi was small, old, and it need of repair. It too was not the cleanest. At $300 a day, I expected much more. And on top of it, you get socked for $25.00 a day (plus tips) for valet parking. What a total rip off!  Also, avoid Shades the

I booked a suite with a king sized bed and it was pure luxury! I felt like a queen sleeping at the Hilton! The service the staff provided was great. They made sure we were comfortable and kept my mini bar restocked. The pool was heated and the scenery was exotic. Very well done. This hotel is top notch and I've stayed at my fair share of hotels. Will recommend to my friends. Thanks for everything!

Summary Heading: Below average in a beautiful Hotel
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel.  Our room included a beach view and had a balcony.  Luckily we didn't have a beach view on the side of the hotel where a major construction project is just underway.  The furnishings in the room were also beautiful.......except:  even though the bathroom sink with granite top was lovely, it was too large for an average size woman (5'4") to comfortably use.  The height was fine, but the 6" of granite in front of the sink made it impossible to use without making alot of splashing mess.  We were very unhappy that our room was not cleaned at a reasonable hour.  By 1:30 pm, I called the front desk to ask that it be cleaned.  When we returned to the room at 4:00 - it still had not been done.  I had to call again.  Finally the maid arrived - and in a quick

Summary Heading: Great views!  Not much to do at the hotel.
Summary: We went to the Waterfront on our 10 year anniversary.  Paid $235/night, stayed 2 nights.  The hotel is described as a resort but there is no day spa at the site.  It had one restaurant and bar.  Pool and fitness room is smaller than pictured on the website.  The decor of the hotel and rooms are beautiful.  42" LCD with HD programming in the room.  Staff is very friendly.   Brunch on Sundays at $38pp but NO crab legs.  There was not much to do at the hotel itself.  However, the location was right across from the beach and about a 1/4 mile from the main strip of Huntington Beach and the pier.   The views from the room balacony was great.  We had a "sunrise view" room.  Note that with the sunrise view, you also see the smoke stacks from a near-by refinery.  To the north of the

I brought my Mom, for her 88th birthday, to this lovely resort.  The resort is right on Pacific Coast Hwy and we could see the ocean, which was a real treat for her (we had a handicapped room with a sunrise/ocean view).  When I called a week ahead, I had asked if  some special things be done to the room to accomodate her.... which they said they would be able to do.    Upon arrival, the only glitch with that was, that my room key would not work and I made 3 trips back to the front desk.  Due to this inconvience, the hotel manager went up with me to make sure I didn't have this same problem again.  When I mentioned the special needs that I had, he got right on it and everything was taken care of.  He kindly gave me my $30 fridge (the fee for a fridge in the room) at no charge for

The Good:  The hotel is somewhat remodeled so the rooms are more or less updated.  Granite bathroom tops, Grohe sink fixtures, and nice Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. The Shades restaurant and bar food was delicious w/ nice staff.  Nice pool area. Nice workout room. Nice desk and chair in the room for working.  Good lighting in the room.  The Not so Good:  The wait to check in was longer than expected.  They failed to notify me when my room was ready after they said they would call.  To top it off, no apologies were offered for forgetting to call me - they acted like they didn't care and it wasn’t their mistake.  Also the valet did not offer to get a bell man to help w/ the luggage when I stated that I had luggage.  Instead he started to drive away with my car while I was still

I use to live is southern california during my teenage years and early twenty's.  Now I live in upstate NY and love going back to Calif. to visit.  We decided to stay one nite by the beach before going to our next destination for our family vacation.  I choose this hotel because it was soo close the the beach.  I use to hang out in newport beach all the time, but I was not familiar with Huntington Beach.  So I decided to give it a try.  This hotel or the room should I say was beautiful.  Nice decor.  I was told by the bellman that they just renovated all the rooms.  They did an excellent job.  I chose a sunrise view because it faces newport beach and I wanted to reminisce.  In my opion its a better view than the sunset view.  The balcony was nice to hang out and have a glass of

First off:  The Hilton didn't disappoint about service and amenities.  Very well done.  That being said, a couple of updates: 1) THERE IS NO LONGER SELF PARKING.  Figure  $22.00 (at time of this writing) added to your stay per night.  I had this unpleasant surprise at check-in and was told "there is nothing we can do".  (As an aside, I don't like doing business with a company that is unable to control what it can and cannot do at it's place of business.) 2) We stayed on the top floor, and as my pix will attest, there is a long term construction site next door.  We were told it will be a hotel/ condo/ shopping complex about 4-5 stories high.  Up on the 12th, we didn't hear any construction sounds with the door closed, but the beeping of a truck backing up was heard with the door

Service staff was extremely friendly, from there outsourced valet service, (thanks Jason) to the front desk clerk (Amanda 5 stars) I was impressed with the newly renovated interior and the beach motif.  Somehow they pulled off elegant with comfort.  I was in a conference room for 8 hours a day there so had a chance to look around on breaks etc...  I found the staff handling the conference rooms to be efficient and courteous, the facilities were clean throughout.  My lasting impression was, I can't wait to come back with my family. Great  place to stay. Restaurant was a little pricey, but the food was well worth the price.  Amazing Filet,  same for the Lamb shank. Great Dining atmosphere and experience. Again the wait staff distinguished themselves.

Summary Heading: Huntington Beach - Nice (but....service needs some major improvement!)
Summary: We enjoyed 4 nights at Huntington Beach Hilton Hotel with a great view of the beacn ahd the ocean (we had a side room, but it still had a great view to sit outside and enjoy.).  We liked the room and the bed was comfortable.  Hotel food was good, but not worth the extra Hotel price.  We had lunch there one day, and it was enjoyable, but the extra "hotel cost" they always add on, meant - let's enjoy all the other great restaurants in the area instead. (and there are many if you have a car.).  The downside is that the service - well - they certainly don't care one bit about the people who stay there.  1) We had our laundry (a couple of shirts done).  We are accustomed to having the laundry picked up when called - it took them 12 hours to do so which meant we had to wait for an

We stayed here for 5 days for a portion of our honeymoon. The service and people were really friendly and helpful.  The housekeeping did a great job cleaning the room. Always smelled fresh/clean. We bought a few DVDs from Disney and we never had a DVD player in our room. We called and they installed it for us no charge whatsoever.  The only negative part is the pool was really degrading. The bottom of the pool is breaking and a lot of floating 'thingys' like insects/leaves/band aids etc. Quite gross. Secondly, there were many kids under 14 running around and eating food in the pool/hottub. So of course that adds to the floaties on top. Other than that...if you want to swim, go to the ocean.

One of the best Hiltons we have ever stayed in!  From the front desk check-in all the way to the housekeeping...everyone was so friendly.  We stayed on the concierge floor and paid a little extra but worth every penny.  The staff all went out of there way to assure that we were shown a great experience.  Also, the concierge staff (especially Deanna) were the absolute best!  They went above and beyond with all our requests.  Some negative comments about the view in other postings need to be clarified.  The Hilton sits sideways but it looks like virtually every room has a view of the ocean, but off to one side.  Off to the other side is an inland view whick looks great at night  Obviously, the higher the better.   We will absolutely go back but for longer next time!

Summary Heading: Rip Off Ocean View Room  - Looked over the huge construction site.
Summary: We stayed here for 4th of July weekend.  Paid a premium for the ocean view room and we booked direct with the hotel not through some online site. Well, on getting there we go out to the balcony and it looks over this huge construction site with cranes, piles of dirt, bricks etc.  All fenced in with the ugly green fence. We are wonderig..this is a mistake,they gave us the wrong room.  Well, if you turn 90 degress kind of look sideways, then yes beyond the parking lot and the highway 1 you could see a smidgen of the ocean....what a rip off! For the duration of our stay, the pool was closed off half the time due to some chemical imbalance. Still, I would say that the amenities at the hotel are good. The staff is very friendly.  The location is great, close to the main street where

Stayed three days in June. The hotel is beautiful and accomodations are excellent.  Service is wonderful and very helpful.  Beach is across the highway but it is not a problem.  About a mile north of the hotel is a very nice shopping area and pier.  Recommend you walk the Huntington Beach pier and have some ice cream at the Rudy's Diner at the end.  We did drive to Disneyland from hotel and found it somewhat difficult with the L.A. traffic. It is only about 15 miles away but give yourself an hour at a minimum if you are traveling during the rush hour which is about from 7am to 10am and 3pm to 7pm.

We stayed at the Hilton Waterfront, Huntington Beach the weekend of April 20th, 2006.  I must say, it really was worth the stay. The service, from the bellman to the waiter, room service and the bar, was certainly above average. Everyone was very respectful and helpful.  We are Hilton members and upon arrival, we were upgraded to an ocean view room including appetizers and evening drinks. The pool was warm and the kids enjoyed the beach directly across the street. Well worth the visit.

Stayed at the Hilton with my wife and two kids,9 and 10 yrs old, March 19th-24th for spring break . Upon arrival at check in we were greeted by a not so friendly front desk person at 11pm. Checked into our room which looked the same as a room from a Holiday Inn or Howard Johnsons. The rooms are small, carpet worn, and our tub had a draining issue.  The restaurant is super expensive  and room services prices are a joke. Parking is  $12-14.00  per day and the pool bottom is chipped and worn away.. The hot tub fits 3-4 people max. I know this because while the four of us were in the hot tub, we had a line of people waiting to get in....They say they have basketball but I didnt see a hoop anyplace. For 250.00 per night this hotel is very very overated . Next time we will stay at the

Huntington Beach is a great spot if you are a surfer and you don't mind staying in an industrial area that includes a huge manufacturing plant as your view if you aren't facing the ocean. This is no quaint beachside village. The hotel itself was fine; the rooms and workout facility are small but the staff was eager to please and the facility itself is pretty. It would be great if you were there to watch a surfing competition but I can't imagine going there for any other reason. We stayed one night then moved our vacation south to Dana Point.

My two girlfriends and I stayed at the Hilton Waterfront hotel Feb.2-5th.  We came to Huntington Beach to run the Pacific Coast 1/2 marathon.  We had a wonderful time.  Hotel is very nice, the staff is very friendly.  We had one problem,the hot tub.  When we were sitting in the hot tub we looked around and realized that all are jewellery was turning green. (Gold and Silver).  Are fingernails and toenails were also truning green. When we got out we all realized that our bathing suit bottoms had really faded. There was about 8 people in the hot tub and all of us could not believe what was happening.  We went back to our room and phoned the front desk.  They basicaly told us there was nothing they could do until they checked the chlorine.  They phoned back at 9:30pm and said that
Love it, love it, love it..Great service. Thank you Jessie (Bartender) and Harvey (Restauration Manager). They were both so cute (ah!) and so helpful!

Booked in with my wife and five teenagers(three boys,two girls).Couldn't have found a better spot in Orange County for an Eastern Washington State Hop and Apple growing Family!Check in was smooth,and the rooms were perfect!Poolside with oceanside view was awesome,sat out on the deck and watched the kids swim late evenings.Access to the beach was great also,They gave us our beach gear for free,and we were off to sunbathing and surfing.Downtown Hunntington Beach has some great shopping and eateries.The pier is a sunset wonder-we will be back soon...

when my wife and i first arived at the hotel i could not beleave that not one person welcomed us, this was just the beginning, i waited ten  (min) no one even helped with our bags,i then proceded to get the luggage rack on my own,even at the front desk they still did not ask if i need any help,i then went in the elavater pushing my rack through the hall's to my room, not good,the custemer service that i received was less than perfect, i can not list all the things that happen, when checking out they did not even ask how my stay was, the last thing is ,i called to speak to a manager , i expressed my concerns they sad the gen mngr will call me back, never did, im from las vegas so maybe im a little spoiled but for the money i paid  i expected much much more!     p.s, i was going

We loved the Hilton for many reasons.  The rooms were nice and clean and just about every room at the hotel has a view of the ocean.  It is much smaller than the Hyatt so it is less crowded at the pool, hotel and beach area in front of the Hilton.  When we were on the beach we looked down toward the Hyatt, which is next door, and the beach directly in front of the Hyatt was packed.  The nightime bonfires are in front of the Hilton and the Hilton is closer to the Peir, restaurants, and shopping.  We really enjoyed the Hilton and would definitely stay there again.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July after spending 4 days at Disneyland and it could'nt have been more pleasurable.Great location for walking to the pier or downtown and easy access to the highway.Might pack some warmer clothes next time for the cold ocean air at night.Even though their beds were doubles instead of queen they were very comfortable.Would definitely stay here again when in HB.

This is a top notch place to stay in HB. Write down by the water, you can walk to the pier and downtown. Excellent facilities, great pool, clean rooms. Staff were very, very friendly and accommodating to us. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

We just stayed there for Easter weekend. My husband surfs and we enjoy the HB easy going fun night life so you cant beat the location.  The rooms were very clean and the front desk very helpful. They are able to get us into our room before 12 noon!  I was a little disappointed in the Turn Down service. They took the wet towels but didn't replace them so we had to call for more and they didn't tidy anything up. I guess I'm used to a different level of Turn Down service. O well mabe I'm just picky but that bothered me. The valet and concierge were excellent.  We had lunch at the poolside restaurant and it was lovely. Everything was wonderful. No poolside waiters maybe because of the time of year. I have been here during the summer and there was music and fun going on. Even though

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price (through priceline, anyway)
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in June 2004 for 2 nights.  We were both impressed with this hotel.  The room was large, along with a nice sized bathroom, and the bed was extremely comfortable.  We had absolutely no problems whatsoever with the "thin wall" complaint others have posted.  I guess it's a possibility we just didn't end up with people in the rooms next to us, in that case we were lucky!  During our stay, we did hear a few people mention that the tower rooms are not worth the extra price, so it might be a good idea to stay away from those.  We specifically asked for a "high up" room, and ended up with a great ocean view, as well.  Overall, the hotel has a beautiful, high-class look and feel to it.  I believe we paid around $160 through priceline.

My husband and I stayed here on the first stage of our honeymoon during September and as I relied on this site for most of the year I thought it was fair to give my honest opinion. On arrival at check in, the receptionist congratulated us immediately on our wedding, and simply couldnt be more friendly. She told us we had a lovely room, and what a gorgeous suprise to find we had been upgraded to a oceanfront king deluxe. The room was beautiful, with two balconies. Everything was spotlessly clean and very well presented. An hour or so after arrival, a bell boy arrived with some chocolates and a card from the front desk asking if we wanted anything at all to let them know. I thought this was most sweet. The room was also very quiet, we heard no other guests in corridors, adjoining

Summary Heading: Terrible poolside service. but nice hotel
Summary: Very nice and clean Hilton.  Hotel location is great, about 2 minute walk to the beach.  The rooms were clean, but small beds if you request double beds.  Just one pool, not so big.  Poolside service was just terrible because they were understaffed.  It took an hour and a half to get drinks, and that's after many complaints.  Room service was not so good.  If you are planning to use the tennis courts: Good Luck! It's unavailable most of the time due to wedding ceremonies and recetptions, and it's closed after 10:00 pm.

Summary Heading: Hilton Hunington Beach - OK by me!
Summary: Just spent five nights at the Hunnington Beach Hilton(August 2004).  Very nice property.  The staff was extremely helpful.  I actually enjoyed the five-ten minute walk into town for dinner.  Relaxing and good way to walk off a meal.  HB is full of some cool eateries.  Newport is just down the road.  That was a fun place to hang out.  The pier is a blast at night.  Great people watchng - felt totally safe.  Only negative I had was that the hotel was noisy after hours.  I heard doors slamming at all hours which bummed me out.  At first I shrugged it off as just famalies with kids on vacation having a good time but at 2:00 AM?  All in all I enjoyed the Hilton - how can you not be jacked about waking up every morning with that view?

Just got back from a 3 night stay.  This is a very good hotel in a great location with great facilities.  I did not eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on the food.  The bar is large and quite nice with excellent service.  The facilities and grounds are incredible.  The pool is very large with excellent service and very clean.  The rooms are at least average sized and quite comfortable.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  My meeting plans changed and the staff were able to extend my stay even while the hotel was sold out during the Pro Surfing tournament.  There are a few pigeons that sit on the balconies but I saw no droppings.  The pier and downtown HB is within walking distance if you are under the age of 75.  It's maybe a 15 minute walk.  This was a wonderful hotel

It's a nice hotel, but I wouldn't stay again.  It's a bit pricey for what you get.  We stayed there because we wanted to be close to the beach, but it's actually very easy to park along the beaches there and a lot of money could be saved staying somewhere else.  Since the hotel is across the street from the ocean, the view wasn't that great and we couldn't hear the crashing waves.

Stayed here MAY 2004.  Rooms are so small. Pigeons and there droppings all over the patio.  Crabby , unfriendly staff.  Food disappointing.  For a hilton i was expecting alot more especially for the room rate they were charging.  THE POOL is very nice and the beach acrossthe street is spotless. There was cops at the hotel 2 out of the 5 nights we stayed there, drunk wedding disruption et. Quite a far walk to the pier and on the weekend dont even think of taking your car into town or get dinner without a reservation. We drove to DANA POINT for dinner..Seemed more like a ft.lauderdale spring break crowd on the weekend.  PROBABLY WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN, but might think about it because of the pool and beach.

We stayed here for 4 days in mildle of March in one of the tower rooms.  They were advertised as offering you utter privacy, and breakfast in a private lounge are included in the price.  It was a disappointment.  The lounge is small and not welcoming to kids because of the way the table and chairs are set up.  There are always men in their 50's and 60's sitting there reading their papers during breakfast looking real serious that you feel the need to whisper when you need to talk during breakfast. The breakfast selection is limited and there is a concierge sitting there watching you having breakfast which can be quite uncomfortable.  The location and views are great but there was alot of fog so forget about seeing any sunrise or sunset for us (not the hotel fault).  I think you

I'm a diamond member in Hilton's frequent stay program - I've got experience with Hilton Hotels!. I've stayed at, among other Hilton hotels, the Palmer House in Chicago, Capital Hilton in Wash DC, and Hilton Torrey Pines in San Diego. This is probably the best Hilton I've ever stayed in. I was there with my family from 13-16 July. I really can't think of anything negative to say. I know people were in the rooms next to me, yet I had no problem with noice in the rooms, and I'm very sensitive to that.
